name: Revolución
description:
May 1810. Conspiracies and betrayals are the order of the day. Patriots and absolutists sink into collusion to force mutually exclusive projects that can cost them their lives. They are writing history and there are members of the town who want much more than "to know what it is about". They want to fight for that new Nation that is brewing...

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Each player represents an urban worker from colonial Buenos Ayres (a water carrier, a lamplighter, a milkman, a seller of candles, cakes or feather dusters) and -adhering to the revolution that is brewing- tries to play his support by moving between patriots and absolutists (cards of all 20 characters) in such a way as to visit only one per table series so as not to be singled out as a conspirator by the absolutist side.

If he can successfully raffle 6 visits to patriots in the same table series, he will have gained two degrees of prominence among the revolutionary forces, raising his prestige among the patriotic "sparks" who are stationed in front of the town hall. If he is unsuccessful, everyone else except him will move up a step in prominence in the revolution.

The player who reaches the level 7 Town Hall arcade will have won the game.

name: La Grieta
description:
The Nation is being built. Internal struggles and intrigues struggle to impose two antagonistic and mutually exclusive country models. Dust and horror of 24 patriots and villains who will try to impose their political project with blood and fire.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Take as many barracks from your opponent as possible and end the fratricidal fight. For this and in turns, each player will alternate deducing which federal leader or unitary leader defends each barracks. The situation becomes more complicated when these bosses will be relieved but perhaps at too high a price...

The game ends when all three headquarters of one side (Unitary or Federal) have been eliminated.

But beware, you can still be defeated if -even after winning the three barracks- your opponent gets more victory points...

An all or nothing game!

name: Década Infame
description:
1930. A thousand oligarchic families own "La Argentina" and manage the State as part of their properties, making all kinds of deals and looting of the national treasury. In this decade, electoral and economic fraud, repression of popular sovereignty and abuses of power of all kinds are the order of the day.

To carry out its negotiations, the Argentine Oligarchy uses collaborators of the same kind. It is precisely there, where our players come into play...

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

The representative of the thousand families delegates his affairs to the first player next to the loot box, which is passed from hand to hand around the table. Each player takes advantage of the opportunity to get hold of the deals that he contains for individual benefit, or to take a character token with whom he collaborates.

After the round and with the box again in possession of the representative of the Argentine Oligarchy, he sees that some of his peers have cheated the interest of the ruling class for personal gain. Immediately afterwards he -offended and betrayed- he interrogates them to identify his henchmen trying to discover who or who have "abusers of his trust" and thus be able to recover his businesses for the set of the thousand oligarchic families. But if the deadline is met, if the Argentine Oligarchy has not managed to recover all the negotiations, it loses the game and the Prosecutors of the Homeland win.

Will the Argentine oligarchy be able to recover all the stolen contracts? Will he take a false step by accusing a National Prosecutor in vain? What will be the fate of the thieves if the oligarchy falls? What luck will the Ruffians have with the different outcomes? A game of simulation and deception where each group of interests will want to win.

name: Puerta de Hierro
description:
On September 16, 1955, the coup d'état of the Fusiladora Revolution took place against the constitutional government of General Juan Domingo Perón, after which he began a long exile of 18 years. The last ten will take place at Quinta 17 de Octubre, located in the small town of Puerta de Hierro, on the outskirts of Madrid, Spain. From there, he will begin to navigate a political labyrinth of intrigues, loyalties, and betrayals that will finally lead him to return triumphantly to the country in 1972 and, the following year, to be elected constitutional president of Argentina for the third time.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

This game takes historical facts as its basis and translates them into the cards of the notable personalities of that turbulent time, which players must secretly handle to obtain a specified number of legitimation tokens, thus achieving ultimate victory.

Throughout the game, each player will keep a secret card in his hand (which could vary on his turn) and that represents his contact of influence and the one who will be the one to carry his message to General Perón. You will want to make sure that the person closest to the General has the message from him at the end of the day, so that it can be delivered with priority.

The game takes place in rounds that ends when the insert deck is exhausted at the end of a turn, or if all the players except one are eliminated from it. In the first case, the player with the most influence wins a standing token; in the second case, the one left standing wins.

A player is declared the winner of the game after collecting a certain number of influence tokens, based on the number of players.

name: La República Perdida
description:
Argentina, 1976. The country is submerged in a terminal crisis.

While some fight for a Nation that represents the inclusive, national and popular interests of the great majorities, others operate to make the country an elitist, neo-colonial, surrendering and excluding appendix of the majorities, representing foreign interests and local minorities. In this framework, a collection of perfidious characters sink into lies, pettiness, greed, impunity, fanaticism, betrayal and death, forming part of the complex web of power in Argentine daily life in the 70s.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Each player must stay alive as he fights to remove the power of his opponents until all influence is wiped out. They will have to know how to hide their secrets very well, be cautious, intelligent, cunning and take care of all the dangers that lurk in each action, infiltrating the ranks of sinister characters to be able to use them until they achieve their goal, die or commit suicide.

Only one (or none) will manage to reach the end of the game, and will try - together with the help of notable personalities - a way out towards the democratic spring of the country.

name: (Des)memoria
description:
(Des)memoria is a dynamic social game of deduction and dissimulation where interaction between players is everything. Playful experience that immerses us in the deep memory of our people, from the English invasions to the fall of De la Rua.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Players assume the role of Argentines who travel back in time to a certain historical moment of relevance.
Everyone knows that place and that time, except one of them, the "forgetful one", who has lost his memory.

Through questions and answers, the players who know the location must try to discover the oblivious, and he, in turn, must try to find out where they are. And all this within an interval of 7 minutes.

Depending on what happened in each round, the players will score in a certain way.

The game ends after the last round and the player with the most points will be declared the winner.

name: Ataque a la Nación
description:
Economic imperialism -along with its local sepoy partners- have launched a soft coup d'état and plan to carry it out during the third presidential term of the Kirchner national government.

While the enemies of the country plan this from obscure foreign offices, the national forces must hurry to make effective the political measures to strengthen the political sovereignty, economic independence and social justice of the popular majorities. A game of hidden roles, intrigue and deception.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

At the beginning of the game, and in strict secrecy, you will discover which side you belong to (the patriots or the sepoys). Once this is determined, you will try to identify your companions without being unmasked by your enemies.

On each turn, you will choose a secret Action Card from the other players and try to play it to obtain the necessary political achievements to strengthen the Nation, or to trigger a Soft Coup d'état that will make the anti-patriotic forces triumph, depending on your identity. .

The Patriotic Side will win the game if they manage to make the Pending Political Actions effective, while the Sepoy Side will win if they manage to carry out the Soft Coup d'Etat or run out of game time without the patriots achieving their objective.

name: Cipayos
description:
Argentina 2015. Manipulated public opinion, the electorate has chosen the most corrupt, looters and traitors to the Homeland since the Infamous Decade.

Immersed in this time of ignominy, we will have to wander through a republic among economic, political and especially moral ruins; trying that the decline in the offer of public personalities does not lead us to the definitive defeat...

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Obtain the most welfare points (or, alternatively, the fewest decay points) at the end of the game.
Each player receives a national and popular figure card that will help him stop the decline and 11 well-being tokens, which they will keep hidden behind the screen.

On his turn, the player must choose between:

take a decay card (with values ​​from -2 to -42) and take its negative cost in decay points, but at the same time take any welfare tokens that can be found on it; either
place one of his welfare tokens (by losing it) on the sepoy card and pass it to the next player. If he takes the sepoy card, he will put it in his playing area trying to make sequences (ladders) with future or previous cards taken, being the national and popular characters wild cards that can help join sequences to reduce negative decay points.


The game ends when the last card of the deck has been dealt. The player with the most wellness points (or the least decay) is the winner.

name: Patria Grande
description:
Patria Grande is a fast and intense simulation game that requires nerves of steel, daring and subtle strategy. Everyone starts the game with 4 cards, neither more nor less: 3 LATIN AMERICAN cards and one IMPERIALIST card. With that alone, he must have the diplomacy to emerge victorious, relying on his Latin American brothers and against the imperialists who will harm his chances.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Win two bets.

To win the game you will have to make the highest bet. Once it is yours, hit the number of cards corresponding to the bet, without encountering a single imperialist card on the way, and do it twice!...

How much risk are you willing to take?

If you are too timid, another player will outbid you to try and steal the win from you. If you are too reckless, you risk losing by revealing one of the genocidal imperialist cards.

Good luck!...

name: Seamos Libres
description:
This historical game highlights the life and work of Don José Francisco de San Martín from his return to his homeland in 1812 until 1845, already exiled in Europe.

The most important personalities and events of his public life appear on his cards for players to share in their circumstances, struggles and destiny, in order to win the trust and favor of the Big Boss.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Obtain the highest number of medals of honor at the end of the game, in order to become the Lieutenant of the Liberator José de San Martín.

GAME MECHANICS

Each player receives a character card at the start of a round.
Then, the first player takes a second character and decides which of the two characters in his hand to play, revealing him to the other players and executing his effect.

The game continues in turns until all the characters have been played or there is only one player left in the round. If the latter happens, it is defined who of the players has won the medal corresponding to the event in dispute and the next round ends.

Repeating these rounds for each of the 15 events, the player who has the most medals or is the last one to reach the highest number of medals will win.

This is a game of deduction, memory and chance, where the participants playfully immerse themselves in the revolutionary passions of freedom and justice; knowing heroes and villains, victories and failures; unjustly forgotten patriots or false heroes turned traitors and, nevertheless, revered by liberal history.

name: Los 7 Locos
description:
Los 7 Locos is a game of hidden identities in which players secretly embody the masks of one of seven great Argentine and Uruguayan writers. Keeping his identity to himself, each player must simulate, deceive and deduce before the others to win the Silvio Ballan Award for best storyteller.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Each player must try to discover the identity of the other players without revealing their own. To achieve this, he must perform actions in order to obtain resources. He must then use these resources to discover information about the other players in order to eliminate them.

The storytellers take turns and carry out one or several actions depending on the resources and the decisions they decide to make.

Thus, each player shows off their best capacities for imagination, lies, deception and deduction -embodying the skills of the different writers, most of the time without being them- while trying to unmask the rest of the players.

The last player left without being eliminated wins...

name: Estanciero: Reforma Agraria
description:
This is an expansion that totally modifies the mechanics of the original game and the political economic conception of the classic Estanciero game. This expansion cannot be played without a copy of the base game.

Each player starts from the base of a sum of values ​​together with an initial Field Deed. Gradually more Deeds of Fields, Chacras and Estancias are acquired, with which they are collected, rents are paid and grains or hacienda can be produced.

Railroads and Companies are bought and profits are collected. Seeds for planting or reproducers for the farm are purchased and the sales of what is produced are collected. Upgrades are purchased and penalties are paid. Taxes are paid for a Solidarity Fund intended for those players who go bankrupt to be able to resume the game.

The game takes place over 4 years of 6 game turns per year.

The game ends when the last player finishes playing the last turn of his fourth year or when there are no more players left who have yet to liquidate their hacienda or their harvest.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Be the player with the most wealth at the end of the game.

name: DETONATORS!
description:
Deception! Destruction! Dexcitement!
Damage your friendships like never before with Detonators!
In this poker-face game of pretending to be a role you aren’t you must carefully build your own winning hand with cards from the deck - but beware, because one of your friends has your Detonator, and if they clue in that you are their target your hopes of winning could be up in smoke!

There are two goals in Detonators - to assemble your winning hand, or to detonate your target. The game is played using cards of five colors - each color has its own ability and rarity in the deck.

At the start of the game each player is given in secret their role card and their detonator. On their role card is written their winning hand - each of the five roles has a unique winning hand. Each detonator is coded to one of the other players’ role cards, but nobody knows who has which role. The deck is then shuffled and placed between all the players, and plays three cards onto the table face-up for everyone to see.

Play is turn-based, and on a player’s turn they can do one of four things:

DRAW a card either from the face-up set of three or from the deck itself.
PLAY a card from their hand, activating its ability and putting it in a discard pile
LOCK a card face-up in front of them, registering it towards their winning hand, or swap one of their already face-up cards with one from their hand.
DETONATE their target by playing two of their target’s winning hand cards, and correctly call out the player with that role. That player loses the game, and gives the player who detonated them their new target.

The game ends whenever a player has assembled their role’s winning hand in front of them, or whenever there is only one player left standing.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game

name: Psycho Dropsy 2: Sezon Drugi
description:
A party game for those who feel the need to say something totally inappropriate.

You have been warned.

The game is very simple. We draw a black card with a question. Then everyone chooses a white card with an answer that matches the question. The funniest and best-read answer wins.

PsychoDropsy is similar to the games "Cards Against Humanity" and "Apples to Apples", but they are in Polish. They have improved rules of the game and completely new cards.

This game is not suitable for people without a sense of humor. In people who are not devoid of good taste, it can cause a sharp cough, redness, difficulty breathing, and remorse. It should not be used with alcohol or other legal abusers. Let's face it - it should also not be used under the influence of any illegal means, even if legalization is only a matter of time.

Psychodropsy: Season 2 is a standalone game. No Psychodropsy: Season 1 or Limited Edition Psychodropsy required to play. Psychodropsy: Season 2 can be mixed freely with Season 1 cards.

The cards of both seasons can be mixed in any combination without fear - each card has an indication of which season it comes from. The Limited Edition cards are slightly larger than the Season 2 cards, but can be mixed and matched for tons of new possibilities.

Psychodropsy: Season 2 is the continuation of the first season of the game. The brand new cards are kept in the same cultural (though quite open) style as the first season. In the second season, there are cards that talk about deviations. And it's just about those deviations that really affect people. You won't believe how strange things can...lift people's spirits.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Because the Lonely Novice Hope to Enter the Dungeon…
description:
Because the Lonely Novice Hope to Enter the Dungeon… is a roguelike dice game for solo play.
You are a novice who dreams of an adventure (or some gold) in the dungeon .
However, other adventurers in the village do not accept you as a party member, as they only give preferential treatment to highly experienced veteran players.
After hitting the training dummy for nothing all day, you realize that this is no use. Finally you head to the entrance of the dungeon alone in search of a wonderful adventure story to tell you at the tavern.

You explore a dungeon with a total of 3 levels.
Each turn you roll the dice to fight the monster.
Eliminate monsters and receive gold and experience points as rewards, and use them to select various talents. Defeat the final boss lurking deep in the dungeon and win the game.

name: Mulodi
description:
Mizano presents:
'Muloodi' AKA 'Mulodi'; A title bestowed upon the landlords in Uganda. A title widely respected and sought after across the country.
Build, rent and hustle your way to the top!
Balodi reigns Supreme!

—description from the back of the box

Mulodi is a Monopoly inspired cardgame with places in Uganda.
Players compete to complete sets of properties and make money.
Most cards have a dual function and can be used either as a property/action, or as money.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: Mulodi Adventure
description:
It's time to take your hustle on the road.
Do you have what it takes to be a Mulodi in the Wild?
Build, Travel and Explore yout way through the Wonders of Uganda.

—description from the back of the box

Mulodi is a Monopoly inspired cardgame with places in Uganda.
Players compete to complete sets of properties and make money.
Most cards have a dual function and can be used either as a propery/action, or as money.
In Mulodi Adventures the properties are national parks, and players are tourist guides. Adventures can be played as a standalone variant, or added to the base game to play with more people.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection

name: dice_market
description:
Welcome back! Dice farmers.
The market is waiting for your arrival.
But time is not waiting for you. Neither will your competitors.

Quickly change your infinite number of dice to meet the demands of the market and exchange them for finite agricultural products.
The more produce you bring back, the richer your life will become.

Note: Dice Market is a stand-alone and spin-off game of Dice_Mancala.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

name: ジューシーキッチン (Juicy Kitchen)
description:
Freedom! How wonderful it sounds! Freedom and independence are inseparable.

You have trained in very popular kitchen car "Juicy Kitchen", and here comes a chance to you to become independent.

By satisfy the Stars and customers who come to the store, you will be recognized your ability by the charismatic owner, Juicy-chan (37 y.o.) (note: the woman in the box illustration. She has a junior high school son who has reached a rebellious period).

Make more juice sales than anyone else and prove your skills to her.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Events, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move
publishers: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

name: Imperium Battle
description:
"Imperium Battle" is a board-wargame of battle, quest oriented, building conquest, exploration in the centuries spanning from 12th to late 19th. Each Player will lead one of the great civilizations of the globe to glory on its battlefield,

There are total 20 civilizations in this game, over 150 miniatures in our Core Box, an average gameplay is about 30 minutes.

Rules Intro:
There are total 20 civilizations in this game

10 of Europeans: British, French, Holy Roman Empire, Dutch, Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, Russian, Swede and Ottoman Turk;

3 of Asians: Manchu Chinese, Shogunate Japanese, Mughal Indian;

4 of Americans: United States of America, Mexican, Plain Nation,Incan;

3 of Africans: Barbary Pirate, Hausa/Malian, Ethopian/ Zulu

During the game round players will be free to command as many units as available, using measure gauge for movement and firing range measurement. Besides of fighting battles, some scenarios have wonderful tasks that offer great value VP for your civilization and every 4 VPs giving you a mighty Card Reinforcement.

There are many potential paths to victory and you will collect Victory Points in different ways, depending on what aspects you decide to focus on. Some players will choose to eliminate 4 HP of enemy units, other will make powerful alliances and gathering resources and yet others will fulfill NPC’s tasks in return of VP collection.

However, the goal for you to winning the game is not just collecting VPs, it may be different depending on the scenario’s setting.

During Skirmish settings, your goal is to destroy your opponent by having at least one of your unit miniature touching your opponents Reinforcement Line the margin which closest to your opponent
Some scenarios, a village will spawn in the middle of the battle mat, placing buildings in the center of it you can get the building accessories by purchasing our Building Extra Bundle, each of the building is worth 1 HP, you can spend 1 turn to loot it and gain 1 VP for each building razed
After collecting enough VPs you can call for a reinforcement
collected every 4 VPs, draw another Unit Cards from you hand deck, place miniatures onto the Battle Mat.
The goal for this scenario is to hold the center of the village for more than 3 turns.
Players can also win by commanding their units to touch their opponent’s Reinforcement Line the margin which closest to your opponent.
During the game you will score VP for every 4 HP of enemy units elimination, completing Missions, Milestones, raiding houses, achieving objectives, this will be tracked by opponent’s unit miniatures eliminated and building miniatures.
End game scoring is initiated when the scenario’s objectives are all been completed, or when certain unit cards or movement have triggered the game to end.
Any phisical structures buildings, walls, trees in numbers will block ranged units from firing the targets behind.
LOS can only be straight.
When attacking the sword dice counts as a ‘Hit’. When defending, it counts as a ‘Missed’. When attacking shield dice counts as a ‘Missed’. When defending, it counts as a ‘Block’. Red Dice has High chance of ‘Hit’ dice, best of attacking. while Black Dice has High chance of ‘Block’ dice, best of defending.
The game mat will include:
• Grassland Battle Mat
• Snow Biome Battle Mat only with Expansion
• Desert Battle Mat only with Expansion
• Ocean Battle Mat Coming soon
• City Battle Mat Coming soon
Unit cards will include:
• 8 Swords Class Cards
• 8 Hussar Class Cards
• 8 Ranged Cavalry Class Cards
• 8 Archer Class Cards
• 8 Line Infantry Class Cards
• 8 Cannon Class Cards
• 8 Pikemen Class Cards
• 8 Special Class Cards
Dice and measurement tools will include:
• 4 Custom Red Dice
• 4 Custom Yellow Dice
• 4 Custom White Dice
• 4 Custom Black Dice
• 40 Measuring Cards
Unpainted soldier miniatures will include:
• 8 Swords Class Units
• 8 Hussar Class Units
• 8 Ranged Cavalry Class Units
• 8 Archer Class Units
• 8 Line Infantry Class Units
• 8 Cannon Class Units
• 8 Pikemen Class Units
• 8 Special Class Grenadier Units
• also More Unique Civilization Unit
Miniatures coming soon

name: Mono Go To
description:
A collection of ten Kuwaiti games in one small box:


Sets
Battle
Mono Go Pair
Memory
Units
Hands
Royale
Spaces
Stacks
Eid Game

name: Frankenfur!: Herbivore Deck
description:
This wily, tricky, and cunning deck is ready to outsmart ANY opponent! Perfect for players who love using clever resource management to gain the upper hand. Why race to the finish when you can run laps around your opponent?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Frankenfur!: Carnivore Deck
description:
This hard-hitting deck is ready to steamroll! Perfect for players who value offensive tactics that get things done - and fast!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Rivet Wars: Reloaded – Nemoan Expansion
description:
The Nemoan Expansion adds a third playable faction to the Rivet Wars: Reloaded core game.

In most cases, Nemoan units are more expensive in deployment and rivet points than their Allied and Blight counterparts. They’ve also got a little less variety in unit types.

That said, their advanced technology and unusual battlefield tactics give them an edge. They’re strong, versatile, and you’ll often find fewer of them on the field.

name: Rivet Wars: Reloaded – Aerial Aces Expansion
description: Bring aerial combat to the Rivet Wars: Reloaded game with the Aerial Aces Expansion. It includes air units for both Allied and Blight forces, which are positioned on stands, so they can occupy a level above the ground units.

name: Monster Mash Grand Prix
description:
“Hello and welcome fellow mad scientists! It’s time for the annual event that you all have no doubt been waiting for, the Monster Mash Grand Prix! You’re here because you’re the best, the brightest, the one that everyone envies and – oh, wait, this cue card is for the Masters Race later. Ahh, here we go, ahem- You’re here because this all you can eat Pizza Palace coupon isn’t going to claim itself. Plus the winner will be taking their first steps towards entering the Masters Race! But let’s not get ahead of ourselves! You have a creation to race, obstacles to overcome and backstabbers to get revenge on! So, let’s make some monsters!”

Welcome to Monster Mash Grand Prix, the race to build monsters, get them around the circuit and eventually across the finish line! But don’t get too attached to your monster, as they have challenges and obstacles to overcome, not just from the track but from fellow players looking to beat you across the finish line, and will eventually fall apart. When that happens, you just build another one and have them take over where your last monster went down and keep racing!

—description from the publisher

name: Broadside & Cutlass
description:
In any Campaign conducted in the Age of Reason, there will come a time when the effect of naval actions becomes important to the outcome of a carefully planned strategy.

Most wargamers would prefer to use a set of rules that would give them the flavour of naval combat without getting bogged down in the intricacies and minutiae of combat in the Age of Sail. A further advantage would be that the rules would have similar mechanisms to the land warfare rules used by the protagonists. The author's personal preference for 'Volley & Bayonet' prompted him to write these rules.

Scales and Assumptions:

These rules are designed to be played on a table top onto which has been super-imposed a grid of approximately 3.25 inches (83mm) square. This grid is used for movement and the calculation of firing ranges as well as being perfect for indicating wind direction and points of turn. For the purpose of these rules the distance across the diagonals of the grid square are counted as being the same as the distance across the flat sides.

Each grid square represents about 500 yards.

Each move represents about 30 minutes.

—user summary

name: Ram & Oar
description:
The intent of these rules is to provide a fast, easy, fun game for ancient fleet battles. The base turn sequence and mechanics are based on the game Volley & Bayonet by Frank Chadwick & Greg Novak.

Each game turn is composed of two sequential parts: First player actions followed by Second player actions. Generally, the first player action represent the attacking side in the battle. Within each player action there are four phases: 1) Command, 2) Movement, 3) Combat, and 4) Exhaustion. There is no individual ship morale phase.

name: Ancient Conquest
description:
(formerly known as Ancient Warfare)

These rules cover classical warfare in the ancient world from the rise of Egypt to the fall of Rome.

The essence of Ancient Conquest is command and the role of the general on the battlefield. Using simple mechanics, the player will find himself thrust into the role of battle manager on a very personal level, and in a very chaotic environment.

Soldiers in the game are rated for their equipment, but also their experience level and specific skills. There are no abstract "troop classes", although you will find that certain combinations of training and equipment necessarily encourage specific deployments on the battlefield.

Ancient Conquest, on the other hand, was created from the very beginning with historical encounters in mind. Units were tested not against the theory of how they ought to have done against different troop types, but rather against the reality of their historical performance in actual battles.

More than anything else, the atmosphere of the game is different from that of most other ancients rules. Many rules are rigid and chess-like in their portrayal of ancient warfare, so that the games are very cerebral in nature. Ancient Conquest is anything but that. Ancient battles were confused and
violent. They were personal and visceral, not impersonal and abstract. Above all else, Ancient Conquest aims at reproducing that sense.

Oracle cards introduce an additional element of unpredictability to the game, and provide players with an additional means of influencing play.

The ground scale using the recommended base size is 1:1500, which means that one millimeter equals one and a half meters of actual ground. (One inch equals about 40 meters of real terrain.) This means that the frontage of a base is 90 meters (about 100 yards).

In general, a stand represents infantry or cavalry deployed four to six ranks deep and as many files wide as will fit in a 90 meter frontage (about 100 files for infantry or 65 files for cavalry). Formations of greater depth than four to six ranks are represented by placing multiple bases one behind another.

Strength of Stands
Infantry: 500 infantry (4-6 ranks of about 100 files each).
Cavalry: 330 cavalry (4-6 ranks of about 65 files each).
Chariots: 100 small (2-3 man) or 50 large (4-5-man, and all scythed) chariots
Elephants: 10 elephants (in one or two ranks)
Engines: 20 bolt throwers or 10 stone throwers.
For very large battles, double scale armies (1 stand per 1000 infantry or 650 cavalry) may be used, and for small actions half scale may be used (1 stand per 250 infantry or 160 cavalry) may be used.

—description from the rulebook

name: Word List
description:
Each player selects a color of ball in the Letter Selection Box. Each turn the box is rotated upside down then upright so all balls settle into holes. All players receive the 4 letters at the ends of the horizontal and vertical rows in which their colored ball is settled along with an extra shared vowel.

Players progressively construct their own selection of 12 words with the heading "word list."

In regular play, longer words count more points and high score wins. In variations of game first to finish wins.

name: Connect Five
description:
Connect Five is a crossword-style word game.

With only five letters (cards) available at any time, players take turns making words, crossword-style.

The set contains 48 letter cards, each with a point value.

Six letters are always in play, but you can only use five of them to form interconnected words. One of the six letters must be discarded at the end of each turn.

Players take turns drawing one new letter and trying to form one to four interlinked (crossed) words. All letters must be used to form the words. If the letters cannot form word(s), the player's turn is over.

On each turn, a player:
- draws a new card
- adds the letter next to the existing five cards
- discards one card
- rearranges the cards to form one to four words
- score only the new words formed.

If all words cannot be formed, the turn is over.
Typically two or three words will be formed.
On a rare occasion, four words can be formed.
All words must be valid.

The game includes five dry erase scoreboards.

-description from designer

Try before you buy. Online game is at https://brainy.games/connect5.php
mechanics: Connections, Deck Construction, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Snorkel
description:
Swimmers compete to collect the most sets of beautiful sea creatures as they snorkel.

Snorkel is a family card game that combines memory and set collection to create an easy to learn and engaging game.

There is a 3x3 grid of sea cards set in the middle of the table. On a players turn they flip over three cards and try to create sets, a set is three cards with something in common or three cards with absolutely nothing in common. For each set created players get to keep 1 card. The remaining cards are flipped back over and the taken players replaced from the deck. Ultimately players are trying to create sets from the cards they have collected.

The game ends when there is only 3 cards left in the grid. The player who has created the most sets wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Memory, Set Collection

name: Stardust Butterfly
description:
Two years after the events of Silicon Soul, in a nearby solar system, a ragtag crew of bounty hunters struggle to survive in their trusty starflyer, the Shoegazer. Led by the amnesiac Sumiv Warring, the trio warps across the solar system chasing after the past. Sumiv believes that locating a giant robot will awaken her lost memories. Gloz, the last surviving Grazaloid, searches to find another survivor of her kind. And not much is known about Jebbrey Ocean, a mysterious, possibly insane, but helpful one-armed cyborg. What adventures are in store for these three? Find out in Stardust Butterfly, the board game continuation of the Steel Love series!

In this 3-player action drafting game, players compete to have the biggest reputation. Hunt down targets and achieve your personal goals to earn points, but since you’re all part of the same crew, helping and hindering one another is not optional. Not to mention the Events that cause even more chaos among the crew…

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Trivia-Update: Events of 1984
description: Touted as "the only game that is up-to-date," this card set aims to add "all new questions" to any other trivia game, or to be playable on its own. The cards and questions are in a decidedly Trivial Pursuit-like format. Categories are People, Entertainment, Sports, Politics, Business, and Art & Literature.

name: Trend
description:
After an worldwide economic crisis, players take on the role of professional investor to earn money on the A-share market through buying and selling stocks on a fluctuating market. But new crisis might arrive at any time. Your goal is to earn more money than any other investors before new rounds of economic crisis.

Stocks of different companies would cause different market effects. On the market phase, players turn over the market cards and adjust to the corresponding prices.(Crisis cards mixed with market cards in the pile) Then players move to the buying and selling phase and optionally decide if they wish to buy a new stock or sell an old stock first. The current market price is determined by both market cards and stock cards. These phases recurring until all crisis cards occur.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Commodity Speculation, Investment, Stock Holding

name: Ring of Candles
description:
Make a 9-card, 3x3 grid of ally cards that defend you from monsters that set up around the parameter. Banish monsters into candles by making certain patterns on your grid.

Each turn, draw the top card from the face-up deck. If an ally, place it on one of the 9 stacks comprising the ally grid. If a monster, place it on the parameter of the grid. Each ally has a number, colour, and picture that help you meet the condition to banish a monster on the same row or column.

You win if you make a ring of candles by banishing all monsters around the parameter. If your deck runs out before you have a ring of candles, monsters break through and munch your bones.

Designed for solo play, co-op & heads-up capable.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Medieval, Puzzle

name: Quanto
description:
Competitive game about managing finances during the month lifecycle. Trying to learn players effectively manage your finances as in real life. You get your salary (if not fired), have to deal with regular payments (eg. rent, groceries,...) and other unpredictable events that can make you more money or cost you extra expenses. Good management and lot of luck needed to win the game.

You move around 31 tiles (representing 31 days in month) by rolling a dice (standard d6). There are several different tile types:

mandatory payment which you have to pay when passing by (groceries, rent, mortgage, phone bill,..)
draw a card tiles - gain, pay, monthly experiences - dozens of life situations that impacts your budget
wheel of luck tiles
salary - you get paid your monthly salary (everyone starts on the same salary, can be increased in the game, but can be also 0 if you get fired)
few more extraordinary tiles (eg. vacation, being fired, etc.)


Last player standing wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Unthinkable!
description:
Unthinkable is a 'Late Cold War' era area control game.

Players choose from one of 8 nuclear-armed Nation-states from 3 political blocs (teams). Players are soft-locked into these teams and must negotiate an ever-shrinking world with rising tension. As the possibility of nuclear war becomes increasingly likely, world leaders may have to ask;

Are you are willing to do the unthinkable?
categories: Modern Warfare, Political, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: La Guerra de Los Mil Dias
description:
A wargame for two players whose theme is the civil war which pitted the liberal rebels against the conservative government in Colombia between 1899 and 1902. This conflict was partly responsible for the secession of Panama in 1903.

—description from the designer (translated)

Un wargame pour deux joueurs dont le thème est la guerre civile qui opposa les rebelles libéraux contre le gouvernement conservateur entre 1899 et 1902. Ce conflit fut en partie responsable de la sécession de Panama en 1903.

—description from the designer (French)

Un wargame para dos jugadores cuyo tema es la guerra civil que enfrentó a los rebeldes liberales contra el gobierno conservador en Colombia entre 1899 y 1902. Este conflicto fue en parte responsable de la secesión de Panamá en 1903.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Oha!
description: Oha! is a word guessing game, like Cards against humanity. With 480 cards for the family. Includes funny specialcards like " next round do..." .

name: Five-Minute Midway
description:
This is a speedy game of the Battle of Midway. Players secretly allocate airplanes to missions: Fighters can escort bombers or fly high or low CAP (Combat Air Patrol), while bombers can carry either torpedoes or bombs. Players then reveal their choices and follow a procedure that creates aircraft losses and hits on ships. When one side has scored enough hits, it is the winner.

A D6 is used for some randomization, but the main sources of uncertainty are the players' own allocations of aircraft to missions, and their initial load-outs of airplanes: airplanes are represented by colored M&M candies, each bag of which embodies a different mixture. Players' strategies are thus in part determined by their initial inventories of aircraft, which can vary.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Cardosseum
description:
In this 2-3 player card game choose your gladiator and fight to the death! Get Equipment and defences and then destroy your opponent(s).

Cards are used as actions and equipment. Dice are used to resolve combat.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Puti: White
description:
Puti (White) is a cooperative card game where players must escape a haunted house being haunted by a White Lady. The only way out is by a series of clues left to you by the only person who can see the White Lady: a little child. Remember the clues, work together as a team, and escape or be trapped in the house forever!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Horror, Memory, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Matching, Memory, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Póker de letras
description: This game proposes a twist of the classic word game. Tiles have poker-style decoration, and the scoring system is based on that, with one exception: all letter have the same value (1 point), but if all the letters in a word are the same color (black or red) the score is doubled, and if they all are the same suit tripled. Additionally, the first word in the board is also played according to a different rule: it has to start in one of the four poker tiles symbols printed on the board.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: All'opera
description:
All'Opera is the first board game for the whole family born from the collaboration between Clementoni and the Arena Sferisterio Association, to have fun living the incredible stories that only operas can give.

A heroic Egyptian commander in love with an Ethiopian slave, a mysterious Chinese princess, an ingenious barber helping two lovers ... so many characters to be revived as if by magic!

Reinterpret the operas of Giuseppe Verdi, Giacomo Puccini and Gioachino Rossini, make decisions and overcome fun tests to reach the known endings or the most unexpected ones! Each player will choose a character and make different choices in the course of the story, which may change it and lead to several Opera-flavoured trials, including but not limited to singing!

Create your own stories, sing the most famous melodies and win the applause of the audience!

Playful-educational activities and the magic of the opera house meet in an original game for children of all ages, born from the happy collaboration between Clementoni and the world of culture.

Conceived, designed and developed in Italy.

—description from the publisher (translated)

All'Opera è il primo gioco da tavolo per tutta la famiglia nato dalla collaborazione tra Clementoni e l'Associazione Arena Sferisterio, per divertirsi a vivere le storie incredibili che solo le opere liriche possono regalare.

Un eroico comandante egizio innamorato di una schiava etiope, una principessa cinese misteriosa, un ingegnoso barbiere in aiuto di due innamorati... tanti personaggi da far rivivere come per magia!

Reinterpretate le opere liriche di Giuseppe Verdi, Giacomo Puccini e Gioachino Rossini, prendete decisioni e superate prove divertenti per giungere ai finali conosciuti o a quelli più inaspettati!

Create le vostre storie, cantate le melodie più famose e conquistate gli applausi del pubblico!

Attività ludico-formative e la magia del teatro d'opera si incontrano in un originale gioco per i bambini di tutte le età, nato dalla felice collaborazione tra la Clementoni e il mondo della cultura.

Ideato, progettato e sviluppato in Italia.

—description from the publisher

name: The Adventure Deck System
description:
A new rondel-based deck builder RPG that is playable solo or with friends, or even with enemies! Control a single hero, using your Adventure Deck to describe your hero and their actions in detail. Use Adventure Setting Cards and Foe Cards to craft an adventure for yourself and your friends. The Adventure Deck System uses instant resolution mechanics to ensure that you don't even need a table to play. Play around a campfire, on the train, and more! Randomizers are built right into the cards so you will never need dice or an app to determine chance again.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Game System
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Drawing, Multi-Use Cards, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Radio Game
description:
This is a two-player abstract strategy game released by the Wilder Mfg. Co., taking advantage of the timely radio trend. It is NOT the same game as those released by Parker Brothers, Milton Bradley, or Alderman-Fairchild with identical titles.

Gameplay is based on Checkers, with each player given five counters, called "messages," which they attempt to get to the opposing side's antennae for "broadcast." Movement is controlled by a spinner.

The game has been found advertised in 1927 but may date from an earlier year.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Shuffle: The Game of Life
description:
Get 100 LIFE points to win!
To score LIFE points, be the first to play all of the cards from your hand onto the table by:
•making sets and runs and
•adding to other players' sets and runs.

-Shuffle all cards together.
-Deal the cards to each player, face down.
-7 cards for 4 players, 8 cards for 3 players & 10 cards for 2 players.
-Put the remaining cards face down in the middle. This is the draw pile.
-Take the top card from the draw pile and put it face up next to the draw pile. This is the discard pile.

Double the fun and download the Shufflecards app for extra gameplay.

name: The Way Of The Barbarian: A Solitaire Role Playing Game
description:
The Way Of The Barbarian (SOLO RPG)

Your family has been executed in front of your eyes, your village has been burned down, and all of your friends have been massacred or enslaved. Only you survived. You have endured, suffered, trained and waited for the right moment all these years. Your sword is sharpened, the rough land has hardened you. Now is the time. Time to take revenge on those who let you experience the horror of your childhood. There will be blood, much blood, and you will not rest until the evil threat has been brought to its righteousness - by your blade.

How To Play

Never forget what you are, The rest of the world will not

Start the game with creating your character. Roll a die on the character creation tables to determine your hero’s characteristics such as gender, name and his/her background story. After you have created your character and rolled your starting location, you begin your journey with a one-handed sword (Damage +0), three bandages, 10 supply and no armor. Step onto one of your adjacent fields to meet your first encounter. Step onto one of the adjacent fields to take your first step on your way to revenge - barbarian style.

equip

What do you need to play?

To enjoy the game you need three six-sided dice, a pencil, an eraser, the enclosed sheets, a piece of paper and of course your imagination. The game is designed in such a way that most likely no extra purchases are necessary. Six-sided dice can be found in almost every household, which is why the use of special dice was avoided.

The Way Of The Barbarian is a solo RPG, which means you don't need a Game Master to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Adventures in Devil's Creek: A Solitaire Dungeon Crawler RPG in the Wild West
description:
ADVENTURES IN DEVIL´S CREEK

Adventures in Devil’s Creek is set in the wild west of a fictional America in the small town of Fortune’s Creek.

Fortune’s Creek was once a thriving small town that was a sought-after destination for treasure hunters and traders. The mines held vast amounts of gold and precious stones. The river that flows through the town kept bringing smaller crystals and sometimes even diamonds with it. This earned the city the name Fortune’s Creek. Anyone could get rich here, you just have to reach out and grab your hand.

But with wealth, corruption also found its way into the city and criminals soon regulated all trade routes. The legislature found itself powerless, but after three sheriffs disappeared in a very short time, the government sent a small army from Washington to ensure law and order in the city. However, the current rulers of Fortune’s Creek were unwilling to give up their gold mine without resistance and so it came to a wild, brutal battle that lasted for several days. Not only did criminals and crooks fall, many innocent people also died in the hail of bullets. After two days the last bullet was fired and the then corrupt mayor McKanzy was executed by the American army shortly afterwards. The city was now back in the hands of the state.

The events seemed to have affected not only the city but also the countryside, because the gold veins in the mines dried up and the river no longer brought any glittering stones with it. The once rich trading city became poorer and poorer. Where there was one joy and confidence, there was now more and more despair. This is how the city got its nickname Devil’s Creek. Only those who ventured deep into the mines could find gold - if they came out again. Those who made it reported strange creatures that have since found their home there. Soon hardly any people dared to venture into the widely ramified mine systems and the city was forgotten by history. You and your small group will end up in Devil’s Creek. Maybe you can get to the bottom of this and bring the city back to its former size.

The setting is enriched with "low fantasy" elements. You take on the role of three adventurers, take jobs in the local saloon and roam the countless mines of Fortune’s Creek, which were once rich in gold veins and are now inhabited by all sorts of creatures and other rabble.

WHAT DO I NEED TO PLAY?

To play, you need a piece of squared paper, a pencil, at least three 6-sided dice and one 4-sided dice. You should also have the attached cards printed out and arranged in a stack ready to hand.

HOW TO PLAY

Adventures in Devil’s Creek can best be classified under the category of "Dungeon Diver". You put together a group of three different characters (Brawler, Valkyrie, Voodoo Priest, White Witch, Gunslinger or Bounty Hunter) and set off to explore the local mines. Before or between the explorations, supplies can be replenished in the city, quests can be accepted or you can just relax and heal your wounds. It can be played by 1 to 3 players. The opponents are rolled and their behavior is determined by the drawing of cards.

GAMEPLAY

After creating the characters, you take a piece of squared paper, on which you draw the spaces that have been thrown out of the mine. The use of a DIN A5 sheet is recommended. Dice out the first room and draw it in the middle on one edge. Then you roll the dice on the space and resolve the encounters. If you defeat a boss, you have cleared the mine. The mine systems are reset and rerolled with each visit.

—description from the designer

name: 7 Turns To Die
description:
7 Turns To Die
Welcome to the zombie apocalypse! You are one of the last survivors and try to defend your home against the attacking zombies. However, it will not be easy, you have to hold out until help will arrive in 7 rounds.
7 Turns To Die is a fun variant of Escalero or other dice poker games, in which you have to defend your house against the attacking horde of zombies. Use your result to roll the dice and put up walls or other defenses to stop the creatures. Play alone, competitively or together against the undead.
Good luck, you will need it!
Preparation
Each player needs a pencil, an eraser and the prefabricated "base sheet". You also need five standard 6-sided dice.

Each player puts his "base sheet" in front of him - then decide who starts.

How To Play
A game consists of 3 rounds in which you expand your base and thus keep the attacking zombie hordes off. In a round, each player has 7 turns to expand his base and thus protect it from the waves of zombies. You can roll the dice up to 3 times per turn. If you are already satisfied with the result after your first throw, you can end your turn early. After 7 turns have been completed, a wave of zombies appears.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Push Your Luck

name: The Roly Poly Game
description: This is a Tiddledy Winks-style game in which two players take turns using a metal "snap" catapult to launch weighted wooden "figures" on to a colorful grid of 4x4 squares. Each square has a different points value and the goal is to be the first to reach a score of 250.

name: The Last Daimyo
description:
October 15th, 1600 saw the bloodiest and most decisive battle of feudal Japan: the battle of Sekigahara. The victor- the Tokugawa Shogunate- would rule Japan for the next 250 years and was the Last Daimyo. The battles leading up to that decisive moment became known as 'The Warring States period'. Now you can shape the course of Japanese history through skillful use of your loyal clans and manipulation of your allies whilst taking full advantage of natural events as they occur.
As one of 2-4 players, you will control one or more of feudal clans trying to establish supremacy over all of Japan. The game will start in 1554 and turns will represent about two years of time, ending no later than 1614 (30 turns). The game will include those events that defined this great struggle. Featuring floods, earthquakes, typhoons, peasant rebellions, pirates, famine and much more. There will be epic sieges and titanic open battles, as well as the chance to assassinate hated enemies.

The map will consist of one 22"x34" map covering all of mainland Japan and the two southern islands (Kyushu and Shikoku). Map labels will be in easy-to-read English font with accompanying Japanese characters to add historical flavor to proceedings. There will be 2 countersheets of 9/16" counters representing the 8 different major clans and 8 different minor clans, troop markers, plus various game effect counters. Two decks of cards (110 total) will be included. A full color rulebook will include synopses of some of the major players of this period (the Sengoku Jidai) as well as other fascinating historical tidbits to enhance the flavor of the game.

The basic game will be quick to learn and easy to play but the players will have a host of optional rules that will add greater detail, such as battle tactics, different types of soldiers (spearmen, samurai, arquebusiers, etc.), defections, and alliances. There will be a number of scenarios, allowing one to play anything from the full war (1554-1614) to shorter campaigns.

Depending on interest, there may also be an extension to allow players to start from the traditional beginning of the Sengoku Jidai, 1467. If you think you are ready to test your skill to become the Last Daimyo, Bring It On Games is ready for you to say, “bring it on”.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape from the Rock
description:
In June of 1962, Frank Morris, Clarence and John Anglin did the impossible. They escaped from the inescapable prison of Alcatraz. Or did they? Situated in San Francisco Bay, over a mile from the mainland, with icy, cold waters infested with man-eating sharks, the prison was said to be impossible for any inmate to find freedom. Over 14 previous escaped had proven that - but after their escape attempt, Morris and the Anglin brothers were never found. Many people think they escaped and had remained hidden for the rest of their lives.

Escape from the Rock is a new game designed by Adam Starkweather. From one to six players each play a prisoner that must find a way to escape from Alcatraz. The prisoners a player will play will be one of the actual convicts of the famous prison. These include such notables as AL Capone, Meyer “Mickey” Cohen, Frank Morris (who actually escaped), John Anglin (who also escaped), Robert “The Birdman” Stroud, Whitey Bulger, Creepy Karpis, Machine Gun Kelly, as well as many others. Each prisoner has a unique set of skills that will make playing that prisoner a unique experience.

The game will have a 22 by 34 inch map, two decks of 55 poker quality cards, a sheet of 5/8ths counters, dice, and a beautiful box to keep everything nice and locked up for when you aren’t playing. The game will have three general phases to the game - getting out of your cell, navigating your way to the water’s edge, and then finding a way to cross the icy waters of San Francisco Bay. The first one to escape and live to tell the tale is the winner. The game will be a wargame mechanically so this will be an ideal game to introduce the concepts of wargaming to your non-wargaming friends - have a copy of a Bulge game standing by.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Dice, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Events, Hidden Roles, Induction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Prisoner's Dilemma, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: El Gran Juego del Circuito de Jerez
description:
You run to win the Formula 1 Grand Prix of Spain at the Jerez de la Frontera speedway.

You have to carefully chose your tires before and take care during the race with the weather conditions, the level of fuel, tires wearing down and even your speed at the curves!

Roll you dices and take cards to advance in the race.

—user summary

name: The Rhodesian War
description:
Counterinsurgency in Rhodesia 1966-1979.

The Rhodesian War is a 3 player game that traces insurgency and counter-insurgency (COIN) operations in Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe) from the late 1960s to the late 1970s Each player takes control of a Faction seeking to enforce their agenda: the Rhodesian Government or one of two insurgent Factions—the Marxist-Leninist group Zimbabwe African People's Union (ZAPU). , or the Maoist group of ZANU (Zimbabwe African National Union).
Through the use of military, political, economic actions and by exploiting various events, players will build and maneuver their forces to influence the populace, extract resources, and fight their opponents to achieve their Faction's goals. A stack of cards regulates events, tempo, victory conditions, and other mechanics. The Rhodesian War uses the COIN series system.

Contre insurrection en Rhodésie 1966-1979.

The Rhodesian War est un jeu pour 3 joueurs qui retrace les opérations d’insurrection et de contre-insurrection (COIN) en Rhodésie (aujourd'hui le Zimbabwe) depuis la fin des années 1960 jusqu’à la fin des années 70. Chaque joueur prend le contrôle d’une Faction cherchant à faire prévaloir son agenda : le Gouvernement Rhodésien ou une des deux Factions insurgées—le groupe marxiste-léniniste de la ZAPU ( Zimbabwe African People's Union ou L'Union du peuple africain du Zimbabwe ) , ou le groupe maoïste de la ZANU ( (Zimbabwe African National Union ou Union nationale africaine du Zimbabwe).
Par l’utilisation d’actions militaires, politiques, économiques et en exploitant divers
événements, les joueurs construiront et manœuvreront leurs forces pour influencer la population, extraire des ressources et combattre leurs adversaires afin d'atteindre les objectifs de leur Faction. Une pile de cartes régule les événements, le tempo, les conditions de victoire et d'autres mécanismes. The Rhodesian War utilise le système de la série COIN

name: International hunters: el primer juego de mesa de caza del s.XXI
description:
This games comes in three flavors:


Big game hunting (Spanish geography board)
Small game hunting (European geography board)
Card game (travel edition, no board)


Move your meeple along the board. Use the cards with the suitable items in each step: before, during and after hunting. You have to demonstrate your knowledge in hunting and then, roll the customized dices to try!

name: Silk: Prom Improvements
description:
Promotional tile given when reserving the base game.

Rules:

This Silk promo tile can be included in your games if all the players agree to that. Bear in mind that Silk must be played with a maximum of four improvement tiles, so you will have to leave aside one of the original ones in order to include any new ones.

The first player to place three silkworms of his color on three pasture tiles of the same type (in other words: 9 silkworms on equally valued tiles) immediately receives 5 silk Points. Flip over the silkworm improvement marker.

name: Plague: Divine Retribution
description:
Spread disease and devastation from the comfort of your home with this suit-based deckbuilding game!

You are a fledgling disease competing to become the most infamous plague in history. Start with paltry rats, develop a powerful deck of carriers, and try to infect the reclusive nobility.

Please visit the official website to leave feedback about the gameplay and rulebook. Thank you!

—description from the Tabletopia entry
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Medieval, Religious
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Il gioco della famiglia GBR
description:
The game is very simple and is based on 30 different and fun challenges, which can be played in no time.

Some challenges are to be played at home, because they need typical objects such as spoons, a napkin, a comb or a pillow.
Others do not need any additional items, or simply use game components, such as the box, the 2 wooden dice or the 6 wooden thumb pieces.

You can play the game in two different ways, the former being just to draw one card at a time and to make that challenge: the winner takes the cards and who first wins N cards wins the match.

The latter way is the main game. Besides the 30 challenge cards you also have 15 action cards. You prepare a trial by shuffling challenge and action cards together, in such a way that the game is always different from one match to another. The action cards (e.g., safety car) give fun and rhythm to the game.

Until the first player reaches the finish line you never know who will be the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: Wild: Discovering Animals
description:
Each card shows an animal and 12 characteristics have been selected, including a peculiarity and a curiosity, to highlight some of the most interesting aspects that are not normally explored.

Each card also shows the conservation status of the animal depicted, a fact that makes us reflect on the delicate balance of nature, to be admired and safeguarded.

Many possible games can be played with these cards: "Discover it" where players need to guess the selected animal among 25 cards knowing only certain information; "Animal line" where players have to put animals in ascending order of the chosen characteristic (e.g. from the smallest to the biggest); "Battle" is similar to "Top Trumps" but with a twist!

name: Crack the Quizzler's Code
description:
A supervillain has taken over the city!

The nefarious Quizzler and her team of malefactors have created a series of devious riddles. You've got one hour to play her fiendish game, and save the day. A pocket-sized escape room in a box for 1-4 players. 45-60 minutes.

—description from the designer

name: Word Field
description: A game with a learning time of under 5 minutes. Our goal is to collect the letters in the letter field before our opponent and find a word. You can complicate the game to your opponents with power cards and penalty cards.

name: Die Rheinreise
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The start at Mainz and have to reach Cologne. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach Cologne wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Die lustige Sieben
description: All players roll a die. Whoever rolls highest pays a coin into the till and dons the jester's cap. The other players take turns to roll two dice. Each player has a card, where he marks off the numbers he just rolled by closing the corresponding flap. Whenever he closes a flap, the player may roll again. If a player rolls a number which flap is already closed, he pays a coin to the jester. On the roll of a 7, the player pays a coin into the till and takes over the jester's cap and hands over his card to the former jester. When a player has closed all flaps on either half of his card, he gets half the content of the till. The game ends, when a player has closed al his flaps. This player wins the game and the till.

name: Super Truffle Pigs: Tantrum Time-Out Promo Card
description:
This card was part of the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter. It adds a new Super Pig Power to the game:

"Tantrum Time Out
Cost 1
Knock out one Wold and send it back to its den to think about how it behaved."
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Variable Set-up

name: SpongeBob SquarePants: Plankton Rising – Board Games Promo Card
description:
This is a new card forSpongeBob SquarePants: Plankton Rising. It was part of the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter

"Board Games
Cost 4

+ 1 blue die or +1 yellow die"
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tavern Tales: Consumables Promo Card
description:
This card was part of the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter for Tavern Tales: Legends of Dungeon Drop

Feat Card
Name: 1. and Adventurer Power
Type: Consumables
Effekt: Adventurer Power: Draw Feat, peek at it, and then add it to the claim face down.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deduction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: French Cards
description:
Each player receives 15 Word cards at the beginning of the game. On a player's turn they must lay out multiple Word cards on the board in order to make a complete sentence. The longer the sentence made the more points that sentence is worth. The first player to get 300 points wins.

There are a number of common and "sexy" words that are included in the game. Players are encouraged to create sentences that their fellow players find sensual, cheeky, and amusing. This is a game that encourages consensual "adult play".

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 25
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 25 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Pegasus Scout Hover Tank (Upgrade)
• Bulldog Medium Tank (ERLL/Chemical/LB-X/Plasma)
• Demolisher Heavy Tank (Cell/Arrow IV/Clan/Gauss/MRM/Reinforced)
• Pouncer T/F/G/I/W/X
• Vindicator VND-7L
• Chameleon TRC-4B/CLN-8V/CLN-9V
• Wraith TR5
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Pirate Loot: Port Expansion
description:
A 6 card deck of retailer-exclusive Port cards that can be added to the base and expanded 5/6 player game.

Cards include:

Blood Island
Port Royal
Treasure Isle
Paradise Cove
Hidden Port
Ship Graveyard
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Pirates

name: Everyone Else Thinks This Game is Awesome: Sex, Drugs, and Citations
description: Adds more than 500 additional questions about sex, booze, drugs, gross stuff and more.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Everyone Else Thinks This Game is Awesome: Death Booster
description: Adds more than 100 additional questions and fun facts about death
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Everyone Else Thinks This Game is Awesome: Pale Blue Deck
description: Adds more than 100 questions about space and beyond.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Bitcoin Moon!
description:
Bitcoin Moon! Is a strategic card game where you build wealth though cryptocurrency. You can purchase mining rigs to mine Bitcoin or Altcoin. Or perhaps you’ll try your luck and HODL as you purchase Bitcoin or Altcoin. In a market where fortunes are quickly made and lost, you need to be the first player to become a crypto millionaire to win!

At the beginning on a player’s turn, they may buy and sell cryptocurrency or invest in mining rigs. Then the player draws a card from the deck. The cards will change the market price of cryptocurrency, provide rewards for owning mining rigs, along with a few surprises. Players take turns attempting to their best strategy at either investing, mining, or both to become the first player with $1 million in cryptocurrency value. The first player to become a crypto millionaire wins!

-description from publisher

name: Legends of the Untamed West: Desperados
description:
It is 1898 and the mine at Silver Creek has run dry. However, before Silver Creek residents decided to pack it in, a miner struck gold! People immediately got back to work with record profits. But rumors of a rich town with soft citizens soon spread and the infamous "Mad Bart," and his gang of thugs, are on the prowl. Silver Creek needs all the help it can get to fight off these threats.

Desperados is a complete programmed adventure set in the American West for solitaire or group play. The game includes an adventure booklet, game rules and playing pieces used to resolve the gun fights fought on the game map (also included). It is the fourth in the Legends of the Untamed West series which uses a similar game system to Dark City Games' Legends of the Ancient World, which is based on the Fantasy Trip game system.

—description from the publisher

name: Nouvelles ContRées: 4 marque-pages exclusifs
description:
Kit of 4 exclusive bookmarks.

Each bookmark presents a new illustration and a new reading constraint.

For example: "Take a single deep breath, HHHHhhh, then read all you can in one breath and on as many lines as possible."

It integrates with the game's bookmarks and plays the same.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Stoopido: Happy Meal Edition
description:
A 2 player only version of Stoopido with fewer components.

For setup each player gets a big red pair of plastic glasses on which different parts of masks can be attached: one part for the hat (or top of the head), one for the nose, two for the ears, and one for the eyes (some of the later also hinder sight).

Player take turns to roll a six sided custom die with faces, which determine, which part can be added to a face. Then everybody tries to first hit the correct "button" tile in front of the players, to be allowed to place such a part onto another player. Additionally there is a "wild" die face, which allows to place any part and a "bad luck" one, were another player may put a part onto the player, who rolled the die.

Whoever is first full attached with all pieces looses the game and a photography can be taken from him or her.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Humor, Real-time

name: Hell's Bunker Rescue
description:
On a volcanic moon, your mission is to rescue a prisoner from a bunker by avoiding robot sentries. Time is limited!

You lay out a grid of 6x8 floor tiles (incl. 2 lava tiles that evrything dies on) plus a door tile on top where the prisoner is. Then place 6 robot sentries on the grid and your 4 rescuers carrying a crate with a protective suit for the prisoner below the grid.

You move your team onto the grid from any point below trying to reach the prisoner behind the door on top. Once freed, you must take the prisoner back to the bottom of the grid where your team started. When successful, you win if you have at least one team member and the prisoner still in play.

During a turn first you roll a 1D6 for the robot movement. The robots kill any team member that is on the same tile with them. Then you can move each team member 1 tile in any direction.
Repeat until either you rescued the prisoner or all of your team members are dead. Easy mode gives you 25 turns, hard mode only 20 turns to accomplish this.

So, are you up to the challenge? Can you rescue the prisoner in time?

name: Sioux Falls-Opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the great city of Sioux Falls, South Dakota?

While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Sioux Falls we could into this box. It's full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions, and of course...Jazzfest - A little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience Sioux Fall?

Here's a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite Sioux Falls properties, and increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax, and the IRS and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

Get your game on!

Choose your token and advance to Go Sioux Falls! You may soon be the Mayor...or out of the game eating too many Almond Croissants!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Monopoly: Columbus, NE Collector's Edition
description:
In the 1850s, Americans were turning their eyes to the West. Hardy settlers had been traveling the plains for the past decade. In 1856, a group of men from Columbus, Ohio selected a spot near the confluence of the Platte and Loup Rivers as the place they would start a new town, in Nebraska, called Columbus. 150 years later, Columbus, Nebraska celebrates its Sesquicentennial or 150th birthday.

From a proud past filled with characters like Buffalo Bill Cody and the North Brothers to a current city of 21,000 filled with industry and advanced agriculture, it has been 150 years of "Power and Progress."

Enjoy this collector's edition of the world's favorite board game, Monopoly, with images and properties drawn from Columbus, Nebraska in 2006.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Saboteur: The Duel Teaser Game
description: A small version of the game with cards that need to be cut apart. It only has around half the cards of the full game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building

name: Drive on Leningrad: 1941
description:
Drive on Leningrad: 1941 (CIE Volume 1) is a two-player series of games focused on campaign scenarios at the division/corps level. The system uses the same maps as War in Europe (WIE), with updated graphics and a more detailed terrain analysis. The counters have been upgraded and are presented with historical identifications. The game system utilizes a Move/Fight, Fight/Move sequence of play to portray simply doctrinal differences among contending armed forces. It also utilizes headquarters units to project logistics and combat support capabilities.

Drive on Leningrad covers the Army Group North drive on Leningrad in 1941, and the ensuing Soviet counteroffensive. It ends with the German relief of the Demyansk Pocket.

Each game turn (GT) represents around one week in clear weather and two weeks in mud and snow game turns. Each hex represents 20 miles (32.5 km) across. German, Finnish, and Western Allied units are shown mostly as division-sized units, with Soviet and Axis Allied units depicted as corps.

—description from the publisher

name: Exocolony
description:
Exocolony is set in the not-so-distant future, just as humans are beginning to colonize the solar system, but haven't yet colonized other stars. 1-5 players jockey for position, buy and sell resources, build colonies and discover new lifeforms. The main path to victory is to build up enough resources to send a ship to another star system.
