Players will collect resources in the form of wooden blocks each turn. These are then spent to place wooden colonies and purchase cards. Victory points are awarded for settling colonies and buying action cards. 16 Victory points are needed to win.

—description from the designer

name: Rêves de Gloire
description:
Rêves de Gloire ("Dreams of Glory") is a solitaire, strategic-level wargame of the Napoleonic Wars between 1805-14. The player takes the role of Napoleon Bonaparte, the newly self-crowned Emperor of France, determining French foreign and military policy, establishing Bonapartist dynasties in satellite states, and raising and leading French and allied armies and fleets in an era of ever-shifting alliances. The game system controls the opposing Coalition forces led by Great Britain. The objective of the Empire is to conquer or control either Great Britain, or as much of Europe as possible, without upsetting the balance of Power, and thus triggering radical revolution or conservative reaction.
Each game turn represents one year. Sizes of the regions vary but are generally at least 100 miles across. Unit sizes are army level (10,000+) with individually named leaders.

—description from the publisher

name: Trek 12: Amazonia – Ocelot
description:
This promotionnal card is a small expand to play with Trek 12 Amazonia

Carte observation promotionnelle pour le jeu Trek 12 Amazonie. Cette carte s'ajoutent aux autres du jeu.
categories: Animals, Dice, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trek 12: Amazonia – Moucherolle Royal
description:
This promotionnal observation card is a small expansion for trek 12 amazonia.

Cette carte d'observation promotionnelle s'ajoute aux cartes incluses dans le jeu Trek 12 Amazonie.
categories: Animals, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration

name: Camp Moonforest
description:
You receive a package in the mail from your favourite summer camp counselor. The camp has been shut down in a hurry, the grounds abandoned. Something has happened. Nothing is as it should be. They need your help.

Inspired by classic 1980s coming of age stories like Stand by Me, E.T., and even Stranger Things, Camp Moonforest pulls players into a narrative adventure filled with puzzles and different challenges to overcome.

Suitable for young adventures, the game provides a beginner-level introduction to a world of intrigue and mystery. Players work together to search through physical props, artefacts, and documents that allow the story to unfold through a narrative investigation.

Together you'll scour for clues, solve different riddles and puzzles, and ultimately unravel the mystery surrounding Camp Moonforest. The game ends when players learn what has really been going on in the quiet of the abandoned camp.

name: Hunt for the Forgotten Tomb
description:
Buried by time and forgotten by history, the greatest treasures of an ancient civilization finally await discovery: riches beyond wealth and power beyond life. In this Egyptology inspired adventure game players work together to unravel the mystery of a lost tomb, following the documented search of a long-lost Egyptologist.

There is no turn order or traditional board - everything you need comes packed into an uncooperative wooden crate. The game comes packed with specially-crafted relics, diary entries, notes, and other pieces that will aid in the player's investigation. Players will work together to scour for clues, solve a range of puzzles, and piece together the mystery surrounding the forgotten tomb and the missing Egyptologist.

At the end, the player's will uncover the truth of the forgotten tomb.

-description from publisher

name: Newsworthy: A Conversational Game
description:
Newsworthy is a social game where players are investigative news hounds. Players seek articles on the internet from their smart phones, tablets, or PCs. The game can be played in person or remotely. The topics to investigate each round are guided by Tech Deck cards. Newsworthy is a blend of a conversational game, an investigative game, and a social game. A player voting mechanic allows articles to be rated to score points. It has a unique game mechanic because players seek information from outside of the game on the internet.

OBJECTIVE – Players/teams try to score points by finding news articles that meet the objectives set by Tech Deck cards.
GAME PLAY – Each round, a Tech Deck card is revealed which sets the topic. Players then search for articles based on the topic for that round. There is a voting mechanic where players can vote on the articles that have been found to score points.
SCORING AND WINNING - If playing in Blitz play mode, the game ends in one round. In normal mode, with more than 2 players, the game ends when a player scores 10 points; otherwise, it ends when a player has 5 points. If there are ties, the tied players share the victory. Players may decide to continue to play and continue the conversation! I have seen rounds go an entire hour! The point of the game is to foster interesting conversation after all.
THEME – Players are investigative reports for a news agency

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Electronic, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Player Judge, Questions and Answers, Real-Time, Voting

name: The Disappearance of Cadet Turner
description:
Players will join the search for Cadet Turner in this narrative puzzle adventure. You will dive into a world of 80s nostalgia and classic science fiction, searching through letters, comics, and digital content to find clues and puzzles that you'll need to solve in order to solve the mystery surrounding the disappearance of Cadet Turner.

This experience uses a free companion app (available for both iOS and Android) and website that allows players to interact with the physical contents of the experience.

Players work cooperatively to piece together the clues and evidence scattered throughout physical props, documents, and digital content in order to solve this mystery.
categories: Children's Game, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle, Science Fiction

name: Victoria
description:
A 1950's Argentinian wargame.
2-player adaptation of Aernaval.

name: Rutas Nacionales
description:
2 game modes: "Circuit Race" and "Sightseeing Trip".

Players start in Buenos Aires. In "Circuit Race" mode, everyone must ride the main routes (marked on the map). In the "Tourism Trip" mode (to the North or to the South), the cities to be covered by each player are distributed equally, and each player decides the route according to his goals.

Players will roll the dice on their turn and advance along the routes, touring cities and picking up "luck" cards. The winner will be the one who visits the objective cities and routes, and returns first to the Capital Federal.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Network and Route Building

name: Women in Sports Special Edition Trivia Pack
description:
This Women in Sports Special Edition Trivia Pack celebrates the achievements of over five generations of athletes.

100 trivia questions. Strategy needed to win. Hints by comedians. This Special Edition set is playable on its own, but for the best experience, shuffle the cards into the core GENSMAK! game.

All profits donated to the Women’s Sport Foundation.

—description from the publisher

name: ならべてカンブリア (Line Up Cambria)
description:
Let's travel back 541 million years ago to the Cambrian sea where a variety of new organisms were born. In fact, let's try our hand at making those organisms prosper!

In ならべてカンブリア (Line Up Cambria), you build a miniature version of the Cambrian sea out of eight cards, trying to score as many points as possible. To set up, shuffle the landscape cards and scoring cards face down, then lay them out in four piles. Choose a first player.

In a round, starting with the first player, each player chooses a pile of cards not in front of themselves, selects a card from it, then adds it to the left or right of all cards they already have in play. Landscape cards are placed horizontally and have two elements on them; scoring cards have one element on them and one of three types of scoring conditions, and they are placed a line vertically (so the scoring condition is present below their line of cards).

Pass the starting marker, then start a new round. After eight rounds, tally your points based on the scoring cards you've collected and how well you've met those conditions. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Climate Change 2050: Who can save the most?
description:
The world's four leading nations are facing climate change and resource scarcity. Their goal is to build trade routes to get food and water.

But as they continue to emit CO2, climate change advances and the temperature rises. The destruction of the world progresses little by little and the affected people flee to the nations.

Technologies must be built to transform to green energy, food crops improved, and desalination plants developed. At the same time, energy supplies must not collapse.

The nations pass through five ages in which the situation becomes more and more precarious. In the end, the nation that destroys nature the least and saves the most people wins.

Climate Change: Who can save the most is a strategic resource management & area control game that implements the coming reality on the table at home.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Mature / Adult, Political, Science Fiction, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Income
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), easy and smart

name: Thar Once Be A Ship
description:
Yer all pirates, down to y’r very core…

Ye laugh together, drink together, fight yer foes together…

Merchants and Monsters alike fear yer mighty crew. Yer ship has ruled the open seas for more ‘n a decade.

And as captain, it’s up to you to load yer vessel with the shiniest gold, the deadliest cannons, the most despicable crew, and enough vittles and rum to keep ‘em from plotting a mutiny.

Game play:

From the designer of the medieval card game Of Knights and Ninjas comes There Once was a Ship, a 20 minute roll and write game for 1-6 skallywags.


Choose a group of dice (various colors represent gold, weapons, infamy, crew, and supplies).
Record yer scores on a simple half page print out.
Reroll yer dice, organizing them back into groups based on their number.


Will ye stash gold, stockpile weapons, or recruit an infamous crew?

After five short rounds, tally up yer score. Best out o’ three wins. If ye ave any pirate blood in ye, ye’ll play again. And again. And again!

Till every last fool is a feared of so much as whisperin yer name.

name: Lizzie Borden's Ghost: The Board Game
description: The game takes place in Fall River, Mass. In 1927 immediately after the natural death of Elizabeth “Lizzie” Andrew Borden, the main suspect in the August 4, 1892, ax murders of her father and stepmother. One player takes the role of Lizzie Borden. The remaining take the roles of City Marshal, Judge, Neighbor Lady, and News Reporter, called the “Seekers.” The Seekers move room to room while picking up Victorian-age equipment to capture Lizzie’s ghost as it travels the scene of the crime: the Borden home.
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement
publishers: Best True Crime Books, Games & Video LLC

name: Architetti attenti
description:
Take on the role of builders to design the most beautiful town, but be careful: you must never lose sight of your opponent's plans! A fun and addictive game to train basic cognitive functions, indispensable for the development of soft skills.
Each turn consists of three steps: Purchase one of the 4 tiles in the centre of the table by paying the cost in gems, Place the tile on your lawn board, Reveal a new tile. The game ends when all the tiles are finished. Points are counted according to how you have placed the tiles, combinations of buildings and other urban elements that earn victory points in different ways.

name: Masu Math
description:
Masu Math is a card game where players will use the cards from their hand to add or subtract to reach certain numbers. Specifically, the number a player needs to reach is the number of cards previously played in the round.

That is, if there are 11 cards in play at the start of a player's turn, they need to play cards which they can combine using addition or subtraction to reach 11; if they play 3 cards to do so, the next player will need to play cards which can reach 14.

Players are eliminated from a round when they cannot play, and the person who is the last to be eliminated earns the most points. The game is played over a series of rounds and the player with the most points wins.

name: Rescue: A Tabletop Survival Game
description:
Rescue is a game of collecting equipment and survivors to overcome obstacles and being crowned as the winner. Players will take on the role of a wandering wastelander attempting to survive post-apocalyptic earth. Players must use equipment and action cards to overcome various obstacles and threats. In the process, they will enhance themselves and the survivors they rescue with loot, uncover lore, and stab their fellow players in the back.

This game is played in a series of 10 rounds consisting of two phases. The first phase of the round is the player action phase.

Phase 1: Action Phase
During this round, players may take the following actions. Steal a card from another player (excluding a survivor card), apply a piece of equipment to a survivor, or draw from the cache deck.

Steal a Card: When stealing a card, the individual having the card stolen will shuffle the fail card and the desired card together. The thief will then pick from one of the two cards. The card is not stolen if the fail card is selected from the two.

Apply Survivor Equipment: A player may apply spare equipment cards to any survivors they may have acquired. If the survivor is lost due to failing an event, the equipment applied to the survivor is also lost.

Draw a Card: If a player selects this option, draw one card from the cache deck.

After performing one of the above described actions, the player may then apply or remove equipment cards to themselves by placing them in front of themselves.

Finally, the first phase ends with players ensuring they have no more than five cards in their hands (unless they have a backpack applied). To accomplish this, they may discard any additional cards and place them in the discard pile or give spare cards to any other player.

Phase 2: Event Phase
During this phase, all players will be presented with an event. If they defeat the obstacle, they gain a prize as annotated on the card. If a player cannot defeat an obstacle, they must perform the loss action. Each player does not get an individual event. One event card is drawn, and all players must overcome that same event. If a player has zero survivors and the loss condition is to discard a survivor card, that player is eliminated from the game.

To defeat an obstacle, the players must have a stat number equal to or greater than the stat/stats being challenged. There are four stats that could be challenged, and those are Strength (STR), Accuracy (ACC), Intelligence (INT), and Stamina (STA). Each piece of equipment has stat/stats. Add the stat/stats required for the challenge to determine if you will defeat it.
Note: Equipment cards can not be equipped or unequipped during this phase.

Winning: Have the most survivor cards at the end of the ten rounds.

-description from designer

name: Fluff Fluff Boom
description:
Get ready for a fluffy, explosion of a good time. In fact, most players don't even sit down! This fast-paced card game is easy to pick up, but hard to put down. There are 5 different card types. Place bombs on your opponents fluffs, and fix your fluffs with med kits. Keep the bomb gloves you find to protect your fingertips and look out for the flip card that can extend the round. Have the most fluff's by playing your cards faster than everyone else to win. Oh... and don't go boom.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Real-Time, Take That

name: Αναζητώντας Πετρέλαιο (Searching for Oil)
description:
The players take turns one after the other.
Each player moves his pawn round the board, from hex to hex as per the die result.
Each hex describes an event and its result. You either gain or loose money.
Each player uses his money to buy plastic pieces that simulate oil facilities and place them on the 6 slots of his property which is drawn on the board. Those pieces are oil wells (2 piecess - slots), gas tanks (2 pieces - slots) and oil tanks (one small and one big, one slot each).
The player who accomplishes this first, wins the game.

–user summary

name: Vostok
description:
In the early 1990’s a Russian antarctic expedition began drilling through the ice to a fresh water Lake dubbed Lake Vostok.

On Feb 2012 they succeeded in drilling more than 2,000 miles. It took more than 30 years.

Many raised concerns of the risks of breaking a barrier to a lake sealed off between 15 and 34 million years. But someone made the call that breaking this barrier was worth the risk.

Because the quantity of oxygen in Lake Vostok exceeds anywhere on our planet by 10-20X. Scientists predicted they would find new species that evolved far differently than any seen before.

After the initial research was completed a conspiracy theory propagated online. One of the Russian scientists defected. He claimed a highly intelligent creature, a new organism, engaged with them and killed some team members. This is where our Vostok story begins.

After a distress signal was received an unprecedented storm cut all contact with Vostok Station. As the storm raged on without any signs of letting up, multiple recon teams were sent. Your team is the only one to make it. After crashing 10 clicks away, you arrive at the aftermath of a massacre. Early into the reconnaissance you realize the story of the station goes much deeper.

The game is based on a First Strike Combat System. Players must battle physically and meta physically. Players also learn to control insanity and weaponize it.

An AI is provided to assist your team to off-set the intelligence of the new organism. The AI assists in many ways including scientific, weapon and ammunition recipes.

There are several player characters to choose from with varying capabilities. Players are free to assemble the kind of team they prefer.

Your team must fully explore the Russian station, re-establish communications, report back on the status and insure the chamber to the lake is sealed. Your team wins if they can make it the chamber and confirm it is sealed.

—description from the publisher

name: Zombicide: Mission A1 – Lost!
description:
Designed by the original studio, A missions are supplementary missions released online for print and play.

A1 is an easy/medium difficulty exploration mission for the original zombicide.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Sunspear Dervishes
description:
Sunspear Dervishes raise House Martell’s doctrine of high mobility to a fine art. Their training allows them to rapidly engage, strike hard, and just as rapidly disengage to either prep for another run or choose a more opportune target. Enemies so besieged are often so rattled by the spinning, whirling dance of blades that their own response is badly hampered. While Dervishes can hold in a melee for a time, they’re best kept on-the-move or working together with other Martell units to wear down a particularly determined foe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Sand Skirmishers
description:
House Martell’s Sand Skirmishers turn their doctrine of high mobility into a deadly dance of blade and bow. Their light armor allows them superior speed, rivaling that of the fastest enemy units, and their training allows for deadly hit-and-fade attacks, all under a rain of incoming arrows. If locked down in a protracted melee, Skirmishers can hold their own as well as any light unit, but a wise commander will free them as soon as possible, allowing their dance to begin anew. They work particularly well savaging enemy lines already engaged with Martell Spearmen.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Joking Hazard: Patreon Exclusive Promo Card
description:
This card was an exclusive gift for Patreons of Cyanide and Happiness.
It shows a boy on Santas lap thinking about his best Christmas memory (the first two cards)

Its red boarded, so it may only be placed at the end of the comic.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Joking Hazard: Pensacon 2019 Promo Card
description:
This card was given out at Pensacon 2019.
It shows Green Skirt Guy telling that "they must be in Florida"
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Bloody Big HUNGARY '48 Battles!
description:
The Hungarian War of Independence was the largest and longest of the conflicts arising from Europe’s Year of Revolution in 1848. It lasted a year, saw half a million troops engaged, and generated dozens of significant engagements on three major fronts. Dedicated research now makes this neglected conflict accessible to wargamers. BBHB lets you refight sixteen of the most important battles of the war! Each scenario gives you:


A clear and accurate historical situation
New decisions for both sides every turn
Simple but ingenious victory conditions
A battle you can fight to the finish in an evening
A great game that will ebb and flow to the end!


Most also offer scenario options to explore ‘what-ifs’ and increase replay value. Campaign options allow players to link battles so that each has consequences for the next.

—description from the publisher

name: Embarquement immédiat
description:
Immediate boarding to find the most eco-responsible traveler! It's a strategy game where you have to use the means of transport to go as far as possible while having a limited ecological impact. Once your destinations are open, you will multiply the travel experiences to score as many points as possible and gain the upper hand over other players. Luck will also be in the game: it's up to you to take up the eco-responsible challenges!
Laughter in perspective but also discovery... enough to make you want to go on a trip.

—description from the publisher (translation)

Embarquement immédiat pour dénicher le voyageur le plus éco-responsable ! C’est un jeu de stratégie où il faudra utiliser les moyens de transports pour aller le plus loin possible tout en ayant un impact écologique limité. Une fois vos destinations ouvertes, vous multiplierez les expériences de voyage pour marquer un maximum de points et prendre l’ascendant sur les autres joueurs. La chance sera également de la partie : à vous de relever les défis éco-responsables !
Du rire en perspective mais aussi de la découverte… de quoi vous donner envie de partir en voyage.

—description from the publisher (French)

name: Jeopardy! Card Game Junior Edition
description: Enjoy America's Favorite Quiz Show with the kid-friendly Junior Edition card game. Each deck plays out like a full episode, complete with Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy!, and Final Jeopardy! rounds.

name: I've Got Bear Parts! Card Game
description:
Collect, attack, and defend your way to victory in this exciting game of bear battles! It takes four bear parts to complete each bear: Head, Torso, Arms, and Legs. Get three complete bears first and win the game.

But wait... it's not that simple. Your opponents will be vying for the same prize and will do anything in their bear power to stop you!

Use the power of all eight bear species to gain the ultimate edge with things like the strength of a "Grumpy" Grizzly Bear or magic of the spectacled "Wizard" Bear!

Who will be the first to complete a trio of bears?

name: Making Monsters
description: You are a stark raving, egomaniacal mad scientist on a quest to earn your place in history as the greatest—and most infamous—monster maker of all time. Sew, splice, and solder together body parts in your lab to create the most menacing, cute, or downright unholy monsters you can imagine. Gain Prestige by making monsters and wowing the crowd in the Mad Science Fair. Earn the most Prestige (VP) and be declared the greatest scientist to ever live.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Gloom Cowl Promo
description:
The Gloom Cowl Promo was included with the Repokratis miniature (not part of the Kingdom Death: Monster Game).

Beta Rules - 1 x new gear and 1 x new armor set bonus card that were included with the Reapokratis First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

Gear card sneak peek: Gloom Cowl (armor, gloomy, leather)- Your attacks gain +2 accuracy when attacking a monster you are adjacent to.

The Reapokratis is packaged in a hand-stamped kraft box and limited to 500. It includes:

1 x Photoresin Reapokratis
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
2 x Beta Gameplay Cards: gear, armor set bonus card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card

Repokratis is a gloomy death obsessed survivor that rarely sleeps. He travels alone, searching for his lost older brother Grimmory.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Australia (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
A fan expansion for Age of Steam by Goodsound

This expansion brings the player to the most Eastern continent of the World.
Australia has a lot of desert and some high hills, so building railroad won't be cheap.
It also introduces a new special action called Subvention which can help to the weakest player.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Connections, Dice Rolling, Loans, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Selection Order Bid, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction

name: 三村人狼 (Sanmura Jinrou)
description:
A card game with "trick-taking + draft elements" that uses the world view of the Werewolf game. It is a difficulty level for those with experience in trick taking.

After cards have been dealt, players passes two cards to their left ("drafting").

Players need to follow the lead suit ("trick-taking". Some of the cards have effects that will be resolved at the end of a trick. When any player has one or less card in the their hand, the hand ends. Every player then reveals cards remaining in their hands to determine whether Demon Fox, Villagers or Werewolves win ("Werewolf"). The winner side score victory points based on those remaining cards in their hand.

name: Anastasia
description:
Roll and Write Revolution returns with an asymmetric 1-2 player polyomino placing roll and write game. Players are seeking to either help a supposed Anastasia flee from the country or trap her for questioning. The players take up the sides of the White (Loyalist) and Red (Bolshevik) Armies. The supposed Anastasia though moves on her own with the help of cards which guide the movement each turn.

Players draft from a decreasing pool of dice to place their polyomino shapes to the map and may also play cards to influence the movement cards or the dice.

Players will fine challenge in this game as it plays in certain ways like a cat and mouse game with each side attempting to direct the mouse to a goal while avoiding the traps.

—description from the publisher

name: Towering Inferno
description:
The call comes in, Engine House Number 9, there is a building on fire downtown. Upon arriving at the scene, it becomes clear to the firefighters that the fire is no ordinary fire. That most of the city is also on fire or has been leveled by a giant monster spitting flame and doing the Twist down 4th Street. Fire hoses and axes are not going to stop a monster, let the national guard handle that! Focus on putting out the fire in this high rise office building, chaps! Up the stairs, no power, keep those people safe!

In Towering Inferno, Roll and Write Revolution goes 3D! Just print, fold, and tape then you're ready to play!

The game sheet becomes a building with 3 or 4 sides for the players to mark the progress of the fire and their firefighters as they strive for the safety of the structure.

Each turn a pool of dice is roll and players select 1 die to act as their firefighter and one to act as their fire. The fire fighter has to enter the building then progress upward as they follow the path to save rooms and control the fire as it burns. The fire will burn downward or to the left or right ignoring paths, but avoiding rooms that have already been secured.

Players can also utilize the special powers of each side of the building they are on to help them move up or laterally. Clever play in this game finds the players having to plan for their moves but also plan for where the fire might go.

Can you secure the fire before the entire structure becomes a Towering Inferno? Or will your dreams go up in flames in this new roll and write game!

—description from the designer

name: ABC DRS 3
description:
Play Switzerland radio's ABC DRS 3 call-in word game at home!

The candidate player has 45 seconds to find a word (first letter is known) in response to a definition read aloud by the moderator. The listener players bet on how many correct answers the candidate can provide.

From the box (in German): ABC DRS 3 weckt die grauen Zellen. Genau wie im Radio! Die Aufgabe ist klar: Wer innert 45 Sekunden am meisten Wörter zu vorgegebenen Buchstaben findet, gewinnt.

name: Absolwenci
description:
Description in Polish:
W grze Absolwenci wcielisz się w osobę prowadzącą firmę doradczą. Będziesz pozyskiwać absolwentów o różnych kompetencjach i podnosić ich kwalifikacje. Właściwie dobrany zespół pozwoli Ci na realizację coraz bardziej wymagających kontraktów. Będziesz zdobywać pieniądze na rozwój, szkolić pracowników i dbać o prestiż swojej firmy. W zarządzaniu składem zespołu będą Ci przeszkadzać headhunterzy podkupujący pracowników. Niekiedy pracownicy sami zdecydują się opuścić szeregi zespołu. Na szczęście, nadal możesz sięgnąć po absolwentów Wydziału Zarządzania.

English translation:
In the game Graduates you will play the role of a person running a consulting company. You will attract graduates with various competences and raise their qualifications. A properly selected team will allow you to implement more and more demanding contracts. You will earn money for development, train employees and take care of the prestige of your company. Headhunters who subscribe to employees will hinder you in managing the team composition. Sometimes employees decide to leave the ranks of the team themselves. Fortunately, you can still reach for graduates of the Faculty of Management.

The turn of the game consists of several steps:
- uncover bonus and event cards for the round
- lay out graduate and contract cards
- earn income
- bid for graduates
- assign and train graduates/employees
- fulfill contracts
- resolve bonus and event cards

The flow of the game is simple: after learning what bonus and event cards will bring at the end of round, players bid for graduates with specific sets of skills. After acquiring them players invest in graduates' development by paying for their training and marking the progress on their player boards. Once the players developed teams of employees matching the requirements of laid out contracts, they can fulfill contract cards and earn rewards (points, money or further employee development). At the end of every round some employees leave the teams and replacements will need to be found in consecutive rounds.

Main sources of points are:
- contract cards (about 55% of points)
- bonus cards (about 15%)
- end-game bonuses (about 20%)
- dividend (about 10%)

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Events, Income, Set Collection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Progressive, Victory Points as a Resource
publishers: Faculty of Management, University of Warsaw (Poland)

name: Walt Disney's Zorro Game
description: A roll-and-move game with a Zorro theme.

name: Próba Ognia: Hurricane
description:
An expansion to Próba Ognia. It introduces new Character on the cards, new Scenario, new cards for Firefighters, status cards, scenario specific tokens and more...

It was released during Próba Ognia Championship 2022.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Winter Wonderland
description:
"Brrr, it's cold..." - this was your first thought when you blinked and looked around. The very previous moment, as you remembered, you and your daughter were at home, drinking hot
chocolate wearing your ugly Christmas sweaters, staring at the snowfall through the window, and waiting for the clock to hit midnight as usual on 30th November. But now, everything seemed so... frosty and strange.
- What on earth just happened? - your daughter asked, but before you could answer...
- Hello! - You heard from behind... What? A speaking snowman?
- Would you like some hot tea? You two look tired. - he said cheerfully.
And then quickly added: - You can pay with snow! - he smiled widely.
- Whoah, pay with... snow? - You were unable to hide your surprise.

The players are wandering in a magical winter land, and their most important quest is to find a way home. In order to do that they have to help some peculiar locals with their tiny little problems while looking for the magic snowglobe as well, which will be able to send them home when they finally reach the Christmas tree. The players start their journey in front of a snowman's hut, where the adventure begins, exploring objects and mysterious piles of snow, finding useful tools, and winding up in all kinds of challenging situations. Meanwhile, it is snowing continuously, which sometimes might be helpful, but other times it blocks their way. As time goes by, the weather gets drearier and drearier, fog and immense snowdrifts could close off the players' paths. Time passes differently in this unusual world, too. Ten minutes here is a whole day in the real world, so they must hurry with their mission to get home by Christmas Eve. At least that's what the snowman in the hut said, and I really hope he was right.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: 72 ソロモンの後継者 (72 Heirs of Solomon)
description:
The standalone expansion of 72 (ななじゅうに) (72 Demons of Goetia)

You can play with the base game of this game alone. This game is specific for 2 players but can be mixed with the base game to support 4 players. It also has 8 randomizer suit cards to select # of player + 2 suits.

This expansion has 4 additional suits and a new effect "cut-in" (interruption) (blue text) to respond to the effect of other cards. In addition, there is a very special card - Phoenix.

It comes with additional clarification rulesheet for the base game.

name: BIke Delivery
description:
A game of dice collecting and strategy

SET UP
Dice must be placed one by one on the 12 available squares of the first half of the board (the first 3 columns).
Then the players dispute the die who starts the game. Whoever is first has the right to choose the exit point before others, but whoever makes the first move is the player who came in second and so on.

HOW TO PLAY
On their turn, each player may move along the paths in 2 different ways:
1) Along the asphalt streets (gray): they may move 1 square at a time, ahead or to the sides.
2) Along the fast bike lanes (brown): 2 squares at a time, ahead or to the sides.
Each player may make their move and collect the die at the door with a number equal to the die in the center.
In this case, the Player has reached door #3 of the green house and may collect the die with number 3.

CHOOSING THE DICE
You must choose and collect dice, trying to pick up those which will provide the best total, and find the best trajectory to take them to their destination.
Choices must take into consideration the number and color of the dice, which grants special features to each of their number:
- Blue - Increase the number on the die by 1 (+1);
- Red - Reduce the number on the die by 1 (-1);
- Green - Allows an extra move (>1);
- Orange - Double the number of the next die to be picked up (x 2).
Dice that are collected go to each player's marker on the TALLY CHART.

END OF THE FIRST STAGE
When a player reaches any position of the 4th column - where there is a traffic light in the middle of the game board - the first stage of the game ends.
All the dice to the left of that column are removed and rolled again, completing the 12 squares of the second stage, from the 5th to the 8th column.
Players keep their current position and game resumes with the next player after the one who first reached the middle of the game.

IMPORTANT DETAILS
Picking up 2 dice
In some cases, a player's movement will allow them to pick up 2 dice (or more):
- When they pick up a green die and make an extra move, they may pick up a second die;
- If they reach a square in which both door numbers allow them to pick up both dice;
- On the fast lane, if they move 2 squares and pass by doors with the same numbers of the dice, they may pick up both.
Extra movement
Picking up 2 green dice only allows for 1 extra move. On the fast lane, picking up a green die also provides an extra move (i.e., a third move).
Changing direction
If a player wants to change direction during the game, they may spend one action/movement to make that inversion.
Doubled dice
The player who picked up an orange die will pick that one with its normal value and double the next die - even if that just happens on the next round. The die with doubled value will go to the gray area of dice tally.
Blocking
A player may not occupy the same square as another player. To move, they must go in a different direction. A player may also choose not to move.
Movement from the brown lane to the gray lane
When leaving the brown lane to the gray lane, a player doesn't lose the second movement. It may be performed in the gray area. To have a second movement in the brown area, the first movement must be in that lane as well.

ENDING THE GAME
To end a game, each player must have picked up at least 1 die of each color.
When a player reaches one of the arrival points, the game ends, and the other players may still play their last turn.
Besides the scoring from the dice, some Bonuses* may also be acquired by players:
- First in Stage 1 (+2 points);
- First in the Final Stage (+2 points);
- Player with the most dice (+3 points).

The total sum of dice and bonuses determines the winner. If they are tied, the winner is the player who collected the most dice.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Impractical Jokers the Game: Ultimate Challenge Pack
description:
600 game cards, challenges, awkward scenarios & accessories (Amazon Exclusive)

Think you’ve got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now’s your chance to put yourself to the test with the Impractical Jokers game. Whether you like pulling off undercover challenges on friends or just laughing at hilariously awkward card combinations, this game has something for you. Phase 1: Mess with unsuspecting friends and family. Phase 2: Match uncomfortable scenario cards with hysterical action cards. Phase 3: The Punishment.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Belyy
description:
A slightly new take on variable strength chits (more granular with up to 5 steps per unit vs. the usual three) covering more obscure battles of the Eastern Front. This is the first entry in a three part simulation of the failed Soviet offensive to eliminate the salient of the German Ninth Army during the winter of 1942-43 known as Operation Mars (25 Nov - 12 Dec 1942). Players will conduct operations as either Soviet Direction Commander Zhukov or the German commander of the Ninth Army, Model. Several possibilities existed given the terrain and the weather situation and some of these will be possible to explore with this game. Included are some hypothetical options that could have altered the outcome. This work is primarily based on Zhukov's Greatest Defeat by David Glantz with some OOB fleshing by Nafziger and maps based on post-war USGS surveys (which were themselves taken from wartime Soviet surveys).

Each volume has one 22"x34" mapsheet (using 20mm hexes to be less cramped) with all three volumes able to link together covering 43" x 48" total area at 1.5 miles/hex and one day per turn.
Each game uses 0.6" counters of mainly German battalions and Soviet regiments or brigades - the first volume (Belyy) has 352 counters with two double-sided and three single-sided PAC accompanying a 18 page rule book, the second volume (Olenino) has 440 counters with three double-sided and two single-sided PAC accompanying a 20 page rule book, and the final volume (Konev) will have 528 counters with three double-sided and three single-sided PAC accompanying a 20 page rule book.

Included scenario:
Belyy - Volume I - #1 Belyy Thrust - The included scenario provides the players a look at the attacks of Soviet 41st Army which managed the best gains of the operation. The goal of this scenario is to present players with a fluid breakthrough and timely reinforcements. Both sides hoping their command decisions will carry the day. Scenario Duration: Turns 1-10 (25 Nov - 4 Dec) on Map KS.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: ぷよとりっく! (Puyo Trick!)
description:
This trick taking game is based on the ぶよぶよ and び魔導物語 series, computer RPG games.

During each trick, players play battle card to win a monster card. Each card has strength of all 4 characters. For each trick, a monster is revealed. The lead trick choose which character is the dominant character of the current trick. After every player played a card, the card with the strongest strength of the chosen character wins the trick and the monster card, which carries experience points (xp). The game usually ends when a player collects more than 20xp, the player with the highest xp wins.

The deck has 52 cards with interesting illustration.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Video Game Theme
publishers: カフェ＆ゲームバーことぶき (Cafe & Game bar Kotobuki)

name: Killosseum
description:
The most deadly and popular arena, Killosseum, draws in a huge daily crowd where people come to watch gladiators battle for their lives. A lot of people also make a living betting on these fights to the death and it is a spectacle for all to enjoy. In the game of Killosseum, you will be playing as a Lanista. As the Lanista you will make bets on matches and have your own gladiator fight in your honor. Your goal is to make as much money as possible and be the first person to gain enough coin to be crowned the most affluent Lanista of the arena.

—description from the designer

name: Eine Bergbesteigung
description: The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach the peak at space 55 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Labyrinth
description: The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach the space 60 wins the game. On some spaces the players are sent back to previous spaces. On the Zodiac-spaces the players get benefits or penalties.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Mit Mittelholzer durch ganz Afrika
description: The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Trail of Light
description:
Trail of Light is a light and strategic dungeon crawler with tile placement mechanics and a roguelike experience. Players take on the role of a group of explorers searching for the idols of light, they will have to overcome various obstacles and pitfalls as they explore the temple labyrinth. Each attempt to retrieve the idol will be a unique experience with the ever-changing maze and modulable difficulty.

During each moment of the game, players will have to decide when to cooperate and when to hinder each other in exploring the labyrinth with strategic choices.
At each turn, each player draws tiles from the maze and arranges them as he or she pleases to reveal the various environments and pitfalls within.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Hexagon Grid, Lose a Turn, Map Addition, Pattern Movement, Pieces as Map, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Word Rotation
description:
A rotating card game where each card has four letters or bigram fragments. Players spin cards to form words that match specific attributes. The game is played in several rounds with successively longer words.

COMPONENTS:
54 2-inch two-sided square cards. One side has letters, the back side has attributes. A timer from a mobile device is required.

GOAL:
Get the most points by cobbling together letters into words.

INITIAL SETUP:
Shuffle the deck and deal three letter cards face up to each player. Flip over three attribute cards.

GAME PLAY:
Players play simultaneously. Each player rotates their cards and melds them together to form a word. The letters of the word must come from adjacent cards, but not all cards need to be used. Words that match an attribute score +1 bonus for each matching attribute. The first player to call out a word and their score starts a one-minute timer. At the end of one minute, each player calls out their word and score. The player with the lowest score can risk one attempt to better their score. However, that player must be able to beat the highest score else they score zero. That player has one minute for the attempt.

Each score is recorded at the end of the round.

Players now decide if they collectively want to increase the number of cards dealt in the next round. Game play continues after shuffling and dealing the next sets of cards as per SETUP above (maybe with more cards).

After the final round of five cards, the player with the highest score is the winner.

ATTRIBUTES:
There are many attributes for bonus points.
For example, is a food, ends in X, has two vowels.
Although players can make any word, they should strive to make words that match one or more attributes to get the bonus points.

SOLO PLAY:
Deal five cards and three attribute cards. Try to make successively longer words with higher and higher points. Record your best score. Repeat to attempt an even higher score.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Demoniac: The Possessive Card Game
description:
Hell-o and welcome to Demoniac, the devilish new card game for 2-4 players. The goal is to possess your hapless victim, and then use them to defeat the exorcist. The first player to convert their victim and the exorcists into Demoniacs wins.

Each player has a victim with mind and body strengths. Demon cards are played from your hand to torment your victims mind and body with precision. Once a victim is properly tormented, a dice roll determines whether they become fully possessed.

Players must watch out for the exorcist, who gets a chance every turn to use their holy power to disrupt players. "Divinity" cards are revealed each turn which change the rules of the game and can set players back considerably. Players can use "Disturbance" cards to cancel them out and keep their diabolical plans moving forward.

The first player to possess their victim and then attack the exorcist with a horde of matching demons wins the game. Can you conquer goodness and be the first to snatch souls? Choose your victim and get possessing!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #7 – Far East
description:
The east is red in this expansion featuring aircraft of the Chinese People's Liberation Army Air Force! With aircraft such as the Shenyang J-6, Chengdu J-7 and Nanchang Q-5, this set opens up a whole new warfront in the Pacific theatre! This set adds 56 cards and 88 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game, including:


45 x Aircraft cards (J-6 Farmer / J-7 Fishcan / Q-5 Fantan)
3 x Squadron Assets cards (H-5 Strike / H-6 Strike / H-6D Ship Strike)
3 x Ground Control Intercept Station cards
2 x Event cards
3 x Zampolit cards
6 x Campaign Sheets
Unique air-to-ground munitions (including KB-1 tactical warhead)


—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Service Please!
description:
In Service Please! You play against friends and family in a food war of gastronomic proportions!

Collect Food Prep cards as you attempt to gather the ingredients needed to create the Dishes ordered. Manage your hand, try to slow down the competition, and cook your way to victory!

The winner of Service Please! Is the player who gains the most stars from completing the drafted dishes, with more complex meals gaining you more stars!

Who wants a slice of that victory pie?!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: PATATA BATATA
description:
"Avoid the sweet potato."
"But who am I?"

Once upon a time, young buds began to grow in peaceful potato fields and new sweet potato brothers began to grow.
a happy sweet potato that thinks of itself as a potato and a potato that doesn't like it live together.
One day, A hungry raccoon came down into the field.
Oh, my God!
The raccoon is digging up the soil to find sweet potatoes and hurting the potatoes!
If things go on like this, the potato field will be ruined.
If you feed the raccoon with sweet potatoes and fill it up, the raccoon will return.
Let's all restore peace in the potato field.

from now on every player is a potato.
You can only say 'PATATA'.

each player lifts their a secret card, placing it on their forehead so that all of the other players can see it, but the player cannot see his own.
Put the card down to the back in front of each player.

When it's your turn, you can choose a card.
- if it's a event card, open it and play the action.
- if it's a secret card, placing it on your forehead. and You can exchange an your secret card.

The round ends when 3 raccoon cards come out.
At the end of the round, they reveal their secret and receive points.

The game ends with the second round.
The player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Events, Hidden Roles, Hot Potato

name: Monster Party
description:
Girls, boys, tomorrow is our big day. The day of the Dead! Aren't you glad? What happen to you? Oh yes, our friends the monsters will not come… They go out tonight to look for candy and tomorrow they will be tired. We throw some epic parties and they'll never know! Unless…
You must take advantage of the rolls of the dice, yours and your rivals, to get the treats that each monster likes the most, move from neighborhood to neighborhood and invite them to your party.

Be careful because not all monsters want to be close to what others... Although that's not a problem for a professional party skeleton like you, right?

Also, you can always use the help of the pumpkin to change your luck.

name: The Brain Butchers
description: Thought provoking tales and unforgettable collectibles that explore mind control from revenants to espionage.

name: Mentor
description:
Mentor is a logic machine that has a mathematical strategy to match every move the player makes in any games that are played. The player can win games by looking ahead and carefully calculating his moves. However, if he makes a mistake, Mentor will win. In some games Mentor makes one or more intentional mistakes so that the player will have a better chance to win. If you are unable to win a game against Mentor, he will teach you step by step the correct strategy.

Game cards are placed on the playing board and the Pawn is inserted in the start position. Take turns with Mentor to move one, two, or three spaces. You win if you move the Pawn to finish before Mentor does.

name: Kitten Dinner
description:
Kitten Dinner is a family game for 2-5 players, ages 8 and up. Can you feed the hungry kittens their dinner to win the game?

IT'S DINNER TIME!
Hungry kittens wander the streets. Can you lure them back to your warm home with the promise of good meal? If you feed enough kitties their dinner, you win!

COLLECT YOUR CARDS!
Roll the dice and decide which direction to move the Kitten mover around the circle of Kittens. Collect cards equal to the number you've rolled and add them to your hand. Don't roll all blanks or a kitty will get away!

FEED THE KITTIES!
Lure the Kitties back to your home by matching their symbols. Spell D-I-N-N-E-R using your food cards to feed the Kittens and earn their point value.

HOW TO WIN: The player who feeds kitties and earns the predetermined points (9-21 depending on player count) wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: 디그타운 (Dig Town)
description:
Find the hidden treasure deep in the cave.
Roll the dice to make your way, and fight other competitors for treasure.
Even if you think you'll be in first place, you may lose all your treasures in a sudden attack.
A racing game that can be played by 2 to 6 players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Best of Town Cryer
description: The Best of Town Cryer collects some of the best articles from White Dwarf about Mordheim: City of the Damned allowing the game to be expanded in multiple ways, including new warbands, random events and rules for multiplayer skirmishes.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, King of the Hill, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Broken Realms – Mortevell's Helcourt
description:
Amongst the deluded cannibals of the Ymetrican Flesh-eaters, there are none more devoted to Nagash than Gorstane Mortevell. With screeching, howling invective, the ghoulish emperor drives his court into a frenzy of religious devotion. To their victims, it is nothing more than a rabid display of madness.
Unleash a nightmarish host of ghouls on an (un)holy crusade, united under the banner of an ignoble anti-hero. Combine the models in the set with the rules found in Broken Realms: Teclis, and you’ll be able to field the Mortevell's Helcourt warscroll battalion, transforming them into Gorstane Mortevell and his fanatically loyal followers. This box also saves you money compared to getting the models separately!
This set contains 3 Crypt Horrors, 20 Crypt Ghouls, and 1 Abhorrant Archregent. The Crypt Horrors can alternatively be built as Crypt Flayers or Vargheists. The kit includes a variety of variety of options and accessories.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Skaven – Plague Monks
description:
Driven into battle by their frenzied faith, the Plague Monks of Clan Pestilens are a repulsive tidal wave of filth that smashes into their enemies with the power of a flood. Wildly slashing, hacking and stabbing with their dirt-encrusted blades, they spread disease and foetidness wherever they fight, infecting with every blow and gnawing at foes with their rotting - yet still formidable - fangs.

This multi-part plastic kit gives you everything needed to build a chittering horde of twenty Plague Monks, with the option of arming them with a pair of Foetid Blades or a Foetid Blade and Woe-stave. One model can be built as a Bringer-of-the-Word - he clutches either a Plague Scroll or Book of Woe. A model can be assembled as an Icon Bearer with either a Contagion Banner or Icon of Pestilence, and a model may be assembled as a Plague Harbinger, carrying either a Doom Gong or a dreaded Bale-chime.

name: Soularium
description: Soularium is a roll-and-write game for any number of players (1 - ∞). Your goal is to build Heaven & Hell from scratch, respectively endowing them with various resources such as: Angels and Demons; Virtues and Sins; Pure Souls and Dark Souls. And, somewhere in between, there is the Purgatory. A key element of the game is trying to avoid Celestial Imbalance by not overpowering one of the two Eternal Places.

name: Gatefall Core Set: Standard Edition
description:
Gatefall is a strategic miniatures game of tactics, deck building, and resource management.

In the game, a rift has opened between worlds, causing a war between very different kinds of characters.
The base game mode is designed for two players to fight head-to-head. Arena mode lets 2-8 players fight one another in a battle royale setting.
In a two player game, players choose which team to control, the fantasy team consisting of Brog, Gildri, and Randar, or the Wasteland team consisting of Exile, Firebug, Penny, and Lost Boy.
At the beginning of the game, each player has the same deck of ten cards, which contain seven “1” cards and three “0”cards. The first player draws five cards, and adds the total of their values. That number represents the number of actions the player can use for their team. Actions can be moving one space or attacking. These actions can be spread across the entire team, or used by only one character, depending on a character’s traits.
During an attack, the attacking player rolls the number of dice equivalent to the attacking character’s attack stat. The defending player rolls the number of dice equal to the defending character’s defense dice. The number of reds rolled are added up, and the defender takes damage equal to the number of reds the attacking character rolls above the total of their defending roll.
Each player then adds up the number of green dice they rolled, and earns one coin for each green die.
coins are saved up and used to buy new weapons from the weapon marketplace, to destroy “zero” cards in their hands, to purchase better cards from the main deck, or upgrade their individual character stats.
Each character has an upgrade shop. Players can choose any of the available stats to upgrade in any order for any of their characters, and spend the appropriate amount of tokens to get those upgrades. When a character is fully upgraded, that character unlocks their special power, which is unique for each character.
When a character is killed, the player who killed that character earns the number of victory points printed on the character’s upgrade shop card, and the player whose character was killed draws a “zero” card from the “zeroes” pile for every victory point listed on the killed character’s upgrade shop card and adds it to their discard pile. The killed character respawns in their base immediately, but that character cannot move or attack on their next turn, and effectively loses a turn while respawning.
The first player to reach ten victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Slaves to Darkness – Corvus Cabal
description:
Agile and avaricious, the murder-cultists of the Corvus Cabal descend on their prey from above. Always hunting for worthy trinkets to offer the Great Gatherer, chaotic patron of cutthroats and thieves, the Cabal strike without warning or mercy.

Do your enemies dare cower in cover, rather than bringing themselves to your Slaves to Darkness army for a jolly good slaughtering? Then you need the Corvus Cabal! These shadowy reavers are terrifyingly mobile, making them perfect for last-minute objective grabs or hunting distant foes, capable of bringing them down with a mix of ranged and melee attacks. Alternatively, you can use this set to bolster your roster for Warcry if you already own your Fighter Cards and Abilities Card for the Corvus Cabal.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Slaves to Darkness – The Unmade
description:
The island of Tzlid, drifting ever closer to the Shyish Nadir, is home to the cannibal tribes of the Unmade. The self-mutilation performed by these pain worshippers is horrifying to behold, and their leaders are visions from the darkest of nightmares.

The Unmade don't just look scary – they're a cracking choice for the battlefields of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, too! These self-mutilating maniacs won’t just carve your enemies up in close combat, but can rob them of their ability to run away, too. This lets you lock down key foes while the rest of your Slaves to Darkness run roughshod on your foe’s squishiest units! They'll also dish out some nasty penalties to Bravery for anyone nearby. Alternatively, you can use this set to bolster your roster for Warcry if you already own your Fighter Cards and Abilities Card for the Unmade.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: What's Next? A Life-Size Drinking Game
description:
Step away from the typical beer pong table and check out What's Next? A Life-Size Drinking Game. This is the ultimate game to get your party started!

This adult party game will get you moving, laughing, and toasting to the good times.

It's the only party game where YOU are the game piece! Drink, laugh, and challenge your friends with this brand-new party game. It's easy to learn — even if you've had a few drinks.

What will you do to win... AND how tipsy will you be when you do? Buy it now and get ready to have a blast!

name: What's Next?: Social Skills Add-on
description:
What's Next? Social Skills Add-on is the first expansion set to What’s Next? A Life-Size Game — designed for special needs folks.

It was specifically developed to...


Provide all-inclusive options for special-needs families.
Ensure that every player feels completely comfortable with all actions of the game.
Enhance player's social skills, while engaging in physical activity.


Here’s how it works…

Lay out all tiles from What’s Next? A Life-Size Game.

Switch the original tile with the Social Skills tile that has the same number. Then just play as usual.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Tobruk
description:
North Africa, 1942. The burning desert sands witnessed the fiercest tank battles of World War II. Imagine yourself commanding a squad of tanks and tank destroyers. Do you think you are more adept at tactics and strategy than your opponents? On the battlefield you will be able to prove it, because the action already begins with Tobruk.

90's Argentinian wargame.

name: Hodl It
description:
Take part in the frenzy of trading in crypto, dealing with the 'pumps' and the 'dumps' in the most volatile way. There has never been a more wacky, back and forth trading situation than with crypto, especially now.

Hodl It is played in a group of 3-8 players, where there are up to 8 different coin cards in play for everyone to collect within a round. These coin cards come in sets, and in order to win the game, a player must endeavour to collect all of one set. They can however, also utilise wildcards mixed into the deck which can have a positive, or a negative effect.

As the round progresses, players are trading 1, 2, 3 or more cards at a time. These trades are likely made up of coin cards but can include wildcards that the player doesn't want in their hand by the end. In turn, they are aiming to collect the cards they need from other players from that trade, so effectively it is fastest person first providing they aren't blindly competing for the same coin card. The round ends as soon as one player has a full winning set in hand and claims 'HOLD IT'!

The round can be played in as little as 5 minutes, depending on how volatile you make your trades, providing they follow some simple rules such as all the cards being traded, are of the same suit. As the rounds can be so short, this is a game of score and how well you can build that score up over several rounds, with each potential win in a round being of a varied score in itself.

The game is solely played with cards within one card deck. There are no other components.

—description from the designer

name: Stash720
description: Stash720 is a quick-playing, fast-investing, stock market card game, played in a way similar to the classic board game, Monopoly. To win, be the first player to collect 3 complete Stock Card sets in different colours. This card game is a great way to help learn basic economics, risk and reward, while dealing with stock trading in as little as 15 minutes. It comes with 110 cards, including Stock Cards, Stock Growth Cards, Wild Stock Cards and Power Cards. Power Cards let players do things such as charge Stock Growth and force favourable investments. Wild Stock Cards help players build Stock sets. Players pay their debts with Bitcoin Cards, or their stock cards if they are out of Bitcoin.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Granja Colorida
description: Granja Colorida is a board game designed for the little ones to have a nice time with the family. The object of this game is to mark all the colored squares on the individual board with the corresponding marker tiles, matching the cards that are drawn.

name: Duck Duck Mousse
description:
It’s picture day, but…
The ducks need help. Their hair’s a mess.
Others look nice. Their hair looks great.
Grab the mousse. Help the ducks.

Game-play involves several different sets of rules:

Normal rules (similar to the "Duck Duck Goose" children's game) - Players throw down a card at a time until mousse appears. The first player to slap the mousse gets it and mousses one of their ducks. The first player to mousse all their ducks wins.
In Style rules (a sets game) - Players use the non-duck animal cards to search for sets of 3. One animal card is chosen as wild. First player to get 3 sets of 3 wins.
Blowout rules - Players divvy up all cards evenly, then play as fast as possible to get 5 ducks and 5 moose. A less-intense version involves stealing extra ducks or mousse left in the center discard pile, and the craziest version involves stealing directly from others as they uncover cards from their respective decks.


—description from the publisher

Kickstarter campaign begins July 11, 2023!

name: Where's Wally Now?: The card game
description:
Using the cards you can assemble "A crazy party in Paris" (XIXth century) or an "the last days of the Aztecs", with 16 cards each in a 4x4 matrix.

The first player who finds Wally gets 10 points. But there are other 10 questions (1 point each) that you have to answer finding the information in the cards

name: Mit der Zeitmaschine in die Urwelt
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 189 (genesis of earth) with his time machine wins the game.

The Game was published as a companion to the magazine "akut" (issue #1 from 25.01.1971).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 26
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 26 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Condor Heavy Hover Tank (Ultra/Fusion/Laser/LAC/C)
• Maxim Heavy Hover Transport (Escort)
• Flea FLE-21
• Hermes II HER-7A
• Starslayer STY-4C
• Merlin MLN-1D/1E/1P/C
• Quickdraw QKD-9G
• Caesar CES-5R
• Naga II Prime/A/B/C/H/W
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Dust 1947: Commissar Poon Hay-Wing Chinese Pla
description:
The World Revolution can only be successfully achieved through political purity and unfaltering courage! Political commissars of the Sino-Soviet Union make sure that front-line troops and those that command them follow every order to the letter. Every thought must be monitored before and during a battle, and there’s no-one better at this than Commissar Poon Hay-Wing of the People’s Liberation Army. He has spent so much time fighting against the invaders of his country that he can inspire greatness in all around him like nobody else. Commissar Poon doesn’t adapt to the area he’s fighting in, the area must adapt to him! He keeps his Commissar leather coat wherever he’s assigned to.

This miniature comes with its own Dust 1947 Unit Card.

name: Zum
description:
Zum is a trick-taking card game for 2-4 players, but up to 6 can play with one deck of cards. “The best of all for skill and fun”.

The game consists of Forty-eight playing cards, numbered 1 to 48, and 12 score cards. Eleven of the score cards bear a picture of the “Zum” Girl with the words “Score” or “Lose”. The twelfth score card is called the “Chance-It” card.

The object of the game is to capture the “Score” cards while forcing your opponents to take the “Lose” cards.

In Zum each player is dealt 12 playing cards. The 12 score cards are shuffled into a separate face up pile with only the top card visible. The winner of each trick (highest card) takes the top card from the score card pile. Scoring cards taken by players are kept face down until all of the playing cards have been played at which point each player counts their score.

name: Wiccats
description:
Help Raven and her friends prepare for the next seasonal festival!

You must help your character friend gather and organize their books, candles, crystals and ingredients so that they will be ready for the magical night. Can you collect all your ingredients before the others? All it takes is a bit of magic!

—description from the publisher

name: Wiccats: The Bad Witch Expansion
description:
Adds 18 cards to the original Wiccats card game including:
Characters (Lily, Trix, Laluna)
Items (9 additional components)
Spells (Curse, Steal)
Oops! (Lost, Soaked, Dropped!)
Aura Cards (Mystery)

Aura cards add a new way to play! Your aura is strong, and it will protect you. Put an aura card into play to protect against a Spell or 'OOPS!' card.

name: Wiccats: The Good Witch Expansion
description:
Adds 18 cards to the original Wiccats card game including:
Characters (Jinx, Rosey, Naga)
Items (9 additional components)
Spells (Beautiful Festival, Recharge)
Aura Cards (Courage, Peace, Love, Vision)

Aura cards add a new way to play! Your aura is strong, and it will protect you. Put an aura card into play to protect against a Spell or 'OOPS!' card.

name: Krimi total Fall 18: Der Fall einer Lady
description:
Bad news for the family of Lady Amelia Bryson: Although she spent her in time in the mountains of Switzerland, her medical condition got worse dramatically. So her doctor determines to summon the family for her last days.
The family and their companions meet at a secluded house in a swiss mountain village after an long and onerous way. A severe thunderstorm hit the town. What a bad omen: Lady Amelia just dies before dawn.
Now all the attendees sit together to resolve the circumstances of her death.

Every player gets new information about the case in each round. An open discussion follows after reading them in your personal booklet. Some hidden information in envelopes may also help to find the murderer.

name: 26-Across
description:
26-Across is a multiplayer crossword game using a board that is either:

a single magnetic board and 26 magnetic A-Z alphabet tiles with point values
a dry erase form and marker.


Solo or multiplayer modes.

It is played solo using either a web app or preprinted challenges.

SOLO GOAL: Beat the predetermined score of each challenge.

MULTIPLAYER GOAL: Win three rounds.

CONCEPT: Using just the 26 A-Z alphabetic letters, form as many crossed words as possible and score the result.

SETUP:

Each player grabs the necessary items as indicated above.

MULTIPLAYER GAME PLAY:

At the start of each round, the next player calls out a 4- or 5-letter word as the first "seed" word.
The word can only comprise unique letters (as duplicates are not possible), for example GAME but not FUNNY.
All players place the letters of the seed word anywhere on their form, left to right or top to bottom.
Players have three minutes to play the round.

Players form crosswords using just the remaining letters.
Players can rearrange letters as needed to maximize their score.
Players are all playing simultaneously in secret.

At the end of the time period, players score their words and show their boards for all players to validate.
Orphaned letters and words must be removed.
Only interlinked crosswords are scored.

The player with the highest score wins the round and gains one point. If tied, no one wins the round.

Players continue to play additional rounds until someone has won three rounds.

SOLO GAME PLAY:
Review a challenge and place the indicated letters on the board in their designated spots. Place as many of the remaining tiles to form crosswords. Score the connected words. If the score meets or exceeds the target score, you win the challenge.

name: Demokracy
description:
Manipulate and cooperate your way to dominance of the world’s first bourgeoning democracy in Ancient Athens.

The players aim to score the most points by successfully fulfilling the requirements of their secret Agendas and by building Public Works.

These secret Agendas dictate which Policies the player will want to pass or dismiss.

In order to pass or dismiss a Policy, players vote by spending Influence, which they draw in their turn, and Drachma, which can be used as bribes when voting on Policies or to fund Projects.

Once 7 Policies have been passed the game ends. The themes of these 7 Passed Policies dictate whether a player has been successful or unsuccessful in fulfilling their Agendas. Players then score Victory Points for any Agendas they have successfully fulfilled. Players lose points for any Agendas they have not fulfilled.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Roles

name: Red Thunder
description:
This game is the card game with the Japanese slot.
The Japanese slot "Pachisuro" is totally different with the normal slot.
The players need some knowledge before playing the slot. For example, there are any staging for the Jackpot.
And players need to stop the reel by three buttons, and must need to aim the same icons.
Is it "777"? No, you need to know the special icons, the players read the books for it.

Of course, it's not all. You need more. And their knowledge is for each slot.

The players try to score more.
The cards are drawn the reel with both side. And players place three cards like a slot.
And check each line.

If there is "777", then the game changes to the Bonus time.
The player can use the card with the back side. The back side is drawn more 7.
However the Bonus time is limited.
When you don't get the bonus, it changes to the normal mode.

When the card pile is out, the game is ended. Now scoring.

This game is the solo game, and try to score more.
But the players play it by comparing with others.

name: Yin Yang: Mini Expansion
description:
Mini Expansion for Yin Yang. Consists of four tiles that players can collect by visiting the Emperor in the Capital, and which gives you certain privileges.

This was part of the Chinese crowdfounding version, but has also been given out at Essen and at other conventions.

name: トリテ富豪 (Trick-Taking x Career Poker)
description:
トリテ富豪 is a game that combines "Trick Taking" and "Millionaire".

The game uses a deck of cards with ranks and suits, but each card also shows an animal which acts as a second suit. During the trick-taking phase, players who play off-suit to a trick will take their cards back and they are placed into that player's hand for the next phase; the winner takes the remaining cards into their hand for the next phase. Some cards have special effects and the winner of each trick obtains a yellow cube.

If a player collected no cards for their millionaire hand, the game ends prematurely. Otherwise, the players take their new hands and play a climbing game. The following possibilities are intricate, due to the game's card distribution and two-suit nature.

The game has a number of unique elements. For instance:


The start player of each trick (for both halves) can choose the direction of play for each trick.
In the millionaire phase, players can only play a single card until "energy bundles" are created. These go into a central pool and can be spent by any lead player to trigger a round of playing pairs, triple, etc.

name: Dragon Ride
description:
Dragon Ride is a party game.
Each player in turn spin the card which must rotate on itself at least once.
If the meeple is in one of the designated areas after the ride, then you are safe and you can continue playing to the next round, otherwise you are eliminated.
If none remain, there are no human winners (the dragon wins).

—description from designer

name: BOOMA
description:
BOOMA is a roll & write solitaire game where you will have to manage the workforce to catch the giant snake BOOMA that is ravaging the colony on planet Gliese 3323 b.
You can build electrified walls or generators, create bait or just bomb BOOMA and its clones.

Game Round
Rounds are played in three phases:
