- Commander turn
- BOOMA turn
- Advancement on the tracks

During commander turn, perform these steps in order:
1. Roll commander dice
2. Assign values (drawing one of the available symbol on an area, writing the number showing the dice inside the drawing)

During BOOMA turn, perform these steps in order:
1. Roll BOOMA bonus dice and trigger the corresponding effect
2. Move BOOMA and its clone (usually to the adjacent
orthogonally area with the highest value)
3. Clone growth: If the strength of the clone is less than that of BOOMA, then add 1 to the strength of the clone

Note that BOOMA and its clone are represented by two dice showing the value of the current strength.

You win in case BOOMA and its clone no longer have the
possibility to move.
You lose as soon as the second city area is devastated.

-description from designer

name: Escape The Grimm Wish
description:
What stories we believe were fairy tales might indeed be real after all… We received word of a change to history right in the heart of Germany’s Black Forest and it appears to be something right out of the pages of a storybook. You always had a Grimm Wish… to have your own happily ever after… but it appears that comes at a cost. The woods are filled with wonders. A talking frog begs for a kiss and a tower with hair dangling below waits for you, but there also is danger. The big, bad wolf stalks you from the shadows, while clever witches tempt you with sweets. If you are to survive these woods, you might need to brush up on your fairy tales and avoid straying too far from the path. After all, this Grimm Wish might not be everything you thought it would be…

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Vikings
description:
The time has come to sail! In this game, we have 2 separate missions in one box. In the first, you can join a Viking crew as they set sail into the fog on a journey to the mythical lands to the west. The seas are rough and storms threaten to send you to Valhalla, but if you manage to find your way, a land of riches awaits. Be careful, though, as some of the crew are planning a mutiny and you might just be caught in the crosshairs. The second game, is a bit darker than the first. A rival chieftain has his eyes set on your village and he has sent warriors to pillage your home. It will be up to you to defend your village at all costs. Set traps for the invaders, hide your treasures, and prepare to face them head-on. The choice is yours. Both missions are available at the start. Will you bring glory to your people or will you find yourself lost to history?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Close Action 3rd Edition: Scenario Starter Pack
description: This module provides 7 ready-to-use Scenarios for Close Action [CA] 3rd Edition. These scenarios are quicker to set up and play than those in other CA scenario books. The scenarios have been carefully selected from among the hundreds of actual battles from 1739 to 1815 to provide a set of interesting small actions; the first six can be played by no more than 4 players, while the 7th requires a minimum of 5. This selection was done deliberately to serve the very large percentage of wargamers who live in communities with only small gaming groups (perhaps as few as a half-dozen players or so). It has the added benefit of also serving new players and those who simply prefer smaller battles. Other key factors include: (a) an emphasis on balanced battles where victory is usually determined simply by victory points, rather than by special victory rules; (b) a selection of different types of battles, from frigate-vs-frigate actions to Ship-of-the-Line [SOL] squadron actions to combinations of both types; and (c) all ship logs for all seven scenarios have been completely pre-filled to allow you to play them all immediately, without having to fill them out yourself.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Escape: Night of the Vampire
description:
The other agents who have been assigned this mission have all vanished. It has become a bit of a curse and now it is your turn to answer the call. We have all heard of vampires, but very few of us actually believe in them. Bram Stoker did and he set his famous novel in the very area you are set to explore... for good reason. Your mission is quite simple. You need to enter this rotting castle and search for evidence of the missing agents. Recover and rescue any survivors, but be careful. The communications we have received from inside tell of creatures with fangs and who only rise at night. If that is the case, you might need to brush up on your vampire hunting skills before entering. This game is divided into 2 chapters. The first is a spooky, family friendly adventure through the crypts and halls of the castle. The second is a more PG-13 escape from the creatures you have disturbed from their slumber.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: Jewel Heist
description:
Three precious jewels have been stolen from history by our enemy, Mr. X, and have been locked up safely in the Royal Museum. These need to be returned to their correct time periods, or else a time paradox might occur. We need you to do the impossible… break into one of the most well-guarded museums on the planet. We have a team assembled to help, but it will ultimately be up to you to find your way into the grounds, pass the security measures, and nab those jewels. Along the way, you might come across dinosaur skeletons, Egyptian relics, and priceless works of art…all of which hold clues to help you in your heist. Be careful, though. Just getting to the jewels is not enough. Once you have them in hand, you will need to find a way out of the museum, as alarms inevitably wail. Can you pull off the heist of the century?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Unearthed
description:
Members of an archeological team set out to the jungles of Mexico in search of an ancient Mayan artifact known only in legends. For the members of the group who have dreamt of this sort of thing their entire lives, it feels like the dig of a lifetime. Or, at least it does, until members of the party begin disappearing during the night. The jungle has held secrets for thousands of years. Is the key to the vanishings just one more mystery that the jungle is hiding? Are the disappearances the work of man or could some of the darker Mayan myths actually be true?

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

name: Hunt A Killer: Royal Street
description:
In Hunt A Killer: Royal Street, you play a 6-episode story and solve the mystery of the murder of Celestine Broussard. Completing each episode solves one piece of the puzzle, and builds your case for the larger mystery.

Royal Street Box Set is a self-directed storyline perfect for experienced detectives looking to test their skills. When New Orleans artist Celestine Broussard is murdered during Mardi Gras, it’s up to you to uncover the secrets behind this party to end all parties and unmask a killer. Help Celestine’s best friend Sylvia uncover the truth about Celestine and the people in her life — no matter how shocking it might be.

Investigate Celestine’s murder in Hunt A Killer: Royal Street. When you take this case, your first task will be to locate the key to Celestine’s art studio somewhere in New Orleans.

Use your detective skills to decode ciphers, solve cryptic puzzles, and uncover the truth.

For each episode:
Check the Objective Card in each box as your goal may change each episode.

Set aside time to dig into the box and read all the materials.

Examine the evidence to uncover critical clues, corroborate alibis, create timelines, and identify each suspect’s means, motive, and opportunity.

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium

name: I Dare You
description:
I Dare You is a soccer game for 2 players aged 12 and up.
It is a simulation of a football match between two teams. Of course, the team that scores the most goals wins. Winning the game depends on the use of various moves and tactical moves. There is also an element of randomness in the game, such as throwing dice, cards drawn and then resolved.
Players take on the role of coaches of teams of 15 players (11 quarterback players and 4 reserve football players). Each trainer will be represented by a unique trainer card, which, thanks to his skills, will influence the course of the game.
The main inspiration behind the creation of this game is that there are very few board soccer simulations available. Thanks to this game, every young person who loves football can sit at the table, feel like a team coach and lead them to victories. Become a coach, learn the secrets of football and have fun fully making decisions affecting the course of the game.

—description from the designer

name: Kepler: la creación
description:
On Planet Kepler, a new world is being created and life is beginning to emerge. Start the fight for survival and see which will be the dominant species in this arena style game.
Take on the role of a cell and evolve to adapt to your environment. It is a fight of cunning, luck and constant change and the first step to dominate the planet!

Choose what food your species will eat, between plants and other cells. Of course, you can evolve and adapt to start eating something different if the environment has changed and food is scarce. Carefully choose the evolutions that best suit your strategy, between attack, defense, movement or special. Trigger one-time use events to give you that little edge that makes the difference between life and death for your kind.

The first player who manages to get 20 evolution points will be the winner and the first species to go to earth to dominate this new planet.

Kepler the Creation is the first in a series of 4 games, all different, that will follow the story of your species on their way to conquer the galaxy:


Your species as a cell
Your species as an animal
Your species as a civilization
Your species as space explorers


—description from the designer

En el planeta Kepler, un nuevo mundo se está creando y la vida está comenzando a emerger. Pequeñas formas de vida surgen en el océano primordial y están listas para crecer y evolucionar. ¡Empieza la lucha por la supervivencia y ver cuál será la especie dominante en este juego estilo arena.

Toma el rol de una célula y evoluciona para adaptarte a tu entorno. Es una lucha de astucia, suerte y cambio constante y el primer paso para dominar el planeta!

Elige qué alimento comerá tu especie, entre plantas y otras células. Por supuesto, puedes evolucionar y adaptarse para empezar a comer algo diferente si el entorno ha cambiado y la comida escasea. Elige cuidadosamente las evoluciones que se adaptan mejor a tu estrategia, entre ataque, defensa, movimiento o especiales. Desencadena eventos de un solo uso para darte esa pequeña ventaja que hace la diferencia entre la vida y la muerte de tu especie.

El primer jugador que logre obtener 20 puntos de evolución será el ganador y la primera especie en salir a tierra para dominar este nuevo planeta.

Kepler, la creación es el primero en una serie de 4 juegos, todos diferentes, que seguirán la historia de tu especie en su camino a conquistar la galaxia:


Tu especie como célula
Tu especie como animal
Tu especie como civilización
Tu especie como exploradores espaciales


Cada juego se integra con el siguiente o puedes jugarlos

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Botcadia
description:
In the not-so-distant future, every day jobs have been replaced by specialized robots. YOU are one of the premiere manufacturers of these robots. Create intricate circuits to produce the resources necessary for your success. But hurry, the Mainframe at the center of it all is unstable and bound to crash at any moment! Be the player with the most points after the mainframe crashes to win!

Each round you’ll be drafting circuit tiles to increase your resource production, or sabotage other players. Roll dice based on your circuit to earn resources, and spend those resources to buy and build robots. You’ll also get a special helper bot each turn with unique abilities that help you get ahead.

When the mainframe crashes the game is over, you’ll earn points based on how many robots you have in each faction. The more robots you have, the more points you’ll earn. Tally up your points; the player with the most points wins!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Backstabber
description:
The game starts with every player being dealt ten letter cards. In their turn, each player attempts to make a word worth at least seven points. If the word is worth 12 points or more, the player will receive an action card for their next turn. If their word is seven letters long or more, they will receive a combo card to keep in addition to the ten cards in their hand.

From then on, each player can either make a word of their own or choose to steal another player's word by adding onto it. If they can't play, they can choose to use their turn to replace as many letters as they desire. The catch is that their discarded letters will go into the center of the table face up for anyone to use at any time! If your word hasn't been stolen by your next turn, then you add the points to your score and set the letters aside to be shuffled back into the deck.

If you have an action card you'd like to play, you can do so at the beginning of your turn, to either help yourself or stab your friends in the back! There are four levels of action cards depending on how interesting of a game you want to play, ranging from cards like "Skip 1 Turn" on Level One to "Divide Your Score By 2 If You Don't Play A 14 Point Word On Your Next Turn" on Level Four.

Combo cards feature some of the most common letter combinations in the English language, and are worth a significant amount of points if you manage to use them in a word!

-from the Kickstarter page

name: Dash Hound Derby
description:
Its wiener takes all in Dash-Hound Derby! Fetch cards and match 3 or more costumes or color ribbons. Score points to out race the other players and move around the board. Unleash special action cards and be the furthest across the finish line to win!

Draft cards from one of three piles, and do your best to manage your hand to earn big points. Every point you score gets your dog further along the finish line, so be on the lookout for the perfect card to earn additional point bonuses. Play special action cards to give yourself a leg up on the competition.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Race, Take That

name: Storyteller Cards: Fantasy – Storyteller Manual: Fantasy edition
description:
Games, activities, and other creative ways to use Storyteller Cards: Fantasy and Storyteller Cards.

The Manual includes rules for different ways to play. From strategic coloring to push-your-luck storytelling, there are game variations for everyone. Many variants are story based gaining points for each card played, best poker hands and matching card elements, but others include strategic coloring (where players must complete illustration quadrants to earn points), and endless possibilities (where the players create and change the rules in a race to 30 points).

The Manual for the Regular deck of Storyteller Cards can be used with Storyteller Cards: Fantasy, and vice-versa.

name: Storyteller Cards: Storyteller Manual
description:
Games, activities, and other creative ways to use Storyteller Cards and Storyteller Cards: Fantasy.

The Storyteller Manual includes rules for 16 different ways to play. From strategic coloring to push-your-luck storytelling, there are game variations for everyone. Many variants are story based gaining points for each card played, best poker hands and matching card elements, but others include strategic coloring (where players must complete illustration quadrants to earn points), and endless possibilities (where the players create and change the rules in a race to 30 points).

name: Storyteller Cards: Fantasy – Swords & Storytellers Bonus Card Set
description:
11 cards that can be used with the Swords & Storytellers game variant or with the Storyteller Cards in general.

Swords and Storytellers, included in the Storyteller Manual: Fantasy edition, is a fantasy adventure role playing game for 2 to 5 players! One player is designated the Dungeon Master. He controls the entire world; the innkeepers, monsters, weather, dank dungeons, fair maidens, dragons, piles of acidic ooze and sentient man-eating treasure chests. The other players control their own characters that they dream up in their imagination. The Dungeon Master guides the players through an adventure he creates trying to challenge and entertain the players. The players try to navigate the world created by the Dungeon Master. Most of all, everyone tries to tell a great story!

name: Lightyear: Galactic Attack Game
description: Players play matching cards from their hands to upgrade their spaceships or to gain bonuses on future dice rolls, then roll dice against terrain cards to gather crystals. Once the last crystal is removed from a terrain card, players battle to steal crystals from their opponent and to keep the terrain card. When a player gains their second terrain card the game ends. Points are scored for terrain cards and crystals collected.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Matching, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Ironjawz – Gore Gruntas
description:
Enormous, foul-tempered porcine beasts of a strength and fury that even orruks respect, gruntas trample down all but the biggest foe, devouring the remains and noisily smashing apart everything in their path – much to the vivid delight of the Ironjawz who bounce gleefully upon their somewhat interestingly-fragranced backs. Gruntas will cheerfully and greedily eat anything, including iron (the result of devouring people wearing it, more often than not.) This undigested metal is harvested by orruks for use as weapons and armour, and called pig-iron. A well-timed charge of Gore-gruntas can easily smash apart an enemy army in a riot of stomping hooves, piercing tusks and unpleasant smells.

This multi-part plastic kit contains all the parts necessary to assemble three orruk Gore-gruntas, savage orruks riding massive, armoured, betusked beasts. The orruks can be armed with pig-iron choppas, or jagged gore-hackas, with an optional Gore-grunta boss featuring his own head, weapon and grunta options. 100 components in total, with three Citadel 90x52mm Oval bases.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Ironjawz – Megaboss on Maw-krusha
description:
Orruk Megabosses are pretty killy – it’s how they become as huge as they do, all that stompin’ causes them to grow and grow and grow until the power of the Waaagh! flows through them. But for some Megabosses, this isn’t enough! These particularly angry orruks seek out and subdue enormous Maw-krushas (often by yelling really, really loudly at them) – ill-tempered and powerful creatures who enjoy smashing stuff up almost as much as the orruks themselves. This uneasy pairing never really gets along especially well, and the Megaboss needs to constantly remind his Maw-krusha who’s in charge with the liberal application of an iron boot to the back of the head. Despite this, almost nothing on the battlefield can withstand their noisy rampage, and the immense number of kills they rack up inspires nearby orruks to fight ever harder.

This multi-part plastic kit contains all the components necessary to assemble one Megaboss on Maw-krusha. Standing atop his fierce steed, the Megaboss is armed with either a boss gore-hacka and scrap-tooth or a choppa and rip-tooth fist – both options are suitably killsome. The Maw-krusha features an alternative mask and bladed tail. This kit contains 63 components, includes a Citadel 160mm Round base, and can be optionally assembled as Gordrakk, the Fist of Gork.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: 63: The Great Game of Welsh Politics
description:
63 is a two or three-player map-based strategy game themed around the competing ideologies in Welsh politics after 1963. Players represent the Welsh national movement, the left or socialist movement, or British unionism. The Liberal Party is represented as a 'non-human player' who any player can choose to play as, instead of as themselves, during their turn.

The aim of the game is to place all pieces held in a player's hand onto the board, with the pieces representing bases on key locations in Wales.

Play is turn-based, with fixed and visible movement abilities and options (which include base-building, grid movement and rail movement), and no chance mechanisms at all. There is no player elimination. As well as outright victory, two types of draws can end the game - one with all the human players losing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Power Poker Baseball
description:
Power Poker Baseball is a socially interactive poker experience. It combines uniquely, a 5-card poker Texas Holdem format, with the dynamic scoring and play action of baseball. It is packed with fun game banter and competitive play. The game is for 2-8 players. Ages 13 – adult. The more players, the better the fun.

This game began many years ago as a wood product and has morphed into a powerhouse of fun poker play. This will be the most fun poker game you will ever play. Players will be standing on the last cards flipped in the 9th inning. The supportive website makes the game easy to learn and offers free replacement downloadable scoresheets and a little of the game's early manufacturing history.

This game’s rule action is so true to baseball, in that it starts out easy, with a lot of table laughter. As the innings go buy, it grows into a naturally competitive and strategic challenge. All players will be standing in the ninth inning, on every card flipped. There are bunts to first, stealing a base, picking off another runner, stealing home and yes, you can be thrown out at the plate. Dealing is crucial in this game, where the dealer scores on the flop. You have Pinch Hitters, Attempts to Rally and Rally Play.

Players can play for the table and give runs to try to create a tied position, keeping all players, still in the game, going into extra innings.

You can play conservative and Fold to Score often, or you can play risky and “bet to win” and maybe get into a big run scoring rally. Watch out though, other players may try to stop you, by calling in one of their Relief Pitchers.
This will be one of the most fun poker games, you will ever play.

Start your own tournament play with family and friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Advantage Token, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck

name: Il circo dei contrari
description:
Il circo dei contrari has 50 tiles of varying difficulty, to be shuffled, placed face down and matched in pairs according to the opposing quality of the situation that characterises the character illustrated on the tile (tiger, lion, trapeze artist, clown, giraffe, elephant, mouse). If in doubt about the pairing, bring the sides of the tiles together at the point where the white symbol is located. If the symbol is completed by matching the two tiles, the pair is correct and the player continues the game. Whoever wins the most pairs wins.
The pairs are divided into two levels of increasing difficulty; you start with a limited number of pairs to learn the game mechanism, then increase the number of tiles and 'turn on' the challenge.
The game proposal, organised by quantity and quality of images, allows the stimulus to be customised according to the players' skills.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Don't Bug-Out
description:
A "Labyrinth" type game with a wooden tilt board where users must twist 2 knobs to move their marble(s) to the center of the maze while avoiding cut out holes. Each hole on the board has a printed point value, going up 5 points a hole until the center is reached. The further players go in the maze, the higher their score. Highest score or fastest run wins.

Published mid 20th century in a plain brown box (likely WWII era). Bug-out is US military slang.

Printing on board is Don't Bug-Out
Title on rules is Bug-Out

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Maze, Party Game

name: Escape From Site 19: Additional Security Protocols
description:
The Security Protocols are designed for those of you who have already escaped Site 19, but are ready to try again, this time in Beast Mode!

What will you find inside?


Additional Protocols Manual
3 Security Pins
11 Security Protocols
Two new Character cards
A new SCP-0001 card
A new Safe SCP card
A new Euclid SCP card
A new Keter SCP card
A new Thaumiel
A new Admin card
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game
publishers: Extreme Board Games, s. r. o.

name: 3rd World Labour: Pandemic edition
description:
Somewhere in a 3rd world country, you are a laborer who tries to survive daily without enough state welfare benefits. When a pandemic occurs, you have to decide to risk your life by working outside or staying safe at home without cash to spend.

In 3rd world labour, there are construction sites that players have to build them up. When the 4th building was completed, the richest player will be a winner. Yes, in the 3rd world country the richest man always wins.

Each round, players have to decide to take action between "Go to work outside" or "Stay safe at home".

"Go to work outside"

Pick a construction site to work
Place the corresponding color of blocks on the construction site.
If the block is placed on a star symbol, take a bonus event card.
Take income equal to the number of blocks placed and spend the expense.
If there are other players on the same site, the player has to take a sickness card. When there are more than 2 sickness cards, reveal the rightmost card and take effect.


"Stay safe at home"

Roll the dice and spend the expense.
Discard all the sickness cards.
Spend the money to buy the new skill card.


The player can take the free action to buy the lotto, pay their debt, and take more loans anytime in their turn.

For each building that was completed.

The player who finished that building gets 3 coins.
all players have to pay the interest according to their debt card.
The lotto prize was announced.


And the winner is the richest player when the 4th building was completed!

Why ?

Because the richest man can survive by buying the better service that their government can't provide to citizens by themself.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Loans, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Elite hockey card game
description:
EHCG is mainly deck construction, dice rolling and role playing strategy game set in world of ice hockey.

Your task as a manager of ice hockey club is to pick your coach and lineup of 12 players, assign the role for each player, choose the tactics, and lead your team to the victory.

Each player chooses unique situational cards, which can be used throughout the game. During the match, you have to guide your players in different situations from the faceoff to shot. Significant part of the game are 1v1 battles of players, where your preparation and skill can truly shine. If you are successful, you will gain many bonuses and you can affect the strategy of both teams. Additionally, as the manager, you have many options in every situation to change the course of the match and turn the result in your favor.

EHCG is game for 2 players, who can battle over and over again in a single match. However, it contains setup of 20 teams, therefore it offers option to integrate up to 20 people, who can compete in different modes such as tournament mode or season mode.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Score-and-Reset Game, Simulation, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Subantarctic
description:
The Subantarctic Islands: bleak, inhospitable rocks in the stormy Southern Ocean. You are on the shipwrecked crew which finds itself castaway, bedraggled, and needing a strong leader.

On your turn, you'll choose between adding crew of varying value to one of two challenges, or else attempting to perform a challenge with the crew already attached. When you add a crew member to a challenge, you may play them face-up (to achieve the challenge effect), or face-down (keeping their value a secret). If all the crew members on a challenge meet the required challenge value, you succeed in the challenge and collect its points. If not, your opponent gets the respect points instead. First player to 6 points wins!

name: Beep Bapp Boom
description:
Beep Bapp Boom is a last man standing gameplay. Game start with default of 30 seconds timer. This timer is adjustable depends on the player.

During player's turn, this timer will be reduced by 1 as default. Player can use any attack or defensive card to manipulate the timer. When the timer become 0 at the player's turn, the player will be eliminated if there is no defense or counter cards.

So player need to think smart to avoid the timer reached 0 at their turn.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Unseren jungen Kunden zur Unterhaltung
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

The game was published about 1930 as a giveaway for various department stores.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Party Joy Series 16 Excite Soccer Game
description:
A soccer game released by Bandai in the Soccer Joy series.

The game use action cards to move a 6 players team on the soccer board and to simulate tackle and shoot, specific event cards and dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units

name: Movie Plotz: Cult Films – REARRANGE the order of the scenes
description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film Pulp Fiction.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film The Big Lebowski.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film Edward Scissorhands.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film Ocean's Eleven.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

description:

This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.

1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film Office Space.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.

1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film The Rocky Horror Picture Show.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film The Warriors.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film The Room.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film Donnie Darko.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.

description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film This Is Spinal Tap.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Movie Plotz: Cult Films – Add a SUPERNATURAL ELEMENT to the movie
description:
1-card expansion for Movie Plotz, based on the Cult Film Beetlejuice.


This card was later compiled in Movie Plotz: Cult Films.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Crossing Fates: Fate Council Mini Expansion
description:
It is a mini-expansion that has more cards and unique city and planner cards. Adding them to the core game for supporting 5 and 6 players.

Fast Game Mode

New Settings:

Remove the Planner Card from the game, and the related system will no longer be used in this variant.

All players draw a City Card. It works like the standard mode, where the player with the smallest city number is the starter. The player take turns clockwise. The player who has the bigger city number wins the tie. However, the City Bonus is not used in this mode.

After the First Round:

Every player passes their City Card to the next player clockwise. The rest is the same, where the player with the smallest city number is the starter.

New End-Game Condition:

The game ends when a player has eight (8) or more Victory Points (VP).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Matching, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Plop: Wortel Weg
description:
In this game, based on a popular Belgian television serie, you throw a die and move to the next available space with that color (or the one of your choice if you threw the joker color).
If the place contains a carrot, you pick this one up, if the place is empty you have to put a carrot back on that empty space. Keep in mind that the carrots that already are half eaten are worth 0 points, full carrots are 1 point.
The game ends if all players have reached the final middle place. The player with most full carrots (1 point each) wins.

—user summary

name: Totem
description:
Totem is one of the world's easiest and quickest games to learn; as simple as 'Tic-Tac-Toe' (Tic-Tac-Totem)!

—description from the rulebook

Basically, this game is similar to Connect 4, except the board is round and will rotate so the players can easily see the whole playing area. The rulebook also gives unique names to the "traps" players can use in the game to set up a winning condition...such as "Steeple, Line-Ladder and Overlap."

The final sentence in the rulebook description of the game says "if Tic-Tac-Toe and Chess had an offspring, it would be TOTEM!"

—user summary
mechanics: Connections, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tug of War

name: The Throne is Mine
description:
The lion is the king of the jungle, and no other animal dares to challenge his throne! But one magical night, the mouse tired of being the weakest of all, asked the spirits of the jungle to be as strong as the lion at least once...
The spirits listened to the little mouse and created a power amulet, when it is revealed, it becomes the most powerful creature of the jungle!
To be fair, every animal received an amulet. Now anybody can claim the throne!

Developed for adults and kids to play together, The Throne is Mine is a fun, fast to play, and easy to learn card game.

Each battle has 3 rounds, win 2 of the 3 round to win the battle.
To win a round is very simple: play the strongest animal of the round.
It is not that simple! You need some strategy to play the cards in the correct order, some luck and also a little bit of acting to scare your opponents!

—description from the publisher

name: La Maldición de Tutankamón
description:
The game has been designed as a tribute for the centenary of the discovery...
One of the most important discoveries in modern archeology occurred on November 26, 1922, when the tomb of Pharaoh Tutankhamun, from the 18th dynasty, was found. After cataloging all the treasures in the chambers, Carter arrived at the royal chamber where the pharaoh's sarcophagus had rested for three thousand years. From then on, people who had visited the tomb began to die, this fact is popularly known as the Pharaoh's curse.
The objective of the game is to be the player with the most valuable collection of treasures (most points) extracted from Tutankhamen's tomb and at the same time not to be the player who dies from the effect of the pharaoh's curse.

—description from the designer

Uno de los hallazgos más importantes de la arqueología moderna se produjo el 26 de noviembre de 1922, cuando se encontró la tumba del faraón Tutankamón, de la dinastía XVIII. Después de catalogar todos los tesoros de las cámaras, Carter llegó a la cámara real donde descansaba el sarcófago del faraón desde hacía tres mil años. A partir de entonces empezaron a morir personas que habían visitado la tumba, este hecho es conocido popularmente como la maldición del faraón.
El objetivo del juego es ser el jugador con la colección de tesoros más valiosa (más puntos) extraída de la tumba de Tutankamón y a la vez no ser el jugador que muera por efecto de la maldición del faraón.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection

name: Tetra-Schach
description:
This is a chess variant for four players. The chess rules basically apply. Each player has three special figures: 2 tetra-pawns and 1 tetra-queen. The two tetra-pawns are placed in front of the rocks. the tetra-queen enters the game only when a tetra-pawn is promoted to a queen. The tetra-pawn may move up to three spaces straight ahead or up to two spaces diagonal ahead and may capture 1 or two spaces diagonal ahead. Ordinary pawns may not be promoted. The tetra-queen moves and captures like a queen and a knight.
The players play in teams, white and black vs. green and red. The goal is to checkmate the two enemy kings. If only one king is mate it may be freed by his ally. An army may not move while it's king is mate.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Ravensburger ministeps: Unser Bauernhof-Spiel
description:
Oh dear, a thick rain cloud is gathering over the farm, but the animals are still in the pasture! Together, the children try to get the animals into the barn by rolling the dice before the rain cloud is full of drops. Depending on the game variant, the die shows either the shape or the color of the animal that may be placed in the barn or a drop of water (blue colour) that moves into the cloud.
All players win or lose together against the rain cloud and thus experience an intensive "we-feeling". In addition to the differentiation of shapes and colors, the game also promotes concentration, initial understanding of rules, fine motor skills and language development.

name: Menschenkenner
description:
A spinner decides if the active player is asked a question or if he has to choose 1 of 4 characteristics. If the characteristics are positive, the chosen one should apply best to him. If they are negative, he chooses the one whom he disagrees the most with.
Before the active player reveals his decision, all other players guess secretly the answer of the active player and may bid in addition with chips. Then the answers are revealed. The guessing players receive chips, if they guessed correctly. The active player receive as many chips as the most successful guesser. If nobody guessed correctly, he may lose chips. The player with the most chips wins.

—user summary

name: Tectonic Shift
description:
In the year 1996, the tectonic plates shifted and destroyed an underwater city. With the city abandoned, two nations fight over the remaining resources. Each player controls a submarine. Players must build their decks by combining sea life and scrap in order to destroy their opponent.

Tectonic Shift is a multi-deck-builder where players build 3 decks at a time. Cards provide different functions and uses depending on the deck they are added to with the goal to deplete your opponent’s health down to 0 to win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Memory, Move Through Deck, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Game of Kriss Kross
description:
Two to four players play cross-shaped pieces to form pairs, triples, or four-in-a row of identical symbols. The more combinations formed, the more the player scores.

Each player has 12 cross pieces in their color. Players shuffle their tiles and form a face-up stack in front of them. In turn, each player takes the top piece from the stack and plays it to the board, trying to match the symbols already in play. The tiles must be nestled together, not end to end.

Play continues until all crosses are played. The winner is the player with the most points at the end.

This is a symbol-matching game similar to others, but different in that it uses cross-shaped pieces instead of dominoes, triangles, or hexagons.

name: Nereus
description:
The game is about exploring uncharted waters and finding and bringing back valuable creatures and artifacts.

In the game, players move freely through three different types of ocean areas with different risk/reward, acquiring tiles as they go. They can also procure equipment for their exploration vessels at junk stores on the map. Some equipment can be used to steal items from other ships, so players need to consider the ship's current position as they take action.

After an item tile is acquired, it must be brought back to the designated square before it is counted as a victory point. Each item tile has a symbol on it, and matching the same symbol will give you a bonus to your victory points.

The player with the most victory points after 12 rounds wins.

-description from designer

name: ATS: Freedom's Price '39 - '40
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Finland with six new scenarios and four new maps to further explore the remarkable defense of Suomi from the overwhelming might of Soviet invaders.

The scenarios include:
- Louhenjoki Loss – Louhenjoki, Finland, December 5th 1939

- Vuoksi Hold-Outs – Vuoksi River Sector, Karelian Isthmus, Finland, March 1st 1940

- Wooden Redoubts – Along Lake Suvanto and the Taipale River, east-of Rauti, Finland, December 30th 1939

- Between a Jarvi and a Hard Place – Between Lake Kuolema and Lake Muolaa, Finland, February 8th 1940

- Following Orders – Tolvajarvi, Finland, December 12th 1939

- Icy Frog-March – Near Suomussalmi, Finland, December 30th 1939

This package includes one sheet of vehicle and heavy weapons (88 counters), one sheet of personnel and support weapons (155 counters), two sheets of AFV cards, four 18' x 12" cardstock maps and the usual Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules.

All the combat counters required for these scenarios are included in this folio package, but players will need the ATS rulebook, play aids and standard system markers to play, plus one or more 10-sided dice.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Princess of Seasons
description:
Princess of Seasons is a may-follow trick taking game similar to Napoleon but with a few wrinkles thrown in. The theme is that there is a Kingdom of Seasons that controls the seasons, but mischievous fairies threaten to disrupt them. One player (and an helper) will play as the Kingdom of Seasons and the rest as the mischievous fairies.

You go around bidding to decide the Princess of Seasons player. You bid the number of Picture Cards you will take (Maximum of 18) and name the Trump Season, this effects the hierarchy of rank. If Spring (3, 4, and 5) are chosen, the ranking of number cards is 5>4>3>2>1>12>...>8>7>6. Once the princess has been decided, they name a specific card and the player that possesses that card joins the Princess team secretly (it is possible to name a card you have or in the kitty so as to be alone).

Then a may-follow trick taking hand occurs. If the princess team meets or exceeds their bet of acquired cards, they win and points are tallied. There are 4 fairy cards that beat all number cards,1 princess card that forces fairy cards to be played (and wins a hand), and a mischievous fairy card that removes a card from play.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Gorilla Warfare: A social deduction battle royale
description:
Gorilla Warfare is a social deduction battle royale. Each turn represents a day in the jungle, leaving you as the player to decide how to use your limited energy for the day.

On your turn you can: MOVE in the jungle, SEARCH for useful items, ATTACK other gorillas, GIVE your energy to other gorillas or stay still, and do nothing..

Your energy gets depleted by the end of the turn, so think carefully about how you want to use your energy! Gorillas eliminated from the game form the Spirit Council, who unleash their otherworldly powers upon the players each turn - so be careful! Your actions in the jungle might come back to haunt you - literally!

Don't be afraid to bluff, form alliances, or make threats - right words at the right time might win you the game. Just make sure you're not the one getting played...

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Fighting, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Bribery, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction, Player Elimination, Player Judge, Resource to Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Tyranny: The Chess Card Game
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Catch the Leader, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Square Grid, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: ダイダラ (Daidara)
description:
In ダイダラ (Daidara), players cooperate with each other to overthrow the giant creature called Daidara. The game is set in a distant land in the far future. It’s an untamed land filled with the swirling energies of “earth veins.” Daidara has pushed the once-prosperous Cobbit tribe to the verge of extinction. The Cobbit race has no future unless they can defeat Daidara.

The players take on the roles of leaders of the Cobbit tribe. The mighty Daidara is difficult to defeat without the right preparation. Players develop the play area, creating tall trees, mountains, and towers. As they build the map, random footprints appear, triggering details about how the Daidara will move and its special abilities. When the fourth footprint is drawn, the Daidara appears and Cobbits can be killed permanently and removed from the game. Players must use proper preparation, available items, and teamwork to defeat Daidara before they're all destroyed.

The game can be played solo or with multiple people controlling the 4 Cobbits. Daidara moves on its own with random movements determined by which tiles are drawn in a particular game. For replaybility, five different Daidaras are available, each with unique special attacks.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Chain
description:
Chain is a set collector combined with shedding/climbing (and a bit of trick-taking thrown in). A 2-phase game with the tagline of "Build & Release" as you build the best hand of cards to score, then release them as fast as possible. All 54 cards have unique and mesmerizing hand-drawn art to stare at as you play through this tactical game.

In the first half, the Build Phase, you collect cards from a tableau to crate a 12-card hand, scoring for the number of duplicate numbers and runs you have.

The second half, the Release Phase, has you shedding your hand by playing sets of runs and same numbers. It adopts a trick-taking structure where after all players have played a card or passed, the winner takes all the cards as points. When a player sheds out, all remaining players remove a random card from their hand as negative points. The game continues until only 1 player remains, then scores are tallied and the winner declared.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Bearly Surviving
description:
Bearly Surviving is a turn-based strategy board game, where players are given workers that double as their health. The more workers players have, the more resources they get each turn, and the faster they can build a colossal army to destroy their opponents.

Through action cards, Bearly Surviving offers unique battle mechanics that are easy to learn but hard to master. Players need to efficiently use their resources and cleverly utilise their units to plan and react to their opponent’s move to destroy their enemies.

During your turn, you collect resources depending on how you distributed your workers in your previous turn. So thinking ahead is very important in this game. These resources help you build up a strong army that you can use to attack other players with the help of the action cards.

An attack on another player not only damages their army but also their workers. Once a player has no more workers, they are eliminated from the game. The game ends when a player either collects all ROAR cards or eliminates all other players.

name: Pumuckl
description:
Each player has to get 4 meeples from start to the finish at the face of Pumuckl. The players take turns to roll two dice and move. To enter the second to fourth meeple into the game, one die has to show a "6". The track consists of three rings which are connected by colored spaces, which can only be used by the meeples of the same color and only in direction to the face of Pumuckl. If a player rolls doubles, the turntable is rotated by 180 degrees. Now the meeples move away from the finish when they have to use the colored spaces! When the first meeple has entered the finish ring or the middle ring, Pumuckl (large black meeple) enters the game. If a player rolls "1" on one of the dice, he may place Pumuckl on any space in the middle or finish ring to hinder his opponents. There he stays till he is moved by the next player who rolls "1". Pumuckl can't be passed by any meeple.

The first player to get his 4 meeple on his finish space wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Coco Dingo
description:
You play as baby monkeys going back home. Alas, they must cross a clearing. Their mother told them to be careful of predators by always hiding when moving on open grounds. To do so, monkeys hide under coconut halves. However, they can't see through the coconuts! So the monkeys keep running until they hit an obstacle. Help the little monkeys reach home!

The game can either be two-player or four-player (two teams). Either way, any player can move any coconut, or reveal any coconut but a monkey will not move unless hidden under one. The game quickly turns into a memory and abstract puzzle where you block your opponent's moves.

name: Poldark: The Board Game
description:
The aim of Poldark The Board Game is to travel around Cornwell, gaining as many coins and crown notes as possible along the way, before arriving in Truro before the time is up.

The length of the game is agreed to before the game starts. 35 to 45 minutes is suggested by the manufacturer.

In a 2 or 3 player game, each player will play 2 characters as a team, in a 4 (or 6) player game each player will play one character as part of a team, and in a 5 player game, 4 players will play one character each as part of a team and the fifth player will play 2 characters as the third team.
mechanics: Elapsed Real Time Ending, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Game Backwards The
description:
The Backwards Game is a party game played in teams in which all of the questions and challenges are incredibly easy...if you do them forwards. However, in this game, EVERYTHING happens in reverse.

At the start of a game, each team decides on a secret five letter word, e.g., B-R-E-A-D, which they write backwards on their "backwards board" and cover up with five mystery cards. Each team has thirty seconds to whizz through as many backwards clues as possible across five types of clue card. After thirty seconds, the team scores how many correct answers they got by ticking them off inside the circles on the backwards board. When a team ticks off three of the circles, they can try to guess a letter on the rival team's backwards board. If the letter they guess is in the other team's word, that team must reveal it by removing the mystery card.

The first team to correctly guess the rival's team secret word and say it forwards wins. However, if they make an incorrect guess, the opposing team can remove any mystery card from their opponent's backwards board...

name: Renaissance Battles 1494-1700, Volume 1
description:
Renaissance Historical battles is the fourth book in a series that allows the wargamer to re-fight actual historical battles with his own preferred set of wargame rules. I have based this book on WRG De Bellis Renationis rules plus I have included a section allowing the army lists to be read using other similar sets of rules.t

My book gives enough information for you to re-enact the battle described in a concise ad compact way covering why it took place, the forces engaged, given in elements and actual numbers of men; a deployment guide and illustration of the battles initial positions; the victory conditions and the historical outcome.

-from the introduction

24 scenarios are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Renaissance Battles 1494-1700, Volume 2
description:
Renaissance Battles Book II is the fifth book in a series of books that allows the wargamer to re-fight actual historical battles with his own preferred set of wargame rules. I have based this book on WRG De Bellis Renationis rules, and I have included explanations for troop types for other rule sets, including a standard key for troop types.

My book gives enough information for you to re-enact the battle described in a concise ad compact way, covering why it took place, the forces engaged, given in elements and actual numbers of men, it gives a deployment guide and illustration of the battle's initial positions, the victory conditions and historical outcome.

-from the introduction

22 scenarios are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: The Normans: A Revenge Module for European Warfare 1000 AD to 1170 AD
description:
Descended from the Viking raiders of Scandanavia, the Normans cut a swath of terror through the very heart of Europe. They rose to dominate western Europe, conquering England, Ireland, and large parts of France and Italy. Here are the great battles of their era, complete with scenarios, maps of battlefields, and army lists.

—description from the back of the book

The book includes 12 scenarios, from Clontarf 1014 to Dublin 1171.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Realm of Rimembor: The Beginning
description:
Together the players must remember the path through each dungeon, avoid traps and wandering monsters, solve puzzles and find loot to help them gain the strength that will make it possible to beat the evil critters guarding the dungeon's lower levels.

To progress in the game the players must reveal Land Cards and find matching pairs, which may then be removed. Each removed pair of cards will activate good or bad events that the players must overcome. They will find treasure, monsters, traps, challenges, hallways and rooms to rest in. And finally, the Boss Monster, one of Forhgot the Wizard King’s generals. To manage and beat the problems along the way the players must remember and turn personal Memory Tiles, and match them correctly with those of the problems at hand.
To win, the team must survive the events and encounters along the way, and in the final battle match the symbols on their Memory Tiles to all the Boss Monster's tiles before the players run out of energy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Steamboat Races
description:
During the 1800s, powerful steamboats made their way up and down the waters of beautiful Keuka Lake in the Finger Lakes region of New York. They carried people and goods from one lakeside port to another. Two big companies owned the boats. They competed with each other to provide the fastest service and do the most business. The competition wasn't always friendly: sometimes lawsuits and collisions were involved. But the steamboats themselves were glorious machines and helped lakeside communities flourish.

Steamboat Races is a simple two-player postcard game for all ages. Each player takes on the role of a steamboat captain (either blue or red). Your goal is to be the first steamboat to circumnavigate Keuka Lake. All you need is a regular deck of cards to play.

—description from the designer

name: Go Bum: the cheeky version of Go Fish
description:
Go Bum is the cheeky version of Go Fish where you match (family friendly) bums, instead of fish or animals.

There are optional rules that make this new version of a classic game more interactive and fun. For example, some matches give you extra points or turns, while some matches have funny actions (e.g. talking like a pirate).

Go Bum was made by Levi (7) and Evan (mid 30s-ish) as a creative activity during covid lockdown home schooling. It was a great project to do together and soon had family and friends asking for a copy.

The response was so positive from the broader community that we had the game professionally illustrated by the talented Dewy Venerius and launched a Kickstarter campaign which funded on the fourth day.

Just as exciting, $1 from each copy went to planting trees to restore habitat for endangered koalas. We were able to plant enough trees to cover two average sized Australian house blocks - a fantastic group effort by all our backers!

—description from the designer

name: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay – Dragon Bow Promo Card
description: The Dragon Bow is a level 1 Treasure Card. It is able to be used as a Ranged or Melee weapon. You must declare before rolling if you are doing a Ranged or Melee attack. With 5 damage Melee it is one of the hardest hitting level 1 Treasure Cards!

name: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay – Miniature Monthly Shield Promo Card
description: The Miniature Monthly Shield is a level 1 Treasure Item. It grants the hero +1 Defense, and +1 Knowledge. Bonuses to Knowledge are quite rare and is a huge benefit to exploring darkness and putting out fires.

name: Cake Take
description:
Today's special is a cake. Everyone has their own favorite cake. But if you're bring the same cake as someone else, the atmosphere will be terrible! But if you bring a cake that's not too trendy or too expensive, the atmosphere will be terrible! What's the best way to do that?

Each round players secretly and simultaneously select a cake to bring to the party. After the cakes are revealed players score points. Trendy cakes are most valuable but points are only earned if no one else has brought the same cake as you have.

name: Ascent of Dragons
description:
There is a greater power in this realm than monarchs or magic: dragons. Born of ancient arcane elements, their shadow overhead is enough to make mortals cower in terror. Let the conflict unfold over the eras and see which dragon reigns supreme.

In Ascent of Dragons, players get to be epic dragons battling over who will dominate the realm. Each player uses a dragon with unique cards and upgrades to ravage the lands, cast spells, and vie for supremacy in battle. Combining hand-management, worker-placement, and area-control mechanisms, players have a huge wealth of options for how they want to approach their strategy. Some may build intricate combos of spells while others dominate control of battlefields. Between loyal troops, monstrous allies, and the dragons themselves, the game looks as epic on the table as it feels to play.

After four eras of collecting gems to unlock upgrades and compete, the dragon who has amassed the greatest hoard of treasure is declared the victor and ruler of the realm.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Spellbook
description:
Spellbook is a fast-paced puzzle-based dueling game that puts players in the role of a powerful wizard in the pursuit of potent elemental magic. They will balance researching spells, binding spellbooks, and battling their opponent all within the course of the duel.

Players draft spell pages that function dually as elemental resources and as combat spells to battle their opponent. Unlike many deck-builders, the cards you draft are never discarded or shuffled away, giving players full agency on how to use and reuse the pages they draft.

Each of the five elements focus on different mechanics and flavors that can be combined in a litany of ways, with a large variety of viable strategies.

Turns are short, with most spells taking multiple turns to cast, putting an emphasis on timing, tempo, and interactive counter-play as you try to destroy the opposing wizard.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Multi-Use Cards

name: Australian Cash Stream Board Game
description:
With Australian Cash Stream Players attempt to build a viable, 'friendly' financial empire within the constraints of a constantly changing inflation mechanism whilst resisting player takeover bids and personal challenges.

Unlike other board games, Cash Stream allows for all players to 'be in the game' at all times, even when they are without assets or cash.

Intriguing challenge cards allow players to constantly challenge each other player, at any time, thereby Cash Stream is not just about cash management and acquisition.

—description from the designer

name: The In-famous Stalemate of Gutterman's Gulch
description:
The In-famous Stalemate of Gutterman's Gulch is a roll & write game where you assume the role of weasels, trying to trench their way to the edge of the chicken coops at Farmer Brown's. All the while, avoiding egg shot and egg bombs being hurled at you by the enemy.

Each turn you will roll dice to determine what type of event you will encounter and the location of the event. You will perform the event and do four actions. If you successfully maneuver three of your six weasels to each of the three gathering spots, you will be having dinner tonight!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hunter Herder: A Two Player Print and Play Game
description:
Hunter Herder is a two player game, with a play time of about 20 minutes. Each player will either take on the role of the Herder or the Hunter.

The Herder: In the conifer forests of the northern wastes, you are the Reindeer Herder. But you have heard that an enemy King, who is invading your land, has sent in his Hunter to round up eight reindeer to pull his mighty sleigh. You have no intention of letting this King steal away your herd and so are tasked with using your guile and knowledge to hide them from the enemy King’s Hunter.

The Hunter: The King has called you forth and told you to find eight reindeer to pull his mighty sleigh. The only place to capture these reindeer is the northern wastes in enemy territory and so you have no choice but to head into these harsh lands. One of your minions has told you a Herder protects the reindeer so you must use your hunting prowess to do your King’s bidding.

Aim

Hunter Herder is a two player game. One plays the Hunter and the other the Herder. The Hunter must capture eight reindeer. Using tranquiliser darts, they are downed and carted out, never to return. But the Herder is determined to stop this from happening by obstructing and tricking the Hunter who has only a short amount of time to roundup the required reindeer.

Setup

You will need to print and mount the cards, tiles and counters on card. These are then used during play. You will also need a six sided dice.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Magical Unicorn Quest: Mystical Gear
description:
The Fairies are enchanting ordinary items with special powers. You may attach the powerful gear to your mystical beings in order to aid you in your quest. But, Watch Out! Trolls are trying to steal the magical gear and keep it for themselves. Keep far away from the trolls in your search for the Magical Unicorns.

The Magical Unicorn Quest: Mystical Gear is an expansion to Magical Unicorn Quest. The base game is required in order to play.

Components:
15 Mystical Being Cards
30 Mystical Gear Cards
6 player reference Cards
1 Rulebook

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Take That

name: Magical Unicorn Quest: Dragon's Lair
description:
Dragons and banshees are terrorizing the Magical Forest. Loot the dragon's lair, craft power potions, and cast mystical magic.

The base game is required in order to play.

Components:
1 Box
1 Rulebook
10 Being Cards
18 Magic cards
18 Potion Cards

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Take That

name: Tactic Flower
description:
MEMORY AND STRATEGY GAME
The garden is in full bloom, and the insects are racing to play amongst the petals. Who will be the first to land on a set of flowers – the butterflies or the firebugs?

A clever cross between noughts and crosses and draughts. In this insect battle, you’ll need to put your strategist hat on to win the most points over the 3 rounds.

There are 3 ways to win a round: Line up 4 tokens from top to bottom or 5 tokens lengthways, or place all 4 insects on 4 identical flowers. Who will take the win?!

—description from publisher

name: Inception
description:
Inception is a PnP PvP game (CC BY 4.0).

It is a rule-light, easy-to-carry puzzle that can be played within different timeframes, according to the different scenarios (setups).

It's also a game designed to be easily expanded to new scenarios using the existing assets.

The goal of the game is to build a path (one tile at a time) that takes you from a starting position to a finishing point (a treasure chest) before your opponent can do the same. Your opponent may make things harder for you during the course, though.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Map Addition, Map Deformation, Map Reduction

name: Kiképala
description:
OBSERVATION AND SPEED GAME
A game of hide and seek is starting on the playground… So, where are they all hiding?!
In this discarding game, you need to be the fastest to get rid of all your cards by picking out the character in your hand that matches the dice.
The first player to discard all his cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Shut the box Junior
description:
The famous “Close the box” strategy and calculation game reimagined for younger children, from 4 years old. In each round, as many flaps as possible must be lowered before being blocked.

A game is played in 5 rounds. in each round, each player has 1 turn; When it is their turn to play, each player rolls the dice until they are unable to close any more flaps.
After 5 rounds, each player adds up the points they have scored in each round; The winner is the player with the lowest total number of points.

—description from the publisher

name: Dictator of Sweden (Second Edition)
description:
Dictator of Sweden is played with two teams, representing democrats and anti-democrats, in the Swedish parliament.

Each player is secretly assigned a role in one of the teams, including 1 role as dictator. The ones assigned as anti-democrats will know each other.

Players in turn, will become prime minister, that suggests another player to form government with. If approved by a majority, that government, may take an authoritarian or democratic decision.

The game ends when 6 authoritarian or 6 democratic decisions have been taken.

Now includes the expansion Tidö Edition - The expansion based on tidöavtalet between the conservative parties and the Neo-Nazi party after the election 2022.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Capitals & Colonies
description:
A game about exploring and settling. Starting with a main island, the players start expanding over the whole board. Depending on which fraction is chosen, the city grows in different ways.

All islands offer different opportunities in form of fertilities. Growing the city offers more taxes which can provide more ships and armies to protect both, land and sea. This is useful because all resources and goods need to be transferred to the main island.

The bigger the city, the higher the demands of the inhabitants. Keeping the inhabitants happy, will unlock better event cards, which will be picked on every turn. If the happiness falls, the events will turn in a bad way. Trade between players and a non player trader supports all and gives even more chances to keep everyone happy.

Who ever builds all required houses and provide all requirements for 3 turns, wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Market, Modular Board

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 27
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 27 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Kamisori Light Tank (Prime/A/B/C/R)
• Galleon Light Tank (GAL-106/106M/200R/201/300/C)
• Buzzard Hover Tank
• Falcon Hover Tank
• Hawk Hover Tank (LTV-4)
• Axel Heavy Tank (IIC/IIC XL)
• Patton Tank (Taurian/Ultra/XL)
• Phantom (T/F/G/I/J/K/L/R)
• Nightyski NGS-7S
• Penetrator PTR-8D
• Gunslinger GUN-3ERD
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Tuttu Juttu tuntemisleikki lisäkysymyssarja 300 uutta kysymystä
description:
This is the 300-question version in a rectangular box - the same as was used for concurrent Alias expansions.

There is also a 400-question edition in a square box that was similar, but somewhat smaller than the original game box; both were published in 1992.

Both versions simply have additional question decks inside the box, for the four categories of the game; no new rules or mechanics were introduced.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Tinyly Party
description:
It’s the evening of the major spring festival. All the Tinylys are invited and are getting ready for this year’s masked ball. To be ready, they need to get their companion, a mask, a cake, an invitation and a flower.

“Tinyly party” is a roll-and-move and object collecting game. Players take on the role of a Tinyly, who must collect 5 tokens along the way to get ready for the ball. To collect their tokens, each of them will first have to win stars: the “money” in the world of the Tinylys.

End of the game:
To get to Léopold, a player must have, on their card, all 5 tokens and at least 3 stars.
The game ends once a player has collected their 5 tokens and joined Léopold, who gives the winner a beautiful daisy.

-description from publisher

name: Mein erstes Sprech-Hexchen
description:
The children help the little witch to cook a porridge. Only certain ingredients (objects) that fit into a given category are allowed in. Does the ball belong with the toys? Do the shoes match the clothes? Is the tractor a vehicle?

This game stimulates language development and builds vocabulary.

For older children there is a variant:
Each child receives a screen, a category tile and 4 objects. One by one, each player chooses another player and asks them for a specific item that fits their category.
The first to own the 4 items that belong to their category wins.

Mein erstes Sprech-Hexchen is a variant for very young children of Die freche Sprech-Hexe.

name: Villages: Crystal Quest
description:
Villages: Crystal Quest is the 7th expansion for the Villages card game–and it’s the biggest one yet, with a monster-infested dungeon to explore and alternate rules that bring new life to all your existing cards.

In addition to waging war on other players, you can send your entire village to explore the dungeon and fight monsters as a group. Unit abilities interact with each other in new ways and each battle becomes a puzzle as you decide which monster each character should fight in order to defeat them all.

For each monster destroyed, you’ll draw treasure cards, which give you extra gold at the end of the game. But what you’re really searching for are the Crystals–six powerful gems, one in each color. The round will only end after a certain number of these have been discovered, allowing you to spend a little longer developing strategies and building your civilization before moving on to the next one.

Villages: Crystal Quest is an expansion that requires the Villages base game.

Contains 69 cards and a rule booklet.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Peleia
description:
Peleia is a variant of Stratego, with typical characters from southern Brazil.

It also introduces a few new elements, such as cards and dice, and it's played with an 8x10 board - altogether turning the matches more dynamic than Stratego.

Most pieces move according to an asymmetric dice - which contain three sides 01, two sides 02, and one side 03.

Each player receives 03 cards, with which they can change the regular mechanics of the game.

With the card "Não tá morto quem peleia", you decide on a fight/encounter by rolling a D6 rather than by the characters/pieces' rankings.

With the card "Às brinca", you can cancel an attack that, otherwise, you'd lose.

With the card "Traíra", you can reveal one of your opponent's pieces.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Napoleonic
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid

name: KALDOM
description:
KALDOM is a skirmish game opposing 2 players on various places. The main advantage of KALDOM is to offer a game system of extreme fluidity and accessibility, to share the pleasure of miniature games with family and friends, and to make discover this pleasure to people who are not familiar with this hobby. The simplicity of the game, thanks to a unique and ingenious system, allows to keep the tactical interest of this type of game. You can play with the various tribes designed specifically for the game, or create your own team with an intuitive character generator. The various powers of the magic stones will make no two games the same and the tactical interest will be constantly renewed.

—description from the designer
