KALDOM est un jeu d’escarmouche opposant 2 joueurs sur divers théâtres d’opérations. L’atout majeur de KALDOM est d’offrir un système de jeu d’une extrême fluidité et accessibilité, pour partager le plaisir des jeux de figurines en famille, entre amis, et faire découvrir ce plaisir à des personnes étrangères à ce « hobby ». La simplicité du jeu, grâce à un système unique et ingénieux, permet de garder l’intérêt tactique de ce type de jeu. Vous pouvez jouer avec les diverses peuplades conçues spécifiquement pour le jeu, où créer de toutes pièces votre équipe avec un générateur intuitif de personnages très complet. Les pouvoirs variés des pierres magiques feront qu’aucune partie ne se ressemblera et l’intérêt sera sans cesse renouvelé.

Pour gagner, vous devez détenir à la fin d’un tour 4 pierres ou éliminer l’ensemble de vos adversaires.

—description from the designer (French)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: História a Honfoglalástól 1848ig
description: Hungarian history game with oldschool move by dice, but instead of dices there are cards with different level of historical questions to answer providing movement based on the level of the card.

name: Pocket Quiz: Modernes Allgemeinwissen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Modern general knowledge" and includes questions about all kinds of events from the last decade, ranging from politics to pop culture.

name: Pocket Quiz Junior: Verrückte Tiere
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "Crazy Animals".

This edition contains 100 questions about the craziest
animals and their behavior. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

name: Clones Attack Hilarity Expansion Pack #1
description:
Love Cards Against Humanity but hate yourself? Buy these 150 unaffiliated, unofficial, but totally compatible cards for the world's most popular party game.
150 Cards (112 White, 38 Black)
Cards are the same size, weight, and finish as the original Cards Against Humanity cards

name: Figo
description:
Figo is a party game for skydivers.

In each round, one person reads a card, and then the group decides who in the group should be tagged with that card.

The person with the most votes at the end of the game receives the title "Figo".

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: The Looter & The Watchman
description:
The Looter & The Watchman is a dice-placement PnP PvP game (CC BY 4.0).

Influenced by One Card Dungeon, the motivation was to create a rule-light 2P PvP game that could be easily expanded and easily carried around — all you need is an A5-size board and a handful of dice.

Plus, it's a game that can be easily expanded by anyone by creating new scenarios.

Each player has a different goal: the Looter wins if they can capture the three items and escape; the Watchman wins if they can capture the Looter before they escape.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Food Truck Entrepreneur
description:
Experience business as a food truck entrepreneur!
Choose your food truck, hire employees, prepare products, and travel to different neighborhoods in the city to outsell your competitors.
Earn the most Experience Points to win.
Play on your own or with up to 4 players at the same time.
A fun and educational board game for youth and adults!

—description from the designer

name: Zirkus Lustig
description: The players take turns to roll and move. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces the players jump vorward, on others they have to go back. On other spaces they win or lose game coins or have to skip a turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Afrikareise
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 84 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Boba Blitz
description:
Boba Blitz is a 1-5 players card game featuring everyone's favourite bubble/boba tea! As the owner of your own bubble tea chain, your job is to outdo your competitors and attain boba supremacy!

Each turn, players can resupply to get more ingredients, toppings and flavours, assemble their bubble tea, sell it for money, purchase premium bubble tea flavours worth more points or sabotage their opponents. Once a player has sold all their available cups including a premium bubble tea flavour, the end-game is triggered.

Blend. Sell. Spill. Nobody is gonna get oolong after this!

—description from the designer

name: Battle for Kojima
description:
Lord Shi, a Commander in the Mongolian supremacy that seeks to ravage all of Japan. With his fearsome generals, hordes of soldiers, bandits and assassins, Lord Shi has set his sights on Kojima Island a small and quiet island with plenty of inhabitants that co-exist peacefully until Lord Shi’s invasion. Now you must rise up and defeat this tyrant. Rally your fellow villagers, build your equipment, gather your resolve and Battle For Kojima!

You are a leader of one of the many villages around Kojima Island under siege from the Mongolian army. You defend yourself, build your resolve and fight for honour, defeating their forces from the island. You start by assembling a band of villagers willing to brave the hazards ahead and equip them with fearsome weapons. Once prepared, you will lead them into peril, cutting down their forces, defeat the generals, and slay the elusive Lord Shi! 

Each player constructs a custom deck of cards during the game. Your deck represents the capabilities and resources of your adventuring party. At the end of each turn, you discard your entire hand and draw a new one, thus it is imperative to create a deck that is reliable and powerful. How well you use the strengths and powers of your cards determines whether victory will be yours!

On Your Turn you can either:

- Attack an enemy
- Gather Equipment or Villagers
- Rally by discarding weaker cards for stronger ones

Each card has a certain ammount of Victory Points (VP) and the Aim is to get as many VP before the game ends. The game ends when Lord Shi is defeated.

name: Re:Creation
description:
The game lasts for 5 or 6 rounds (years). Each round consists of 4 phases:

Planning Phase — Players simultaneously plan their actions behind their player screens.
Turn Order Phase — Players change the turn order and receive the track bonus.
Action Phase — In turn order, players perform the planned actions.
Structure Activation Phase — Players may use the effects of their Structures.


Actions are performed on 4 game boards, each representing 4 ways to interact with its cells:
Pollution board — Reduce pollution and repopulate clean cells.
Ruins board — Clear the area, gather valuable modules, and plant the groves.
Mutant board — Study mutants and extract genes to recreate animals.
Creation board — Spend resources to recreate animals and repair structures.

Your goal is to earn the most Victory Points by doing the following:
Complete Goals
Study Mutants
Reduce Pollution and gather valuable resources
Gather Compatible Modules
Recreate Animals
Build Eco-Friendly Structures
Plant Groves
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Colour Cheater
description:
The challenge of the game is how to combine the basic colours red, blue and yellow to create new colours. The winner is the first player to produce his favorite colours.

Things get tricky when players compete for the basic colours and colour plans are intercepted. Experienced players develop the talent to detect their opponents colour plans and include them in their own colour strategy.

The gameplay is as follows. Every player gets a few hidden goal cards with colors. Than the active player draws one colour disc from the bag. Using his colour discs he can move the current marker in the direction of the chosen discs on the rondel. Once the player reaches his secret goal he can reveal one of his cards.

name: Journeys of St. Paul
description:
St. Paul didn't spread the gospel alone. In fact, the book of Acts refers to numerous individuals who played key roles in his ministry. Each person had a different critical part to play, including those who delivered St.Paul's letters to the newly established churches. This was a dangerous and arduous task. Messengers braved harsh wilderness, barren deserts — even the deadly Roman Legion! — to help St. Paul get his Epistles to Christian brothers and sisters in need of guidance and encouragement.

In Journeys of Saint Paul, you will be one of several messengers dispatched to deliver one of St. Paul's momentous letters. Your mission: Be the first to cross the city gate and deliver St. Paul's letter to its secret destination. But beware! The Romans are intent on seeking and destroying all Christians, so the chase may be on! This adventure requires cleverness, courage, and tenacity — with billions of souls at stake.

—description from the publisher

name: Gloom: Got the Pox at Pax
description:
This is a promo card for Gloom.

To play with this promo, shuffle it into the pile of cards at the beginning of the game.

The card's ability reads: Both you and the player to your left must discard 2 cards from your hands.

This promo was released at PAX Unplugged 2022.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Rock Paper Wizard – Bigby's Hand
description:
Bigby's Hand is a new spell card for Rock Paper Wizard.

"After checking for wild surges, place your finger on the space in front of your target. Any wizard that lands on or passes through this space gives you 1 gp."

Instead of having a card number in the lower right corner, the card is marked "promo" there.

name: Jinja: End of Season Bonus Promos
description:
Promo pack containing 3 cards:

Spirit's Fortune
- 3 Honor Small
- 1 Honden, 1 Kitsune Statue, 1 Torii Gate, 1 Chozuya
- Roll the Mask die. If you roll a Blue Star or Red Star, gain 1 Gold.

Spirit's Inspiration
- 5 Honor Medium
- 2 Honden, 1 Kitsune Statue, 1 Torii Gate, 2 Chozuya
- Roll the Mask die. If you roll a Blue Star or Red Star, gain Random Structure.

Spirit's Esteem
- 7 Honor Large
- 2 Honden, 2 Kitsune Statue, 2 Torii Gate, 2 Chozuya
- Roll the Mask die. If you roll a Blue Star or Red Star, gain 2 Honor.

name: Victoria: The Board Game
description:
Never before have the lives of so many changed so much, so quickly. Turn the shouts of upheaval echoing in the streets into government reform. Transform the force of technological innovation into sparks of progress. Social, technological and cultural revolutions provide the perfect playground for your alternate history fantasies.

The muscle of industry is powered by the sinews of trade. Import necessary goods to keep your people happy and fuel the factories that will produce valuable items for export. Harness the power of steam and coal to transform factory towns into industrial titans.

Rather than painting the map of the world, you write the book of your nation. But you are an actor on a global stage, racing your opponents up the mountain of prestige. In Victoria, the choice is yours, play tall or play wide. While some players will focus on internal politics, developing their state's infrastructure and institutions, others will use high-stakes diplomatic plays, involving pacts, alliances, threats and bluffs, to get their way on the stage of international politics and claim their place in the sun. As a last resort, such dangerous plays will sometimes inevitably result in war.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Economic, Political, Post-Napoleonic, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events
publishers: Aegir Games, Paradox Interactive (I), PSC Games

name: x-Chess: the First Mutant
description:
x-Chess is a series of Chess variants, all of them played on a 5x6 board, each introducing one or more fairy pieces to a different setup.

x-Chess: The First Mutant (CC BY 4.0) is the first of the x-Chess variants, in which only one piece is a mutation: the Archbishop.

It's a game designed to be quick and dynamic.

Each player has 05 Pawns, 02 Rooks, 02 Archbishops, and 01 King. There are no Queens, Bishops, or Knights.

White pieces: Pawns fill the row from A2 to E2; Rooks are placed on A1 and E1; Archbishops, B1 and D1; King goes on C1.
Black pieces: mirror the white pieces.

Rules

Archbishops move like a bishop or a knight. Although they cannot jump over other pieces when moving as a bishop, they may do so when moving as a knight. They can checkmate all by themselves.
Castling is not allowed.
Pawns cannot perform two-step moves as in regular Chess. Therefore, there is no en passant.
Pawns can be promoted only to higher pieces already captured by your opponent. If there are no higher pieces available to proceed with the promotion, pawns cannot move to the last row of the board.
The first player to checkmate their opponent wins.


—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: Tanguero
description:
In this game the players will impersonate tangueros who will perform a Milonga (4 tandas of Tango, 1 of vals, 1 of milonga). At each turn they have to perform the mirada choosing their partner among the people sitting next to the dance floor and contend for him with their opponents; the loser will have to dance with a beginner who, instead of giving bonuses as the partner would do, will cause malus during the dance. Once on the dance floor, the players took turns playing their "figure" cards which they must replicate by moving on the dance floor according to the rules of the tango, i.e. without overtaking the opposing dancers, without colliding and so on; each correctly completed figure will award victory points. All this will be repeated for each tanda and at the end of the evening, the player who has collected the most gems will be the best tanguero.

In questo gioco i giocatori impersoneranno dei tangueri che si esibiranno in una Milonga (4 tande di Tango, 1 di vals, 1 di milonga). Ad ogni turno dovranno eseguire la mirada, ossia scegliere il proprio partner tra le persone sedute accanto alla pista di ballo e contenderselo con gli avversari; il perdente dovrà ballare con un principiante che anziché dare bonus come farebbe il partner, causerà dei malus durante il ballo. Una volta scesi in pista, a turno i giocatori dovranno giocare le proprie carte "figura" che dovranno replicare muovendosi sulla pista da ballo secondo le regole del tango, ossia senza superare i ballerini avversari, senza scontrarsi e via dicendo; ogni figura correttamente completata, regalerà punti vittoria. Tutto ciò si replicherà per ogni tanda ed alla fine della serata, il giocatore che avrà collezionato più gemme sarà il tanguero migliore.
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Movement Template, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Otete Sama
description:
Otete Sama is a horror dexterity game about a school girl who was found with no hands, hanging from a double-bay window, which had a bloody hand print on it. Newspapers at the time attributed her death to a tragic accident caused by Western architecture.

The game comes with a set of cards and 3 red strings. One of the cards shows Otete's bloody hand print on the reverse side.

The cards are placed face down on the table, and surrounded by a red string. One player takes on the role of Otete and the other are investigators from the Occult Research Society. The investigators close their eyes and hold a second red string with their pinky fingers.

The investigators each turn over cards; if they reveal the hand card, the Otete player grabs their wrist and that investigator can no longer reveal cards. However, those players can pull on the red string as a way to communicate to the remaining investigators.

Once the remaining investigators think they know where the hand is, they can announce it. The investigators carefully set down the red string and each remaining player has once chance to reveal the card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Deduction, Horror

name: The Dwarves: Wooden Box
description: Contains the base game and the Saga expansion in an exclusively hot stamped wooden box.

name: Project:Waifur
description:
Project:Waifur is a strategical Collectible Card Game where you summon a team of digital beings called "Waifur" to fight for you within a virtual space.

Upgrade your waifur and enhance them by installing several programs such as weapons, supports, skills, viruses and many more.

Build the ultimate deck and challenge your rivals to an exciting CYBER-BATTLE!

Experience unique features, such as:
\ COOLDOWN: Played cards eventually return!
\ CHARGING: Pay for card cost with any card!
\ CANCEL: Hinder your opponents progress!
\ ESCALATION: Play hands of 20+ cards!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: クフーヒ と コトバ (Kufuhi and Kotoba)
description:
If Kufuhi and Kotoba, an apprentice witch comes across a dragon who changes colors depending upon what it is near.

The game includes a set of translucent color cards and one player tries to describe a word or phrase (e.g. internet or classical music) with these cards.

The game includes both competitive and cooperative play modes.
publishers: Game Circle Rarirupa (ゲームサークル ラリルパ)

name: Preachify! A Game of Strategic Subversion
description:
Overview

Ridiculous zealots. Derpy followers. Subversive preaching. Amass your own cultish following by out-preaching your opponent in this strategic card game for two that takes less than 15 minutes to play.

Preachify has simple, easy to learn rules without sacrificing depth of gameplay. In short: 

 1. You each secretly choose a card, then reveal the chosen cards at the same time. 

 2. After doing this three times, whoever has the higher preach power wins the round. The losing cards become "converted" to the winning player's creed. 

 3. Whoever has the most believer points at the end of the game wins! 

Misleading your opponent, the use of special cards, and card counting are all encouraged. Just be aware that although you may think you are leading your opponent on, they may be misleading you...

-description from designer

name: Gangster Family
description:
The Godfather has asked you to collect the revenue from the city's underground bars. This is your chance to put your pockets full of money in the process! But be careful, collaborate with each other to satisfy the sponsor or the story will end very badly...
A game of bluff and influence. You will have to play smart, bluff and reason with the greedy companions who fill their pockets with them at the risk of losing everyone.

In Gangster Family, the starting player picks up an envelope of his choice from the Godfather's desk. He reads out loud the amount inside, then draws two money cards (then hiding the amount). He must place one of the 7 cards in his hand in front of him and discard one. He then hands the envelope with the money to his neighbour on his left. It is important that this amount must be strictly higher than the amount given at the beginning. The player on the left then has 2 choices: to believe the amount given away or not. The game ends when all the cards are gone, or when all the envelopes are gone. During the game, you must work together to collect the amount of money offered by the Godfather. If you do, the player with the most money wins the game. If not... then the wrath of the Godfather will catch up with everyone and you will all lose.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Desconectados
description:
Disconnected Game - Cell Break Get ready to lock your cell phones in a cell and connect with others! This fun party game forces players to lock their cell phones in the included cell and prove how much they know about each other in order to get their phones back.

Each player attempts to assemble their key to unlock the cell after answering different questions in 3 different categories - About Me, About You and About Us. How well do you know those around you? "What is the best brand of sneakers?""Who would win the lottery but lose the ticket?""If I could only eat one type of food for the rest of my life, what would it be?"

When a player answers correctly they receive a key piece. The first player to get the 5 pieces needed to complete their key will be the winner and unlock their cell phone (ouch!). On the other hand, the player who makes the least number of connections will have to leave his cell phone in the cell for the longest time!

Includes: cardboard cell with base, 100 cards (300 questions), 30 key pieces, 4 voting tokens, 4 plastic holders and game rules.

name: Legends Untold: Novice Booster 1 – The Alchemy, Druid & Treasure Booster
description: Combines the previously separate Alchemist, Druid and Treasure Novice Boosters.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Legends Untold: Novice Booster 2 – A Trove of Treasures
description: Contains all sorts of gear to help your adventurer: weapons, outfits, companions, weapon talents, kits, and loot. Don't forget the loot.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Legends Untold: Novice Booster 3 – The Cryptic Collection
description:
A collection of unusual objects to aid in your adventuring.

Contains 18 Loot cards, 12 Recipe cards (6 potions, 6 preparations), and 36 Knowledge cards.

• Mysterious Potions: 6 Flasks + 6 Potion Recipes

This includes a new mechanic where you can find the Flasks and then identify them during Camp Actions to unlock one-off Potions. Note you do not need the Potions & Preps Expansion to use these Potions, but if you have it then you can find any of those Potions with this mechanic.

• Knowledge of Deepsorrow: 6 Tomes + 12 Mini poker Knowledge cards

This includes a new mechanic where you can find the Tomes and then learn more about Deepsorrow from them.
• Magical Remnants: 6 Curios + 6 Preparation Recipes

This includes a new mechanic where you can find the Curios and then identify them during Camp Actions to unlock one-off use Preparations. Note you do not need the Potions & Preps Expansion to use these Potions, but if you have it then you can find any of the Preparations with this mechanic.

• Knowledge of Caves & Sewers: 24 Mini poker Knowledge cards

This includes a new mechanic where you can find the 6 Tomes (noted above) and then learn more about the Caves and Sewers.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Tank Hunter: Girls und Panzer
description:
Lead your tank units to destroy your opponents' units and
Aim for victory. Panzer for!

"タンクハンター ガールズ＆パンツァーエディション / Tank Hunter Girls und Panzer Edition" is a tank battle card game that uses the "Tank Hunter" card game system, which allows players to play hand-to-hand tank battles.
Players drive tanks from each of the high schools that are members of the Tank Road Federation and fight against other players' tanks to win.
The game system, which omits the infantry and artillery rules of "Tank Hunter" and focuses on tank battles, is simple and quick to play, allowing players to play quickly and enjoy the game again and again.

The unit cards, which are tanks, include all types of familiar tanks from the TV series, complete with paint and emblems.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: カルタード from えんどろ～！ (Karutado from Endro!)
description:
Caltado is the crystal of the world's mystery and the destination of mankind's wisdom! The destination of mankind's wisdom~!
The card game "Caltard from Endoro! is now available in the form of the card game "Caltard from Endoro! has been made into a product as "Caltard from Enndoro!

Simple and easy to play, "Caltard from Endoro! and "Level Up! and "Raise the Level!
and "Raise the Level!

The cards are 58 cards featuring Yusha, Seira, Fai, Mei and their friends, as well as other characters, monsters and items.
The package and top card illustrations were newly drawn for this title by Studio Gogumi!

The daily fantasy "Endoro! is a party game where players can get along and have fun just like the friends in the daily fantasy "Endoro!

—description from the publisher (translated)

カルタードこそまさに世界の神秘の結晶にして人類の英知の行きつく先～！

TVアニメ『えんどろ～！』に登場する「カルタード」を、カードゲーム『カルタード from えんどろ～！』としてグッズ化しました！

シンプルで遊びやすい「カルタードきょうそ～！」と、原作のストーリーを再現した「レベルをあげよ～！」の2つのルール遊べるほか、
カードをトランプとして遊ぶこともできます。

ユーシャ、セイラ、ファイ、メイたちを中心に58枚、登場人物たちやモンスター、アイテムなどもあしらったカードになっています。
パッケージと最上位カードのイラストは、Studio五組による本作のための描き下ろし！

日常系ファンタジー『えんどろ～！』の仲間たちのように仲良く楽しく遊べるパーティーゲームです！

—description from the publisher

name: Forces of Hordes: Grymkin The Wicked
description:
Players take on the role of powerful Warlocks as they lead their savage forces into battle. Aarmies will use a mix of brutal warriors and packs of hulking War beasts fueled by unbridled rage.

Cast down to the hells of Urcaen by Menoth long ago, the Defiers and their grymkin armies have risen again to punish the wicked across all of Immoren. Freed by the Old Witch, Zevanna Agha, the Defiers now work toward their own ends. Each is a self-made, godlike being who wields uncanny power to reap what is due from the corrupted denizens of Caen. The harvest of the damned will not end so long as the hearts of humankind remain tainted and debased. Within this Hordes sourcebook you`ll find a trove of evocative Grymkin lore as well as details on the shadowed history of the Grymkin and their dark masters, who dared to stand against the god Menoth. Unleash the malevolent power of the Grymkin army upon your foes with two specialized theme forces, and take inspiration from a painting guide that will fuel your own maddened creativity as you summon your forces to reap the Wicked Harvest.

name: Hordes: Exigence
description:
Hordes: Exigence is the third expansion for the second edition of Hordes. This book introduces lesser warlocks for the main factions and warbeast packs.

EVERY PROMISE HAS ITS PRICE

As titanic battles are fought across western Immoren, the fires of a war more ancient and terrible than any of those conducted by mortals are being stoked to world-consuming fury. The leaders of the United Kriels fight to ensure their survival by calling on both old and new allies, including the recently awakened mountain kings. Aloof from the struggles of the other factions, Xerxis leads an army in a risky gambit amid the larger plans of Supreme Archdomina Makeda, positioning the skorne to subjugate Ios. Meanwhile, events already set in motion by Krueger the Stormlord threaten to scar the face of Caen itself as he works toward his ultimate goal: the destruction of the dragon Everblight. Ancient beings advance toward an apocalyptic end game with no regard for the innocents caught in their path, and only time will tell if great heroes will find a way to forestall this doom.

HORDES: Exigence brings you the next thrilling chapter of the HORDES saga. Hold nothing back in your fight for survival with:

- New warlocks, including new epic versions.

- Three new character lesser warlocks who bring even more furious support to your army.

- New units and solos to expand HORDES armies with new strategic possibilities.

- New narrative fiction picking up directly after the harrowing events of HORDES: Gargantuans.

- A painting and modeling guide to help you prepare your forces for battle.

- Theme Force lists for each new warlock, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces found in the HORDES world.

AWAKEN YOUR FURY AND HOLD NOTHING BACK IN THE WAR FOR SURVIVAL!

name: Forces of Hordes: Legion of Everblight Command
description:
Hailing from the frozen northern wastes, the Legion of Everblight represents many different races gathered and corrupted by the insidious power of the dragon Everblight. Led by preternaturally potent warlocks, each of whom holds within her breast a shard of the dragon's own essence, endless ranks of blighted Nyss and ogrun march forth to spread the dragon's corruption to the farthest reaches of Immoren and beyond. This formidable army is backed by twisted and terrifying dragonspawn born from the very blood of Everblight's generals and shaped by his own nightmarish imagination.

Forces of HORDES: Legion of Everblight Command provides the foundation you need to unleash the destructive will of the dragon upon your foes with:

Complete rules and profiles for the blighted warlocks and terrible warbeasts of the Legion of Everblight, including two new warlocks and a new character warbeast.
Detailed history and background information, including an in-depth look at Legion warlocks and warbeasts.
A painting guide full of tips and inspiration to help you create an army as individual as you are.
Three new theme forces that allow you to create specialized Legion of Everblight armies with specific benefits.

EMBRACE THE POWER OF A DRAGON!

-description from the back of the book

name: Forces of Hordes: Trollbloods Command
description:
For Kith and Kriel

Caught amid the destructive wars of man, the many tribes of the trollkin have united to save their kind and drive out those who despoil their lands. Led by mighty warlocks who can summon ferocious full-blood trolls to their side and backed by hearty trollkin warriors, pygmy sharpshooters, and powerful champions who have banded together to forge their own legends, the trollkin are prepared to stand their ground against any army that dares threaten them.

Unite the kriels under your banner with Forces of Hordes: Trollbloods, featuring:

Complete faction rules and profiles for using all current Trollblood models in Hordes Mk II. New troops to bring to the fight, plus the all-new warlock Captain Gunnbjorn. An in-depth look at the history and structure of the trollkin kriels. A painting and modeling guide to help ready your forces for battle. Trollblood Theme Force lists and rules, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces from the Trollbloods.

Sate the Hunger of Trolls upon the Carnage of War!

-description from back of the book

name: Cuckoo Byebye
description:
This game is special because it was born out of the observation of birds and particularly the way the cuckoo bird behaves. Rather than creating a nest and incubating its eggs, it prefers to observ the nests of other birds. As soon as the parents leave the nest, the cuckoo lays an egg instead of another. The birds do not realise that they are incubating an egg that is not their own.

You take turns playing the role of a cuckoo and aiming at another player. This player will present his hand of cards to the blind and the cuckoo will try to target an egg. . The targeted player will have to defend against the cuckoo and prevent it from laying an egg containing a baby cuckoo in its nest.

Throughout the game, players collect baby birds and other cards that the other players place on their nest. No one knows exactly what they have in their nest.
At the end of the game, all the eggs in the nest hatch.
Whoever has the most chicks and the least baby cuckoos in their nest wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Cactus Air Force: Air War Guadalcanal
description:
Cactus Air Force is a tactical game that allows you to fight the air battle over the Solomons in late 1942. As either the raiding Japanese or the defending Americans, you will take command of a small flight of aircraft, representative of a larger air battle, and engage in swirling dogfights around Guadalcanal. As the players advance in the campaign game, they can increase their skills, earn promotion and receive awards for heroic feats, all in an attempt to defeat the enemy.

One player takes the Japanese side and sends raids from his main base at Rabaul to try and knock out the American presence on Guadalcanal. The second player takes the American side and sends his motley crew of Marine, Army and Navy pilots up to intercept the raids and help to maintain their foothold in the Solomon Islands.

Play starts on the Operations Map and when contact is made between the opposing flights, they will move to the Tactical Map to fight it out. Take command of your individual aircraft and that of your flight. Can you penetrate the intercepting fighters and bomb the American installations? Or can you keep your home, Henderson Field, from falling into Japanese hands?

Can be played solitaire, two-four player, or cooperatively.

—description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: PotionSlingers: Mini Expansion
description:
Originally released as the final stretch goal for Kickstarter backers and delivered separate from the base game box.

It contains 18 advanced cards, including a 2 sided additional rules card to switch up gameplay.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 28
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 28 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• TinStar Battle Armor
• Skulker Wheeled Scout Tank C
• Warrior Attack Helicopter H-7F
• Whirlwind Scout Hover Tank (Standard/IFV/AAA)
• Mobile Long Tom Artillery LT-MOB-25F and support carriages
• SturmFeur Heavy Tank (Cell/Heavy Gauss/WoB/Steiner/Assault/Support)
• Firestarter FS9-N "Mirage II"
• Spector SPR-6F
• Cicada CDA-4A
• Devastator DVS-11
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Forces of Warmachine: Retribution of Scyrah Command
description:
Retribution is at hand!

Once outlawed as a dangerous and radical sect of extremists, the Retribution of Scyrah has become the last shining beacon of hope for the elves of Ios. The Retribution is convinced that by eliminating the spread of magic among humans, it can halt the slow demise of the elves’ last remaining gods and save their race from soulless oblivion. The Retribution’s weapons and its warjacks, called myrmidons, harness the power of arcanika and tap powers undreamed of by the other nations of the Iron Kingdoms. Led by warcasters drawn together from the numerous houses and martial disciplines of Ios, the army of the Retribution represents undeniable peril to any who would dare threaten the Iosan people or the elven nation.

Forces of Warmachine: Retribution of Scyrah Command provides the foundation you need to lead the Retribution in victory and vengeance, featuring:

Complete rules and profiles for the deadly warcasters and sleek myrmidons of the Retribution of Scyrah, including two new warcasters and a new character warjack.

A collection of units and solos that can form the flexible core of your Retribution army.

Detailed background information on the Retribution and Ios, including an in-depth look at their warcasters and myrmidons.

A painting guide full of tips and inspiration to help you create an army as individual as you are.

Three new theme forces that allow you to create specialized Retribution armies with specific benefits.

name: Forces of Warmachine: Cryx Command
description:
From the darkness of their nightmarish isles, the undead legions of Cryx strike at the Iron Kingdoms. Each battle serves to fuel their unholy necrofactoriums as scuttling necrotechs reshape everything that walks, crawls, of slithers out of their dank, macabre workshops. Wielding the powers of death and black sorcery gifted to them by their terrible master, Toruk the Dragonfather, the insidious warcasters of Cryx send forth masses of undead thralls to overwhelm their mortal foes. Their ranks bolstered by looming black-iron helljacks and skittering bonejacks, the undying army of Cryx will not rest until Toruk's shadow covers all of Immoren.

Forces of WARMACHINE: Cryx Command provides the foundation you need to serve the Dragonfather and bend the power of death to your will, featuring:

• Complete rules and profiles for the nefarious warcasters and murderous warjacks of Cryx, including two new warcasters, a new character warjack, and a new solo.
• A selection of units and solos that can form the sinister core of your Cryx army.
• Detailed background information on the Nightmare Empire, including an in-depth look at its warcasters and warjacks.
• A painting guide full of tips and inspiration to help you create an army as individual as you are.
• A new theme forces that allow you to create specialized armies with specific benefits.

RISE TO THE CALL OF THE DRAGONFATHER!

name: Forces of Warmachine: Cygnar Command
description: Providing the foundation every Cygnar player needs, Forces of Warmachine: Cygnar Command features a complete listing of all current warcasters and warjacks released to-date, in addition to two new warcasters, a new character warjack, and a selection of core units and solos from the Faction.

name: Forces of Warmachine: Khador Command
description:
In the cold north of western Immoren lies the mighty Khadoran Empire, whose massive military epitomizes the national ideals of strength and resilience. This formidable force is led by powerful warcasters as unrelenting in battle as the bitter Khadoran winter and back by the most brutal and heavily armored warjacks ever to stride the battlefields of Immoren. With thundering ranks of bold imperial soldiers, howling madmen armed with ancient relics, and potent arcanists wielding forgotten and forbidden magic, the army of Khador marches with on singular goal: to carve out the greatest and most dominant empire the Iron Kingdoms has ever witnessed.

Forces of WARMACHINE: Khador Command provides the foundation you need to lead the empire's conquest with:

• Complete rules and profiles for the proud warcasters and unstoppable warjacks of Khador, including two new warcasters and a new Man-O-War solo.
• Detailed history and background information, including an in-depth look at Khadoran warcasters and warjacks.
• A painting guide full of tips and inspiration to help you create an army as individual as you are.
• Two new theme forces that allow you to create specialized Khador armies with specific benefits.

FOR THE EMPRESS AND THE MOTHERLAND!

name: Forces of Warmachine: Protectorate of Menoth Command
description:
Bow before the glory of the creator of man!

The proctorate of Menoth wages a relentless crusade against all other, lesser faiths of western Immoren. Filled with glorious purpose and the divine favor of their god, the holy warcasters of the Protectorate command armies of the faithful with unbending resolve. The powerful iron frames of their warjacks stand as a testament to man’s ingenuity, each sanctified by blessings and sacred inscriptions to be made worthy of fighting for the Creator of Man. Armed with fearsome weapons that burn with the righteous fires of their god’s fury, the protectorate marches forth to bring the Lawgiver’s light to the darkness wherever it may be found.

name: Little Master Chef
description:
Little Master Chef - The Perfect Game for the Food-Loving Family. An addictive, fast-paced card game, where luck can change with the flip of a card! Imagine cooking up amazing dishes with no messy kitchen to clean up afterwards. Play pretend chef and be the first to complete 3 dishes and earn the rightful title of 'Little Master Chef'. But beware of opponents who try to steal items from your kitchen, and you can use Deny cards to reverse the effects of Action cards

On each turn, players draw 2 cards from the draw pile and can play up to 3 cards to make dishes. The first player to finish 3 dishes wins the game

name: The Beetle in a Box
description:
Social deduction in a poetic muddle
The human mind is unverifiable. We only ever directly experience our own, private thoughts. With that in mind, how well can you communicate a series of concrete and abstract concepts to a partner using only simile and metaphor? Moreover, do you trust them to tell you if they got it wrong?

According to philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein (1889-1951), language does little more than distort our understanding of the world. With this game, your goal is to embrace the poetic muddle of language by clearly communicating with your partner/s through indirect communication.

—description from the publisher

name: Yahshua Road The Game
description:
“This game explores in a playful way, how to walk on the Narrow Path (Yahshua Road) from sunrise to sunset.

With real-life situations, insightful tips, prayers, and inspirational Bible verses, the players will receive a deeper understanding of what it means to be a follower of Jesus Christ.” (From the instructions)

Players take turns rolling a die and moving down the path, moving from the sun toward the moon, which signifies a day. Some spaces correlate with different cards that are drawn and read, others move you forward or backward along the path. The first player to reach the moon wins.

name: Labyrinth: Beginner's set
description: Three new mazes to put on top of the base game to help train. They are all simpler than the base game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Maze

name: Defeat the Threat!
description:
Defeat the Threat! provides an exciting, fully solitaire and multi-player board game experience. At the game's core is a patented assembly that simulates a global attack by a mysterious alien Threat. The patented assembly is a multi-level 3D structure that simulates sending player's Gunships up into the atmosphere to defend Earth. One or more players advance R&D, defend cities, and maintain a World Treaty to Defeat the Threat! The game includes the patented board game assembly, magnifying glass, reference cards, dice, and playing pieces.

During each round of play, which represents a defensive action against an attack launched by the Threat, players advance R&D to strengthen armament and altitude capacity of their Gunship Fleets defending their respective City Regions. The combination of a Gunship Fleet’s Armament and Altitude for a given player yields a defensive value which, when equal to or greater than the Threat attack value provided by the patented Assembly, results in a successful defense of a given City Region defended by that Gunship Fleet. Because the Threat Attack values increase throughout the Threat’s campaign, each player serving as a Gunship Fleet Commander must steadily advance R&D to maintain the successful defense of protected City Regions. The goal is to successfully defend as many City Regions as possible for the entire duration of the Threat Campaign, which lasts on average about 8-9 rounds, but can be shorter or longer. In addition to operational decisions made during the Threat Campaign, players must also constantly reconsider the strategic impact of remaining in, or leaving, the Treaty. For example, remaining in or leaving the Treaty affects the availability of the Command Reserve and the cost of R&D advances, either of which may make the difference between saving or losing City Regions under particularly intense assaults by the Threat. The Latest Intelligence Board provides vital intelligence that players can consider in planning their strategies. During each round of play, players receive resources, cooperate to advance R&D, identify a Threat attack, decide whether to exit the Treaty, and defend against the Threat attack.

The game ends when Week 30 is reached based on operation of the Assembly per the Assembly Instruction Board (e.g., adding the rolled 6-sided die value to the existing week results in 30 or more). In any case, the last Threat Attack of the last round is resolved with the Yellow Pointer at the week “30” number on the board base.

If desired, Gunship Fleet Commanders may evaluate their performance by summing performance points listed below and checking the Performance Level listed below. You can even add your name to the “General Officer Promotion List” included in the game for particularly high scores! You can also see how high of an average score that all 4 players can achieve to measure the overall success of the players’ cooperative global effort.

Defeat the Threat! is based on two novellas, Guns of Shirlington and Forever Fight, which are available from major online booksellers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Ratio / Combat Results Table, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Bhargage
description:
Bhargage plays similarly to Five-card Cribbage, with cards of the Extended Decktet instead of regular cards. The linear deck of Cribbage is substituted by the fluid, interwoven deck of Bhargage. The Decktet cards and scoring combinations give Bhargage an entirely different flavor. Frequently, Bhargage presents interesting decisions that are quite alien to Cribbage thinking.

Sets of 2 or more cards of the same value score points, as in Cribbage. Players score for cards totaling 11, not 15, and the play of the cards is up to 23, not 31. Sequences don't score in Bhargage, but Bhargage uses the bharg combination, which is common to other Decktet games—a bharg is a set of cards containing each of the six suits exactly once.

The Pawns, Courts, and Excuse of the Extended Decktet are zero-valued cards in Bhargage, and can multiply the counts for 11 in the scoring. The Excuse also has no suit and can likewise multiply the score for bhargs. Lastly, players score for "shortage," for the number of suits not present in the opponent's hand. Bhargage is played up to 111, not 121.
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Recognition, Race, Set Collection

name: Wir bauen eine Jugendherberge
description:
Each player rolls a die to determinate ones key figure. Then the players gets a player board (youth hostel construction site) and take turns to roll three dice. If a player rolls his own key figure, he may insert the foundation stone to his youth hostel. From this point on he may set a stone (chopstick) on a white space each time any player rolls his key figure. If his key figure is rolled on two dice, he may place a stone on a yellow space. If his key figure is rolled on all three dice, he has won the game prematurely.

Only after the ground floor is finished, a player may start to build the upper floors. The last stone may only be placed if the player rolls his own key figure before another player does, else the youth hostel is breaking down and only the foundation stone remains. The player has to start building again. The first player to finish the construction of his youth hostel wins the game.

The game was published between 1935 and 1945 as the HJ-Flag in front of the youth hostel reveals.

name: Entropia Game: World of endless fantasy and mystery
description:
Welcome to Entropia, the NEW board game of endless fantasy and mystery. We are opening our gates to everyone.

The game uses dice rolls and ability cards to determine the outcome of combat, monster encounters, and boss battles. Players can also gather resources such as food and coins and use them to build cities and upgrade their character.

The game takes place on a map with different biomes and locations that players can explore. The map is divided into hexagonal tiles and players move their figures across the map to engage in combat, gather resources, and build cities.

The goal of the game involve defeating all of the monsters and bosses on the map, building the most powerful cities, or achieving other objective.

Players choose a main character card with a unique ability and take on the role of that character. They then move their figures across the map, engage in combat with other players, monsters, and bosses, and gather resources to build cities and upgrade their character. Players can also use ability cards to gain an advantage in combat and make strategic decisions about where to move and what actions to take.

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Number
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps

name: Corrida do Ouro
description:
Be the owner of a mining company and go after the gold before your friends. Hire more miners, bribe miners and steal ore from friends. Almost anything goes in the Gold Rush.

How Game Works?
Each player gets a starting miner that cannot be fired or bribed by another player.
This miner has the actions to mine and reserve a trading card.
Being possible to do both only if the letter says.

When mining, if the mined ore has the time symbol, you can only reveal it on your next turn, if you don't, you can reveal it and use it on the same turn.

When reserving a charter, it is possible to pay to use it. When paying, you can use it and take effect immediately.

It is possible to hire new miners, some are better and some are worse. But it's always good to have a lot of workers, because they are the ones who do the actions in the game.

It is possible to equip workers with pickaxes to increase the amount of mining, being able to pull more cards when mining.

The player with 3 gold wins the game. Gold nuggets are worth 1/3 of gold, so we need 3 gold nuggets to get one gold.

If all possible actions of the players end and no one has the 3 gold, whoever has the most gold wins.

-description from publisher

name: OneThirty Deck
description: Print'n'Play 130 card multi-deck, each card having 10 values, in three sections. Can play a variety of games, and people are encouraged to create new games. The expansion adds a letter for word games.
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Last Man Standing
description:
Players choose a color, and collect their pieces.

On the count of three everyone drops their pieces onto the table.

Of the pieces that are still upright and not laying flat, collect them up into your hand again, putting the others to the side.

On the occasion where there is no one left standing, collect your pieces and start again.

Everyone repeats the steps until there is a Last Man Standing.

name: Tall Tales Expansion Pack: People Edition
description: Add 14 people and 4 environments to your tall tales game.

name: Celestial Events (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The sky is full of wonders. We are starting to understand them but not always it has been like that. The devoted people of Carcassonne, lead by superstition, would read the signs in the skies as omens, premonitions, divine messages, or even punishments from the heavens... Repent or you will all be damned.

The effect of the tiles in this mini expansion can be summarized as follows:

A solar eclipse will fill the hearts of the followers in the area with terror. They will flee to the nearest religious place to pray for salvation: monasteries, cathedrals in cities, German cathedrals,...
A moon eclipse will disband any thieves on a road, as they will fear for their lives.
A comet will serve as a heavenly sign for the next player founding a new city, who will persevere in this endeavour moved by their faith. The player will be granted with up to three turns while extending this new city.
A meteor shower will be a sign of luck for players. Fate will grant them the favour to choose between two tiles in their next three turns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Tangram Race
description:
Tangram is a geometric puzzle that originated in China over 1,000 years ago and consists of 7 shapes that can be arranged to create endless designs. The TTangram is a geometric puzzle that originated in China over 1,000 years ago and consists of 7 shapes that can be arranged to create endless designs. The Tangram Race from Mudpuppy is a fresh take on the classic game and teaches spatial relationships, geometry, and problem-solving in a fun, fast-paced game!

2 players can race to complete each design, or 1 player can master all the designs!

Includes 2 colorful tangram sets and 30 challenge cards. The challenge cards are double-sided for 2 levels of difficulty.angram Race from Mudpuppy is a fresh take on the classic game and teaches spatial relationships, geometry, and problem-solving in a fun, fast-paced game!

2 players can race to complete each design, or 1 player can master all the designs!

Includes 2 colorful tangram sets and 30 challenge cards. The challenge cards are double-sided for 2 levels of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Tiny Kingdom Builder
description:
The King has issued a Royal decree:

BUILD!

Tiny Kingdom Builder is a small worker placement game for 2-4 players.

Who will build their project first?

Utilize your workers to gather the material you need to finish your Building first. The first player to collect all their material wins! But be careful, with prosperity comes wandering eyes. Make sure the Thief doesn't steal from you!

name: Spears and Bones
description:
The hunting season commences at the Valley. Tribes hailing from the four equators of the world join forces every year to battle the wild animals and the valley dwellers. The tribes must return home with sufficient prey before the winter sets, or they will not survive the cold season. Their centuries-old alliance is fragile. One chief secretly plans to break the pact to attain sole power. Another cares only about self-interest, even to the detriment of others. Who’s a friend, and who’s an enemy? Decide, and lead your tribe to victory!

The teams and the goals of the players are allotted randomly at the start. These remain secret until the end of the game. The players’ task is to find out the motivations and teams of others while aiming to complete their own goals. Players may openly support or block others, while they also possess action cards that secretly influence the outcome of actions.

The game consists of turns. The players gather berries at first, then carry out steps consecutively in the order defined by their roles, and finally, they defend together. At the beginning of a new turn, the roles alternate. Therefore the players’ order and abilities change. When the players are out of their shared vigor, the game ends. Players who have completed their victory goals win the game. Multiple teams may win, or there can be no winner.

Many of the illustrations of the game depict nudity, therefore the game is for 18+ only.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Prehistoric
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Communication Limits, Force Commitment, Interrupts, Negotiation, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Candy Trains Board Game
description:
Oh no! The candy bandit has taken all of the train tracks connecting the candy fields to the town. Work together to help to rebuild the missing train tracks and get all the trains full of candy back to the station before the candy bandit gets back.

In Candy Trains you must work together to rebuild the missing train track tiles and move all the trains full of candy across the candy fields and back into town before the candy bandit returns. In this cooperative game, players work as a team to draw cards that match missing track pieces to rebuild the path to the train station, while also using cards to move the trains along your newly built tracks. But watch out, the candy bandit is on his way back and if all the candy bandit cards are drawn and he makes it back before all the trains get the station, he will take all the towns candy. If all the trains get to the station before the candy bandit gets back, then everybody wins!

Colorful and sweet images make this a fun and creative way for kids to learn teamwork, communication, strategic thinking and simple counting through hands-on play.

-description from publisher

name: Hell Dorado: Inferno
description:
The Inferno expansion book and card deck is the first major expansion in the Hell Dorado universe. The greatest war of Hell has escalated to new heights of destruction as the demon Legions under command of the Fallen Angel Abezeth rise to eradicate the upstart invaders from Lucifer's realm.

The Inferno expansion book includes 48 new profiles across all six Hell Dorado Factions. This full color book will also feature: New Scenarios, new battlefields, and new terrain types to make your games more exciting than ever before. Hell Dorado: Inferno will give players more army strategies, more game variety, and more of the miniatures that make it one of the best looking miniature games around. The expansion also includes a card deck for all the units that are included in the book for use in the game with your models and as quick reference of your opponent's forces.

name: Castles: Duel of Kings
description:
Castles - Duel of Kings is a medieval themed, turn-based card game. Set in a time where many kingdoms are in turmoil, the nation is in desperate need of one ruler to unify the lands and settle the chaos. Players will take turns conquering lands and furthering their reign, showcasing their tactical skill to outwit and outmatch their opponents. The players who is best able to utilize multiple strategies to attack, defend and out-maneuver their opponents will have the best chance of being the ruler of this land. In this game luck rewards the bold. Testing your luck and exploring the lands to recruit the powerful gladiators and sorceresses will work greatly in ones favor.

Each new turn poses a problem to other players as the state of the lands continue to change. Players fight to maintain the ownership of a castle as they further their efforts to obtain more. After each turn players will gather all newly acquired warriors and alter their strategy to better their chances of becoming the one true king

The winner of the game is the player who successfully holds all castles simultaneously.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Real-time
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Zone of Control

name: Moo Invaders: The COWsmic Battle
description:
Pilgrim is a fast-paced, fighting, strategic card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player acts as a leader of his army, whose composition from round to round changes by representatives of four different races - Elves, Dwarves, Orcs, and Undead, as well as rare representatives of the Pilgrims.

Players fight each other in a big battle for gold, consisting of three chains of rounds. In the 1st chain, the number of bouts increases by one each round and decreases by one in the 3rd. In the middle 2nd chain, the number of bouts is always 8.

During all chains, the game goes the same way - players try to win as many coins as possible, which can be obtained by beating off cards according to certain rules. At the end of the game, players count all earned coins, and the player with the highest amount of them wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Impyrium
description:
An expansive 4X empire building strategy game where you and up to 5 other players vie to be the most dominant empire in the land. Achieve victory by being the first empire to reach 10 Victory points through any combination of Economic, military, societal and technological means. Explore a new land with over 75 unique border tiles allowing billions of possible board combinations across 3 different board sizes.

With over 500 models, every building and unit in Impyrium has a physical model that can be placed on the board or within the larger city and settlement models. Spread your workers across the land to harvest resources from the land. Then grow your economy by constructing farms, mills, mines and quarries. Build barracks and stables to train infantry and cavalry units. Build markets to foster commerce and trade resources with allied and rival empires. Or become a beacon of science and education by constructing universities to research over 100 unique technology cards.

Choose wisely from one of the 5 government systems, each providing you empire and leader specific bonuses based on their area of focus. Autocrats rule with an iron fist able to construct cities and monuments with easy. Monarchs are able to requisition additional armies with gold from their treasury as well as being powerful generals. Those who choose to implement a democratic government foster a culture of innovation allowing their empire to quickly advance through the ages and develop new technologies.

Track all your Empire's advancements and achievements on your play board. There you can purchase upgrades for your buildings and units, store your unspent resources and most importantly track your victory points.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Civilization, Economic, Medieval, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Multiple Maps, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Unluckables: Mad Scientist Promo Card
description:
Promo card given out at BGG con 2022.

Skellie Cost: 5
Skellie Amount: 1
Unlock Amount: 1
Card Name: Mad Scientist
Card Type: Unluckable
Ability Type: Instant
Ability Effect: Play 1 Trick for free.

name: Time's Up!: Game Boy Geek 2022 Promo Card
description:
Promo card from Game Boy Geek's 2022 Kickstarter for R&R version.

Text
Orange: The Game Boy Geek
Blue: Kenny G

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: Ystad
description:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1990s.

In the middle of the board is a photo from Ystad and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.

This game is endorsed by the Ystad kommun, and licensed to use the coat-of-arms of Ystad.

—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: House Of Influence
description:
House of Influence takes place in a historical age of diplomacy where influence is everything. Set after a war that has ravaged the lands people thought the golden age of peace had finally arrived. But underneath deceptive smiles the five different houses are still fighting for power and will use any means to become the house at the top: Influential people with unique skills are at the houses’ disposal to win the game. Be it the selfless Martyr who will sacrifice everything to gain influence for their house, the idealistic diplomat and her silver tongue, the valiant general or other powerful roles.
Which house will win? A house that holds honor and valor in high regard or a house preferring the subtle tactics of a cunning Charlatan?

House of Influence is a Team vs Team semi co-op Hidden role game where 3-10 players become members of a majority or minority. But players need to be careful, their allies might not be who you think they are. In order to accumulate the highest influence score in four rounds, the houses have up to 6 different characters at their disposal to manipulate the flow of influence and information.In this turn-based game each player rolls two available characters with their own set of abilities but can only use one to gather influence or information on the other players.

The appeal of House of Influence is the quick pace of the game with easy to understand rules automated and managed by the game app and unidice - the digitized die. Replayability in this Social Deduction game of intrigue and information is guaranteed. The different houses give different advantages to their house members and the characters at their disposal - depending on the flow of the game. This Hidden Role game combines decision making with the fun of rolling a dice console in the shape of a D6.

-description from publisher

name: Die Reise durch das Warenhaus
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the players have to make a jump ahead or back. The players lose a turn on spaces 29 and 34. The first player arriving at space 121 wins the game.

The game was published for the opening of the department store at the corner of Hohe Straße and Gürzenichstr. in Cologne.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Casino Seventh Heaven
description:
Casino Seventh Heaven is a set of rules for 7 card games played with most of the same components. The game is designed to be like a trip to the casino where you can choose which games you will play, and you take your winnings from one game with you to the next game. The player who has the most money at the end of the trip to the casino wins.

The games include various game mechanisms, such as a poker variant, a roulette type game, and others.

name: Robot Roll & Write
description:
In Robot Roll & Write, each player builds their own robot over the course of twelve turns, adding components to the shell of the body, then connecting them with circuits in order to score points.

At the start of every third turn, lay out five cards on the display in the dice slots 1-5. Each card shows a component or two different circuits; some cards also have a die depicted on them. One card at random has a special token on it. On a turn, each player rolls two six-sided dice, then uses the results of the dice to choose one or two cards and add the components or circuitry to their robot shell. A result of 6 always lets you choose any card, but if a card has a second die depicted on it then you need both that die result and a 6 (or the designated die slot 1-5).

name: Offensive le jeu
description:
Offensive le Jeu is a simple and effective educational tool to explain military operations up to the brigade level. It is particularly interesting for officer or student training. Generic in nature, it allows a wide range of player-generated scenarios, can be played on a 1:50'000 military map and can be easily house-ruled.

Each side starts with a set of forces and special units, as well as a hand of event and asset cards. The scale of the units' movement on the square grid is realistic, as well as their spotting range and firepower. The games teaches combined arms on the higher tactical level, while allowing for a skillful combination of obstacles, mines, demonstrations and paramilitary groups - the game conveys the idea of a hybrid engagement.

The use of blocks and the combination with event & asset cards allows for good bluffing strategies. Combat is very simple but introduces unit-specific terrain modifiers which work really well together. A lot of additional "chrome" is left out, but the system works and it is simple enough to be extended with logistical rules, command & control, asymmetric forces, or new characteristics for units.

Victory can either be achieved by the destruction of enemy units or after agreeing to a specific scenario victory condition.

—user summary

As you may have understood, Offensive the game is not a game like the others! It was developed for instruction and then adapted for all audiences! So it has kept some characteristics that make the difference:


The possibility to play on all Swiss topographic maps at 1:50'000 scale.
Rules that adapt to the level of the players to accompany you on the path of knowledge and tactical understanding.
Simple rules so that you can get the hang of it quickly!


Offensive the game is a board game that includes:

A basic game board;
66 units to command;
Offensive cards to influence the battle;
2 dice to play the confrontations;
2 types of rules according to your level of play (Novice or expert) which are downloadable on the page of the Internet site.


—description from the publisher (Translated)

Vous l'aurez sans doute compris, Offensive le jeu n'est pas un jeu comme les autres! Il a été développé pour l'instruction est adapté ensuite pour tous les publics! Alors il a gardé certaines caractéristiques qui font la différence:

​* La possibilité de jouer sur toutes les cartes topographiques suisses à l'échelle 1:50'000.

Des règles qui s'adaptent au niveau des joueurs pour vous accompagner sur le chemin de la connaissance et de la compréhension tactique.
Des règles simples afin de pouvoir le prendre en main rapidement!


Offensive le jeu est donc un jeu de société qui comprend:

Un plateau de jeu de base;
66 unités à commander;
Des cartes Offensive pour influencer la bataille;
2 dés pour jouer les affrontements;
2 types de règles suivant votre niveau de jeu (Novice ou expert) qui sont téléchargeables sur la page du site internet.


—description from the publisher (French)

name: Impetus: No one gets left behind
description:
Rescue the Little Mushrooms from the Evil Stain, guide them through the darkness but be careful with your orders, they can be misinterpreted.

Impetus: No one gets left behind is a solo game where the player needs to program the directions he wants to give, using the cards in their hand.

In your turn: You will place the cards in your hand on a "Orders Row" using the color or shape of the card, so the corresponding character moves to the nearest shape or color; but be careful, the mushroom have the same colors as the cave and they could move into the wrong direction. Also, you are not alone in the darkness...

The Evil Stain will use the card you left in your hand to place their traps on those colors and/or shapes in the cave making your mission more difficult. Also, it will move a step closer to you every turn.

A game for the puzzle lovers, it creates an unique problem each turn that must be resolve the most effective way, in order to save the little mushrooms and win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Programmed Movement

name: Auf Sendung!
description: Be the boss of a TV station yourself - it's possible! With the game "Auf Sendung!" Here, pupils can create the programme of a public and a private broadcaster themselves and learn what they have to pay attention to.

name: Das Sternenspiel
description: Each player starts with 2 spaceships at the yellow line. Movement is forward or sideways, never backwards, to the next ring (filled or empty). Each constellation has two filled rings. Whenever a player first occupies these two filled rings in a constellation, he gets points awarded. If other players do so at a later time they get no points. The game ends when all players have rounded the game board and are back at the yellow line. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 11
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine transports you to the blistering, hard-hitting BattleMech conflicts that ravage the war-torn future of the 31st century and beyond!

In this issue, you’ll sign up for a notorious mercenary unit and fight through your first day on the job. You’ll jockey to be first across the finish line in a hovertank race fraught with danger. You’ll chase the glory days of a once-noted BattleMech manufacturer in a quest to reinvigorate a declining enterprise and secure your birthright. Will you defeat your demons from the Battle of Tukayyid during battle with would-be conquerors? Will you escape from murderous cartel members, or succumb to the elements in the unrelenting, sun-beaten desert?

Load your chamber with technical articles, a Northwind Highlanders unit digest, a MechWarrior’s catalog of cockpit must-haves, a snow-filled RPG adventure, a BattleForce scenario, and more—all by BattleTech veterans and new enlistees:
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Pseudotech – Arcade Operations: Urbanfest
description:
Thank you for purchasing our latest expansion pack for the award-winning Arcade Operations system: UrbanFest! As you wait for your system to install this new, exciting, downloadable content, please take a few moments to review our updated Terms of Service… [Click!] Are you sure you want to skip the ToS? [Click!] Are you really sure you want to skip— [Click!Click!Click!] Okay, if you insist…but don’t say we didn’t give you a chance… Welcome back to the combat-enhancing extravaganza of madness that is PseudoTech: Arcade Operations! And prepare yourselves for a real treat with this, our first (and only?) expansion to the game catalog meant to spice up your BattleTech games in a variety of new (and, frankly, ridiculous) ways: UrbanFest! Feel the power and excitement that can only come from thirty tons of slow-moving metal, and limited firepower! Thrill to the tales of heroism and adventure that only the most unassuming of BattleMechs can deliver. Anyone can be a champion in a Marauder or a Turkina! But if you really want to know the meaning of challenge, try to forge a glorious career from the cockpit of the infamous UrbanMech!

UrbanFest! expands on the playability of the sim-game rules first introduced in PseudoTech: Arcade Operations, with new features ranging from the amazing Urbify! power-up, to all new medal-worthy achievements, and a host of new scenario types with which to earn them! Even better yet, this expansion introduces new UrbanMech variants and never-before-seen technologies bound to raise an eyebrow or two both on and off the arena circuit! So, park your favorite standby in the garage, don your neurohelmet, and climb into the giant trashcan-’Mech of your choice; it’s time to show the Inner Sphere that size (and speed, and firepower, and armor, and fully actuated arms) isn’t everything!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: True Zero!
description:
A hand-building game where players try to get as close to 10 or -10 as possible without going beyond. However, if any player reaches exactly either score, someone else can swipe the victory with a score of exactly 0.

On your turn, you can either play a card and draw a card to improve your hand, or you may call, letting everyone else know that the pressure is on them to finish up. The game can be finished in less than 5 minutes, making it great on the go, and as a warm-up on game night.

Several variations are mentioned in the rules to let you customize the game to your need.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Number, Party Game

name: Eine Reise durch Freundesland
description: The journey starts and ends in east Berlin (GDR). The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The last player to return to Berlin wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Die Sonne
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to find the sun wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Verkehrs-Würfelspiel
description: The players, as Rolli, Flitzi and Schnapp, take turns to roll and move. They have to move from the three starting spaces (pedestrian, bicyclist, car driver) to the lake and back to their "Ziel" space, while minding the traffic rules. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players. The first player to arrive back at their "Ziel" space wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Tankfix deckt die Karten auf ...
description:
There are three triplets of cards. Each player gets three cards and three cards constitute the talon. Then each player takes a card from the talon and puts a card under the talon. The first player to get a triplet wins the game.

The game was published about 1956.

name: Moto Cross
description:
Moto Cross is an old racing dice game by Piatnik, presumably published in Austria in the 1960s or 1970s.

Players roll dice to go forward. If you stop on a yellow flag, special good or bad events happen, either slowing you down or giving you some extra steps forward. The first player to complete two rounds on the board wins the game.

The board has nice artwork, and the motor bike miniatures are made from metal and painted.

The box contains:

the game board
six motor bikes
two dice


(rules are printed on the inside of the box cover)

Except for the rules, the game is language independent.

name: Pocket Golf Party
description: Match-play golf simulation game, playing item, prank and caddie cards, rolling club dice to solve the direction.

name: Zwergendorf: Dominiques magisches Portal
description:
1 promo card

Draw a magic portal to ESSEN at the beginning of the game, you get points for dwarves in the queue.

name: SHOOT-A-LOOP
description:
SHOOT-A-LOOP is a marble-shooting, point-scoring, dexterity game for any number of players. There are many ways to play, but all involve loading a marble or marbles onto the loop-track and launching them into scoring positions by pulling back and releasing a spring.

Original box included:
Tin loop-track with integrated scoring tray and launch spring
6 glass marbles in different colors
Packing slip
Instructions printed on box

The box reads:

DIRECTIONS FOR PLAYING No. 59 SHOOT-A-LOOP

Place all marbles in the track at the lowest point. The marbles are propelled forward by pulling button found on the end of flat spring, away from the upright and allowing it to spring back with a snap. After doing this a few times, the player can judge what force is necessary to shoot the marbles into the scoring tray. Scores are plainly marked beside each hole in the tray.

In most cases, players will have their own ideas about method of play and scoring, but we find the following to game very interesting. Players will have to use their own ideas in deciding who is to play first, second, etc. One player continues to shoot until all marbles are in the scoring tray.
