The total score for this player is then taken and the next player takes his turn. This continues until one of the players has accumulated a total count of one thousand or over. He or she is the winner.

MADE BY
WOLVERINE SUPPLY & MFG. CO.
N. S. PITTSBURGH, PA.

name: Alien Siege
description:
Alien Siege allows you to take part in the Marines’ first encounter with the Aliens, in the chamber under the reactor. It is based in Aliens, the 1986 science fiction/horror film.

The game may be played by one or more people. The player (or players) run the squad of 9 Marines; the Aliens pretty much run themselves, following an easy set of rules.

The game ends when all the Marines have left the room through the doorway at the north end of the Map, or have been dragged off by the Aliens.

This game is a simplified form of the standard Leading Edge system. Used, for example, in Phoenix Command.

The authorship of the game is not indicated, only the © of Leading Edge Games is mentioned, but quite possibly the authors are Barry Nakazono and David McKenzie, designers also of Phoenix Command and Aliens.

Was included in Gateways Magazine #10.
categories: Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Krimi total Fall 16: Das Feuer der Diamanten
description:
General info on Krimi Total:

Murder mystery game in which players act out their role and try to solve the mystery.

Info on this particular case (in German):

Es ist ein wunderschöner Tag. In einer kleinen Stadt, irgendwo in der Nähe von Moskau, gibt heute Viktor Lasarew, Russlands mächtigster Diamantenbaron, die Hand seiner Tochter dem ätherisch schönen Sohn seines indischen Geschäftspartners.

Der Festsaal auf dem Anwesen der Lasarews erstrahlt in all seiner Pracht. Prunkvolle Kronleuchter, goldbesetztes Geschirr und mit Diamantsplittern versehene Tischdekoration warten auf das Eintreffen der Hochzeitsgäste. Alles ist für die Hochzeit des Jahres vorbereitet.

Doch der Bräutigam wird seine bezaubernde Braut nicht mehr in ihrem Hochzeitskleid sehen! Soeben wurde sein Leichnam gefunden ...

name: Maquis. El juego de cartas
description:
Spain, 1946 Francoismis ruling the country.

After the failure of the Operation Reconquest of Spain, the democratic resistance has escaped to the mountains. The sierra has become a dangerous refuge. The fog isolates an outpost of the Rural Guard and forces to stop a military operation against the "maquis" resistance.

The officer has been found dead with a telegram in his hand. Before communications were cut off, the city reported that various guerrillas had infiltrated the corps...

Card game with 10 role cards and 66 game cards. Similar to Bang! and The werewolves of Castronegro.

name: Hesperidae
description:
Hesperidae is a card game that you can carry anywhere in your pocket and that will help you learn Canarian history in an entertaining way with games of about 15 minutes. The 54 cards that form part of the game represents some of the most outstanding events in Canarian society, culture and politics. But don't worry, because you don't need any prior knowledge about the Canary Islands, you just want to have a good time thanks to its history and culture.

Players will play cards over the table to reach circle at least 4 cards. If it achieved he/she put them like a victory Deck. Then draw another card to his/her hand. Player with more victory poins will win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Cyberrun
description:
Cyberrun throws you right into the action in a technologically advanced city filled with symbiotic alien organisms, cybernetically enhanced humans, and AI powered robots.
A group of mercenaries is hired to take on missions no matter the danger. Without further thought the merciless Brute uses the strength of their four arms to charge right into a mob of out-of-control robots to create a path for the Runner to strike the huge Alien. But the Alien only gets into a raging fit and spits toxic poison on the Runner’s arm. The Medic quickly and efficiently comes to their aid and does everything in their power to save them. One of the robots is about to shoot the Medic but the Hacker intervenes, hijacking the robot’s firewall. Finally the Drone pilot finishes off the mob with heavy artillery robots. Only the giant Alien still stands and charges at the pilot with its powerful claws. The mental attack of the psychic stops the Alien in its tracks, trapping the Alien’s mind in agony. Another mission is accomplished when the last gunshot stops Alien’s screaming. The Runner nods off to the Medic as they return with the Alien’s head in their grasp. What might their employee have in mind with such an obnoxious trophy one might wonder but mercenaries ask no questions.

Cyberrun dives right into the sci-fi experience offering six unique starting classes and offers solo-mode and co-op gameplay for up to four players. Players find new augments and upgrades to optimize and customize characters which can be found after accomplishing missions in turn-based strategy combat style. The mercenaries have to defeat a wide variety of Alien swarms, hordes of robots and hostile human factions using mob action mechanics tracked via app on the cellphone. If players use their items strategically they can cancel the opponents’ move before their turn. The party shares a single health pool, ensuring an exciting adventure for the whole party until the end of an encounter.

Cyberrun’s gameplay is designed to combine the cooperative, exciting sci-fi experience with the fun of rolling a dice console in the shape of a traditional D6 - the unidice. Players choose up to six different item options they can roll during their turn using the unidice like a dice gaming controller and cellphone serves as a display. Mercenaries use Action Points to roll/reroll or use the rolled gear.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: 国のために悪魔と契約したらえらいことになった!! (I made a contract with the devil for the sake of my country, and it turned out to be a big deal!!)
description:
There is a country in a different world where the existence of a "devil" is believed and the leaders of each party gather to hold an "election campaign" to determine the next leader.
The "election campaign" is a 4-week competition in which the party leaders themselves show off their different strengths to determine who is most suitable for the next leader.
However, strength alone will not bring people together. Every week you have to make a new pledge and deliver on it.
At times, it may be necessary to use the forbidden "devil's power". Who will gain the most support from the public and become the next leader?

国のために悪魔と契約したらえらいことになった!! (I made a contract with the devil for the sake of my country, and it turned out to be a big deal!!) is a must follow trick-taker with 3 main suits (financial power, armed power, and intelligence), 1 devil suit, and 1 priest suit. The devil and priest suits can be played at anytime regardless of the must follow rule. The winner is the highest of the lead suit unless a devil suit is played, then the highest devil suit wins. However, if a priest card is played in the same trick as a devil card, then the priest card will win. The winner will gain a crystal. Players are attempting to complete contracts they took at the beginning of the round. You will score based on how well did on your contract. The player most points when one of the end game conditions are triggered wins.

name: SATANIMALS: Annihilation
description:
Annihilator, the world devouring banana slug, is on course for it’s next course: Planet Earth!

Meanwhile cultists are gathering outside your zoo awaiting its very slow arrival. Will your offerings on the Altar appease the world devourer? Will the prophecy reign true and reveal the chosen one?

SATANIMALS: Annihilation includes a physical altar for players to perform a new action, placing offerings. Be the first player to have an offering on the altar at the start of your turn to summon Annihilator! Roll the demonic die at the end of the game to find out how many points Annihilator is worth.

While you're at it, you can now attract Cultists to your petting zoo! Will you sacrifice your Cultists along with your Visitors, or take the risk and hope your Cultist is the chosen one?

-description from designer

name: Wiccats: The Happy Witch Expansion
description:
Adds 18 cards to the original Wiccats card game including:
Characters (Happy Cat, Happy Dog, Happy Unicorn, Happy Ghost)
Items (8 additional components)
Spells (Friendship, Party)
Aura Card (Happiness)
OOPS! Card (Flattened)
Wild Cards (Souvenir, Cake)

A fun crossover from the Happy Animals card game bringing in 4 cute Happy Animal characters to join in on the fun.

Wild cards add a new way to play! For your turn, you can put a wild card into play like an item card. When you play it, you pick one of the item types listed on the Wild card description. That card then counts as the item type you picked as long as it's in play.

-description from publisher

name: Roll Out: Live or Die
description:
Roll out - Live or Die! takes place in a world dominated by zombies. Humans have become nothing but mere scavengers that loot malls, police stations and many other locations that have long been abandoned - by the living. Around every corner the wary scavengers take turns taking every useful item they can find - until they get surprised by the undead rising in front of them.

Roll Out - Live or Die! is a simple dice survival game which can be played with 1-6 scavengers in Team or Individual Mode, trying to collect the highest amount of rations. They roll different locations either containing rations to score points or weapons, ammo and med kits to survive. Every scavenger can pick a location with item rewards to loot and can search until they find the item - or get bitten. Those who survive the encounter will get to live until their to loot another location in the dreary world of the undead. The goal? Collect the most rations to survive just a little longer in this apocalyptic world.

Roll Out - Live or Die gameplay is all about a quick and fun dice adventure. Watch your scavenger’s fate unfold in the displays of the unidice with every roll. All you need is the undice gaming console in the shape of a D6, the game app and you’re ready to roll out into the world of undead!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: B17 Bomber Defense: A solitaire dice & cardgame
description:
A solitaire dice & card game. Fly bombing missions as the crew of a B17 flying fortress in World War 2.

Can your crew survive long enough to complete their bombing mission and be back in time for supper?! Fight and fend of enemy fighters and get through enemy flak to reach your bombing targets in a pivotal role in World War 2 to aid Allied war effort.

—description from the designer

Official link to game
https://thekealf.itch.io/b17-bomber-defense-a-solitaire-dice...
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Die Icon Resolution

name: Tiny Ninjas: Tournament
description:
Tiny Ninjas: Tournament is a collection of challenging dexterity mini games for 1-4 players.
Played right inside of the Game Box, Tiny Ninjas: Tournament is immensely portable and takes up very little space.
An entire tournament system the size of a book. Take it with you anywhere you go and play on virtually any surface.
Rules and scoring for each game are incredibly simple and can be learned in seconds.
To master these games however will take a keen eye and a steady hand.
Gameplay is lightning-fast and very addicting.
Score more points and reach new heights - become the Ninja Champion!

name: Tiny Ninjas: Puzzle Battle
description:
Building puzzles is one thing, but building them the FASTEST is what really counts!
Tiny Ninjas: Puzzle Battle contains six, 5x7” double-sided puzzles
with gorgeous artwork featuring 12 of your favorite Tiny Ninjas characters.

Each puzzle consists of just 24 pieces - sounds easy right?
Well when you only have a few minutes the dynamic changes dramatically!
Plus with them being double-sided you’ll need to determine both the location for
the piece as well as the correct side to use. #doublethepuzzle

Race against the clock with included sand-timers for 2, 3, and 5 minutes.
With two game modes suitable for all ages and groups.
Select your difficulty, flip the timer, and let the chaos begin!

Score points on which sand timer is used and your largest completed
section as you battle it out to be the puzzle solving champion.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Real-Time, Score-and-Reset Game, Speed Matching

name: Zoo Race
description:
Do you think the pig will take first place?

Some animals are faster than other, but in this game you decide, so everything is possible. At the same time you have to bet on which animals you think will win, and the sooner you bet the bigger the reward.

First and foremost it has to be fun to play, but at the same time give you a simple understanding of probability. In addition there is strategy, bluff and co-operation - so everybody has a chance of winning.

The game is Danish designe and produced in environmentally friendly materials, amongst some incredible good people from the Copenhagen Northwest neighbourhood.

Published in 100 copied in December 2022

Player take turns to roll three dice, choose to re-roll 1-3 of those dice once. Move animals in the lanes rolled. Buy betting cards and chance cards.

Once three animals are in the goal, players will receive income based on the number of betting- and chance-cards that corresponds with the winning (1st trough 3rd) animals.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Race

name: Mythicarium
description:
To begin, players must choose 3 champions to build a deck around them and their classes.

Decks are built of cards representing magical artifacts, weapons and armor, legends of the world, allied creatures, minions, realms, and campaigns. If your strategy is well-planned, these cards will work synergistically and lead you to victory.

Combat is essential to achieve victory. Your champions, allies, and minions will fight under your command against your opponent’s forces. Every time you attack, all unblocked damage points will become victory points.

Each turn has a structure, based in phases. During each phase, you can do certain actions, including playing cards. However, playing them has a cost: you must use experience points. These points are earned every turn from your champions, destroying opposing allies and minions, or completing campaign objectives.

The player who defeats the three opposing champions, or the first to collect 20 victory points, wins the game. A player with no more cards to draw loses the game.​​

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Robot Maze!
description:
Welcome to the future! Welcome to what counts as parole in today's prison system. So, you want out? You're tired of making money for The System through hard labor? Well, if you want out early, you'll have to make up for lost profits by going through the Robot Maze. An event televised to a paid viewing audience where you have to make it out of a maze while being tracked by Robots!

In this PnP game you have an A4 map of a maze printed out. You start out in the middle of the bottom of the maze and have to move through it to one of the two exits at the top corners in order to win. You can move up to one square each turn.

But in the middle of the maze 4 robots await you and move according to the die result that you throw for each robot each turn. When you come into their line of sight, they will move onto your square and you lose. So be sure to plan your movement carefully!

Do you have what it takes to make it out safely?!?
categories: Dice, Maze, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Northwest
description:
Northwest is a 2 to 4-player abstract game where players explore the Pacific Northwest to extract honey, hunt mushrooms, make leaf stamps, and spot the elusive bigfoot.

For a 2 or 3-player game, create a 7x7 exploration board from different light memento cubes. For a 4-player game, set up an 8x8 exploration board from both light and dark memento cubes.

Each turn, the player drafts a memento cube from the main exploration board by moving the shared exploration token onto the cube and adding it to their tableau. The previously captured memento cube sets the next player's available move:


Bees/Honey: next player must move in the L-Shape similar to the Knights from the Chess.
Mushrooms: next player must move into a space in any of the 8 surrounding spaces.
Ferns: next player must move into 1 of 4 orthogonal spaces.
Maples: next player must move into 1 of 4 diagonal spaces.
Bigfoot: next player may move into any space in the same column or row.


In Northwest, your journey is represented by a 4x4 tableau in which you will track memento cubes drafted from the exploration board. Each memento cube scores victory points (VPs) in a unique way. The game ends when a player cannot make a legal move in the exploration board or all players have their personal tableau filled. The player with the most VP wins!

—description from the designer.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Folwark marzeń
description:
Today you dreamed your favorite dream again - the same as always. The cows barely fit in the barn, the hens are laying like crazy, and the ears of grain are bending under their own weight. The weather is fine, so you spend a beautiful afternoon outside polishing the paintwork of your new tractor. A neighbor is standing behind the fence, and the edges of his face are slowly but surely turning green with envy... Eh! Fairy tale!

But wait a minute - why a fairy tale right away? Maybe it's time to roll up your sleeves and make this dream come true? Why not? Grab the pitchfork, prepare a plan and turn your farm into a real "dream farm" - the decoration of the area and the habitat of all abundance!

Sit under a tree, put your hands under your head, roll your eyes around your estates and fat livestock and think with satisfaction "it couldn't have been better developed!" What do you have to do to be able to think like that? Earn the greatest wealth: money, equipment, plants and animals. The richest farmer wins!

—description from the publisher

The game contains of 4 phases: development, fortune, trade and race. In development phase players breed their animals. During fortune phase everyone spins the spinner in order to gain or lose some resources. Next is the trade phase, in which players buy and sell plants and animals. And finally the race phase - players flick their tractor pawns on the back of the box from a side to the stump in order to get a animal/plant token corresponding with their specialization. After 12 rounds (or 6 rounds in short game) the player who gather most points wins. The point are awarded for: tiddlywinks tokens, money, specialization tokens, animal/plant tokens, additional cards, green cards.

—user summary

name: Reload: Tom's Hat Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Tom's Hat
Type: Special Item
Attribute: !
Ability: Modify a 1 (Any Die or Combat Line Die) into any other Rolled Value

name: Kitchen Sabotage
description:
Kitchen Sabotage is a turn-based card/board game with a goal of gaining points by cooking recipes with various ingredients; through the game, though, players can sabotage each others' creations to try to get ahead!

2-8 players ("chefs") can play (or more with expansion pack madness and/or multiple decks). Each chef works in their own kitchen, gathering/assembling ingredients, cooking/baking them just the right amount of time, and serving them to happy (or not-so-happy) customers. Each round progresses through turns in that order (assemble ingredients, cook, and serve). But here's the twist - there is ample opportunity to sabotage each others' ingredients and cooking methods, to turn their fine cuisine into a gross heap of mush and get ahead in the restaurant game!

If you make your food to perfection, you'll be rewarded as such. But if your cooking is off too much thanks to your opponents' sabotaging, you won't be rewarded as much (or maybe even take a penalty). Players tally their earnings and losses at the end to see if anyone made it through the kitchen sabotage with edible food.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Angels: Heralds of War
description:
... God created the Heavens and gave it to the Angels. The Angels live in the Silver City. The Angel Lucifer took issue with God over giving Earth to the humans, and he was exiled from the Silver City. Many, known now as the The Fallen, that agreed with Lucifer, left with him, and the Red City was born. Lucifer schemes to take the Silver City. Now war is on the horizon. The Faithful Angels look to stop the Fallen roaming the Heavenly Realms. These are the Heralds of War.

Welcome to Angels: Heralds of War, a rules-lite skirmish-level war game for 2 players, but a solo mode is also available. This game uses the ZipWarz game system. In the game, one player plays as the Fallen Angels, while the other player plays as the Faithful Angels. Each side has their own goals they are looking to achieve on the battlefield. Each goal earns them Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the 4th round wins the game.

It's a PnP game where you can use your available minis, tokens and dice with the PnP material provided. Included with Angels: Heralds of War are 8 unique armies ready to battle. Each one has special powers and unique Victory Point goals to reach during the game. Each one has a leader and some followers.

Each player has their army and moves their units on the 4x6 battlefield grid. They choose 1-3 units to take 2 actions each round, alternating players after each unit until all units are done. When in the same zone on the grid the units can attack and try to defeat the opponent's units to earn Victory Points.
categories: Dice, Game System, Miniatures, Print & Play, Religious, Wargame

name: Wer bin ich?
description:
Title translates to: Who am I?

This fun children's game encourages communication and imagination at the same time. Each player draws a secret motive card without looking at it. He/she then shows the other players the card. In each round, the players ask the others questions about their picture: Am I a human? A machine? Can I fly? The players have to figure out who they are by asking smart Yes/No-questions. Whenever someone guesses their motive correctly, they get a point. The player who is the first one to gather two points, wins.

name: Black Stories Junior: Ferien Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old.

In this version, which translates to "black stories vacation stories", is designed for vacation time. Whenever the kids are bored while riding the train with the family or stuck in the car on their way to their vacation destination, black stories junior is a great way to pass the time.

100 funny riddles are waiting to be solved.

name: Tenacity
description:
Tenacity is a quasi-real time arithmetic game. Each turn, a player plays a card to a central stack and announces the sum of the cards in the stack - the card they played and the number said by the previous player.

Each player has a face down "target" chip in front of themselves. If the number announced matches a player's target, the player should grab a stone from the middle of the table. Once the other players see someone grab a stone, they all try to grab a stone as well.

The player who is not able to grab a stone takes the cards from the central stack as a penalty.

The game ends when the deck of cards or target chips are exhausted and the person with the most points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Math, Real-time

name: 風変わりな贋作師 (Fūgawarina Gansakushi)
description:
In 風変わりな贋作師, roughly "Eccentric Counterfeiters", players are revealing a card from the deck or taking the last card revealed. If the card revealed by a player matches a card already in a row of revealed cards, they must take all of the cards already present.

The deck consists of many copies of some cards, each worth 1 point, and few copies of other cards, each worth their face value. Players do not want to acquire points.

The deck also contains a few "Double" cards which challenge a player to guess if the next two cards in the deck are the common cards or will their be at least one of the rarer cards.

The game ends once the deck is exhausted and the person with the fewest points wins.

This is a reimplementation of the designer's previous game, Double Picks, and adds rules for playing by teams at player counts 5 and up.

name: Reitturnier
description:
The players take turns to roll the dice to determine if they clear an obstacle, in which time and with or without any mistakes. The results are documented on three indicator discs for each player. When all obstacles are cleared, the player with the best end result wins the game.

There are 3 dice the players can choose from: a slow but safe die (black), a medium die (yellow) and a fast but dangerous die (red).

—user summary

name: Epilogue
description:
A word-building storytelling game about the end, reimagined.

Epilogue is a group storytelling game in which players are attempted to reconstruct their final memories. Using word fragments the tale of everyone's tragic demise is woven co-operatively.

name: Market Share
description:
Market Share is an economic head-to-head game where players take the role of company owners specialising in producing and selling a product in a duopoly setting. Each economic quarter, the companies will hire experts, pick up contracts, and decide on advertising expenditure (that will shape the potential market share) and the amount of product to be produced. The demand, which is uncertain and affected by the outcome of random events, needs to be fulfilled from the current quarter's production but also excess production from previous quarters (inventory), converting potential market share into actual market share. Unfulfilled demand and unfulfilled contacts will lead to reduction of the company’s share value.

The game is played over 8 rounds (8 quarters or 2 years). At the end of the 8th round, each company owner sums up the wealth accumulated during the game (company cash, shares, value of inventory stock). The winner is the player with the most total wealth. However, an early finish is possible. The game may end before the end of the 8th round if one of the two companies has dominated the market or if a company goes bankrupt.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Events, Investment, Market, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stock Holding, Worker Placement

name: Out on a Limb
description: Out on a Limb is an entry-level tile-laying game. On a given turn, each player can either place a tile to grow the branches on the board or claim branches by placing a fairy on the board. At the end of the game players harvest the branches they claimed to see who cultivated the most fruit.

name: Der Meisterfahrer
description:
The players choose a game master (traffic inspector) to monitor the exact observance of all traffic rules during the game. He notes the number of moves drawn and the number of penalties for each player. He manages the till.
One half of the tokens goes into the cashbox, the other half is distributed evenly to the players.
At the start of the game, the traffic signs should now be placed on the empty, white circles. The game master shows the players one sign after the other and the players place them on the appropriate place according to the landscape of the game board. If a player gets it wrong, he pays a token into the till and the next player must now indicate the correct place, etc. If the answer is correct, the player receives a token from the till. If someone violates the same sign the second time, he pays 2 tokens, the third time 3 tokens, etc.
Each player places his figure on his starting space S in the color of his own vehicle (car, truck, racing car or motorbike). Each player has to get to his destination Z (which again has the color of the vehicle). He is free to choose his path.
All players always make a move one after the other. The streets are divided into equal spaces. Each space means one turn at a driving speed of 30 km/h. This is the initial speed for each vehicle. On the second move the vehicle may go to the next higher speed of 60 km/h. Each vehicle may increases its speed by a further 30 km each time it moves up to its specified maximum speed (truck 60km/h, motorbike 90 km/h, car 120 km/h, racing car 150 kn/h). This rule is interrupted immediately if the vehicle comes to a road obstacle, which is indicated by a traffic sign. Such a sign forces the player to drive more slowly or even to stop or turn around.

Whoever gets to their goal Z in the shortest time - i.e. with the fewest moves - and with the fewest penalty points and the most money is the winner. If two players arrive at the same time, the number of penalty points and the money decides. The winner receives half the till as a prize. Only the driver who gets to his destination in 35 moves without making any mistakes, becomes the champion driver. He wins the title and in this case the whole till.

name: Kamigami Battles: Mary Christmas Promo
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Mrs. Claus is promo card # XMASP003

ACT: Each player may search their deck for a Warrior card and put it in their hand.
Act: 2 Energy: Reset your Temple' Energy to 5.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Psycolo
description: A two-player dice-capture game on a 5x5 grid where players roll their dice and capture the opponent's dice with numbers higher than the opponent's. Capture dice leave blocked spaces behind. If a player captures all five of their opponent's dice, they win.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement
publishers: KUDARANAIMONO factory (くだらないもの工房)

name: Multi Level Mania
description:
Multi Level Mania is a game where you join a multi-level marketing company (totally different from a pyramid scheme, we swear!) and hustle your way to the top by pitching the products or the company to character cards. The goal of the game is to make $10,000 before the Cubicle Troll (an NPC with a regular paycheck) and before all the other players.

The game can be played by 2-6 players and takes between 1-2 hours.

Each round consists of four phases: the Hustle phase, the Payday phase, the Restock phase, and the Event phase:

During the Hustle phase, players choose character cards and roll a die to either try to sell product to that character, or to recruit that character as a downline.

During the Payday phase, each player gets paid money according to the number and type of downlines they have - and the Cubicle Troll gets their paycheck.

Next comes to Restock phase, when all players must buy at least the minimum required inventory to maintain membership in their chosen MLM - don't worry, you can take out credit cards if you need to!

Finally, during the event phase, each player selects an event card that can either help or hurt their chances of success. Then it's time for a new round with another Hustle phase!

This game allows for some sabotage of other players by stealing or alienating their downlines, and all players have the opportunity to spend money to make money - just like a real pyramid scheme - I mean, multi-level marketing company!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Automatic Resource Growth, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Loans, Ownership, Stock Holding, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Tales are Real: Menschen vs. Untote
description:
A fantasy dueling card game with easy to learn rules and intuitive game mechanics.

In Tales are Real, two to four player fight with creature cards against each other. Each player has five creatures on the table and can equip them with item cards to make them mir powerful. On every turn, both player choose one of their creatures for battle. The creatures fight against each other and deal damage to each other. The damage depends on the creatures basic strength and equipment. Creature cards has special abilities to avoid or reduce damage. To activate the ability players has to roll the dice.

The goal of Tales are Real is to destroy as many creatures of your opponent as possible. The player who lost the most creature cards within five rounds, loses the game.

name: Etsi ja löydä! Luontoretki
description:
A reimplementation of Muumi viidakkoseikkailu, Coral Reef and Etsi ja löydä Safariseikkailu is a game of fast reactions that has the players flipping two cards and trying to find the animals depicted in the cards from the board as soon as possible.

First player to find both animals scores a point, five points wins the game. Some rounds reward players with looking glass tokens and it's also possible to win the game by collecting two camera tokens.

name: Crazy Chrono
description:
A party game combining reflex and speed.

The cards are in a pile in the middle of the table. On each of them, 2 mathematical operations and 2 words in the center, but also 4 numbers and 4 images on the edge. Only one correct association is possible.
Ex : On a card, you have the word "lion" and a picture of lion. You can also have "24-5" and "19".

You have to be the first to find the right answer to win the card. The winner is the one with the most cards at the end of the stack.

name: Letterkenny Opoly
description:
Welcome to Letterkenny!
Join the hicks, skids, and hockey players and experience all of their problems in the World’s Most Popular game!

Buy a Hockey rink or team, your favorite Modean’s Pub or the Fishing Hole. Build shacks and barns on your properties. Try to avoid “Chorin’!” Find out who is the toughest guy in Letterkenny. Host a bush party, surf the dark web and win “back to back to back ships” in the local hockey championship!

Features special game tokens from the show including a beer bottle, truck, jeep, hockey skate, Shamrock and a German Shepherd dog – plus one mystery token you’ll find inside the box!

—description form the publisher

name: Cross Matc: A Competitive Immunohematology Learning System
description:
In this roll and move game, 2 to 4 players roll a d6 then move their tokens around a triangular board in a clockwise fashion, attempting to land on strategically marked positions where they can draw cards from one of two card decks (Patient's Serum or Laboratory decks). The first player to acquire all 8 units of the different blood types (3 Group O; 3 Group A; 1 Group B and 1 Group AB) from the Blood Bank is the winner.
The Patient's Serum card deck represents different antibodies and are trivia questions related to the antibody. Incorrect responses result in an immediate lost of a Blood Bank card showing a blood group. The Laboratory deck gives "play immediately" cards that either penalizes common errors in technique or rewards good technique. The Blood Bank card deck provide the blood units that the players require to win the game. Players who loss all their blood group cards are immediately eliminated from the game.
Produced and sold by Ortho Diagnostics in 1978 as a learning tool for technicians in immunohematology.

—user summary
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Host Your Own Murder Mystery: Murder in the Dance Hall
description:
It's the 1940s, and one of the judges, Hank Hankinson, is found murdered just prior to the start of the annual Chicago Dance Competition! The dancers and staff of the Talk of the Town Dance Hall must search for clues to bring the killer to justice.

The host and up to 12 friends participate in a thematic murder mystery where everyone plays a role and everyone is a suspect. The game contains two different outcomes.
publishers: Grafix Games Hub, RMS International Ltd.

name: Monopoly: Toronto Edition
description: The game of Monopoly, set in Toronto.

name: Switch
description: In this trivia game, the players will first go through eight randomly chosen categories, earning switch tokens and/or coloured dice. Then they will go through the same eight categories in a final round where correct answers will allow players to take away life points from the other players. Last player standing wins.

name: ア・デイ・イン・ザ・八戸 (A day in the Hachinohe)
description:
ア・デイ・イン・ザ・八戸 (A day in the Hachinohe) is a 'butting' card game (like Hols der Geier) from Japan, themed on a day trip to Hachinohe City in Aomori Prefecture in Japan. Hachinohe is in the far North East of Japan, and all the images in the game were taken by the designer on their trips there.

The game has the players spending the day going around the city, visiting the various tourist attractions and beauty spots. Sometimes they share a ride, sometimes they go alone, which gets them a more valued experience. At the end of the game, players accumulate their score from icons on the scenic cards and on their travel cards.

The main deck of scenic cards is laid out in a tableau of 8 columns, representing the 8 hours spent day tripping, with various scenic cards making each column. Players bid from a hand of 3 travel cards numbered 1 to 5, being the mode of travel: walking, bicycle, bus, train, and taxi. Players that chose a unique mode get to collect more scenic cards, but spend that card. If players spend travel cards too quickly, they could fail to collect anything in the later rounds.

At the end, players compare the icons on the scenic cards and on their travel cards to calculate their score.
user summary

青森県の八戸市での日帰り旅行をテーマにしたバッティングゲームです。ゲームは全部で8ラウンド。それに対して、手札は3枚。一人なら、得点となる八戸カードが取れます。誰かと移動手段が被ると、使った移動カードが得点になるかもしれません。最後、四種あるアイコンのうち二種類をかけて一番得点の高いプレイヤーが一番八戸を満喫したとして勝ちます。
publisher's summary
publishers: シュピールディスオーダー (Spieldisorder)

name: 文字禍ウント (Spell Count)
description:
文字禍ウント (Mojika unto) (Spell count) is an unusual word game from Japan that uses leaflets and flyers which would be thrown away. The game has an A4 plastic file sleeve with a print design (a very common item in Japan). The design has 5 clear windows of different shapes. The players insert an A4 sheet from a pamphlet, catalogue or flyer into the sleeve, and predict which window will show the most characters of one type. For example, which will show the most Katakana characters, or the most numbers. Players with the best or worst guesses score or lose points in the game.
user summary

A4サイズのクリアファイルにチラシを入れ、クリアファイルの枠から見える文字の数を予測して当てる、語彙力やスピードを問わないワードゲームです。
文房具×ボードゲームブランド「BUNGUGAMES」作品。
publisher's summary

name: Smelly Socks
description:
A fun and simple matching game for children aged 2-6. Turn over welly cards to find matching pairs of wellies for your monsters. The first player to fill their board wins!

There are two ways to play this colourful game, for both younger and more advanced players. This means children of all ages can play and enjoy the game together, either as a simple pairs matching or more complex memory game. The patterned welly cards can also be used to encourage children to identify the objects they can see on them.

Featuring an array of colourful character illustrations, the quirky monsters are bound to get children giggling! Why not ask your child to pick their favourite monster?

—description from the publisher

name: ゾンビVSサメVS? (Zombie VS Shark VS?)
description:
ゾンビVSサメVS? (Zombie VS Shark VS?) is a card game from Japan, the third in a series of B-movie themed games. A big brawl battle between B-movie characters, zombies, sharks, aliens, mad scientists, all in unexpected developments.

Each round, players choose a card to play face-down in the brawl. When they are turned up, the highest card should win. But the characters have special powers too, which change events and even cause deaths.

Then, a fresh card is dealt off the deck as an Intruder, who could change the result of the battle again. A chaotic fight with unpredictable results.

手札からカードを伏せて出し一斉に公開します。最も数字の大きい人の勝ちです。2回先取です。
ただしカードには効果があります。カードの数字が変わったり、誰かが死亡したりします。
また、全員の効果を解決した後乱入者が現れます。山札の上のカードを1枚公開し、それが乱入者となります。
乱入者の効果を解決します。結末は予測不能です。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies

name: Car Wars: Road Sections (道路セクション)
description: Car Wars: Road Sections (道路セクション) is an expansion for Car Wars that features 4 straight road sections, 16 curves, 2 on ramps, and 2 intersections, plus familiar features such as oil puddles, smoke bombs, mines, and spikes. Additionally, this expansion includes 124 tokens, such as potholes, 16 barricades in two types and 8 grenades, as well as a booklet containing sample layouts of arenas/circuits and mini-scenarios.

name: You had one job
description: You only have one job, so don't mess it up! Climb up the corporate ladder by memorizing the fun sound effects and gestures for your task and those of the other players while keeping the rhythm going. If you make three misses, you will be fired. The last worker standing wins the game!

name: Hello World Bingo Game
description:
Learn how to say “hello” in over 50 languages with this brightly coloured bingo game!

Discover an array of global greetings, from the familiar to the unusual, and test your linguistic abilities as you play the fast-moving and beautifully illustrated Hello World Bingo.

A perfect family game for up to 9 players.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Crosschecking
description:
Crosschecking is the most rough boardgame ever. In every championship you play, you can face up friends and foes through the exciting experience of a hockey match full of unexpected events. The only thing that matters is the Prestigio Cup.

Use your sense of position and your strategic skills to leverage the right cards and sink your opponents. Build up the final roster and win the league.
Your team will consist of one Captain, one Goalie, and four skaters. Bear attention to the skills of your team members, they could be the difference between win and defeat.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports

name: お嬢様人狼 (Ojousama Jinrou)
description:
お嬢様人狼 (Ojousama Jinrou) is a Werewolf style hidden identity game from Japan.

The players are young ladies at a young lady's school. They learn that a Kansai man has been reincarnated and slipped into their noble tea party. Each player aims to find the old man while role-playing as the young lady according to the Lady card and Attribute card they have been dealt.

During the tea party, the players arrange their discussion to try to expose (or conceal) the hidden old man. When the tea party ends, a vote is held, and if the old man is banished, the young ladies win.

Each Lady has a particular role-play attribute (their personality), and it is necessary to role-play accordingly.
user summary

「お嬢様」たちの中に紛れ込んだ「関西人のおっさん」を見つけ出す招待隠匿系バカゲー。
プレイヤーはお嬢様学園のお嬢様として、高貴なお茶会に紛れ込んだ、転生してお嬢様になって紛れ込んでいる関西人のおっさんを見つけ出す人狼風パーティーゲームです。
各プレイヤーは、手元に配られた「お嬢様カード」と「属性カード」に従って、お嬢様のロールプレイをしながら、「おっさん」を見つけ出すことを目指します。
お茶会（議論）ののちに投票を行い、おっさんを追放したらお嬢様たちの勝利です。
それぞれの「お嬢様」はロールプレイ上の属性（個性）があり、それに従ってロールプレイする必要があります。
mechanics: Acting, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: 妄想リストランテ (Delusion Restaurante)
description:
妄想リストランテ (Mousou Risutorante) (Delusion Restaurante) is a party game from Japan. Players are part of an editorial meeting for the gourmet magazine 'Delusion Restaurante'. The editor wants to know the next eatery to be featured in the magazine. You have to come up with a new restaurant on the spot and pitch it to the editor.

The game has decks of cards, some with names that can be combined to form a new restaurant, some with special themes for a restaurant. Players are dealt some cards and then think up how the restaurant would be. What is it called? What food does it serve? Who are the clientele?

Each player then has time to pitch their discovery to the meeting. Once everybody has made their pitch, they all choose their favourite simultaneously. The one chosen by the most players goes into the feature and the player gets a Delusion star. Most stars wins after three rounds.

手札の店名カードを並べてお題にぴったりなお店の名前を妄想する、グルメ系大喜利パーティーゲーム。妄想した店舗名を順に紹介し、グルメ雑誌の編集部になりきってお店の名前やどんな特徴があるのかをプレゼンします。すべてのお店を紹介し終えたら、お題にぴったりなお店を選んで、グルメ企画に載せる店を決めます。全員で一斉に特集したいと思うお店を指差しましょう。投票数の一番多かったプレイヤーは妄想スターを１つもらえます。1~5を３回繰り返して、最もスター獲得が多かったプレイヤーの勝利です。
user summary

name: Curling Dice!: Just 10
description:
Curling Dice!: Just 10 is a two-player dice action game inspired by the Finnish sport [gamedid=186279 Molkky].

Players take turns flipping dice onto the board scoring points by knocking down monsters. The player that scores exactly 10 points from this wins!

The designer has produced other games under the 'Curling Dice' brand, each with different modulations.

user summary

name: Da ist Der Wurm Drin: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Each player gets a worm head and place the worm heads next to one another at the same level.
Each player takes 3 worm sections cards in his hand. Then place 6 worm section cards in the middle of the table and the remaining cards form the face-down draw pile.
On his turn, each player puts a card from your hand face down next to the 6 cards in the middle of the table. After that, takes a different card from there, reveal it and add it as a worm section to your worm.
When all players have added their ninth worm section, the game ends. The player who has the longest worm wins.

name: Borix
description:
Borix is a game that takes place in a small village haunted by werewolves. Each player is secretly assigned a role: Wolf, Gofrix, Fairy, etc
A narrator is needed as well, the Moon player covers this role.
The game alternates between the night and day phases. During the night the wolves kill a Gofrix. During the day the players still alive will deliberate and vote to get rid of the player they think is a wolf.
This is a social deduction game, either the wolves win by eating all Gofrix or the Gofrix win by getting rid of the wolves.



En el reino de Borix suuceden asesinatos espontáneos cada noche, los Gofrix tienen sus poblados en los cuales intentan resolver día con día queines son los causantes de estos sucesos, antes que los hombres los erradiquen por completo, desafortunadamente estos se reproducen rápidamente y podrían dominar la localidad hasta extenderse a todo el reino.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Voting

name: Humanoides: Trendy invasion
description:
A million likes, comics, magic dice and an android invasion in the classrooms that will have to be stopped?

To win more likes on the interactive platform of the new trendy series "PUNCH and KiSS" you have to look like the main characters.

But this obsessive quest for popularity has gotten out of hand for most of the students and they have become a kind of zombie-humanoids with catastrophic consequences: they behave according to the dictates and models of fiction and harass anyone who still retains their difference?

Will you manage to give them back their humanity with the help of magic dice and restore coexistence in the classroom, before the platform reaches 1,000,000 likes and the mutation becomes irreversible?

4 WAYS TO PLAY!

STOP android bullying!
The value of being different!
The social network ("I like you").
The "Squid Command" against android invasion

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un millón de likes, cómics, dados mágicos y una Invasión androide en las aulas que habrá que detener...

Para ganar más likes en la plataforma interactiva de la nueva serie de moda “PUNCH and KiSS” hay que parecerse a sus personajes protagonistas.

Pero esta búsqueda obsesiva de popularidad se le ha ido de las manos a la mayoría de estudiantes y se han convertido en una especie de zombis-humanoides con consecuencias catastróficas: se comportan según los dictados y modelos de la ficción y acosan a quien todavía conserva su diferencia...

¿Lograréis devolverles su humanidad con la ayuda de los dados mágicos y recuperar la convivencia en las aulas, antes que la plataforma alcance 1.000.000 de likes y la mutación sea irreversible?

¡4 FORMAS DE JUEGO!

¡STOP acoso androide!
¡El valor de ser diferentes!
La red social (“I like you”)
“El Comando Calamar" contra la invasión androide

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Las Aventuras de Tueli: Creaventuras
description:
Las Aventuras de Tueli is an award-winning and critically acclaimed trilogy of children's literature made by a teacher that wanted to create exercises, so his student could prove their reading comprehension. Now you will have the opportunity to create your own adventures by playing this fast-paced card game with the whole family.

Each turn, players can play up to three cards from their hands, to earn adventure points,send threats to the other players, or use cards with special effects.

The winner is the first player who gets to 25 adventure points.

—description from the designer

name: Completion
description:
Completion is a complete-the-quote Bible game with three suggested playstyles. The box even suggests using the game cards to put on a Church Pageant play.

The first playstyle involves one player reading the prompt cards aloud to a group of players. In this version, the player who correctly completes the Bible quote receives the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

The second playstyle involves one player reading the prompt cards and two teams of players competing much like a team spelling bee. The player reading the cards will read to one team, and that team will continue to be asked prompt cards until a teammate misses the answer. After giving an incorrect answer, that player drops out of play, and the reader begins reading to the other team. This continues until only one team remains or the cards are all read. The team with the most players remaining wins.

Another playstyle involves all the cards being distributed equally to players. Players go around clockwise asking the player to their left to finish the quote. If someone answers correctly, they receive the card. If someone fails to answer correctly, the asker is allowed to steal a card from them. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

—user summary

name: オルターネオ (ALTER-NEO)
description:
オルターネオ (ALTER-NEO) is a card game from Japan, revised from an earlier game called Alter. The publisher notes the new game has better card production, which you cannot see through.

In this new game, the players try to affect the future of the round, and achieve bonus scores or an outright win. The game rules are for four players, with variants for two or three.

Each player gets a Pick card in their colour, and an aide showing the various Bonus point combinations they can win.

The game has a deck of 16 scoring cards numbered 0-3. Players will try to pick a score card each round, but risk being bumped on to the next card. A dealer is selected (the player who has recently altered the future). The dealer shuffles the draw deck, and turns up four cards so all can see. These are then shuffled and placed randomly face-down around the draw deck. The dealer placers their Pick card on one at random.

The players take turns going clockwise. They can either Watch - look at an uncovered card and if they wish, place their Pick on a card they have Watched - or they can Change - place their Pick on a covered card, which bumps that player's Pick onto the next card, and so on.

The player who goes last gets to Watch the remaining uncovered card if they want, and can place their Pick card there or choose to Change, and place on a covered card, and force the other Pick cards to move on.

Once the four Pick cards are down, the players collect their Score cards and Pick cards, and begin a new round by passing the Dealer to the next player.

Players try to accumulate four Score cards that will trigger various Bonus points at the game end. Players can check the value of their Score cards at any time.

When the deck is exhausted and all score cards collected, players total up the base points on their Score cards, and any Bonuses. For example, by collecting 0011, or 1111, a player gets 5 points.

If a player manages to get 0033, they automatically win. otherwise, most points wins.

The game was published in three different coloured plastic boxes, but the contents in each were the same.

English rules are available online.
user summary

name: Miss The Point
description:
Trivia game where teams take turns to preview the possible answers to questions and choose how many points to offer to each team.

Fixed number of round with a closed economy of points on offer.

name: せーの! おやつゲット! (Seno! Oyatsu Get!)
description:
せーの! おやつゲット! (Seno! Oyatsu Get!) is a card game from Japan. Players are taking shares of sweets on the table. But if they cannot divide them up, they get nothing.

Each round, some different sweet cards are dealt face up on the table, and sorted into matching types. Players then simultaneously call out Seno! and touch the group of sweets they want.

If only one player points at a set, they collect all the sweets there. But if multiple players choose the same sweet, they can only be shared out if none are left over.

The game ends when the deck is exhausted and the player with the most sweets wins.
user summary
publishers: Install Games (インストールゲームズ)

name: Proud of You
description: A reimplementation of the Game of the Goose, themed after Peacocks going to a fancy party. The only gameplay-related change is the placement of the hazard spaces: these are shifted around such that it is not possible to land on the go-back-to-start space on the first throw.

name: Nova: Conflict in the last frontier
description:
NOVA is a card-based 4x space strategy game in which players lead rival space civilizations to achieve supremacy in a region of space. To do so, they must employ different strategies.

The game features an original card game system with three decks (military, civilian and diplomatic) that allows players to customize their style of play. The rules cover all the typical aspects of a 4x game: exploration, expansion, colonization, technological advances, diplomacy ... and include a solo game system that is also integrated into multiplayer games.

Although the mechanics are card-based, it has wargame elements and, above all, many ideas that make it unique not only in its genre. The rules for playing solo games are well integrated into the multiplayer scenarios. They are combined in a way that creates a lot of variability within the same scenario.

The scenario system is also elastic, even allowing players to design their own, set in their favorite Sci-Fi universes. This edition provides four solo scenarios (one of which is introductory), one two-player scenario, and a sixth 3 - 4 player scenario.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wer reist mit?
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The journey begins and ends in Berlin. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player back in Berlin wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pattie et la Colère de Poséidon
description:
Pattie et la Colère de Poséidon ("Pattie and the Wrath of Poseidon") is a cooperative game. Together you will try to appease the Wrath of Poseidon by completing 4 missions without being slowed down by the Cyclops! If you manage to free Jason from prison, reprogram Nazar the robot, confront the Hydra and forge the Trident, you win the game. On the other hand, if the Cyclops manage to slow you down and you don't manage to accomplish these 4 missions before you run out of cards, you lose the game.

—description from the designer

name: お前の罪は何色だ！ (Omae no Tsumi ha Naniiro da!)
description:
お前の罪は何色だ！ (Omae no Tsumi ha Naniiro da!) is a card game from Japan, themed on the Seven Deadly Sins. The sins on the cards are colour coded, giving the game title as What Colour Is Your Sin?.

Players are trying to build up colour sets of cards of the Mortal Sins, taking from a tableau or the draw deck, and then pay them down to take the Deadly Sins. When a player has enough Deadly Sins, they win.

But the Mortal and Deadly Sin cards also carry special effects, which make life easier for the player, or harder for the other players. For example, Gluttony or Greed let players draw more cards. Securing the Deadly Sin card Pride means the other players cannot draw from the deck, forcing them to take cards they don't want from the tableau. The sin Wrath reduces their hand limit from 7 to 6 cards.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Game Circle JOKER (ゲームサークルJOKER)

name: お前の罪は何色だ！拡張セット (Omae no Tsumi ha Naniiro da! Expansion Set)
description:
お前の罪は何色だ！拡張セット (Omae no Tsumi ha Naniiro da! Expansion Set) is a small expansion pack for the original game Omae no Tsumi ha Naniiro da! .

The pack has new cards to replace cards in the original, that have upgraded effects to make the game more aggressive and faster. There is new artwork too.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Game Circle JOKER (ゲームサークルJOKER)

name: アオイトリ (Aoitori)
description:
アオイトリ (Aoitori) is a set collecting game from Japan. Aoitori is the Bluebird, and the game is themed on the bluebird of happiness. Players are trying to collect chips showing happy things (Family 4pts or Cake 3pts) and avoid the negative (Death -1pt & War -2pt), and also to get the most Bluebirds too.

The game has a deck of cards, showing a birdcage on one face, and on the other, either a bluebird or a blank space. The deck is shuffled, and groups of six cards are dealt face-down to form birdcages, one cage for each player.

Then the chips are shuffled face-down and one chip put on each card. These are turned face-up.

Players take turns taking a chip of their choice from a cage, and then turning the card over to reveal either a bluebird or a blank space.

If a birdcage has at least one card turned over, a player can take the whole birdcage home, but this puts them out of the round.

Once each player has taken a birdcage (the set of six cards), the round is scored. Players get points for having the majority in each type of chip (lose points for the negative chips), and for having got bluebirds.

After playing some rounds, the player with the most points wins.
user summary
publishers: Install Games (インストールゲームズ)

name: ドラ猫 (Doraneko)
description:
ドラ猫 (Doraneko) is a deck-building game from Japan, where herds of cats explore an island. Players draft cards into their hand and then play them to expand the map of the island. The cards have effects or themes, which the players try to complete to earn treasures.

When adding cards to the map, they must follow the rules, connecting roads, and always keep a connection to their cat on the road. But they can choose whether to increase the number of cats in the herd, or aim for better road cards. At the end of the game, players score for the number of cats on the island.

The deck has over 100 cards to explore and was designed by a champion Dominion player.
user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Harklaad
description:
Harklaad is an area control game in which the areas are also action spaces of a rondel.

In this game, you summon fluffy hluups and cast various spells, in order to control islands full of gems.
What’s unique about the game is that your actions are decided by your opponent, and you decide theirs.
Also, the value of each island for you is secretly decided by your opponent (and vice versa).
So be careful not to try too hard to control worthless islands!

◆Features
Rondel Control: Spaces of rondels are the areas you try to control.
By using the rondel / areas, you not only select an action, but also which area to execute it.

Double Modular Rondels: The actions on each area / rondel space is different for each player. This is represented as 2 separate player-rondels.
Actions (= spell tiles) on each rondel goes to the opposite rondel after casting them. (I.e. the action spaces move back and forth between 2 rondels).

Mutual Action Selection: You choose your opponent’s spells, and they choose yours.

Secret Value of Areas (deduction and bluff): The value of each area is different for each player. You decide the value for your opponent, and they decide that for you

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Rondel, Secret Unit Deployment, Sudden Death Ending

name: Big Pootential
description:
Big Pootential is a game all about who can brew up the biggest poo. Players take it in turns to draw food and drink cards from the pile, each card has a Pootential Factor which will increase the size of your poo. Beware however of traps your opponents may enforce upon you. Cards like 'laxative' will reduce your likely hood of winning with the largest poo. The end of the game is when you pick up a Release card, this ends your game whilst others can continue to grow their poo.

In the end, the largest poo emerges as the victor!

name: ハカリウリ屋さん (Hakariuriyasan)
description:
ハカリウリ屋さん (Hakariuriyasan) is a push-your-luck game from Japan. Players are acting as shopkeepers, trying to get the customers order up to 99 grams and no more. Players take turns adding small items to a digital scale, with the player going over-weight taking a penalty. The most accuarte shopkeeper is the winner.
user summary

name: ラビット・イン・ユー (Rabbit in you)
description:
ラビット・イン・ユー (Rabbit in you) is a social deduction party game from Japan. Players take turns with topics, and consider how much they like something on the topic. They choose a rabbit card in secret that is numbered 1 to 5. The other players take turns asking one question each, to deduce how the person feels. Then they vote using their fingers to show which card was chosen, 1 to 5.

The players who got it right score points, but if all the players guessed right, the leader gets no points. The most points wins, but the game is aiming to introduce people socially rather than be the highest score.
user summary

name: 俺の鍋 (Ore no nabe)
description:
俺の鍋 (Ore no nabe) is a card game from japan, with players putting together special meals. Nabe is the Japanese version of a hotpot, so the game is My Hotpot.

Each player is dealt a Nabe card and a Dashi card (Dashi being the base stock used in much cooking in Japan.) Players then start drawing ingredient cards and try to form a new dish.

The Nabe has a certain capacity shown by icons, and the dashi has certain characteristics that must be matched. Players need to combine new ingredients that fit the Dashi, but do not go bust on the Nabe card.

Once everyone has formed their new recipt, they are all turned up to be inspected. Players discuss what a meal might be like. The meal with the largest gap left in the Nabe is eliminated (the chef didn't try to fulfil the meal). Then there is a voting round to select the best recipe. The recipe most most attractive wins, and players try another round.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Voting

name: 皆の鍋 (Mina no Nabe)
description:
皆の鍋 (Mina no Nabe) is an expansion set for Ore no Nabe, and adds 40 new cards to the game, and a dark hotpot for stranger recipes.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Voting

name: ヒポカンコール (Hipocan CALL)
description:
ヒポカンコール (Hipocan CALL) is a push-your-luck memory game from Japan.

The game has a deck of cards with a white side and a black side. Each side has an image of some animal and a number, one or two digits. Some cards are dealt up to the table.

A player declares a target they will reach and start by selecting the first card, and then turning it over and adding the value together. They can choose whether to go on or stop there. If they go on, they add the next card and its flipside too. If they go bust, they are out of the round.

If the player chooses to stop, another player can decide they will continue the run, at the risk of going bust. The last player standing wins.

The game relies on a certain amount of memory of the values on the flipsides of the cards, by tying the numbers to the animals in the players' minds.
user summary
mechanics: Memory, Predictive Bid, Push Your Luck

name: Bloox
description:
Bloox is a two-player trick-taking game in which cards in your hands has no colors, until you paint them by playing them.
Unlike many other trick-takers, or card games with extra board elements, Bloox is a full board game in which you play cards directly on the board and their positions decide who wins.
The game features unique “you must sandwich” system, which gives this “every card is wild” game a robust structure, and allows you to pull off clever tricks.

Other unique features, such as double-edged sword win-con, unfinished cards, harmony cards, value of colors, are explained in the official page.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Investment, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending, Trick-taking

name: シルとり (Shirutori)
description:
シルとり (Shirutori) is a communication game from Japan. The game has a deck of tiles showing silhouettes of various objects or ideas, or showing numbers or colours and so on.

Three tiles are dealt out and a player must come up with a good idea or word or sound that combines the three things shown. The other players vote on whether it is successful or not.

Players then go further and try to establish more elaborate ideas. For example, instead of just saying bag, or shopping bag, can you show it says Louis Vuitton bag?

The player getting the most votes by the end is the winner.
user summary

name: 魔導士のエレコレ (Wizard's Element Collection)
description:
魔導士のエレコレ (Wizard's Element Collection) is a roll and move, set collection game from Japan. Wizards move around the edge of the Elemental field, and try to capture elements to make even pairs.

The game has a deck of 68 Elements in 12 different types (such as Heart, Wind, Earth, Brass...). These are shuffled and a 3x3 grid is dealt out. A set of 16 Mass discs are placed around the grid, in line with all the rows, columns and diagonals. The players move their wizards around the discs using dice rolls, and point along the line they want to collect from.

Where wizards want to take the same card from the grid, the priority is based on the Mass disc they stand on. But the Elements carry special effects, and cards already taken by a Wizard can be used to strengthen their priority.

Wizards are trying to build an even collection to gain positive scores. Odd sets will lose points.

As cards are taken from the grid, they are replaced until the deck is exhausted. The wizard with the highest score is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Creep in Silent
description:
Attack and sink enemy submarines. If the opponent's submarine is in the square you indicated to attack, you successfully attack and win this game.

This is a game in which you move your submarine using the six cards in your hand. Movement is done by placing three cards vertically, horizontally, or at different depths.
The position of the enemy submarine is estimated by the cards placed by the opponent and sonar cards.
Attack the enemy submarine with bomb, missile and torpedo attack cards. If the position and depth of the enemy submarine are within the attack range, the submarine can be sunk.
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Measurement Movement, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending

name: Battles in the East 4: Mius River and Vitebsk
description:
Volume 4 features two battles from 1943. Components include a double-sided full-size mounted game board, 440 large counters, a 16-page series rules booklet, and scenario/exclusive rules sheets and displays, plus full-color set-up charts for each scenario, series charts and tables for each player.

—description from the publisher

name: Project Transylvania
description:
The game is set in a medium fantasy, dark themed, medieval world. The aim of the game is to encapsulate local folk stories and take you through an unique journey where you can rediscover old legends as you might know them. The game takes inspiration from some TTRPG games but at its core, it comes with its own set of unique combat rules and creatures that keeps the combat realistic and dynamic. The game can be played around a table with as many people wishing to participate but, I personally advise you to keep it up to a maximum of 5 players for a better immersion. I hope I piqued your interest and that you’ll stick around!

• How is it played?
- Like most TTRPG games, you will need your character sheet that you will compile with the help of the source book where you will find all necessary information about the game mechanics and it will basically teach you how to play the game. Reading through, you will find out the various combat mechanics that are divided in chapters:

STATISTICS:
- There is a list of statistics that you may invest points in and they all boost your character's strength, agility, dexterity, spirit and other. There are 9 statistics in total and some of them have various functions in order to keep the list small and compact.

COMBAT:
- First thing first, you have to know that there are 4 types of damage and each benefits from a said "Main" statistic out of the 4 main ones. For example, there is Slicing Damage on a weapon, it means that your agility will serve as a damage multiplier for that kind of weapon. This will prevent that dexterous rogue to pickup a great sword out of the blue and use it as effectively as a fighter. There is no rule for what you can equip so you can let your imagination run wild with the actual 23 available subclasses, over 120 magical abilities and many many more to come, you can make your own unique character and set it free into the dark ages of mythical Transylvania. You will find a lot more in the source book about bleeding effects, wounds and how they can turn the tide of the combat, a progression chart where each level, your character is allowed x points that you can spend in increasing your statistic's value thus making your character stronger... There is a lot but, let's move on...

PROFESSIONS

Your character can learn professions that will allow them to gain access to certain consumables and more. Professions are meant to bring to the table unique interactions between players that can alter the course of the story drastically, from the Thaumaturgist rogue that can either create poisons or cure them, to the alchemist vedmak who can transmute certain weapon materials, these are all things that as you progress and level up, you will be able to unlock.

MAIN STORY

The game starts you off slowly, with your character not knowing about the existence of the supernatural and then slowly discovering of it's existence, you will find yourself in a situation where you've seen things and experienced but can't share them with other people freely as freedom of speech was not so common back then and being accused of witchcraft was quite common for even the most ridiculous things, a situation where you have to measure your words carefully and having to find a way to survive and make moral choices that will shape the world around you, in other words, you are the story, you make the world shift with your actions.

ENEMIES:

There are all sorts of monsters and beasts, some of them, are inspired off of mythical creatures from local folk stories that I grew up with as a child, like iele or moroi, pricolici and more, but, there are also simple creatures that you can find in the wilds, simple, but very dangerous sience the game tries to achieve a realistical combat feel, so, one can only imagine, if a simple wild animal is that strong, how strong can a werewolf be... or a vampire... Guess you'll find out soon. I just hope that whatever it is you decide to do while playing the game you're having fun!

name: スキットドゥ (Skit Do)
description:
スキットドゥ (Skit Do) is a poker-style 2 player game from Japan. The players select pairs of cards to win, but there are special effects on the cards and set winning conditions too. Of the five tricks played, highest value will win three, lowest will win won, and highest total wins the fifth. These are turned up randomly at the start of each of the five tricks.

The game has a deck of 25 cards numbered 1 to 5 in five colours. This shuffled and players are dealt a hand of 10 cards, plus a zero card. The remaining cards are used as victory points for each trick.

Each player gets an aide showing the different number combos that rank in the game. A combo of 1 and 5 in the same colour is the highest rank, then a run in the same colour, then any pair, then any two in the same colour, then any run, then any two.

At the start of a round, the winning condition and the scoring card are revealed. Players choose two cards to play face-down as their trick. The starting layer can choose to Open or pass. Opening means they force the opponent to reveal a number card, but the effect on that card takes place. If they passed, the opponent can Open or pass. After this, the cards are revealed and the trick resolved.

The winner takes the scoring cards as victory points and the game moves on to the next trick. After five tricks, the player with the most victory points is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: ノンドランカ (Non Drunka)
description:
ノンドランカ (Non Drunka) is a card game from Japan themed on drinking but not getting drunk.

The game has a deck of 49 cards showing sets of seven cocktail cards, seven cards in each set. The front of each card shows the alcohol value of that glass, the back shows the range in the set. So the pink cocktail goes 1,1,2,2,3,4,5 but the red cocktail set goes -2,0,2,4,6,8,10.

Players are dealt some cards face-down and do not look at their drinks. Instead, they select some to hold up in front of themselves, so the other players can see the values. Players then take turns to ask questions about their drinks, until the start player stops asking, after which everyone else gets one more question.

Players must deduce from what they see, and what they learn, which cards to drink and which to discard. They must drink under their limit, which is set by the hand cards they chose not to pick up.

If they finish under their limit, they score points equal to the number of cards held, so being able to drink more glasses but not get drunk scores most. If they go over their limit, they get zero. After player a few rounds, the player with the most points wins, being best at social drinking.

In addition, players may draw and discard during the round, and certain cards also have special effects that apply to the player or to the others.
user summary

name: Drag Racing: All-Time Greats Top Fuel / Funny Car / Pro Stock
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Crack the CodeWord
description:
CRACK THE CODEWORD

A two-player word deduction game using dry erase cards and markers.

RULES:

Each player uses a dry erase marker to write a secret 5-letter word at the top of their card, then encodes their word as follows:

Above each letter, write the row or column where the letter is found (0-9). Below each letter write a single code: V for vowel, C for consonant or the letter’s point value (#). You must encode at least one of each type.

Each player gives their opponent the ten codes to write at the bottom of their cards.

Players then use the codes to crack their opponent’s secret word. They can attempt a maximum of five guesses. The person who guesses first gains one point. Play until one person has guessed five words.

—description from the designer

name: Fraxure: Legends of the Sea
description:
A conflict between the world's most legendary creatures, all controlled by a single deck of cards in your hand!

Each player has their own creature deck, and performs attacks on their opponents by 'scrolling' through their cards. The more powerful cards make you scroll faster through the deck, which is risky, because the instant you pass the dreaded 'Fraxure' card, your creature takes Fraxture damage.
Accumulating 6 Fraxures results in your defeat!!!

The Legends of the Sea boxset includes 4 decks:
Jörmungandr, Charybdis, The Kraken and Umibozu

Fraxure is a fast back-and-forth dueling game, so fast that players are barely in control!
The boxset includes reference, scoring cards and score gems.

—description from the designer

name: ヤミヤミバーガー (Yummy Yami Burger)
description:
ヤミヤミバーガー (Yummy Yami Burger) is a game from Japan themed on constructing hamburgers with unusual ingredients. Will a hamburger taste good with tofu or seaweed?

The game has 50 ingredient cards (strips showing the layers of food). Players must construct their burgers to fit themes, such as a burger that's good with beer, or one that is most healthy.

Players then vote on the most suitable burger to fit the theme. The player winning the most rounds is the winner of the game.

The idea of the game is to stimulate discussion of food and generate surprising new ideas for recipes. The designer suggests, even a joke burger could be a good burger.
user summary

name: 88アイスクリーム (88 Ice Cream)
description:
88アイスクリーム (88 Ice Cream) is a stacking dexterity game from Japan. The logo and package design resembles an American brand that boasts a lot of different flavours. In the game, there are 8 flavours customers want to be scooped onto their cone, represented in a deck of cards that are turned up one by one.

Players take turns to hold the cone (made of folded card) and place a scoop of ice cream on top. The scoops are paper slips that fold out to form a square of four walls. As they build up, the players can turn them about so they stack well. But some flavours are thicker or thinner than others, and after a few scoops, the stack is unsteady.

Each turn, a new card is turned up and the other players pull out the matching slip from the slip and make it square for the player, who takes it and adds it to the top. Then they pass it clockwise to the next player.

Any scoops that fall mean the cards in the order go to the player that dropped them. When the game ends, the player with the fewest cards is the best scooper and wins the game.
