The designer recommends players buy a tub of ice cream before playing, as they will want to eat it when done.
user summary

As each customer

name: こそドロパンケーキ (Kosodoro Pancake)
description:
こそドロパンケーキ (Kosodoro Pancake) is a cute dexterity game from Japan. Players have to grab pancakes from a pile using a knife and fork. There are three pancake monsters asleep on the pile, and they must not be disturbed.

The game has a set of discs showing pancakes with lots of different toppings; honeylemon, macha, chocolate, strawberry and so on. The players make up a random pile of discs no wider than 15cm. Three monster standees are put onto the pile. Players take turns using the small disposable knife and fork supplied in the game to gentle lift a pancake free from the pile, without waking the monsters. If a monster is woken, they eat the pancake instead and the player misses out that turn.

As the game progresses, the more pancakes people collect, then a series of traps come into play. Tokens are turned up which put restrictions on the player. For example, they must get the pancake in under 15 seconds, or they can use one hand only.

At the end of the game, the player with the most pancakes is the winner.

The game is packaged in a glass jar with a metal screwtop lid.
user summary

name: パフェdeフィーバー (Parfait de fever)
description:
パフェdeフィーバー (Parfait de fever) is a set collecting game from Japan. Players are putting together ice cream parfaits for customers. The game has three decks to the make up the bottom, middle and top of the dish. There are customer cards requesting certain dishes to be made. A player takes turns flipping cards to form the parfait to best fit the request.

The parfait cards have 6 colours and three background patterns. If the player can get these matching, they can score bonus points. When the player has turned enough cards, the other players vote on whether the parfait does fit the request from the customer.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points is the winner.
user summary

name: 怪盗レオンの予告状 (Kaito Leon no Yokokujo)
description:
怪盗レオンの予告状 (Kaito Leon no Yokokujo) is a butting game from Japan.

There is a notoriously phantasmagorical jewel thief, Leon. Leon cannot be caught or even identified. This is because Leon is actually several different people. These thieves are trying to steal more jewels for themselves and so send out letters to the other thieves telling them which jewels to leave.

The players have a set of cards numbered 1 to 5 in three colours, red, yellow, blue. They play two cards face-down to the table to decide which jewels they will take. The jewels are in 6 colours, red, yellow, blue and also green, orange and purple. Some gems are drawn at random from a bag and are the jewels Leon is trying to steal.

Players reveal their cards and work out, by combination and value, who gets which gems. So if a player plays two red cards, they will get the red gems. But a red and yellow card means they will get the orange gems.

Where a player has a unique colour combo, they take the gems right away. But where players have the same combo, then the values of the cards determine the winner.

In addition, players have fake letters which can be used to bluff their oponents.

The player with the most gems at the end wins the game as the most successful Leon.
user summary
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Grand Fleet
description:
The cards are printed with representative battleships, aircraft carriers, cruisers, and destroyers of World War II.
In the game, the first player to attack organizes an invasion fleet from a hand of five cards, while the second player organizes a defense fleet from a hand of seven cards.
The first player to attack wins the game when he or she withstands the attack of the defending fleet and succeeds in a direct attack. Otherwise, the player with more victory points gained by sinking the opponent's battle ships wins the game.
Cards are discarded when used for attack, so it is important to organize the invasion fleet efficiently.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: アクマトリツク (Akuma Trick)
description:
アクマトリツク (Akuma Trick) is a shedding / ladder game from Japan. Players are trying to play cards in sequence, but not to actually empty their hand.

The game ends when one player clears their hand, but they cannot win the game. Instead, the winner is the player with the lowest total value of cards still in hand.

In Japanese folklore, Akuma are malevolent demons that afflict humans. In the game, you are possessed by the demons. The game has a deck of cards numbered 0 to 9 (zero is treated as higher than 9), in six colours. The deck is shuffled, and players are dealt a hand (according to the number of players). Players take turns to play cards from their hand to the table in sequence.

A player can place a single card, or a pair of the same value, or a run of numbers in the same colour.

In addition, some cards have special effects, such as the 5 card reverses the direction of play.

When a player cannot play a card at all, the current tableau is discarded and a new one started. But that player must discard cards adding up to a value determined by the tableau.

As the game progresses, players are trying to stay in the round playing cards to the table, but not emptying their hand, but also not keeping their hand value high.
user summary

name: Legit Business
description:
In Legit Business, each player oversees the success of their family business. Legitimate business dealings will bring you prestige and respect, but to keep the cash flowing in, you may have to resort to less respectable means. How much are you willing to risk to come out on top?

Each player will command a syndicate of characters of whom only a select few can represent the family in legitimate business deals. You'll recruit additional associates to handle the shadier side of the operation. These characters will be deployed to different locations in the city to manage finances and cash flow, acquire and sell goods, obtain trucks for transport, recruit new associates and curry favor with City Hall.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Pick-up and Deliver, Resource Queue, Set Collection, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: 魅惑 (?) のスムージー (Miwaku(?) no Smoothie)
description:
魅惑 (?) のスムージー (Miwaku(?) no Smoothie) is a deduction game from Japan. One player is the master of the smoothie shop, the other players are customers. The customers are trying to deduce the ingredients by working out what is not in the smoothie. If the customer gets one of the ingredients correct, the master gets points. If they get it wrong, they score points.

Players ask questions of the master, who cannot lie. But the master does not have to tell the truth. If they can get away with making the customers laugh, that's okay.

The game has a deck of cards and a board showing all the possible ingredients. These range from obvious choices such as fruit, less common ones like avocado, and strange ones like garlic.
user summary

name: Pixel: What Do You See?
description:
Pixel is a fun family & party card game. Pixel is a deck of 50 beautiful picture cards, based on the premise - "A picture is worth a 1000 words". It’s fun, educational, and for the entire family (2-8 players). The pictures are selected to cover a very broad range of topics and every round of the game is guaranteed to be unique. All you have to do is, ask yourself - “What do I see?” 

Pixel can be played in a few variations. Players are expected to come up with a caption by looking at the pictures. This caption could be an object, a country, a person, a colour, or anything that can be connected to the picture. For example - there is a picture in which kids are playing in a beach. One could say - “Sun, Water, Ocean, Atlantic, Barbados, Umbrella, Sand, Holiday, etc.”. The caption/words can be in any language.

Variation 1 :- The objective of the game is to be the first one to spell a word using the pictures. Distribute 4 cards to each player. Each player should find a 3-letter word from one of the pictures and use the other 3 cards to spell it out.
For a 4 letter word, distribute 5 cards (and so on….). Shuffle and deal again. First one to complete is the winner.

Variation 2 :- Someone shouts a common word (e.g: CAT, LOVE, WATER, etc.). Distribute as many cards as the letters in the word to each player. Players have to spell out the word using the pictures. One picture per letter.
For example - if the word was LOVE, one possible answer could be – Lemonade, Orange, Volcano and Exercise.
First one to complete is the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Deal Damage
description:
Deal Damage - the fast-paced, easy-to-learn card game where players compete to deal the most damage to their opponents.

Players 2-5 | Time – 15 to 30 minutes | Cards – (with Rules Cards) 135 and 5 markers. (Kickstarter Exclusive additional 30 event cards)

In Deal Damage, players use cards from their hand to attack other players and reduce their health points. The player with the most damage dealt at the end of the game wins. With simple rules and quick gameplay, Deal Damage is a great way to spend time with family and friends while engaging in strategic and exciting battles.
The game includes over 100+ high-quality cards, featuring simple and clean illustrations. It's small enough to take on the go and easy to set up, making it perfect for game night and parties.

name: Master Parfums: Olfactory Game
description:
This is THE game that shows you what your nose knows! Smell is the fifth sense in humans, and its specificities are surprising. Olfactory memory is a powerful tool, and Proustian moments are there to prove it!

Anne-Laure Hennequin designed this game of trivia about the world of fragrance to share her life-long passion. It has everything going for it. Players wil have fun, deepen their knowledge, stimulate their creativity, and develop their sense of smell.

The olfactory game comes in a full-featured set so you can have fun with family or friends. It contains an educational booklet with detailed explanations, 120 questions about perfume, 40 olfactory challenges, 12 scent pens, and 100 paper blotters to create pleasing fragrance sketches.

To win the game and become the Master of Perfumes, you’ll have to correctly answer 12 questions (3 levels in each of the 4 categories). The winner can then sketch his or her own perfume using the scent pens and blotters included for that purpose. Get your creative juices flowing today!

Master Parfums is a unique game to explore the world of fragrance and smell while having fun!

Take turns drawing cards and answering the questions about perfume culture. Watch out! Don’t draw a trap card that could slow your progress towards earning the title of Master of Perfumes! Awaken your senses by designing a fragrance and put yourself in a perfumer’s shoes!

—description from the publisher

name: Master Parfums: Pocket Quiz – special edition JOVOY
description:
Master Parfums introduces its special Pocket Quiz with JOVOY, the Ambassade des Parfums Rares!

Challenge yourself with the niche brands of the Parisian boutique, and discover all the stories and anecdotes of its selection of exclusive perfumes.

Master Parfums presents its new exclusive Pocket Quiz, a special edition dedicated to JOVOY, “the Embassy of Rare Perfumes”.

120 questions and answers to play and learn about niche perfumery brands found at JOVOY.

Discover these unique perfumery brands along the usual Master Parfums categories: History and Arts, Perfume Secrets, The Olfactory Palette, Brands, perfumes and tips.
Test your knowledge and challenge your friends!

From amateur to connoisseur to expert, who will become the JOVOY MASTER OF PERFUMES?
 
 Rules: the first player to correctly answer 12 questions (3 from each category) wins the game and becomes the Perfume Master!

—description from the publisher

name: What's For Dinner?
description:
What's For Dinner? plays much like a simplified version of Silver with a fun food theme that is appealing to a younger audience.

—user summary

How good is your memory? Find out as you swap, vomit and spy on your dinner cards! Be alert to swap out the Dramatic Desserts for Goofy Greens for the Sparkling Sodas for Vacationing Veggies - don't be late if you want to end up with the healthiest plate! Get ready to play this super fun game as you build a meal, worth a reveal!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Take That

name: Pink Panda's Pajama Party
description:
Pink Panda's Pajama Party is a fun, colorful card collecting game for families.

Roll the big pink die to find out how many pink character cards you will draw, or roll a panda to draw a special blue action card that might let you steal or swap with other players. If cards are stolen from you you may immediately draw more cards up to eight in hand. Collect eight cards in a matching color to win!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Vudù Dollz: Aattla
description:
Expansion for the Vudù/Voodoo game (first edition).
This expansion contains a doll, 3 new ancestral artifact cards, 3 location cards, and a set of rule variations.
Players can now activate the doll's power and cast her effect to the other players for new, terrifying curses! But it won't be so easy... When you are on the last step to your victory, you have to visit the doll's location, and survive to her dark power!

name: おにぎり食べられますか？ (Onigiri Taberaremasuka?)
description:
おにぎり食べられますか？ (Onigiri Taberaremasuka?) is a dice game from Japan. Players are trying to predict which Onigiri will be served first. Onigiri are a popular food in Japan, balls of rice formed into triangles, filled with different centres like fish or pickles.

Players are customers in a popular Onigiri store, waiting on their orders. The game has a deck of 42 Onigiri in five different types. Two cards of each type are laid open, and players roll dice to see how the orders progress. the total from the two dice advances a marker forward for that Onigiri. When one marker reaches the fifth point on the board, the game ends.

Players have five markers to bet of which Onigiri will advance. Each Onigiri has different numbers which affect how they advance. Players score points for predicting the winner, and other points for betting. The player with the most points is the winner.
user summary

name: ゲムマイスターの選択 (Gamemeister no Sentaku)
description:
ゲムマイスターの選択 (Gamemeister no Sentaku) is a game from Japan featuring games from a wide range of doujin publishers with images from over 40 doujin games.

Players take on the role of a boardgame expert working in the doujin game industry in Japan. A customer has ordered a game to fit certain criteria, such as player count, price, age and so on. The players gather at the game market and recognise other game masters looking to complete orders too. Using their memory, intuition and bluff, players try to secure the best game to fit their clients.

The game reflects the huge growth in the Japanese doujin game scene and appeals to payers familiar with boardgame cafes in Japan.

The base game was followed with an expansion offering more doujin games.
user summary
publishers: Friends gathering at Tenganan Yokocho (天岩庵横丁に集う仲間たち)

name: ゲムマイスターの選択：R3 (Gamemeister no Sentaku: R3)
description:
ゲムマイスターの選択：R3 (Gamemeister no Sentaku: R3) is an expansion for ゲムマイスターの選択 (Gamemeister no Sentaku), offering over 18 more cards with more kinds of doujin games, including ones not sold in boxes (as is this expansion).
user summary
publishers: Friends gathering at Tenganan Yokocho (天岩庵横丁に集う仲間たち)

name: PRJ
description:
Theme is the maneuvering of game pieces on a 6x6, 8x8 and 10x10 square board layout to Trap and Purge the Baron

Game play is similar to Chess, if it were on steroids

There are a lot of game pieces involved, about 102 starting pieces and 2 decks of cards

It's a table top game, meant to be played in a modular fashion, so that no 2 games have to be played in the exact same layout or manner

It's a truly 3 dimensional game
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Educational, Medieval, Religious
mechanics: Action Drafting, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Force Commitment, King of the Hill, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Negotiation, Re-rolling and Locking, Team-Based Game

name: Fratrum Bellum
description:
In 1861, the Southern states had seceded from the Union, attacked Federal positions and forts, and were preparing for a War of Independence. The North responded by building up its own army (prewar Union troops were approximately 20,000; the total number who fought at Bull Run alone.) The armies on both side would swell, so that at their peaks, the South would have close to 1.2 million and the North would have more than 2 million manpower in uniform. What it took to do this was incredible. Some of the factors were the draft, establishment of income taxes, and the further implementation of machines for manufacturing. The organization which took place North and South allowed the war to go as long as it did.

Now, become a "Super-general" in charge of 100,000 manpower, an area's production, moving supplies, moving manpower and material, building war materials, deciding how and when to blockade, or running blockades. Explore what it takes to defeat the Southern Rebellious Slime, or the Northern Yankee Imperialist Oppressor. Can you do it alone, or will you link your survival to that of the others on your side? Will you trade needed goods and units freely and not consider the fame others gain from your generosity, or will you decide to risk defeat so that you might do it all yourself?

Become one of the eight players:
The General of the Army of the Potomac
The General of the Army of The Ohio
The General of the Army of the West
The Admiral of the Navy, for the North
The General of the Army of Virginia
The General of the Army of Texas
The General of the Army of Tennessee
The General of the Army of Mississippi for the South

Your goal as the leader of a vast amount of manpower and lands is to generate victory for your side, while gaining fame and prestige for yourself.

"It is a well that war is so terrible, lest we grow too fond of it"
-Gen. R.E. Lee

—description from the designer

name: Tessella
description:
Tessella is a simple but addictive two player abstract.

Easier to learn than checkers
Has a strategic depth similar to chess or go
Uses a completely novel board layout and capturing mechanic


Each player has 7 pieces displayed along opposing corners of the board, the goal is to capture 4 pieces of the opponent.

On your turn, you can either:

MOVE to any empty adjacent spot (be it a square or an octagon) or
CAPTURE an opponent's piece.


To make a Capture, two of your pieces must be in a line with no other pieces between them. Following this line, you can then capture an opponent's piece, no matter how distant it is, by "shooting" (sliding) the nearer of the two pieces to take its spot.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Pattern Movement, Static Capture

name: 学校へ行こう! 拡張せっと (Go To The School! Expansion Set)
description:
学校へ行こう! 拡張せっと (Go To The School! Expansion Set) is an expansion for 学校へ行こう! (Go To The School!). It adds more cards to enable 3 or 4 player games along with the rules for the same. The publisher suggests the base game and one or two expansion packs to allow better play.
user summary

name: Budget Town
description:
Budget Town is an educational roll-and-move game designed to teach money counting and making change. Players roll a die to progress along a track, drawing Pay, Collect and Mail cards that cause the gain or loss of money as they go. They make change using the replica US bills and coins included.

The first player to reach the end by an exact roll earns a $50 bonus, and the player who finishes with the most money wins.

name: まるぺけ (Maru & Peke)
description:
まるぺけ (Maru & Peke) is a noughts & crosses game from Japan, using special effects on the cards.

There is a war on the dark side of the Moon between two tribes of rabbits. Both tribes are using their special abilities to occupy the territory and win, or gain a draw with the fewest cards.

Players spend cards to a 3x3 grid trying to get three cards in a row in the standard fashion. But the cards have abilities, such as switch places diagonally, or blocking movement, or laying traps.

If the game ends in a draw, the player how spent the fewest cards to draw is the winner.
user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Zoker
description:
How high can you go?
Zoker is a fun new game to play with your friends and family.
Each player is dealt 5 cards. Players can exchange these cards by trading their Zoker chips for new cards. The aim of the game is to obtain the highest number of points with 4-card combination.
The player with the highest points wins the round and collect5 all the Zoker chips played during the round. At the end of the game, the player with the maximum number of Zoker chips is the winner.
Let's ZOKER!

—description from the publisher

name: あるちん (Aruchin)
description:
あるちん (Aruchin) is a dice gambling game from Japan. Derived from the popular gambling game Cee-lo, the Japanese version is called Chinchiro (チンチロ) or Chinchirorin (チンチロリン). The designer describes Aruchin as the ultimate evolution of Chinchoririn.

In Cee-Lo, players roll three d6 only, and bet on the outcome. There are various combinations that trigger scoring, such as an instant win or an instant loss, and the game is fundamentally a gambling game.

Aruchin develops this using 81 special action cards that can be used to alter the results of dice rolls, or of the betting outcome.

The game was originally published in a Trial version for 2-6 players, and then in a larger version with higher grade components but for 2-4 players. The publisher also sold expansion score boards to allow more players.
user summary

name: UMA探検隊 (UMA Expedition)
description:
UMA探検隊 (UMA TANKENTAI) (UMA Expedition) is a memo-style card game from Japan themed on collecting strange creatures known as UMA, that must all be collected. However, UMA have unusual abilities that affect the game.

The deck of 36 cards is shuffled and laid face-down across the table. Players take turns flipping two cards over, looking for a matching pair which they then collect. All the UMA have certain ecological information on them, and some have special effects that affect the opponents, or make the UMA harder to collect.

The game is aimed at younger children and includes Furigana to help them read the text.
user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory

name: Capture the creature
description:
Be quick! Follow the dice and catch the right creature.

Place six of the cards face up in a circle around the compass and the rest of the deck next to the circle, face down.

The first player starts the game by rolling both dice. The dice refer to one of the cards in the circle. You use them and the compass to figure out which creature to catch. The first
person to take the right card, wins it, and a new card from the deck is placed in its place.
Now, it is the next player's turn to roll the dice. The game is over when there are only two cards left on the table. The winner is the player with the most cards.

name: Murder Mystery in a Box: Ripper
description:
Your goal is to uncover the identity of the killer and reveal the motive for the murder. You may also be given other assignments to complete during the course of the investigation.

Start by reading the assignment letter to learn specifics of the case and then begin examining all the contents found inside the box.

When you have finished your investigation and are ready to reveal the solution and conclusion of the mystery, you will need to go to the publisher's website. There is no hint system online so you will only need internet access for the solution.

Christopher's Curiosities: I found the items in the box you now hold....I now give possession of these mysterious items to you. They relate to the unsolved murders of Jack the Ripper. I need your help to investigate this new evidence and solve the mystery of the most infamous serial killer of all time."

name: Murder Mystery in a Box: Papa Midnight
description:
Your goal is to uncover the identity of the killer and reveal the motive for the murder. You may also be given other assignments to complete during the course of the investigation.

Start by reading the assignment letter to learn specifics of the case and then begin examining all the contents found inside the box.

When you have finished your investigation and are ready to reveal the solution and conclusion of the mystery, you will need to go to the publisher's website. There is no hint system online so you will only need internet access for the solution.

The perpetrator of the abduction is known as Papa Midnight. He sent a letter to the FBI that includes a bizarre challenge. Identify the abductee from a selection of 6 photographs he provided, and he will release them unharmed, otherwise they will be murdered.

name: Three Colors
description:
Three colors is a silly simple dexterity game. It is for two players only and just 9 cards are required (you can print the paper sheet we designed or use any standard playing card deck). In this game, you and your partner will be playing against each other trying to be the fastest one.

This is mostly a kids game, but can be played and enjoyed by anyone. It can make a really good drinking game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Abstract #1
description:
The Abstract project was born with the idea of starting to experiment with the design of abstract games. This type of game is characterized by a lack of theme in it (or a very soft one) and by a great component of strategy as the base mechanic of the game.


The first in the Abstract series of games. In this number 1, two players face each other to try to get the most points, however, when preparing the game, 4 dice will decide the score of the game, making each one a unique and totally captivating experience.

name: Война на Хамстери (War of Hamsters)
description:
Once upon a time, before the Hamster War, all the hamsters in Hamsterland lived peacefully and happily. However, one day the Cheese appeared and everything changed. The hamsters started fighting each other because each wanted to get hold of the Cheese.
War of Hamsters is a fun card game for kids and families, where brave characters like Cookie, Mircho, Lily, Zorkata, and many others will help you win the legendary battle! In the box, you will find 53 pieces of plasticized playing cards, resistant to children's antics.

—description from the publisher (translated)

How to play:
All cards are shuffled and given out to the players except the Cheese card.
Players put their pile of cards on the table with the back up.
On each turn, players turn the upper card at the same time and the one with the highest numbers wins the round and takes all the flipped cards.
The winner is the player who manages to collect all the cards. That player gets the Cheese.

—user summary

Едно време, преди Войната на Хамстерите всички хамсерчета в Хамстерландия живееха спокойно и щастливо. Един ден обаче се появи Сиренцето и всичко се промени. Хамстерчетата започнаха да се сражават помежду си, защото всеки искаше да се докопа до Сиренцето.
Война на Хамстери е забавна игра с карти за деца и семейства, в която смели герои като Куки, Мирчо, Лили, Жорката и много други ще ви помогнат да спечелите легендарната битка! В кутията ще намерите 53 броя пластифицирани карти за игра, издръжливи на детските лудории.

—description from the publisher

name: 松永久秀トリック (Hisahide Matsunaga Trick)
description:
Yoshiteru Ashikaga, who is good at arms. The betrayal of Miyoshi Chokei. Junkei Tsutsui can't be used...In the time of the Sengoku period, will you be the one to conquer the Kinai region!?

In 松永久秀トリック (Hisahide Matsunaga Trick), the goal of the game is to get 5 victory points.

At the start of the round, deal the specified number of cards to each player and you are ready to go. The deck consists of a total of 40 cards, five colors with numbers 1-8. The "face cards" numbered 1, 2, 5, and 8 of each color have portraits of military commanders on them.

The flow of the game follows that of basic trick taking.
Each player plays a card, starting with the lead player. If you have a card in hand that matches the suit of the lead player's card you must play it. After all cards have been played, the "highest" strength card determines who wins the trick.
What determines "highest" strength can change based on how many face cards were played (0 or an even number, the card with the higher number is stronger. Odd number, the card with the lower number is stronger). Place any face cards you win in front of you so that you can see the number.

Do this until you run out of cards in your hand, then calculate your score. The cards you have won are grouped by number, and for each number, if you collect an odd amount of cards, you will get a total of 1 point , and if you collect an even amount of cards, you will get 0 points.
Example: You collected three 2s=1 point and two 8s = 0 points.
After calculating the score, if someone's total score meets or exceeds 5 points, the game ends.

name: Sen-Ryu (川竜)
description:
川竜 (Sen-Ryu) is a card game from Japan. Players put together word cards to form spells to summon dragons. The spells must match the form of dragon they are trying to summon.

The designer says the game is intended to evoke the feeling of Chūnibyō, where young teens gain grandiose delusions and feel they are imbibed with special powers.

Played over two rounds, players draft cards, building up a combination of dragon and word cards, to form a summoning chant 'Kawaryu'. Each round, players score points for how well their spell matches their dragon. At the end of the game, the player with the highest total is the winner.

The game features 15 dragon cards with unique illustrations.
user summary

name: Monster Girl High School
description:
Class is back in session at Monster Girl High School! It’s time to make friends, form rivalries, and not think too much about the schoolwork that is very absent from this game!

In Monster Girl High School, you’ll make long lasting friendships with your new monster girl BFFs, forming a clique ready to dominate the school! Pick your friendships carefully and think about who sits next to whom because one wrong move could spell disaster and tear friendships apart! Can you thrive and make the most popular clique in school?

name: どろっぷス (Drops)
description:
どろっぷス (Drops) is a "Hide Identity + Trick Taking" card game where you play cards from your hand and pack the drops into boxes.
Boxed up drops will be shipped out if the box has the required number and colors of Drops, otherwise it will not be shipped and will be discarded. After all drops are boxed, the player that ships the most drops out of the 5 colors wins.

At the start of the game, you are assigned which color drop you are in charge of. Your assigned color is not revealed until the end of the game.
After the game starts, in each round, one drop card will be played in order from the factory manager (start player). When playing a card, you must give priority to the colors that have not yet appeared.
Once everyone has played their cards, the box shipment will be determined. If the number and color of drops matches the required amount, shipping is OK. If it is more or less than what is required, it will not be shipped and discarded.

After repeating several rounds, according to the number of players, the game ends and your secret color is revealed.
Successfully shipped drops are counted by color, and the person with the most color wins.

name: Disoville Heroes
description:
Disoville Heroes is a dice-drafting, action-selection game in which players use asymmetrical player powers to train up powerful superpowered abilities so they can fight the emerging crime within the town and become the most popular superhero.

—description from the designer
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Matchy Matchy
description:
Players try to match shapes and colors or shapes of different colors to get points. There are 4 colors of 7 shapes to match or Matchy Matchy. Get to 200 points to win the game!

In the Matchy Matchy box are 56 cards and easy to follow instructions!

—description from the publisher

name: Sweets House
description:
The game is a sequel to the fairy tale "Hansel and Gretel". Maybe it's the effect of going to the witch's candy
house. At first glance, it looks like a very cute game of making a candy house, but there's also a slightly dark development that doesn't choose any means to make a house...

In スイーツハウス (Sweets House), players will help Hansel and Gretel by doing one of the following during their turn:

building
exchanging
drawing


The game is like trick-taking, and the player who goes to collects 7 victory points first wins.
publishers: みっくすスムージー (Mix smoothie)

name: Presidente: Expansión Vacancia
description: This expansion for Presidente gets 17 new cards to add to the original game. Includes cards such as "presidential vacancy", "quarantine", "vaccine scandal" and more. (Event cards). Also includes new Power, Moneys and Vote cards.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Alchemist Library
description:
The day has come! As an Apprentice in the ancient art of Alchemy, you will race to prove your skill by being the first to complete creations from the books of the Master’s library. Each creation requires the combination of four different components, as well as the correct placement on the arcane circle. Think fast, outmaneuver your friends, and use your abilities to become the next Master Alchemist!

Alchemist Library is a fast-paced game for two to four people which can be played with in 20 to 30 minutes. Each turn the players will play a card from their hand, either adding a Component to the board, or using an ability. However, one player holds the Master Talisman, an artifact which gives them more powerful versions of each ability, which they can then use to their advantage, whether it is their turn or not. Once the Talisman is used, it is passed to the next player, so use it wisely!

The game is all about set collecting, but with a twist, and while each player is trying to get the correct position matching one of the books in hand. As the board fills up, matching elements or materials can be stacked on top of one another, to change the layout in your favor, or slow down your opponents. Every player can also score at any time, so pay close attention to the board, as your friends may give you exactly what you need. Be the first Apprentice to complete 3 books to win the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Jungle Dash
description:
In Jungle Dash you will be racing your opponents to complete 2 laps of this jungle circuit! The game is played simultaneously with all players making decisions and moving together. You will pick a direction to move, an item or upgrade to play and then roll your dice to move around the board. Take advantage of every opportunity to finish 1st in this action packed race around the jungle!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Programmed Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Balloon Party Plus+
description:
The highly acclaimed micro board game has launched an upgraded version! Add a more challenging table expansion.
Place number cards in a limited space and turn balloons into numbers you like.
It is suitable for families and seniors to play.
The balloon party is about to start. Hurry up and invite your friends to the party!

How to play:

According to the number of players, divide players into 2~3 teams. Different teams like different colors of balloons.

Every player takes turns placing number card and adding up the number. (There are two colors of semicircles on the number card, and the card can only be stitched together with the same color.)

After calculating, put the corresponding balloon on the number.

You need to place the table at the right time, and try to make balloons of your team color appear in the cross direction of the table to get more bonus.

After the party venue is completely set up (5*5 or 6*6), the team with the most balloons of its own color in the venue wins.(For example: There are 10 red balloons in the venue, red team +20 points.)

—description from the publisher

name: 眠れない夜の色 (The Color of Dreaming of a Dream)
description:
The world is full of colors, and each color has a name.
Blue for the sea, black for crows, red for mailboxes, red for sunsets … and so on. Oh? Is the red of sunsets and the red of mailboxes the same red? Is the sunset always the same red in the first place…? In this game you must pay attention to the "similarities" and "differences" of colors and give them new names.

In this game, the questioner is secretly given 1 of 6 colors on a board (variable based on the orientation of a color grid and an overlay) and must come up with a two part name to get across to the respondents which color they are talking about. This name is given in two parts, with the respondents being given 1 guess for each. Points are awarded based on how well respondents guess, with the questioner wanting them to guess it wrong on the 1st guess and right on the 2nd guess.

Example:
Red, Blue, Green, Yellow, Orange, and Black are on the board.
The questioner rolls a 5, corresponding to the Orange. They decide to name it “Color of a Sleepless Night”, because they think of someone working by candle light. They first write, show and say, “Color of Night”. The respondents guess. Then they write, show and say “Color of a Sleepless Night”. The respondents then guess a 2nd time. Points are then evaluated.

name: Black Metro
description:
Welcome to Black Metro, a dystopian and chaotic city! Black Metro is a competitive area control game.

Using your personnel, acquire resources to research technologies, build fortifications and promote your subordinates - all with the aim of acquiring the most power to claim the title deed to Black Metro.

Black Metro plays in 6 game rounds, and the overall winner is determined by the player who has acquired the most power (victory points) by game end.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Automatic Resource Growth, End Game Bonuses, Point to Point Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: ステンドおむらいす (Glass Omurice)
description:
ステンドおむらいす (Glass Omurice) is a card game from Japan. The game is themed on making stained glass windows, but is also a pun on Omurice omelettes. The pictures on the cards show different omelettes.

The game has a deck of 36 cards. 12 of them are large 'Om' cards, showing the main stained glass image with six different coloured backgrounds. The remaining 24 small 'Om' cards show four different images in different combinations of colours.

The game has two sets of rules and both can be played solitaire:
かさねおむらいす (Kasane Omuraisu) - Players draw cards and place them to form a large tableau of stained glass. Players are trying to match the colours on the small Om cards to the large Om cards, and place cards to overlap each other. By joining colours together, a player draws more cards and scores more points.

おむらいすいじゃく (Omurai Suijaku) - In a Memo-style game, players are drawing and placing cards to make their own stained glass window. If they draw the same colour twice, they can make extra moves in the game.

user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement
publishers: めめめのアトリエ (MeMeMe No Atelier)

name: Primacy
description:
Compete for primacy by recruiting ministers to your cabinet, raising armies, developing military technology and tactics, collecting resources, and battling enemies in a grand strategy game with tactical combat.

You cabinet of ministers determines how efficiently you perform actions. Your military strength depends on the number of armies you can muster as well as the military technology and tactics you develop in the form of combat cards.

In battle, commit your forces to different objectives including increasing your legend, eliminating enemies, and other objectives depending on the territory you are fighting over. You probably cannot win every objective, so the player who allocates forces most efficiently will get the most out of the battle.

In the end, the player with the most victory points wins. Your score each round is determined by the sacred sites you control multiplied by your legend multiplier.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Income, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Shuffleshot Game
description:
Will you build tactical barricades with well-placed discs or power through your opponents with the perfect slide? Either way, it’s the highest score that wins with the 34090 Shuffleshot Game. This strategic game offers a unique competitive experience for the entire family that takes inspiration from shuffleboard, air hockey, curling and crokinole. The objective of the game is for players to score the most points by shooting their discs the closest they can to the centre point of the board. When all discs are shot, the player with the most discs closest to the centre wins!

—description from the publisher

name: アンティークアンフェア (Antique Unfair)
description:
アンティークアンフェア (Antique Unfair) is a card game from Japan. The game offers one mode of play for 2 to 4 players, and a solo variant playing against the game. Both modes come with an easy rules set to introduce the game and more rigid rules set to play a harder game.

In Antique Unfair, players are competing to obtain different antiques and artworks at auction. The items on sale have different qualities (cost/follow/value/points) and players are trying to score points progressively, or achieve an instant win by meeting their specific goals.

The designer says to focus on reading the other players' intentions based on what is offered for sale, and bluff them out of their targets.

In the solo mode, the player is trying to keep fakes out of the market, and build up a special collection. As the player repeats the game, they can learn to achieve higher goals.
user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: めめめのアトリエ (MeMeMe No Atelier)

name: RGB Playing Cards
description:
RGB is not a single card game, it is an entire card system based on an old discovery. The discovery is simple and amazing. When cyan, magenta, and yellow ink are paired with a red, green, and blue light only the corresponding ink will be visible. Effectively, one 2d image can hold 3 images and each image can be selected by the player at will. This is the first time that this discovery has been applied to card / board gaming.

The RGB card game system is based on traditional playing cards. The main difference is that there are only 48 regular cards, ranking from 1 – 12 and 6 color changing cards which can also be used as wild cards (you can print more if you see fit). The suits are the colors red, green, and blue. So, keeping that in mind it is possible to play most traditional playing card games but with a twist. It is up to players how they will adapt traditional games to the RGB system.

It is best to use a red/green/blue light bulb to play, it is also best to play in a dark or dimly lit area. The RGB light should be placed above the playing surface and positioned in a manner as to not shine into anyone’s eyes directly. That being said it is also possible to use the screen of a single or multiple smartphone(s) or tablet(s) by displaying a red/green/blue background and using the device(s) as if they were lights. However, using device screens in this manner will not have as good as a result as using a RGB light bulb.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Skraldeludo
description:
Skraldeludo ("Garbage Ludo") is an entertaining game with waste sorting as a focal point. Food waste, metal, paper & cardboard and plastic must be sorted and delivered to the appropriate department at the recycling station. While you are in the process of clearing your trash district, you can knock your opponents home, but be careful, you can also be knocked home yourself. Use the parking spaces as sheds. Whoever has cleared their district first and delivered their waste to the right place has won.

The game has both high entertainment value and contains learning elements for both children and adults. The game gives the child the opportunity for strategic and tactical development at the same time as it increases awareness of waste sorting. The game has several tactical layers, so as an adult you can also test your strategic abilities. Playing Skraldeludo with children creates the basis for a dialogue about an important topic in our everyday lives. The game is also fun for adults to play.

Trash Ludo is produced from FSC certified paper or wood. This means that in the production of trash ludo, a social responsibility has been taken, both in relation to the environment and the employees in the production.

The game is for 2-4 participants and can be played by children up to 6 years old.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: That Sound Game: X-tension Pack
description:
Add some filth into That Sound Game with the X-Tension pack. Not for the easily offended, these additional 65 cards will make you question the world around you. This is the original game with a side of NSFW and a dash of WTF! You’re welcome. It’s pretty simple, just mix these cards into their corresponding categories and get ready to be a little naughty.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: KnightMore
description:
Knight More was released in Japan at the 2014 Tokyo Game Market and is a trick-taking game for 3 to 5 players. The deck features 4 suits (Knights, Archers, Spearmen, Swordsman) ranked 1 to 10. The deck also includes 2 unsuited Ambush cards. The goal of the game is to avoid getting eliminated from play and to take the final trick of the game.

The game takes place over 6 rounds. At the start of each round players are dealt a hand of cards, receiving one less during the deal in each subsequent round (6 in round one, 5 in round two, etc). A random trump suit is revealed from the top of the undealt card deck. Players will try to take tricks using standard "must follow" rules. The winner of a trick is determined by assessing who played the highest value in the lead suit or the highest valued trump. When following suit, the unsuited Ambush cards may be played at any time whether suit can be followed or trumped. Ambush cards rank higher than any suited card, including trump. However, when resolving a trick that includes an Ambush, if a 1 rank card in any suit is present the Ambush is ineligible to win the trick. If both Ambush cards are played to the same trick, the second played wins.

At the end of each round, any players who have taken zero tricks are eliminated from the game. The player who wins the most tricks in a round will be the lead player of the next. The game continues until one of the following occurs:

1) A player wins the game by collecting all tricks in a round, leaving all other players with zero tricks.

2) A player wins the game by making it to round 6 and winning the final trick.

There is an optional variant called "Guerrilla Operations". The game is played the same, except the first time a player takes zero tricks in a round they are not eliminated. Instead, in the following round they are dealt a single card. During that round, on their turn they may play this card into any trick of their choosing. If they don't want to play it into a trick they may pass. If a player can use this card to win a trick they will re-enter the game in the following round. A player is only eligible to receive the single card second chance if it's the first time they end a round with zero tricks. If a player collects zero tricks for a second time after having re-entered the game previously or fails to win a trick with their single second chance card, they are eliminated.
publishers: Non-Power System Yugi Anage Chang (非電源系遊戯あなげちゃん)

name: Halli, hallo, wir ernten!
description: The players take turns to roll and move. If a player gets to a harvest space he take a corresponding harvest card. The game ends when al players have reached the farm yard. Whoever has the most harvest cards at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: 3 Runden
description:
Each game consists of 3 rounds. For each game, one player is the banker for 3 turns. He gives each player the coins: 2 coins of 10, 4 coins of 5, 10 coins of 2 and 20 coins of 1.
Each player deposits 2 coins into bowls 1-6 and the pot in the middle. The banker does the same but fills the pot up to 12 coins.
The banker begins to roll all 3 dice. Only 3 rounds are rolled. The give/take die determines whether the player has to deposit or withdraw money. The number die indicates the cup you pay into or receive from. The die with the eyes determines the amount of the win or the deposit.
Bowl 1 and 6: Doubles the bet. You pay or receive twice as much as you rolled eyes.
Double: In the case of a double, i.e. if the numbers on the number dice and the number dice are the same, the pot also plays.
If a bowl becomes empty during the 3 rounds, it is the banker's duty to refill it to the original deposit of all players. In return, the pot in the middle belongs to the banker after the end of the 3 rounds
Final round: When the 3 rounds have been rolled, the banker only starts with the number die. Each player now gets the total contents of the bowl he rolled. Play continues until all bowls are emptied. In the new game, the next player automatically becomes the banker.

name: Affaire Conclue
description:
Which of you will make the best deal ?

Each of the 325 items has unique characteristics which modify its estimated price. Hide them from other players to raise the stakes!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Marked Miles
description: Marked Miles is for 2 to 6 players. The recommended age is 10 to adult. This game gives each player the opportunity to win regardless of what experience in trucking the player may or may no have. Marked Miles is a fast paced trucking game of chance, skill, opportunity and finance.

name: Mime-le si tu peux
description: A pack a cards with actions or expressions you must mime and other players to find.

name: Mermaids Vs Kraken
description:
Your ships are being attacked by a Kraken and your only hope of survival is gaining the help from the Mermaids of the deep. The thrashing tentacles threaten to destroy your ships and drag your crews to the depths of Davey Jones' Locker.

Each turn players will simultaneously roll and place their dice on the sheet. Certain placements will allow the player to gain Sand Dollars to hire the Mermaids for deeper dice placement with stronger effects. Other spaces allow players to use Tridents to fight back against the Kraken while further spaces allow for dice manipulation.

After the players have placed their dice, they will face the Kraken. Each turn the Kraken card is revealed. The players will compare their Tridents against the Kraken, if they succeed, they will earn a Gem which can earn them more benefits for later in the game. If they exceed the Kraken by 2 Tridents, then they save everyone else at the table from the Kraken's attack.

Any player who failed to meet or exceed the Kraken's Trident value will face the Kraken's attack which can destroy collected Gems, change dice for the following round, or block certain levels of Mermaids where the players hope to place their dice.

Dice placement comes to Roll and Writes in a big way with this game, capturing the feel of battling the Kraken each turn when a new card is revealed.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Billy Shakespeare
description:
This game is built as a party game and for family fun. It is interactive and the players create rhyming stories about the players. Make sure you segment of the story rhymes, makes sense, does not take to long and does not repeat a rhyming word or you will get challenged. If you are challenged, decide to defend your position or not. If you do defend your position be ready to win people to your side and win votes. This game is interactive, fun, challenging, educational and perfect for any gathering.

Get ready to laugh as you compete in story creation, rhyming, logic, challenging, debating and convincing others you are right. Win this game by becoming the Poet.

Succeeding in this Game is mostly based on convincing others you are right and getting them to vote for you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Player Judge, Storytelling, Voting

name: Super Speedway Cribbage
description:
Super Speedway Cribbage combines the strategy and card play of traditional Cribbage, with an Auto Racing themed board game.
Cribbage card play and scoring is what gets you around the Super Speedway styled race track that is packed with action "Zones".
Crashes and passes will occur...reference cards and dice rolls help decide the various track events and their outcomes.
Theres even a Pit Lane that can slow you down or shoot you to victory!
Up to four players can race around the track, competing to be the first across the finish line.

It helps to already understand traditional Cribbage rules, but full instructions are included to learn.
The race track styled game board can be used as a normal cribbage board and the game comes with its own themed Playing Cards.

The large fold out Super Speedway Track game board is big, bold and simple to understand.
A large multi page Instruction booklet is included along with enough Track Incident and Reference Cards for up to 4 players.
The game board features a Lap scoring area, and extra tokens are included for that.

Purchase this game at The Game Crafter: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/super-speedway-cribbage

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Race, Track Movement

name: Turn 'n Burn: The Barrel Racing Game
description:
Turn 'n Burn is a simple dice and score game that is played by one person (at a time) and requires only minutes to complete.
Move your pawn throught the various stages of a Barrel Racing course, roll the dice, and record time penalties as you go.
At the end, add up your score and set a new "record" barrel racing time if you can.

The game box comes with two complete sets of game parts, so two people can play head to head.
The theme and content of the game will definitely appeal more to those who are Barrel Racers or Horse riders,
and those who already understand competition Barrel Racing and Rodeo events.

But thats not to say anyone who enjoys a simple dice rolling and scoring game, won't enjoy Turn 'n Burn.
In fact, it would make an entertaining party game for a group.
Everyone can take turns playing the game, setting their own Barrel Race time.
Whoever sets the fastest time is the current "record holder" and everyone can try again.

Purchase this game at The Game Crafter: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/turn-n-burn

This game also comes in a 'Pocket' edition, for single player. (see attached photos) Details at The Game Crafter

—description from the designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Actifry
description:
Described as the game of the seven families.
For ages 4 and up.
44 cards for 2 - 5 players
Goal of the game
The winner is the player who gathers together the greatest number of families. A family is a series of 5 cards which have the same background colour.

How to play:
The youngest player starts.
He asks another player to give him a card of his choice. If the designated person holds the card requested she must give it to him, otherwise the player takes a card in the stock. If he gets a good card, he can play again immediately. As soon as a player has gathered together the 5 cards of a family, he places them in front of him.
The winner is the player who has put down the greatest number of cards.

Promotional game published by Tefal ('the first widespread seller of cookware with non-stick surfaces' according to Wikipedia).

The box also includes background information such as recipes.

name: Avus-Rennen
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to complete 3 laps wins the race.

If a player rolls a 6 in a curve, he misses a turn in the 1st lap. In the 2nd lap he misses two turns and in the 3rd lap he is eliminated from the game.

If a player rolls a 6 on a straight track, he may move 3 extra spaces. In the 2nd lap, if a player gets on space 9 or 10, he has to change tires and loses one turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Amiga Duel
description:
Amiga Duel is the ultimate card game for all Amiga fans, retro collectors and gamer enthusiasts: it features 32 models of the greatest computer series ever created. The lineup includes all Commodore Amigas from the A1000 to the CD32, various clones like DraCo or Pegasos, devices from the grapevine like Walker or MCC and of course the brand new The A500 Mini. The classics shine through year of availability or innovative strength, the newer machines stand out through computing power or kickstart. All playing cards have been illustrated with love and researched with passion – by Amiga fans for Amiga fans.

—description from the publisher

name: Chin-Chan-Walla
description:
A classic game in which three objects compete to find the winner of each challenge: Stone breaks scissors, paper wraps stone, scissors cuts paper!


Shuffle and deal cards face down to each player. (4 players get six cards each).
Players view their own cards.
The dealer challenges player 2 only.
Both players decide which card to play and lay it face down.
All players shout "Chin-Chan-Waala" and both challengers turn over their cards. The player who has the winning object wins the cards, and lays them aside in a pile. The winner then challenges the next player.


Game ends when a player lays the last card. The winner has the biggest pile.

Note: If players lay the same objects, they continue till one wins.

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 29
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 29 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Dragoon Battle Armor (Std/WD/Upgrade/Upgrade WD)
• Command Van (Fusion/ICE/Q-Vehicle)
• Browning Mobile HQ (Wheeled/Half-track)
• Hetzer Wheeled Assault Gun (Cell)/C
• Eurus MBT Prime/A/B/C/D
• Ontos Heavy Tank (Chemical Laser)
• Firefly FFL-5A
• Assassin ASN-109
• Dervish DV-11DK
• Charger C
• Sagittaire SGT-14R
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Pondlife
description: A distant cousin of chess involving a nest that spawns pieces as it moves around a hexagonal board
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Medical Mania
description:
A medical themed trivia-based board game where players compete to rise through the professional medical ladder from nurse to surgeon general.

—user summary

Become medically enlightened as you travel up the professional ladder from Certified Nursing Assistant all the way to Surgeon General of the United States. Medical Mania is full of interesting facts...some helpful, some strange, all sure to pique your curiosity...An absolute must for health care workers at all levels!... An absolute must for everyone concerned (or just plain curious) about health!

—description from the back of the box

name: Obscene
description:
How much money would you need to eat the hottest pepper known to man, or to cut off your own finger? In Obscene - you and other players try and guess what your price would be in these fictitious yet seriously Obscene situations. If players guess right, they get money! Too obscene to list here - buy the game to be shocked and even learn something about yourself and your friends! This is strictly for ages 21 and up, and not those easily offended.

—description from the publisher

name: That's my Jam
description: Using kazoos to play songs for opponents to guess.

name: Music Mayhem Mix
description:
Find out if you're a one-hit wonder or a musical maestro! Divided into three categories on 80s and 90s sensations, rock hits and chart-topping tracks, this trivia game will have you screaming for an encore!

Set contains 150 cards with 300 questions.

name: Booted!
description:
LEARN FAST. Takes only 3 minutes to learn. Scan QR Code to watch a quick YouTube. No need to read instructions!
OBJECTIVE: Advance all your pawns to the other side of the board... but beware of your opponent's strategies to boot you back!
10 MINUTES. Each game takes approximately 10 minutes to play.
FUN FOR ALL AGES. Anyone ages 4 and up can enjoy the game.
1 vs 1 STRATEGY. Sharpen your minds in this dynamic, fun game!
SUPPORT YOUNG ENTREPRENEURS. Created by two teenagers in Silicon Valley, not some big game company.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Derailed!
description:
Derailed is a game of train to train combat set long after after the wake of an apocalyptic event that tore down the gilded peaks of mankind and replaced it with the capricious rule of the now-unseen Fae. Players will take the role of agents from one of the six great rail factions, assemble their train and crew, and brave the wilds in order to keep humanity’s few remaining cities connected and supplied. There’s a fortune to be made and history to be written by those courageous enough to journey through the rail wilderness.

Part wargame, part worker placement game, part resource management game, Derailed is a fun and exciting experience for 1-6 players with numerous ways to play, adding levels of depth and complexity to suit any player; casual boardgame players through to avid wargamers will find something to love, from the rich setting with a wealth of lore, to a ruleset that's easy to learn but hard to master. Six different factions offer a variety of play styles based on their unique special rules.

The objective of Derailed is simple enough: complete your journey alive and with the most tickets in hand. To do so, you first build your train, hire crew and purchase supplies for the voyage. Six different engine types, eight different carriages and a wide selection of weapons and upgrades affords you plenty of options to create your own unique train. Crew are your resource for performing actions aboard your train, represented by dice. Once you have your train and crew ready, load up with fuel, cargo and passengers to make your trek as profitable as possible. But remember that the rail wilderness is a dangerous place; a place of profit, piracy... and worse…

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Trains, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Map Addition, Move Through Deck, Movement Points, Programmed Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement with Dice Workers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Denk Rasch
description:
An educational card game for children from 7 years up.
This game includes 85 uppercase letter cards + 6 joker cards.

The title means Think Quickly so this is an educational game first and foremost.

The cards can be used for a crossword-type game and then lots of other variants (including a dominoes variation).
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Freischach
description:
The positions of the white pieces (officers) are drawn by lot for each game and are also decisive for the deployment of Black.
All figures, unless they are in their usual place, have double the possibility of movement from their deployment line and only from this line, depending on their quality and their location. So for example, a knight on square 1a is also a rook (knight rook), a rook on b1 is also a knight (rook knight), a knight on c1 is also a bishop (knight bishop), etc. Any move that contradicts the quality of a piece is called a free move.
The players must always keep the usual line-up in mind. If a figure moves to another square in its deployment row or returns to it in the course of the game, it has twice the possibility of moving from this deployment row if it does not end up in its usual place. The king also participates in the increased freedom of movement of the figures. However, as in castling, he may not step over a square where he could be captured, may not take a free move once he has moved, or evade check by a free move. Castling itself is only allowed in free chess if the king is in its usual place.
Otherwise the regular chess rules apply.

The Game was published in a booklet called "Zwei neue Kriegsspiele".
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture, Variable Set-up

name: BUGS Matching Games
description:
This fun and simple game for little ones is perfect for developing recognition, memory and communication skills. The box set contains 36 vibrantly illustrated picture cards, 4 bingo boards and a book with instructions and fascinating facts about bugs. There are lots of bugs to match and talk about, including spiders, ladybirds, butterflies and bees.

Players each have their own individual boards with a shared grid of tiles in the middle of the table. They take turns flipping a tile over to see if it matches one of the spaces on their board. If it does it is placed on the board. If it does not, it is flipped face down in the same spot.

This is a memory game for children that also affords the opportunity to learn about the bugs with the included information.

name: Blow My Mind
description:
Blow My Mind is a conversational discussion game in which the goal isn't to win the debate, but to blow the most minds with weird and interesting points while you collectively try to answer the unanswerable.

The rules are simple: Ask the question, talk about the answer, and choose who blew your mind the most.

Made in partnership with Kickstarter, the game is playable with as little as a single card and is generally only available at conventions, starting with the first set of fifty cards at PAX Unplugged 2022.

name: Dwindell
description:
A solo word game for the ELL deck.

Winner of the 2021 ELL deck game design contest.

Depending on the game mode, you start with 5, 8, or 12 cards and win when you have only 3.

Each turn, make a word and replace all the cards.

If you didn't use a card, take a card with a higher number. If you used the easy letter, take a card with an equal number. If you used the tricky letter, take a card with a lower number.

Each time you use the tricky letters in your words, the numbers on the cards will dwindle, until you have a card with a '1' on it (JKQVXZ), which will get removed when you use those trickiest of letters.

The game will always be won - once a card is removed, it never comes back. For a challenge, count how many turns it takes you and try to get a good rank!

Normal mode is a quick 10-minute game, epic mode can easily take over an hour and rewards you for consistently making long words like 'EARTHQUAKE'.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Shaderest
description:
The Circle is broken. Long have the Druids preserved the balance between the natural world and the supernatural, protecting the denizens of both. Yet Time has grown envious and now the spirits of the dead and damned pour out through the ruined hengestones and across ancient boundaries to once more inhabit the land. The broken Circle of Druids will need to be reformed, the unquiet shades of ancestors appeased, and the balance between time and fate restored before the passing of a hundred solstices, or the magic of the henges will fade forever.

In Shaderest, players will assume the mantle of Druids and form a Circle from the remnants of a once majestic order. They will work together to lay the risen shades of their ancestors and the disturbed spirits of the land to rest, and in the process discover the hidden potential of their true power: compassion, sincerity, and truth.

Druids will age, grow, change, and pass their mantles on to later incarnations and successors, combining and matching game elements to create synergies and playstyles. Coordinating the strengths of Seasons, Disciplines, Blessings, and Relics is the key to building a strong Circle.

During each session of Shaderest, the Circle will confront a Cairn, a select grouping of Shades that must be laid to rest in order to restore balance to the land. If a single Circle can complete five Cairns in a row without breaking, they will restore the shattered balance and win the game!

—description from the designer

name: Discovery: The Expandable Card Game
description:
Discovery is a 1v1, constructed, duelling card game, set in a fantasy world where four guilds battle for control over a mysterious island that’s risen from the sea. Leaning heavily into thematic design, it allows players to pull from faction and archetype-specific mechanics to create their perfect decks, with a variety of win conditions to choose from.

Assuming the role of a powerful Hero, each of your chosen Minions and Spells will follow your every command as you set out to complete your Quest. The Quest system is an elegant marriage of mechanics, art and short-form storytelling that streamlines resource systems and deck building, while offering strategic depth and making the genre more accessible.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Fruity Fruit
description:
Released at the 2022 Fall Tokyo Game Market in Japan, Fruity Fruit is a trick-taking game that heavily incorporates tile placement mechanics and resource gathering.

Fruity Fruit uniquely does not utilize a deck of cards for its trick play. Instead it uses tiles in 4 different suit colors (red, green, yellow, blue). In each suit color there are tiles valued 1 to 9 in sizes that vary by value. The breakdown of tile sizes are:


All 1,2,3 value tiles are 4 squares in length
All 4,5,6,7 value tiles are 3 squares in length
All 8,9 value tiles are 2 squares in length


At the start of the game and in turn order, each player will draw a hand of 4 scoring cards from a deck of 9 and choose one to keep. When each player has a single scoring card, all unchosen cards are returned to the box unrevealed. Each player will then take a turn blindly drawing 3 tiles from the bag of 36. These tiles are kept secret and are placed behind their player blind. The drawing phase continues in this manner until the bag is empty. Each player is then given one basket tile, which has 4 empty spaces on it where acquired fruit tokens may be placed. On the table is a 10x10 game board with fruit, basket, and insect symbols printed on it.

Tricks are played using the tiles each player has drawn. The game uses standard "must follow" trick-taking rules with the trump suit always being the red suit. To begin a trick, the lead player places one of their tiles onto the game board. In turn order, each other player must follow suit by playing a tile of the same color to the board. If a player can not follow suit they may place any color tile they would like. When placing a tile it must be orthogonally adjacent to a previously placed tile. Anytime a player covers a fruit symbol on the board, a token of that type is taken from the supply and placed in the middle of the table. If covering a basket or insect symbol a player receives immediately receives it. Once all players have placed a tile onto the board the trick's winner is determined:


If a player's has no empty spaces on their basket tile(s), they are not eligible to win the trick.
If any player couldn't play a tile to the board during the placement phase, they are not eligible to win the trick.
The player who played the highest value of the lead color or the highest trump is the winner of the trick.


The trick's winner will take all fruit tokens placed in the middle of the table and place them into their basket(s). Any fruit that can't be placed in an empty basket space must be returned to the center of the table. The trick winner then leads the next trick. If any player isn't able to play a tile to the board due to unavailable space, that player is skipped and the game proceeds in turn order. It is possible for a trick to be comprised of a single tile.

Play continues until either one player is out of tiles or no player is able to place any more tiles. When either happens players proceed to scoring. All players score points based on their score card drawn at the beginning of the game. For each insect token a player has in front of them, one of their highest valued fruit is discarded and will not be scored. The player with the highest score wins.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Coin Knight
description:
Coin Knight is a betting game for 2 players where you will be playing with any 16 random coins you have around your house and a single card you can print yourself at home.
Each coin will a different power based on it's colour or the area of the board the fall on, so try playing with a different set of coins each time for even more variety!
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Betting and Bluffing, Closed Drafting

name: Planeteers
description:
Overview:

You are Planeteers racing across a vibrant alien planet seeded with randomised Discoveries that can act as boons or hindrances. Use wacky Gadgets to boost yourself or delay opponents, in this easy-going, family-friendly, casual race game for 3-5 players with playful 'take that' elements.

Aim of the game:

When the first player reaches the end of the game board (that represents an alien planet)the game ends. The player that has managed to bank the most treasure (victory points) at this moment is declared the winner!

There is also a simple version for younger players that just includes the race to the end, without the complexity of victory points.

How to play:

Players get a hand of gadget cards that are used to propel themselves around the board or influence other players. Gadget cards can be played on a players turn, or traded in at special board spaces for victory points. Light hand management and card 'order of play' dictate the game's tactics.

The game board 'race track' features multiple types of spaces. Checkpoints that act as navigation beacons and trading spots for acquiring victory points. Gadget Drops that replenish Gadget Cards. And Discoveries, which are essentially randomised events that change from game to game, ensuring no two playthroughs are the same.

On a player's turn, they can play cards, bank treasure or take a free move up the board. They may then draw more gadgets and end their turn. Some gadgets can be used out of turn to mess with other player's strategies!

This game is best played casually, and is very family friendly.
categories: Children's Game, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Stratagem
description:
Approved by the British Chess Foundation, Stratagem is a revolutionary 2 player game of chess which offers all the excitement, challenges and subtleties of the existing game.

Although it takes just minutes to learn, Stratagem takes a lifetime to master. So whether you are someone who has never played chess before, or a grand master, Stratagem is a game you'll enjoy playing for the rest of your life.

—description from the publisher

The board is circular, with no centre and differs from 'circular chess' by having the baseline as the starting position with 2 fronts. It appears to be a re-implementation of Byzantine Chess, but with only the following changes from normal chess:

pawns move forward only, but on two fronts
all major pieces are free to move round the board in both directions and across both baselines
castling can only be performed with the rook on the same radial as the king


—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Point to Point Movement, Single Loser Game, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Loupežníci, třeste se!
description:
A free sequel to Loupežníci with simpler and more dynamic rules for kids as young as 5 years old.

Become one of the brave soldiers who will rightfully fight the dangerous bandits. But beware, bandits are sneaky and can't just be caught. You have to fight each of them and only after a victorious battle you can arrest him.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Card Sale: Midwest Expansion
description: 54 Midwest themed cards to add to the Card Sale base game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Interrupts, Player Judge, Storytelling, Take That

name: Som el que decidim!
description:
A card game for understand the political, social and economic situation between Spain and Catalonia.
The players goal is achieve the independence of catalonia, given by spanish governement,or get a referendum for independence. The player with most democratic participation counters wins.
If the Spanish goverment made an intervention in catalonia, all the players lose.

name: Das Schmitz-Spiel
description: The 60 cards show 60 different people belonging to 5 families located in the Rhineland area named with the typical Rhineland dialect. Each family consists of 12 people marked with one of the 12 symbols. On your turn, play a card face down announcing the person on it. The person must belong to the same family or must have the same symbol as the card played before. The next player may check if his predecessor was right or not. If he decides to check, he reveals the card and the player who was wrong must draw 2 cards as a penalty. Some cards have a special function. The player who first got rid of all his cards wins.
