mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: 里山さすてぃなぶる (Satoyama Sustainable)
description:
里山さすてぃなぶる (Satoyama Sustainable) is a card game from Japan, themed on the Satoyama landscape that exists in Japan. Satoyama is the area between arable flatland and the foothills of the mountains (sato 里 means village, and yama 山 means hill).

In the game, players are placing cards in a pyramid, representing the food chain in a Satoyama area. The players' goal is to keep the area healthy by maintaining a good balance between vegetation, herbivores and carnivores.

The cards show anime-style images of the plants and animals as cute girls. Foreign or alien species must be kept out to allow the native speices to flourish. A good balance must be kept, otherwise the ecology will collapse quickly. If there is too much food, the predators will increase and overload the system. If there is not enough food, the predators will die out.

Players can win in different ways. By eliminating alien species, they can achieve an aggressive win. By causing the other players' ecosystems to collapse, or eliminating three native species, they get a passive win. By maintaining a system and scoring more points, they gain a judgement win.

The designer likens the game to Tsume Shogi, which are Shogi puzzles in which a player must force a win or lose immediately. The game is designed to show the fragile nature of ecosystems in Japan.

The game can be played solitaire. A revised edition was published with extra cards, improved graphic design, added trivia and a supplementary set of rules by the designer.
user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Puzzle
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement
publishers: めめめのアトリエ (MeMeMe No Atelier)

name: The Game of Rival Armies
description:
This is a small version of Chivalry, on a board of 80 squares. Each side has six generals and fourteen regiments that start at opposite sides of the board. Players take turns by either making a Move or a Jump.

Generals can go in any direction, one square at a time, or by jumping over another game piece or pieces (own or opponent). 

Regiments can only move and jump forward (toward the opponent).

If a player jumps over an opponent’s piece or pieces, as in checkers, it is taken off the board.

And as in Chinese checkers, if jumping over a player’s own piece, it remains. Setting up opportunities to traverse the board towards the opponent’s Forts is advantageous.

Goal is the same, though: to capture both of the opponent's forts.

name: MATRX GIPF
description:
MATRX GIPF features the basic elements of GIPF combined with the move options from DVONN, PÜNCT, ZÈRTZ, YINSH, and TAMSK, opening up completely new tactical options that need to be mastered.

MATRX GIPF can also be used as an expansion for GIPF.

name: Lily Hop
description:
Lily Hop is a quirky and strategic 2-4 player game of hopping about as frogs and catching flies! The game consists of various types of tokens (lily pads), that each present a different pond creature that possesses a special power and ability. While some lily pads will aid a frog (the player) in collecting flies, others will hinder them in accomplishing this goal.

Lily pads are organized in circles and function as constantly changing rondels, leading to a constantly shifting game with strategies and plans changing turn-to-turn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Rondel

name: たべる（られる）Eat to live, not live to eat.
description: Eating (Eat to live, not live to eat.) The god of the savanna was furious. to greedy animals. One morning, a black panther, a mouse, a hyena and a lion wake up to find that their bodies have been replaced. A black panther becomes a lion, a mouse becomes a black panther, a hyena becomes a mouse, and a lion becomes a hyena. I don't know the work of the savanna god. In order to return to my original form, I must suppress the wrath of the savanna god and abandon my greed. The real intention hidden behind a simple game where you just eat meat. What is the motive of the savanna god... It's a simple game where the player becomes an animal and eats meat. However, the player who ate the most meat at the end of the game is fat and will be eaten and dropped out. Let's fight well and aim for the second place.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ironborn Reavers
description:
All along the cost of Westeros, sailors know to fear the Ironborn Reavers. Sightings of their longships are met with fear and trepidation. The Reavers are coastal raiders, ready to make quick assaults wherever they please. Now, these pirates loyal to House Greyjoy are bringing their swift hit-and-run tactics inland during all the chaos caused by the war for the Iron Throne.

The Ironborn Reavers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players a new melee assault unit for their forces. They are adept at grabbing loot from fallen foes, getting stronger as they decimate enemy units. However, being lightly armored, a smart commander would know when to pull back and let the Reavers regroup before joining in the fray once more.

Approximate Height
Captain: 39mm
Bannerman: 60mm
Reaver A: 39mm
Reaver B: 37mm
Reaver C: 38mm
Reaver D: 38mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures
  ‣ 1 Reaver Captain
  ‣ 1 Reaver Bannerman
  ‣ 11 Reavers
1 Attachment Card
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray (140x120mm)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Mind Game
description:
Mind Game is a 2 player bluffing game from Japan. Players have a simple set of cards and betting chips, and try to bluff each other to win chips by having the highest card.

Each player has a set of cards numbered 1 to 5 and a Trick Star card (effectively a zero that beats the 5). They also have a card marked Big, and one marked Small, and a set of plastic chips for betting.

The players place their Big and Small cards in front of themselves and then place a number card against each face-down. If the chosen cards are 1 to 5, the higher number goes against the Big, the lower against the Small. If the Trick Star card is chosen, it goes against the Big card if the other card is the 5, otherwise it goes against the Small.

The start player then chooses one of their face-down cards and puts it forward, with some chips bet on it. Their opponent must now advance their matching Big/Small card and match the bet in chips. The two cards are revealed and the highest wins, the player taking all the chips. The revealed cards are set aside and players can check them.

If the card values match, they are set aside and the betting chips are also set aside.

Then the players replenish their face-down cards, and move the cards to the appropriate Big/Small side. This might indicate that the previously Small card is now Big, and therefore what the values of the two cards might be.

Play continues with the Start marker alternating. The game ends when the hands are exhausted or when a player has run out of chips. the player with the most chips is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: お姫様と結婚詐欺師 (Ohimesama to kekkon sagi-shi)
description:
お姫様と結婚詐欺師 (Ohimesama to kekkon sagi-shi) is a push your luck card game from Japan for exactly 4 players. The title translates roughly as Princess and Marriage Scammer, and one player is the Princess receiving gifts from the other three scammers. The scammers take turns to offer a gift to the Princess, who can choose when to bank the gems she collects. However, if a scammer succeeds in scamming the Princess, they take the gems the Princess has not secured.

user summary

name: Atomic Smash
description:
A multiplayer science card game featuring the Atomatons, 118 chemical element characters and wild card individually designed by artist Pat Redding Scanlon.

Players ages 6+ learn the elements of the periodic table. First player to smash an element with another of the same type wins the match! Look out for the Radioactive elements - they can also smash other Radioactives!

Whoever smashes the most elements by the end of the game wins!

Game format: Card Game with 126 playing cards. (Card size: 2.5 x 3.5 inch) in a double rigid box with lid and base with accordion-fold rules.

name: Build the Stadium or BUST!
description:
This is a satirical game inspired by circumstances surrounding the Cleveland, Ohio professional football team and the construction of the city’s new stadium in the 1990s. (The rulebook, being written in a comedic and highly satirical tone itself, explicitly denies these connections to actual events.)

Each turn consists of rolling a 6-sided die, then drawing a card from the corresponding “Odd Roll” or “Even Roll” deck and following any instructions to add or remove tokens from one’s player board. When any one section of a player board is fully covered, that player draws a card from the “Build or Bust!” deck, which will either declare that player the winner or penalize them.

name: Flotsam Falls
description:
We may never know what has happened because the current is too strong to let us escape. The water rushes with an unrelenting pull. The world’s ocean plummets off the endless waterfall. What is below, we cannot see for the spray. What is upstream we cannot reach for the current. All we know is what floats past. Civilisation has crumbled and now its edifices bob with the current.

You see one now, a former museum perhaps, whatever it was it looks like it would make a good addition to your city. You wind up the giant electromagnetic harpoon cannon and bring the building into sight. In the distance, on the other side of the flow you see activity. Do they really think they are going to take this building from us? We need it more!

Welcome to the twin cities of Flotsam Falls.

The ends of the earth are just the beginning.

As players you’ll be guiding one of the two cities. Each round the remnants of once great civilisations will slowly drift down the flow towards the waterfall at the end of the world. You’ll use these remnants to expand your city. The player who scores the most points from their city will be the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Slide/Push, Tile Placement

name: Super Trooper: Final Conflict
description:
Super Trooper: Final Conflict is standalone expansion of science fiction fantasy crossover card game Super Trooper.

In the year 2500, humanity is not on a bed of roses. The polluted and contaminated planet Earth has become an inhospitable home for humanity, whose global population has split into two ideological factions.

The Progress Movement professes a techno-optimistic belief in never-ending virtual growth and progress through the constant development of new technologies. Poisonous air and water, along with a weakened atmosphere, have forced this segment of humanity to live in vast, mostly underground metropolises where most of the inhabitants hardly ever see sunlight. They have largely entrusted the fulfillment of their needs to robots and virtual reality.

The rest of humanity, left out in the wilderness, has gradually adapted to the changes. The Balance movement is guided by a fundamentalist philosophy of sustainability and total balance between man and nature. These communities are governed by strict rules regarding the behaviour and lifestyles of their members, which are enforced by severe penalties. Zero waste and near 100% recycling requires a demanding lifestyle, but contributes to their resilience.

In the metropolises of Progress, people had no idea that any civilized society could survive outside. When diminishing geothermal resources, coupled with fluctuating solar activity, began to cause increasingly frequent energy problems, they were forced to send explorers into the wilderness in search of new resources. To their surprise, vegetation returned to parts of the surface in the form of radioactive jungle, and they quickly began to replenish the energy necessary to run their cities by burning the biomass they harvested there.

The clash between Balance and Progress was not long in coming. Any hope of reconciliation is completely unthinkable for ideological reasons. The last clash in human history, the final conflict, begins.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Mapit
description:
Increase your knowledge of the WW1 terrain.

The Map Cards must be shuffled, cut and dealt in exactly the same way as ordinary playing cards; an equal number of cards being dealt to each player. The player to left of dealer lays a card upon the table, the next player must follow with a card on which the portion of map adjoins any side of the four sides of the card upon the table; if the player is unable to do this from the cards in his possession, or his knowledge of geography is insufficient to enable him to judge which card adjoins the card already out the player must call “ Pass,” and the next player must endeavour to play an adjoining card and so on.
Should a player play a card which does not join he must take back the card and ‘”Pass”.
No cards may be placed near to those on the table for the purpose of discovering the adjoining card, any player doing so forfeits his turn.
Only 30 seconds are allowed for consideration of the card to play.
Should there be one or two cards in excess when an equal number of cards have been dealt to each player, the remaining cards are placed on the table to start the game and the player can play the adjoining card.
The player who first places all his cards is the winner.

—user summary

name: Centivide
description:
Centivide is a math based card game where players participate in up to 6 rounds where 3 numbers between 1-13 are used to Add/Subtract/Multiply/Divide their way to 100 at the end of the game. While performing their operations they will gain points each time they hit 100 points or use division.

—description from the designer

name: Hide & Squeak
description:
A lighthearted competition between Ol' Lucy and a mischief of mice. Ol’ Lucy must protect her home from a band of mice that are intent on stealing cheese. The mice are trying to nab as much as possible, as quietly as they can, to keep the feline guardian from spotting them!

Hide & Squeak is a hidden-movement game for two players.
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Point to Point Movement, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Giddy Up
description: 3,2,1, Giddy Up! Ride Giddy Up in 3 fun games - Cross Country, Challenge and Training. In Cross Country - place the 10 command cards in an open space and Giddy Up. When you reach the card, do the command and then gallop to the next. How fast can you complete the track that you set? In Challenge, follow the commands that the horse gives you. Be careful though, do an incorrect action and your game is over. How well can you do? In Training, get used to Giddy Up with this freeplay game mod

name: 組み合わ戦隊ヘンセイジャー (Kumiawase Sentai Henseijya)
description:
組み合わ戦隊ヘンセイジャー (Kumiawase Sentai Henseijya) is a card game from Japan. Players form Sentai, squadrons of fighters, in the style of shows like Power Rangers. Can you save the earth from the invaders from another dimension?!

By combining their strengths, the players defeat a series of powerful monsters and villains. Players earn stars in combat and the player with the most stars by the end is the winner.

The player cards come in a wide variation of types and abilities. The costumed warriors have specialities, such as power, or weapons, and appear in nine different classes. Likewise, the attackers (either troops of low level goons, or powerful kaiju monsters) have their own strengths and special abilities. Only by combining the right classes and specialities, the players can defeat the monsters.

The cards come with a lot of text, so the game may be restricted to Japanese readers. However, the publisher rates the game as age 6+, so gameplay is not complex.
user summary

name: Rababia
description:
The raven queen of Rababia sends five animals as messengers to send secret messages to the raven king, whose castle is at the other end of the country...but not every animal can take every path. Lakes, swamps, cliffs, caves, and ravines are natural habitats for some animals, insurmountable obstacles for others.

At the beginning of Rababia, each player is secretly assigned an animal. All players use cards to move the five animal messengers on their way through the raven kingdom. Who can get their pet to the Raven King's castle first? Who succeeds in unmasking the role of the other players and gaining additional points for doing so?

—description from the publisher

name: Luda Ludo Battle-Yard Game
description:
Luda Ludo Games is an advance and improve version of the classic game of Ludo.
A registered modern version of the regular Ludo games. Our games are unique in design, made with strong material. The game is of skill and strategic thinking which comes with everything needed to play, treated frame wood, quality board with firm glass, a token of 4 different colours – red, yellow, blue and green, and two dices. And it comes with plastic to roll your dice. A game interesting to play.
This is an inexhaustible fun-filled version of Ludo board game. Enjoy this super Ludo game in series. Take a game, let fill your fun.

OVERVIEW
Ludo is an ancient and timeless board game. A popular game that has stood the test of time and will continue to do so, because it’s enjoy by everyone who comes across this game. A fun and calculative game. It can be played by both adults and children, and it is equally very easy to learn. Sharpens your mind and apply your analytical thinking. Easy to play. An educational and social game. One of the best physical game and can serve as both indoors and outdoors game.

Looking out to have a fun-filled weekend and holiday alone or with your friends and family members? Then this modern version of Ludo games make Ludo even sweeter than ever to play. Luda Ludo games is a fun time and quality advance Ludo series that every one will love to always use to exercise.

HOW TO PLAY
This is an advance dice-and-race board game of Ludo. Roll a six and race your 4 tokens from start to finish. It involves two to four players, players take turns in a clockwise order; the one who throw out the six dice starts the game. This means that a player must throw a 6 to move a piece from the starting point. Capture your opponent’s pieces and send them straight back to the starting area.

The basic rules for Ludo Battle-Yard Game is of the same with that of the regular Ludo. In this case, players race from top to down, down to top, moving forward & backward, following the arrow indicator. Start by rolling a six and race your seeds/tokens by moving to and from in order to strike any available opponent. The first that succeed all his game's out wins. Strategies and calculate your movement, watch out or you get strike. Be ahead!

—description from the designer

name: Luda Ludo X-Cross Game
description:
UPGRADE TO THE NEW LUDO GAME

Luda Ludo Games is an advance and improve version of the regular Ludo game. Luda Ludo games comes in different Ludo series. A registered modern version. This game is of skills, racing and strategic movement.
Quick to play! Endless Fun! Educative! Entertaining!

OVERVIEW
Ludo is an ancient and timeless board game. A popular game that has stood the test of time, because it’s enjoy by everyone who comes across the game. A fun and calculative game. It can be played by both adults and children, and it is equally very easy to learn and play. Sharpens your mind and apply your analytical thinking. An educational and social game. Serve as both indoors and outdoors game.

HOW TO PLAY
This is an advance dice-and-race board game of Ludo. Roll a six and race your 4 tokens from start to finish. It involves two to four players, players take turns in a ANTICLOCKWISE order; the one who throw out the six dice starts the game. This means that a player must throw a 6 to move a piece from the starting point. Capture your opponent’s pieces and send them straight back to the starting area.
Escape or take advantage of your opponent. Strategies and calculate your movement, watch out, you never know from what spot your opponent may come-out to strike you. Be ahead!

Looking out to have a fun-filled weekend and holiday alone or with your friends and family members? Then this modern version of Ludo games makes Ludo games interesting to play. Keep somebody happy by playing physical board game together ?.

Play Luda Ludo fun-filled games, the newest and amazing Ludo variants on the planet.

—description from the publisher

name: Kamigami Battles: Father Time Promo
description:
Released via the Japanime Games patreon.

Father Time is promo card # KBP-001

Act: 1 Energy: Look at the Top 3 cards of your deck. Choose 1 to put in your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your deck.
Act: 2 Energy: At the end of the Discard Phase, choose a card from your Discard pile and put it in your hand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Eine Seefahrt, die ist lustig ...
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 132 wins the game. The comic characters Alwin and Otto are featured in this game.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 5/87.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Zirkusparade
description:
Two games in one! Cut out the cards and put them together in a circle so that they all form a picture. Watch out! The drawings are continued in the adjoining picture cards!
Any number of players can participate. Everyone draws one of the face-down cards and tries to place it. After the first game, the dice are rolled, with two dice at the same time. If the number on the dice matches the dice representation on a card, the player may take the card. Who has the most cards at the end wins the game.

The game was published in the magazine Frösi Nr. 6/88.

—user summary

name: Im Gespensterschloss
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. If a ghost appears on the special die, it causes the pawns to flee in panic. If they stand on an even number (2, 4r 6 etc.) they dash 5 spaces forward, from an odd number (1, 3, 5 etc.) they go 5 spaces back. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.

The game was published in the magazine Frösi Nr. 8/87.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Des tranchées aux barricades
description:
Rules 15-28mm for interwar for skirmish battles.
Command is a important rules, it give to your unit the number of order for turn. Units are divided in three types: elite, regular, militia. Dice used for each are not quite good.

—user summary

name: Hin und her
description:
A game for two! Each player places a Halma stone on the big "1". They alternately move, in each case to the next higher or lower number. (Example: 1-2-3-4-3-2-3-4-5)
The first to find his way to the finish wins the game.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 1/87.

—user summary

name: Otto und Alwin im Labyrinth der Pyramide
description:
Start is space 1, goal is 78. The dice are rolled alternately and each player places their pawn accordingly on the numbered spaces. If a pawn comes to rest on a labyrinth, the player has to look for the right way and get on or through the indicated space with the next throw. The winner is the first to reach the ladder at the top of the pyramid.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 3/84.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Amazing Ocean-Food Chain
description:
Theme:
The most important thing that sea creatures is to find food and survive in the azure ocean.
Sea creatures will die becouse from garbage in the ocean.
We hoped that players can preserve the environment.

Game-play:
The game mechanic is Simultaneous Action Selection.
Each player picks one card from his or her own deck and place it face down on the table.
Perform the following actions according to the card content: "Foraging"、"Group"、"Food chain broken"。

Goal of the game:
When every player does not have any more hand card, the game is over. Add the total numbers on all the cards that a player earned will be the score.

name: Fuß vor Fuß in die Runde
description:
The sole cards are placed on a pile with the numbers face down and the sports equipment is distributed randomly on the spaces of the track. One after another the players draw a sole. They let their athlete run as many spaces forward as there are dots on the sole. Drawn soles are put back under the stack with the number face down.
If an athlete is on a space with sports equipment, he does not draw a sole on his next turn, but moves forward as many spaces as indicated on the equipment. The sports equipment cannot be thrown around a curve, so the athlete has to take the path straight ahead. Only on his next turn does he pull a sole again and goes back to the round track. However, if he gets on another piece of sports equipment on the outside path, he has to walk straight ahead on the track and then continue towards the finish line on his next turn.
On the high jump space: On his next turn the athlete advances only one space.
Hurdles: Place sports equipment in front of the hurdle, back up two spaces and try again on the next turn.
Arrow space: Athletes get lost and go straight ahead. Only on the next turn they return to the track.
Finish space: The athletes cross the red finish line and come to a standstill on the striped space. If they miss the finish space and cross the starting line, they have to do another lap around the track.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 3/84.

—user summary

name: Würfel-Roulett
description:
The starting positions of the discs is not important. The first player rolls the die and turns his disc in the direction of the arrow according to the number of spots. If two colored areas are congruent in the middle (orange arrow), he may roll the die again. otherwise it is the turn of the second player. He also rolls the die and then turns his disc in the direction of the arrow. The winner is the person who manages to line up two identical numbers in the middle by spinning their disc.

—user summary

name: Wettlauf der Schneemänner
description:
Two or four players can participate. If you play in pairs, each player receives 10 Halma figures (smowmen) of one color to place. With four players each takes only 6 figures. Two dice are rolled alternately.
If it is your turn, you must place one of your snowmen on the black circle in front of your starting square with every 6. According to the number of points rolled, the figures run from here in the direction indicated by the arrow on the starting space. It is up to each player whether he adds up the number of points on both dice and only moves one figure or places one figure for each die. Only one player's figures can occupy a space in twos or threes. Snowmen, who are resting alone on a square can be captured by an opponent's figure. The captured piece is returned to its original square and must be brought back into play with a 6. Only if you have all your snowmen on the track can you remove the figures from the game that have gone through all the spaces and returned to the starting space. The winner is the first to remove all of his snowmen from the track.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 2/79.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Schuss und Tor
description:
As basic equipment for this game you need 10 red Halma figures, 10 blue Halma figures and one green Halma figure.
You place the green Halma figure on the middle black field (it counts as a ball), Halma figures of the same color are placed on the base line in front of each goal, the 10th Halma figure is placed on a black dot in the goal.
Each player takes turns making a move. The game is set according to the Halma rules (one space forward, the figures are skipped). However, in our game, the figures may also be reset.
The player who first reaches a space before the center has possession of the ball and may play it. The ball is also placed according to the Halma rules of the game. It may be played over your own and opposing players. If the ball comes to rest between one of your own players and an opposing player after it has been placed, it is deemed to have been taken and the other player may place it. This also applies if the opposing player comes to a standstill next to the ball by moving his halma figure.
The goalkeeper may only move on the black dots, one square at a time.
If the ball lands on a black dot in the goal, this shot is counted as a goal and all figures must be returned to their original positions.
You can limit the time of the game (2x 20 minutes) or set a goal number.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 7/78.

—user summary

name: Kreuz und querweise
description:
Shuffle the number tokens and give each player five of these. In addition, everyone receives a different colored Halma figure.
These pawns are placed on the "Start" space. Now the first player plays a token and places his pawn according to the given number of points. On the left half of the board blue) the pawns may be moved orthogonal in any direction. When the pawn reaches the orange-colored half of the board, it may be moved only to the right and down. The winner is whoever gets their pawn very close to the target space or whoever has the fewest game points left. The spaces with a drawing may not be entered. You can also split the points, for example, on an 8, move three spaces to the right and five spaces down.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 4/79.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Square Grid

name: Geh den sichersten Schulweg!
description:
For this game you need two dice. Glue the cut-out traffic light discs (red and green) onto a die. One player gets the traffic light die and his neighbor gets the right die. In addition, each player gets a Halma figure.
The game starts at the top left in front of the house. The winner is the first to reach the school with a direct throw.
The player with the number die begins. Then his opponent rolls the traffuc light die. If the traffic light die turns green, the figure an be moved. If the dice traffic light shows red, the figure may not be moved and both dice must be passed on to the next players.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 9/80.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Frösi-Exkursion
description:
Each player alternately connects two dots (cities) of his color and tries to block the way of the opponent. The task for each player is to get from one side to the other, only forming a connected line at the end. It does not have to be drawn contiguously.
Red moves from top to bottom, black from left to right or vice versa. The opponent's lines may not be crossed. The first to establish a continuous line between the two sides is the winner.
Lines are always drawn horizontally or vertically, but never diagonally. The small dot boxes are for practice.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 7/78.

—user summary

name: Bunte Blütenblätter
description:
Each player gets a colored pencil or felt-tip pen of a different color. The die is rolled alternately. The players can choose their starting space as they wish. According to the number of rpoints rolled, continue counting from your starting space. Color in the space have reached with your colored pencil. Then it's the next player's turn.
If you roll a 6, you can roll again. If you get to a space that has already been painted, you may not paint it over with your own color. It is the next player's turn.
Since you can roll the dice again after every 6, you can add up these rolls if you can get to an empty space that way.
If nobody can use their crayon anymore, the round is over. The winner is the one who painted the most flower spaces with their color.
If you want to start the competition again, this time write your character in each space you have reached. Of course you can also use Halma figures to place them if you can no longer overlook which square each one landed on.

This game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 10/78.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Frösis kleine Friedensfahrt
description:
The players take turns to roll and move.

1st lap: On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Whoever reaches space 20 first gets 2 points time credit. The second driver 1 point. All others, depending on their arrival, minus points.

2nd lap: Time trial, the events doesn't count. Points are arwarded same as for lap 1.

3rd lap: same as lap 1

The player with the most points at the end of lap 3 wins the game.

This game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 5/69.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Feuerwerk
description:
You need a die and a pawn for each player. Whoever has a 6 starts. The pawns are moved on the yellow and orange stars. Throwing out is allowed. Only when the token is on a cloud is it untouchable.
If the token lands on an orange star, the next roll, based on the number of spots on the die, is placed in the direction of the star tip marked with the corresponding number (example: number of spots 5 - star tip 5). It can happen that a player has to go back the way he just came.
The first player to reach the red star wins the game.

This game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 12/88.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Heiter auf der Leiter
description:
The hats are placed in the treetop. The die is rolled alternately and the pawns are placed according to the number of points rolled. The pawns start with a ladder on the lowest branch. There the ladder is placed to reach the second branch, then the pawn goes down, get the next ladder, back up to the first branch, over the ladder to the second branch, place the second ladder, down, get the next ladder, etc. Upon arriving at the treetop the pawns get their hats and start climbing down.
The first player to stand on the ground next to the tree wearing a hat wins the game.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 12/88.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: De allerslimste mens ter wereld
description:
Boardgame based on a Belgian TV quiz. There are 5 different rounds to play. Depending on where your meeple is on the board you get a certain round question. With a good answer(s) you will advance on the board until someone will reach the final.

From that moment the final will be played. All players receive questions from the final round. With each good answer, the other meeples will go back one spot. This will continue until only one player is left.

—user summary

name: Stranded in Love
description:
Welcome to Ecuador's Bellavista Cloud Forest Reserve! This highly diverse ecosystem is home to one of the world's most dangerous and inhospitable terrains. In this date night, you and your partner will be dropped off in the center of this rainforest and must survive a series of challenges, ending with a perilous journey through the thick jungle and across crocodile-infested waters!

Much like surviving in the jungle, your relationship is filled with unexpected twists and turns. It can sometimes feel like you are alone in the wild, with no one there to help. But remember that you have the strongest survival tool around: each other.

The Stranded in Love date night box is perfect for couples that love to solve challenges together and enjoy a good action movie every once in a while.

name: Tricksdale
description:
Tricksdale is a game of diplomacy and resource management in which 3 to 6 players compete to win the king's favor by building the most illustrious district.

In Tricksdale, there are 5 clans that compete to dominate the valley: cats, mice, canines, owls, and bears. Players must leverage their influence over all clans to obtain the resources they need to attract the right business.

The game is played over 3 hands (e.g., seasons). At the beginning of each season, players receive 7 cards representing the clans and the resources players influence over.

Throughout each round, players will go through the stages that include:


Assembly: In this stage, players Play cards to gain resources and determine which clan is the most influential one in the next round
Trade: Each player can gain a business and add to their district. Alternatively, players may sell resources and obtain contracts from the royal court.
Collection: Each business established in the player's district can provide a special bonus triggered by the result of the assembly stage. Players may gain additional resources, gold, or victory points.


The season ends when all players have exhausted the cards in their hands. After all 3 seasons, the player with the highest victory point wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張１「烈花」(Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 1 「Rekka」)
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ　Ctrl-Z　拡張１「烈花」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 1 Rekka) aka 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z ／ ゼロ　拡張１「烈花」 Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z / Zero Expansion 1 Rekka is the first expansion set for 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero), a party-building and cooperative card game with a UNO-like engine and smartphone game theme. It is a set that adds unit cards and boss cards that are easy to handle like the first expansion set.

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の拡張セット１弾です。
最初の拡張セットらしく扱いやすいユニットカード、ボスカードが追加されるセットです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Card Barrage
description:
Card Barrage is a head-to-head dexterity-based tower defense game. Players hone their dexterity skills and finesse at card tossing through attacking your opponent’s castle. At the start of the game, players lay out a card to represent their castle and its surrounding wall cards. Each turn, players physically toss cards against the other player’s castle and surrounding wall cards. Players score points when their barrage cards land on the other player’s castle or wall cards. Wall cards can be damaged and destroyed through attacks. You can play solo, head-to-head or team vs team. Rules govern how you can toss cards to attack through the lob, Frisbee, or flip method.

OBJECTIVE – The objective of Card barrage is to score points through attacking your opponents’ castle and castle walls. Successfully tossed cards that land on your opponent’s castle or is surrounding wall cards will score a point.
GAME PLAY – Each turn players may build a wall, upgrade a wall, and attack. Build a wall by playing a card into a previously destroyed wall section. Upgrade a wall by exchanging a wall card with a card in hand. If you did not build a wall, attack an opponent’s castle and wall by tossing a card to score points.
GAME END AND WINNING – The game ends when one player has scored 10 points or destroyed all their opponent’s walls and then hits their opponent’s castle with all players getting an equal number of turns. The player with the most points wins.
THEME – Medieval Setting and Castle sieges

—description from the publisher

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張２「夜天」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 2 [Yaten])
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張２「夜天」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion2[Yaten]) aka 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z／ゼロ 拡張２「夜天」 (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z/Zero Expansion 2 Yaten) is the 2nd expansion set for 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero), a party building cooperative card game with a UNO-style engine and a smartphone game theme. It is a set that adds a unit card with conditional skills and a boss card.

The pack re-implements 精霊回路ドライヴ拡張セット第１弾「夜天術式」 (Seirei Kairo Doraibu Kakutyou Setto dai1dan 「Yaten Jutsushiki」).

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の拡張セット２弾です。
条件付きのスキルを持つユニットカード、その他にボスカードが追加されるセットです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張３「神代」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 3 [Shindai])
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張３「神代」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 3 [Shindai]) aka 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z／ゼロ 拡張３「神代」 (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z/Zero Expansion 3 Shindai) is the 3rd expansion set for 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero), a party building cooperative card game with a UNO-like engine and smartphone game theme. The pack contains a set of 3 expansion sets that adds an attractive and powerful high-cost unit. In addition, normal enemy cards are also added.

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の拡張セット３弾です。
拡張セット３弾で、魅力的な強力な高コストユニットが追加されるセットです。その他に通常の敵カードも追加されます。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張４ 「幻創」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 4 [Gensou])
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張４ 「幻創」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 4 [Gensou]) aka 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z／ゼロ 拡張４ 「幻創」 (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z/Zero Expansion 4 Gensou) is the 4th expansion set for 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero), a party-building cooperative card game with a UNO-like engine and smartphone game theme. This set adds a unit card with a level-restricted awakening skill and a boss card.

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の拡張セット４弾です。
レベル制限の覚醒スキルを持つユニットカード、その他にボスカードが追加されるセットです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張５ 「刃雷」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 5 [Jinrai])
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張５ 「刃雷」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 5 [Jinrai]) aka精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z／ゼロ 拡張５ 「刃雷」 (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z/Zero Expansion 5 Jinrai) is the 5th expansion set for The Wet Werewolf, a party-building cooperative card game with a UNO-like engine and smartphone game theme. This set adds gimmicks unique to this expansion set, unit cards with charging ability, and boss cards.

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の拡張セット５弾です。
この拡張セット固有のギミック、充電能力を持つユニットカード、その他にボスカードが追加されるセットです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Coin Combat
description:
The coins in the vault are getting restless because no one is using them anymore. They have decided that they need to find out, once and for all, which is better: Heads or Tails? The Heads and Tails get into position to battle against the other team - but only one will remain as the ultimate champion

Contained in Casual Game Insider Magazine CGI#42(2023).

name: Dinoloo
description:
Welcome to the land of happy dinos! Our dinos are ready to play with you. Roll the dice to find their matching hidden eggs. Be the first to collect six dinosaurs to win! Memory and a little luck will help you succeed in this fun prehistoric eggspedition!

Contents: 12 Wooden Dinosaurs. 12 Wooden Coloured Eggs. 4 Scoring Boards. 2 Wooden Coloured Dice. Illustrated Rules

name: Wissens-Quiz
description:
1000 questions from 10 different categories (e.g. science, fairy tales, horses, sports etc.).

Game play is pretty simple: You roll the die to see which category you can choose from. If you answer the question correctly you advance on the scoreboard. Whoever reaches the final space first is the winner.

Although it has almost the same title and is made by the same company it's not to be confused with the game 'Das Wissens-Quiz'. This one has no board (except the scoreboard).

name: Gent Expert
description:
Gent Expert is a question and answer game.
You roll the dice to pick a category and score points.
Categories:

History, Politics, Geography
Showbusiness, Sports
Tourism, Culture and gastronomy
Shopping, Economics


Gain Points with the right answer, loose points with the wrong one.

It's all about the Beautiful City, Ghent in Belgium.

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張６ 「円環」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 6 [Enkan])
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z 拡張６ 「円環」 (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion 6 [Enkan]) aka 精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z／ゼロ 拡張 ６ 「円環」 (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z/Zero Expansion 6 Enkan) is the 6th expansion set for 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero), a party-building cooperative card game with a UNO-like engine and smartphone game theme. In addition to Unit Cards and Boss Cards, this set adds Geass Cards to strengthen the enemy.

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の拡張セット６弾です。
ユニットカード、ボスカード以外に、敵の強化となるギアスカードが追加されるセットです。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z レイドボックス (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion [Raid-BOX])
description:
精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z レイドボックス (Spirit Circuit Drive Zero Expansion [Raid-BOX]) aka 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z／ゼロ レイドボックス (Seirei Kairo Drive: Ctrl-Z/Zero Expansion 7 Raidbox) is a special expansion set for 精霊回路ドライヴ Ctrl-Z / Zero (Spirit Circuit Drive Ctrl Z / Zero), a party-building cooperative card game with a UNO-like engine and smartphone game theme. This set allows you to challenge the high-difficulty raid mode. A unitized boss card will also be added.

UNO風のエンジン＋スマホゲームテーマのパーティー構築・協力型カードゲーム「精霊回路ドライヴCtrl-Z」の特殊な拡張セットです。高難易度のレイドモードに挑戦できるようになるセットです。
またユニット化したボスカードも追加されます。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Port Xpert Shipping
description:
A game for Havencentrum Antwerpen to teach about important roles in the logistical chain of transport.

The players play the role of either a Forward or a Shipping Agent. By fulfilling assignments and working together, players receive points.

At the end of the game, there's 1 best Forwarder and 1 best Shipping Agent.

name: Ript Showdown
description:
Ript Showdown features two options on each card, allowing disc golfers to choose a side to play based on their style.

Players begin the round with 3 cards and draw additional cards based on their score for each hole. You can be Good and play a defensive game or Bad and attack your opponents mercilessly. Either way you hope to be Lucky in the end and pull off a win!

name: Let's Play Who's An Angel
description:
Start at the bear and look way up there... there's an Angel at the top of the Christmas tree!

Grab a button to use as a token, then draw an ornament from the shuffled pile and move ahead along the board track... but watch out for the spaces with setbacks (goats eat your peanuts, ornaments break, monkeyshines and giraffe necks). If you've been nice this year, Santa may smile on you and give you a boost with a tasty peanut or an extra turn.

Keep shuffling and drawing ornaments each round in a race to the top of the tree to see who will arrive first and become the Angel!

This simple boardgame is from the back cover of the book "Christmas at the Little Zoo", written by Beth Vardon and Illustrated by Charlot Byi. The book itself is undated, but was most likely self published sometime in the USA in the 1950's.

name: TranZformations
description:
We all had it, and those of us who survived assumed the risk was over. But the latest variant is different, oh so different…

Each of the 9 cards in this micro party game lists one symptom in your zombie transformation. One card is set aside and represents the BrainZ (yummy yummy!). Each player gets one card face down in front of them, and the rest go face down in the middle.

On your turn, you look at your card and start acting out that symptom (as well as any previous symptoms), then swap your card with any other card. As the symptoms develop and spread you must use observation and elimination to deduce what is on the BrainZ card. If you are right, you are cured and win. Otherwise you die and the other players continue...

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Man's Best Friend
description:
Protect the last known survivor of humanity who has awoken from stasis - naked and afraid - to a nuclear winter where doggos are hyper-sentient.
1-4 players play canine cards who trace their breeds back to famous pups from all across human history.
Your mission?
Defy your common enemy - Felis Catus Duplicitus. Protect the frail and hapless animal known as 'Man' from themselves - they are, after all the last of their breed.

With clever planning and synergy, different dog cards and breeds produce combos and intercept the cruel and canny Cats who call this nuclear waste their hunting grounds.
Canis Lupus Familiaris - assemble!

—description from the designer

name: Bayeux Question
description:
Cards are shuffled.
The first player takes a card from the pack and calls out the letter in the top right hand corner.
The person to the left of the player takes a card from the pack and asks the question corresponding to the letter given by the first player. The correct answer is underlined.
If the player answers correctly, he keeps the card and the game continues.
If the player answers incorrectly, the cards are put back into the pack and the game continues.
If a Joker is revealed, the person revealing it can keep it.
The winner is the first player who gets the 7 cards of the same colour or who has more cards of the same colour than the others at the end of the game.

name: Escape Box: Steampunk
description:
For weeks, a mad zeppelin, the Relempago, has been roaming the skies.

He has killed his entire crew, and robots in his pay are capturing new victims.

Now it's your turn to be locked up on board the flying ship!

You'll have to solve the machine's riddles and put it out of action in order to be the first to tell the story of your adventure aboard the airship.

name: Krake beim Schneider
description:
Berlin illustrator and author Nadia Budde has created an adorable memo game from her universally appreciated, highly successful ZEIT column "Tiere wie wir" ("Animals like us"). 36 animal encounters populate this game, and they are all tied together with an animal two-liner: Laundry smooth, raccoon flat; octopus at the tailor, two long dresses. This lovingly designed memo game is packaged in a small-format sewing box. As an additional gimmick without function, there is a cardboard tape measure populated by the animals of the game.
The Octopus at the Tailor appeals to young and old and is the perfect family memo.

—description from the publisher

name: Affenkuss & Kokosnuss
description:
The monkeys are loose in the jungle! As fast as they can, they climb the big palm tree to harvest the coconuts. But watch out! The giant tree snake is also on its way to the top of the palm tree. Will the monkeys manage together to get all the coconuts to safety before the snake reaches the top? A fast-paced climbing game with cute monkeys and funny "grimaces" (mouth motor exercises) begins.

The play accessories for "Affenkuss & Kokosnuss" (engl. "Monkey Kiss & Coconut") (16 pcs.) are made exclusively from wood in a small company in Germany. The game works as a cooperation game, but also as a betting game. Classically as a memo or large board game.

name: Troll Dich
description:
The greedy troll has stolen the dwarves' treasure and taken it to his mountain. He knows that the dwarves want to get it back. That's why he runs back and forth between his kingdom and the dwarves' kingdom to catch the dwarves. If he succeeds, the treasure will be his forever and he will have won. Fortunately, the dwarves have the support of Aquarius and Fairy.

The game is suitable for children from three years and has the peculiarity that the group of players together wins or loses against the troll. The players do not compete against each other. Especially for children who are just starting with board games and are still learning to endure the frustration of losing, this game is an enrichment.

The game Troll dich! combines ideas and design of our children's book author and illustrator Kristin Franke with the traditional craft of Erzgebirge folk art. The figures are hand-turned and made by toy maker Tino Günther, the famous inventor of the virologist incense man.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Exilegard
description:
Exilegard is an open source miniature skirmish wargame where you lead a warband of exiles through a dying far far future sci-fantasy setting. The game uses preplanned alternating activation and asymmetrical RPS combat with dice. Your warband has a common pool of HP and you choose if miniatures die when they take damage. You will also need to pay attention to cover and flanking in order to win.

—description from the designer

name: BIGGIES
description:
The BIGGIES are huge space container ships. Their job is to transport cargo, but first the cargo must be loaded inside the cargo bay. Load it up as quickly as possible and be the first to pack your ship to the top!

Each player get a copy of one of six ships with a 28x40 sized cargo bay grid. Now take turns rolling 2 dice to determine the size of the different cargo pieces. For example a roll of 4 and 5 gives you a 4x5 container, that you can rotate and place either way on the grid. In this matter you fill up each row horizontally, with each block having to touch the previous, before you can start the next row on top, going from left to right. Also some special interactions between the players when doubles are rolled.

Be the first one to touch the top of the cargo bay to win!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Educational, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: What a Wonderful COVID-19 Vaccine
description:
This is a satirical game about silly conspiracy theories regarding the ingredients of the COVID-19 vaccine. It was originally released at Tokyo Game Market Fall '22 in a Ziploc bag.

Players play ingredients of a single value face down in front of them, then simultaneously reveal their cards. The player with the highest total value may play their ingredient onto the research board and move up the appropriate track (RIDICULOUS, IMPACTFUL, TASTEFUL, or INTELLECTUAL). Players who did not win draw new cards. At the end of the game, players score for their three lowest tracks.

The rules also include a co-op mode.

name: Evenquads: Deck 2 of 4
description:
Play even more mathematical games with this double-sided deck that commemorates the 50th anniversary of the Association for Women in Mathematics! EvenQuads games use symbols representing four major mathematical organizations and EvenBetter games use the flip sides featuring amazing women mathematicians.

All included games are mathematical. EvenQuads games challenge your matching speed as you collect Quads, as solitaire, with friends or in a rummy version. EvenBetter games help you learn about the featured women. All games are specially designed to accommodate our unique double-sided cards.

Deck 2 (of 4) of EvenQuads includes 64 cards, an insert with instructions in both English y Español for three games, and a description of the EvenQuads mathematics. The Association of Women in Mathematics website includes rules for additional games utilizing the cards from both Decks 1 and 2.

Evenquads: Deck 2 functions as a stand-alone game, or it can be combined with Evenquads: Deck 1 as an expansion.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching

name: Evolve Wrestling
description:
Everything you need to start playing the Evolve Wrestling card game! The set includes 14 wrestler cards featuring stars from Evolve Wrestling including Johnny Gargano, Riccochet, Rich Swann, and The Best Friends. It also includes the Evolve Handbook, featuring bios for all the wrestlers. This set also includes starter instructions and needed charts.

—description from the publisher

name: That Dog Won't Hunt
description:
This is a hilarious game of WHO CAN BLUFF THE BEST with a Southern twist! "A little fibbin' goes a long way!"

To win a round of That Dog Won't Hunt - you have to be the best bluffer - or be really darn lucky. If you're the only one left with a dice at the end of the game - you WIN!

Liar's dice with a Southern twist - the dice are our own design with Bless Your Heart, Possums, Pecan Pie, Cast Iron Skillets, Steaming Biscuits and of course Kudzu is WILD! HA!

—description from the publisher
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Advance Local Media LLC

name: Fog of Love: A Visit to La Sagrada Família
description:
Promo card for Fog of Love that came together with a promo card for Sagrada.

“Take it all in! The stained glass! The facades! 200 years of history! A two hour wait! During your trip to Barcelona, you decide to visit Gaudi’s majestic La Sagrada Família. It’s unspeakably beautiful. It’s also unspeakably touristy. How are you feeling about the experience?”

name: Trip-It Railway Game
description: A train game where you move your chosen engine along the tracks with the objective to pass each of the 24 stations on the board. Each player’s engine starts at one of 4 London stations (Paddington, Euston, King’s Cross, and Waterloo) and moves along twinned track. The track has coloured spaces that when landed upon require the moving player to draw one or more cards that have various consequences. There are also numbered spaces on the track that when landed upon indicate the number of cars to be added behind the engine - thereby affecting the speed at which the engine moves. The number of cars and engine speed is tracked on individual player cards. A chart is consulted and a single die is rolled to determine engine speed/movement, which stays in effect until the number of cars changes. Slower engines can block faster moving engines going the same direction and you may have to wait until an oncoming engine (placed on the board from a drawn card) goes to a siding before moving forward.

name: Towerz
description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players inspired by an app that is now gone.

In turn each player adds a piece to the board in any empty space, and if 3 or more pieces of the same height are orthogonally connected, the other pieces are removed from the board and an extra piece is added to the piece just played.

When the board is full , (no more empty spaces) the winner is the player with the most pieces on the board

name: Smiles
description:
A pure guessing game, not much room for skill.
The pack is shuffled and placed face-down. The first player has to predict the colour of the top card (Red, Green, Blue or Yellow). If correct he takes the card and can try again. If wrong the turn passes to the next player. Game ends when all the cards have been taken.
As per the title of the game, the winner holds the Smiley Badge and the loser holds the Sad Badge.

—user summary

name: Turtle Game: Mini-Europe
description:
Turtle Game: Mini-Europe is a game similar to the Game of Goose. You start at one point of the gameboard and end at the finish.
Throughout the map you get to learn about Europe's Economy, Culture, Buildings, Successes, etc.

This game was designed for Mini-Europe, it's a miniature park in Brussels, Belgium.
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Negotiation, Party Game, Racing, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Forest Trails: Autumn Spooktacular
description:
A new Event map to play using the core rules from the base game Forest Trails.

These are premium maps based on special Forest Events which feature new, additional, game actions, player interactions and new objectives.

Play Trick and Treat to please visitors. Plan routes for the ghostly land train and take visitors past areas of interest for more points (The Green Man Experience, pumpkin patch and bat caves).
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stroke of Genius
description:
Stroke of Genius is a card game for 3-5 players aimed at medical students and residents to teach and exercise Neurovascular concepts and differential skills. It replaces traditional faculty led case discussions, and has been rated 5 out of 5 by trainees for fun, efficacy, and ease of play. Participants play cards representing anatomy, predisposing condition, pathology, and pathophysiology to an evolving case. Play is most effective in a proctored setting to settle disputes and explain concepts.

—description from the designer

name: Pushing Seven
description:
A Black Jack type game where you play and draw dual-sided cards in an attempt to get to as close to 7 without going over. Players take turns either drawing or playing cards in an attempt to get the perfect score. Use your resources carefully.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cabbage & Rooster
description:
Cabbage & Rooster is a trick-taking game AND a tile-laying game.

You're trying to farm the most Eggplants, Carrots and Tomatoes.

First you play a trick of cards. Then everyone lays down a tile.

The cards played determine who may put down a farmer, and who may recruit a Wily Cabbage to help against the tyrannical Roosters. The game integrates the card game with the tile game, and includes rules for both. It is appropriate for intermediate to experienced gamers.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: Lenox Ave 35
description:
Welcome to Lenox Avenue, Harlem, New York 1935! Where the nightclubs are hot, the entertainment is hotter, and the magic does not begin until midnight! Lenox Ave 35 is a lightweight matching and tableau building game for two players. Your goal in the game is to earn points by signing contracts for performers to your club’s revue, combining with their favorite songs to earn additional points.

In Lenox Ave 35, you will compete with another nightclub owner to put on the best music revue for the evening. To sign contracts with entertainment performers and select songs for the show, both players have to deal with a chaotic agent that controls the entertainment world in Harlem, laying down restrictive rules, but also awarding points as you satisfy their whims. Make the right moves for your club and maximize your points. The player with the most points earned at the end of the game is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Matching, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: GeoSnakes
description:
In GeoSnakes, players race to be the first to move all of their pieces across the board. Using a bit of luck, players will want to think strategically about how to quickly make their way across without getting tangled up.

This game is easy to learn and one that families will enjoy playing together. With two ways to play, GeoSnakes will provide hours of fun for young and old alike.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Die Rheinreise
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the North Sea wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to "Meidinger's Kinder-Kalender 1915".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Primary
description: Win the most cards by matching primary and secondary colors in different combinations and ratios, going from simple (red + blue = purple) to complicated (red + blue + yellow = black).

name: The Golden Trout
description:
The biggest day in the fishing calendar has arrived. Participants from all over the quaint and somewhat quirky English village of Upper Wallingham have arrived to compete for the ‘Golden Trout’ – a trophy only the best can win.

Choose the best fishing locations along 5 stretches of the river, load up your bait and fish like you’ve never fished before.

A colourful roll and write, number placement and fish drawing game. Game Play comes in two modes - Beginner and Pro Fishers with low ink and colour game sheets.

Before the tournament begins, each fisher (player) rolls 1 or 2 dice to see what type of zone their middle stretch of the river will become for the duration of the game. This alters fishing strategies for individual players for varied game play.

Game Play:

Roll 2 dice (2 six-sided die) and use the numbers to decided where to enter them (fish) on each turn. There are 5 zones along the river to choose from, with 25 fishing spots. The catch (pun intended) is that number entry must be in order with no repeats.

Fishers may alternatively use their turn to buy worm bait or upgrade equipment. Fishers will need to manage worm bait carefully - this is used to alter dice numbers and is essential for tricky fishing spots. You only get a certain number of turns before the tournament is over so make every one count.

Scoring:

Players complete zones to start scoring points and increase their points by fishing twice in the same spot and drawing fish. Completing certain zone combinations will get you bonus points. Pro Fishers have more ways to score and play.

Pro fisher mode:

Pros may use 'hot zones' that change on each turn.

Fishing in hot zones catches high scoring or multiple fish - but avoid river rubbish or points will be deducted!

Pro fishers will need to balance buying and using bait, upgrading fishing weights and utilising hot zones productively to get the high scores.
—description from the publisher

name: Cazadores
description:
Cazadores is a cooperative miniatures game about tracking and hunting monsters, beasts, and other things that go bump in the night. It can be played solo or with up to 4 players with 1-4 miniatures per side.

Game Pitch
Each player creates a Cazador, a brave and formidable hunter hellbent on defeating fearsome mythical beasts, twisted beings, uncanny horrors, and other terrifying Adversaries. Cazadores are joined by a rare few Companions willing to follow them into the wilderness, through the desert, across mountains, and into the lairs of monstrous things and the darkness between the planes.

Cazadores is a narrative-focused game that can be played solo or cooperatively. It only requires 1-4 miniatures per side and a 24"x24" space, making it a perfect kitchen table game and introduction to those new to the miniatures hobby.

Features
A simple d10 dice pool system that resolves actions in a single roll (e.g., to hit, damage, and modifiers)
A Time-based initiative system where actions cost "Ticks" contributing to a more dynamic flow for combat.
Streamlined stats and decision trees that make Foes' actions easy to determine and execute.
Unique attacks and abilities for Adversaries using a standard deck of playing cards to make them special and intriguing enemies.

Design Goals
The game was inspired by my desire to get more use out of miniatures from big box board games, usually from Kickstarter, like Blood Rage, Kingdom Death Monster, etc., that just don't see the table that often. Frankly, it also helps I can work on it while not being able to meet in person with others.

The current version has five Adversaries to take on but more are coming and the guts of the system are there. With a little imagination you can run with this to set up your own Hunts.

—description from the publisher

name: Deadly Missions
description:
You are the owner of a starship, flying out into the galactic expanse to make your fortune, gather prestige and make scientific discoveries! Hire a captain and crew, warp across the sectors revealing them as you go! Exploring each Quadrant to gather resources, claim them as your own, establish colonies, and gain advantages.

This is a science fiction game of mission solving, victory point gathering, with lightweight 3X elements. Explore, Expand, Exploit, but without Exterminate. (No violence please)

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Pieces as Map, Resource to Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Just Like Mama Used to Say: Granny's House Expansion
description:
50 card expansion for Just Like Mama Used to Say

From the box back:

Almost as good as Granny's Pecan Pie

50 new cards that are funnier than the time we put that fake snake in Paw Paw's bait bucket
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Insurgent Earth: Operation String Bet
description:
Operation String Bet is a five-mission campaign supplement for Insurgent Earth – Resist or Die, the science fiction, tabletop miniatures game of survival and combat on Earth after a massive alien invasion.

Designed to accommodate up to five players, (five Resistance characters) Operation String Bet offers new Player Character options, new equipment, and new Alien Occupation Force enemies.

The invaders are building something in the old industrial park south of town. Whatever it is, they're very protective - which means you definitely need to blow it up.

The Global Resistance Network is offering help, so grab your weapon, gather your friends, and head out. This planet isn't going to save itself.

NOTE: This is a supplement for INSURGENT EARTH. You need that core rule book to get the most out of this material.

name: Poison Researcher
description:
Story
Becoming a researcher studying poison, I came to the sea to investigate poisonous creatures. I want to collect as many creatures as possible, but if I collect a lot, I will mishandle the creatures and get poisoned. Will you be able to successfully collect them and advance your poison research?

Poison Researcher is a trick-taking game with the theme of poisonous creatures of the sea.
To start a game, first remove cards from deck equal to the number of players and return them back to the box (they are not used in this game). Distribute the remaining cards to the players (12 cards per player).
The starting player chooses any one card from the dealt cards and plays it face up. After that, all other players play one card from their hand in clockwise order, adhering to must follow rules. After all cards have been played, the person with the highest number written on their card wins.
When you run out of cards, count the number of times you won (the creature cards you won). The player with the second most wins receives two Poison tokens, and the player with the third most wins receives one Poison token. The player with the most wins gets nothing. This is repeated as many times as the number of players, and the player who gets the most tokens wins.
If there are multiple 2nd place players, the player with the most poisonous cards wins as 2nd place.

name: 植民地資本主義 (Colonize)
description:
植民地資本主義 ("Colonize") is a worker placement game in which players create companies as capitalists, secure colonial interests, and gain social prestige. Players aim to win the final game by gaining victory points through their own actions.
The winner is the player with the most victory points at the end of three generations in the game.
So grab your bag of gold coins and embark on a journey to capitalize the world.
There are two types of cards in the game.
These are the "Corporate Card", which is a workplace where workers are placed to generate funds, and the "Colonial Card", which produces a Colony Concession Icon that strengthens the effect of the Company Card and is a condition for goals.
The basic game flow is that the player pays the cost on the upper left of the card on his turn, purchases the card from the market, demonstrates its effect, and moves to the next player's turn.
The number of yellow shields drawn on the card is the "victory point", and the player who finally got the most of this is the winner.
You can also get victory points for achieving various "goal cards" and the majority of each icon, which will annoy the player.

name: うしのひ (Cow Day)
description:
Catch eels to the point of extinction so as not to be outdone by other fishermen! An eel overfishing card game featuring
bluffing and chicken racing ! Seeking good fishing, misleading rivals, and catching them to the point of extinction. This is an advanced brain battle between humans who are crazy about eels. If extinct, the fisherman with the lowest catch wins. Is there an answer to the question that simple rules pose to modern society...?

name: Στρουμφ (Smurf)
description:
A Smurfs themed board game, made in Greece in the early 80's. It can be played from to 2 to 4 players. There is no dice, instead there is a wheel with numbers.

Each player in his turn spins the wheel, and moves in the board the exact spaces, as the number you have in the wheel. There are some spaces on the board, where when you reach them you have to pick a card and follow the order that is written on it.

The winner is the first player, who reaches the end point (number 100).

—user summary

name: Carnavalesco: Fifth Player Expansion
description:
An additional parade board and 36 dice for a fifth player.

The dice can be included at lower player counts, if desired.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Carnavalesco: Black Dice
description:
These 31 black dice can be used in three different ways:


For color-blind players, they can replace one of the six colors of dice that come with the base game.
They can be added to the game as a seventh color.
Black dice drawn from the bag cannot be drafted, meaning there will be few dice to choose from.

name: Livornopoli
description:
Basically just Monopoly, but set in the Italian city of Livorno (Leghorn). Some board adjustment are made (e.g. there are now 2 yellow fields and 3 purples) as well as theming the cards around famous locations or stereotypes of the city.

Everything was re-made from scratch, with all illustrations being hand-drawn. It first came out in 2005 but has since seen numerous prints. Explore the streets of Livorno, their famous statues, squares, but most importantly, their local food.

"E’ un’immersione nella “livornesità”, racconta i livornesi e la cultura popolare di Livorno. Un 5 e 5 da Gagarin, un Ponce dar Civili, un panino da Giovanni, un frate in Piazza Cavallotti…e la domenica tutti allo Stadio a vedere il Livorno."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Nothing Personal: Danny "The King" Geekini Promo Card
description:
A special Gangster card from Game Boy Geek Season 4 Kickstarter.

"If Danny ever becomes Capo, the controlling player immediately receives 6 Respect."
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: TAPLE
description:
Played with colored Velcro strips and fluffy balls on a special playmat, the goal of TAPLE is to place all of your Velcro strips into the play area.

Players gain the ability to place a strip by rolling or shooting their fluffy balls through opponents' arches or rings. The shots and placement of the strips can be quite creative, though the rules have some guidance on what is not permitted.

name: Plus!
description:
Plus! will challenge your SUM and BLUFF skills to achieve victory. To do this, you need to ask your opponents for a COLOR of cards and hope to form a set that adds up to 25.
But be prepared for the unpredictable, as you can receive the GRAY LETTER. That's why BLUFF becomes such an important strategy.
Gather your crew and join the fun!

name: O.P. Arena: Mr. 7 Minutes Abs Promo Card
description:
A special Promo Card from Game Boy Geek's 2016 Season 4 Kickstarter.

"1: Pecs of Fury: 4 or Higher - Do 3 damage to up to two dudes.
2: Muscle Bulge(persistent): Each damage on this dude increases his base attack damage by 1."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Scouts Out: Raids and Reconnaissance in 1914-1918
description: A quick and simple 28mm skirmish game set in the historic Great War of World War 1. Take control of small raiding parties, from raiding the enemy trenches to rescuing downed pilots. The ruleset is designed in mind for the busy gamer, no more 3 hours games, get in play and have a blast all before your little one wakes from a nap.

name: 大財族 (Dai Zai Batsu)
description: A Landlords-variant from Konami. Players move around the board, buying property. Property values increase or decrease based on the weather. The weather is determined by card draws.

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 30
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 30 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


Stormbird Battle Armor
Onuris Attack VTOL Prime/A/B/C/D/E
Pike Support Vehicle (LB-X/Clan/RAC/Plasma)
SRM Carrier C
LRM Carrier C
Vulcan VT-7T
Whitworth WTH-2H
Hellcat (Hellhound II)
Conjurer (Hellhound) 6
Hellcat-P (Hellhound II-P)
Hoplite 5C
Grizzly 3
Highlander IIC 4
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Ring Routes: Icelandic Summer
description:
The Ring Routes – Icelandic Summer is family-oriented board game which will guide you through Icelandic landscapes, winding roads and hidden touristic treasures. It will introduce you to many tourist attractions and activities on the island – the very famous ones as well as those still undiscovered. It’s the first guide book which you can play and a perfect game for anyone who is dreaming or planning to visit Iceland!

It is an innovative hybrid board game for 2-5 players supported with a mobile application. It is designed in such a way to help you plan your trip to Iceland in real life. To do so, choose how many days you want to spend on the island and how many companions will you have.
