This decision will determine the level of the difficulty of the game and time needed to finish it. The more players and the less time you have, the more difficult it will be to achieve your goals. So watch closely what the others are doing and react when it is needed!

It may be a difficult task to plan your trip when you and your friends have different dream locations to visit and unfortunately time is limited for everyone. Moreover, all of you share the same rental 4×4 car, change as a driver frequently and face obstacles on your way, so sometimes you will need to make compromises. Remember, you won’t ever be able to see everything.

There are multiple routes to choose from to reach your goals. Use your skills and planning techniques to seize the opportunities, react to the constantly changing situation on the road and convince other players to go where you would like to. Play it wisely (or mean!). This trip will be a real test for your characters. Travelling in a group is never an easy task however if you manage it well then you can go anywhere together!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Interrupts, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Rolling In It
description:
The game board is an eight-lane alley with a disc launcher at one end and a slot for each lane at the far end. Each slot will reward the person who launched the disc with a cash reward if a multiple choice question is responded correctly, a loss of money, or the opportunity to steal money from an opponent. The risks and rewards increase after every third round.

After fifteen rounds, all lanes are designated either “Win” or “Lose.” Starting with the player or team that has won the most money and going in descending order each entity launches one last disc. The game ends with the first to launch a disc into a Win lane for victory.

This is a faithful adaptation of the television series.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Erdei lakoma
description:
The Erdei lakoma is a roll and write game, where the players goal to deliver as much animal to the restaurant in the middle of the forest as they can. For that you have to make roads from the edge of the board to it's center so they can reach it.The active player rolls and chooses from the dice. The other players can draw the remaining dice result. The game can end in two ways.
1. One player could manage to reach the restaurant with all of her/his animals.
2. Somebody has 2 Sectors filled on her/his board.
Who got the most points will win the game.
The game contains 3 game variations.
Mouse for 5-6 years old, Llama for 7-8 years old and Elephant for 8+ years old.
These variations are getting more complex.
The game in not going to be available at the market. The Pénziránytű foudation would like to use it for kindergartens and for schools with teaching purpose, to be used as a tool of a financial sensitization program.

—description from the designer

name: El huerto
description:
You are part of a community of neighborhood orchards. Among all the people who form the most sustainable and healthy garden so that products are environmentally friendly. But strange things are happening and some orchards have serious problems that are preventing crops from developing properly.

Will you be able to get your garden to have all the essential elements?

name: El Timeline de los Derechos Humanos
description:
Are you ready to be the fastest of your friends in history?
Do not hesitate any more and play with us the TimeLine, of human rights where you will see and learn scenarios and characters where historical events have occurred and passed, from 2000 years ago to our days.

name: ヘビーソルジャー (Heavy Soldier)
description:
Powered Suit, "Combat shell" and armored vehicle combat in 2150 on TTRPG "Metal Head" world.
It can use as expansion for TTRPG Metal Head, vice versa.

name: Kro-ko-dil-Spiel
description:
The players must try to form whole words from the individual syllable cards. Only those who skilfully collect cards, trade them or negotiate with fellow players can put the words back together correctly.

The correct composition of the individual words is facilitated by the illustrations on the cards.

—user summary

Au-to oder Was-ser-lei-tung - die Abbildungen auf den Karten helfen, die Wörter wieder richtig zusammenzusetzen.

Die Wörter sind leider alle auseinander gefallen und die Silben sind ein einziges Chaos. Nur wer geschickt Karten sammelt, sie tauscht oder mit Mitspielern verhandelt, kann die Wörter wieder richtig zusammensetzen.

Ein Silben-Legespaß von Erika Bruhns für kleine und große Leseratten, mit bunten Illustrationen.

—description from the publisher

name: The First Wave: Roll & Write
description:
Wargame vault: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/427969/THE-FIRST-WAVE

Despite these preparations, very little went as planned. Ten landing craft, and the soldiers manning them, were lost before they even reached the beach.
Of the nine companies that landed from the first wave, only A Company of the 116th RCT, at Dog Green, and the Rangers to its right, landed where intended.
As soon as the infantry jumped out of the landing vehicles, they found themselves on sandbars 45 to 100 m from the shore. Before reaching the beach itself, they had to wade through the water that separated them, sometimes up to their necks, and then they still had 600 feet or more to go before they made it to shore.
As soon as the boats approached within a few meters of the shore, they received intense fire from automatic weapons and artillery.

This game with Roll and Write mechanics tries to recreate the arrival of US troops on the coast of one of the Omaha beaches. This game contains the necessary sheets so that you can print at home on a home printer without the need for color, you only laminate the sheet of the board, with a couple of dice and erasable markers, you can enjoy this game.

—description from the designer

name: Ars Bellum II: Scénarios "Le Prince Noir"
description:
In this expansion, at the heart of the Hundred Years War (1337-1453) find Edward of Woodstock, King of England (1330-1376), known as The Black Prince facing the French forces of King John II the Good or the coalition Franco-Spanish of Enrique Trastamare pretender to the throne of Castile.
It contains :
- 1 11-page scenario booklet to play the battles of La Chaboterie (September 17, 1356), Poitiers (September 19, 1356), Inglesmendi (March 1367) and Nájera (April 3, 1367)
- 1 sheet of 108 pawns and markers and one of 54 pawns and markers representing the English, French and Spanish armies of the campaign
- 2 A4 maps and 2 A3 maps
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Monk
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Monk all the way from 1st to 24th level.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Necromancer
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Kickstarter exclusive Necromancer all the way from 1st to 24th level.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Druid
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Druid all the way from 1st to 24th level.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Bard
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Bard all the way from 1st to 24th level.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: What Do You Meme?: 90 Day Fiancé Expansion Pack
description:
What Do You Meme? is a party card game for the social media generation. Each round, one player takes the role of judge and plays a photo card, after which everyone else plays a caption card to complete the meme. The judge decides the funniest pairing, and whoever played the winning caption card wins the round. Lather, rinse, and repeat.

No Passport Needed: This is the expansion pack that lets players meme the most iconic moments of their favorite reality TV show, 90 Day Fiancé.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hero Realms: Dungeons – Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
Includes and all the Kickstarter exclusive promo cards from the Hero Realms: Dungeons Kickstarter campaign.

These cards were all shrinkwrapped together and has its own bar code. It was packaged separately from the base game. Like the other Promo packs will it be available in future Wise Wizzard-Kickstarter and in limited amounts on conventions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Coragem: A Chave Contra o Medo
description:
The Beast has always lived in a safe and comfortable castle, but something sinister has happened and the tranquillity is over. Fears invaded his castle and broke his heart into several pieces.
Now, as he walks through the castle, the Beast feels a terrifying fear.
In this game you will learn about the Beast's fears, and you will have to have courage and determination to face them. She will need the help of great heroes to conquer her fears and regain peace in her heart.

Each round, players move through the castle, retrieving items and gaining courage so that when they find a dark room, home to one of the Beast's fears, players can face it.
This is done using the courage acquired and an item card, along with creating a story about how that hero could use the item to conquer the fear forever.
Through the game, children are encouraged to talk about their own fears and how to overcome them, in a playful and fun way.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Bigfoot
description:
A game of exploration and deduction where players race to find Bigfoot. Set in the wilderness of Bigfoot country players must explore the map in search for evidence of the mysterious creature. Finding enough evidence will allow players to decode the location/clue cards around the board and eliminate symbols from their hunt. Eliminate all but three symbols to find where Bigfoot is hiding. But beware the forest is full of danger...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Matching, Race

name: Willemsen de Koning: Vervoert met zorg
description:
You are a bus driver and are tasked with picking up eight students and delivering them to school, the central point in the middle of the game board. The order in which the students must be picked up and dropped off is different for each player and is on the schedule of his bus panel. You can choose to pick up the students in a different order, but some students insist be the first or last to board the bus. If you don't respect that, you will get negative points at the end of it game, unless you phone the parents or guardians in order to switch to reassure the student is set.

Always make the right choice. Do you go for speed, or do you go for carefulness? The winner is the player who makes the fewest mistakes, but also ensures that everyone was delivered on time.

—description from the designer

name: Kopfrechnen schwach?
description: The players take turns to roll and move. Movements is determined by two number dice and a special die, which shows mathematical operations ( + - *). The combination of the three dice (for example 1 + 5) gives the number of spaces to move forward ( + and *) or backward ( - ). Captured opponent pawns are sent back to the start. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Warriors of America
description:
From the box description...

“I woke last night shaking from a frightful dream. We have come to the edge of the ocean and there is no advancing or retreating. My own sons may sink in the torrent. I wish I pray that there be some decent honorable way to put an end to this conflict. Tone once again reconciled old friends. Out cause is righteous and I have no doubt of final success. But I see out generation and perhaps our hole loaned drowned in blood”.

Sarah Scott was an English novelist, translator, social reformer, and member of the Bluestockings.

Warriors of the America is a fast playing game on the American War of Independence. Inspired by the very well received game, Warriors of God, this game features the leaders, soldiers, and events that were pivotal in this history changing war. Players control leaders, soldiers, and fleets on a map that features both the wilds of North America and the more civilized colonized areas. Major events will shape each season. The American player must contend with raising money and a less-trained but highly motivated army while preventing the greatest army in the world, the British Army, from snuffing out the fire of the greatest enlightenment of human rights yet seen on earth.
mechanics: Impulse Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Barbe-queue
description:
Will you become the bbq master?
Or is your grill a recipe for disaster?
The tastiest food may take some time
But if you see guests forming a line
The infamous BARBE-QUEUE, a wriggling snake
You need to speed it up, don’t burn your steak
So try to give your guests a blast
By serving your food tasty and fast!

Barbe-Queue is a quick and tasty game where you display your grill skills against your opponents. Against each other, but also with each other to avoid the barbe-queue getting too long.

Players prepare food on the barbeque, which is placed in the center of the table. Each turn they choose to serve guests who are waiting in line, add more food to the barbeque if there is space available, or move their food on the barbeque to the next level. Serving your food the fastest does not guarantee the win: the longer prepared food is tastier and worth more points. And not all guests want the same food. So choose your grill strategy wisely and become the bbq master of all time!

—description form the publisher

name: DISEYUDV
description:
DISUYEDV is a card-game system based on the Cherokee Syllabary. It is designed with four ways to play, though the system is robust enough to allow players to come up with their own games fairly easily. The four ways it is designed to be played are:

ADANELODI (Arrange!)- A strategy game for two to six players; collect sets of three cards while treating the discard pile as a shared hand. Similar to the classic, card game, Rummy, but with a few, key differences which create an entirely new (and fun!) experience.
Ganesquaduga (Cartwheel)- A raucous, four-player, party game where players race to collect the numbers 1-13 in their hand, but with a twist! The player you just asked for a Seven might start a Cartwheel, and force you to pass some of your cards to the player on your right... and maybe even your whole hand!
Galkwogi Iyanitsila (Seven Fires)- A solitaire game where you must build a fire to start seven other fires. Bearing elements of Free-Cell, Spider, and traditional Solitaire, this unique take on the idea of solitaire is easy to learn, and fun!
Replace a deck of playing cards- The DISUYEDV deck can easily be used to play any game that is possible with a standard deck of playing cards. Instructions to do so are included with the deck.

name: Master of the Arena
description:
Masters of the Arena is the new strategy board game that will challenge you to become the ultimate master! Inspired by MOBA-style games, you control your own heroes and fight in an arena to become the winner. With a variety of available skills and strategies, each match is unique and exciting. Combining elements of RPG and board games, Masters of the Arena is perfect for strategy game lovers and MOBA fans. Join your friends and fight to be the best in the arena!

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Dark Venture: Khrag Pit Arena
description:
Warbling trumpets blare through cheap-sounding loudspeakers as the announcer barks an introduction: "Welcome, one and all, to the Khrag Pit Arena! Tonight! A showcase of spectacular and thrilling contests! Eat, drink, and prepare to be amazed!"

The Khrag Pit Arena expansion adds new items, characters, and locations to the core set! Add components from the core set to the expansion components to play an all new gladiator game!

Use the arena board for a standalone gladiator game and in the core Dark Venture game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Dark Venture: The Alderkang Mini-expansion
description:
The former king of Darkgrange, ousted and murdered in a coup, has miraculously returned! The Alderkang is constructing a powerful army to take back his throne.

This 20 card box of new characters, items, and locations is added to your core set! Includes 3 punch-out sheets of standees and tokens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Dark Venture: Beasts & Monsters Mini-expansion
description:
This mini-expansion box assembles a collection representing some of the most foul creatures created when the magik of the Cataclysm swept through Darkgrange!

This 20 card box of new characters, items, and locations can be added to your core set! Includes 3 punch-out sheets of standees and tokens.

—description from the publisher

name: SHIBUYA120
description:
SHIBUYA120 is a competitive card game based on real data stats, where both players pursue the victory of a football game simulation.

Act as the Manager of your football team and win your opponent avatars on the SHIBUYA120 multiverse.

Draw cards from the same 120-card deck to strategically scout your team players from a variety of 10 multiverses. Decide your first lineup on the table and make your first move.

Technical skills, physical and mental attributes and special abilities are played in combination with tactical decisions from your Manager's card. Master the gameplay to keep ball control and discard rivals before scoring a goal.

High interaction with your opponent, easy to play and challenging to find the best synergies. Every duel is different and all matches are unique.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: Fill With Squares!
description:
Try to stay in the game by placing the shapes in your hand in a limited area. Do not think that everything will be easy, you will need squares when creating a shape, and these squares have different properties. I must say there are many things you can do with these. In short, a fun game where you can be creative and please keep reading.

How To play?


Deck both Square cards and Shape cards separately and put 1 Square card in the middle of the table with the back side up. That square in the middle of the table is the Center square.
After completing the installation as written above, you can start the tour. The game consists of 2 rounds and at the end of the 2nd round, whoever reaches the highest score wins, if there is a draw, the 3rd round is played.
The player whose turn it is in the round draws 1 Shape card and takes as many square cards as the number written on the Shape card, then places the squares in accordance with their shape.
The player who places a square 6 squares away from the center square loses the round and the other player gets a point.


—description from the designer

name: Dark Venture: CRAWL!
description:
"A mysterious shadow has fallen across Darkgrange. Many that were once bastions of righteousness have become possessed by a cryptic, evil force. They wander the land as unthinking husks, attacking man and beast with abandon. You recognize this sickness as THE DARKNESS, an incantation associated with the Ancient of Death, DHOREGAT KELT. You must disperse this ancient evil before you succumb to it!"

CRAWL! is a solo or 2-player game mode that utilizes the components of the Dark Venture Core Set (plus new characters, items, locations, and quests), activating them in a different way with the use of encounter tokens and new game rules.

In CRAWL! all Dark Venture enemies and unplayed heroes are sorted into separate decks based on their difficulty. Items are separated by type and the map is laid out, ready to explore. Tokens representing encounters are placed on each map location. When your hero enters a location, the token is flipped to reveal a possible enemy and treasure. Fight and kill enchanted enemies or disenchant them, it's your choice. BUT BE CAREFUL! At some point in the game Dhoregat Kelt, Ancient of Death, will appear and attempt to enchant your hero! Defeat him to win the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: Picnic Attack
description:
In each round (depending on the number of players), place 5 picnic cards on the table face up. There are 6 types of picnic cards (sticky, hot, liquid, sugar and baskets), each type has different characteristics and points.
Each player chooses which of their bugs they will use in this round. Choose your bugs carefully, each one has different strength and abilities.
We place bugs on the picnic in turn order (Bugs' abilities interact with other players and picnic cards). When all the bugs have been placed, we will check which player has more power on each picnic card to find out who gets each food card.

At the end of the last round, count the points of the picnic cards you have collected to find out which player is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Take That

name: Switch Blocks
description:
Enjoy a family game night full of fun with this Play & Win Switch Blocks Board Game.

Take 5 blocks and match the pattern on the card to win! The pressure is on as the fastest person wins the game! With 50 rapid time challenges there's so much to be had.

Product features:

Match blocks, match cards, instructions
Ideal gift for any occasion
Great family game to promote logical thinking
Suitable for ages 6+

—description from the publisher

name: La Bête: Hurlements
description:
This expansion for La Bête brings:

special abilities for the Investigators
new Event cards
two new Investigators
a new Identity for the Beast


This expansion enriches the gameplay and expand the replayability.
categories: Age of Reason, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Programmed Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle of the Seas
description:
Battle of the Seas is nautical wargame set in XVII century however with no historical scenario.
The game included 10 ships for each player Blue and Red)along with cards to direct wind changes, player movement, battle scenarios, and ship damage.
The task of the game is to reach the enemy port with the transport ship (with out guns)Wind direction and the battles between ships are resolved using card deck for each scenario.
During the battle each player draws a card which determinates result of gun fire or boarding. There are serval damages the ship can receive- damage sails, lost sails, ship fire or ship sinking.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Mercado Central
description:
Mercado Central is a fun card game, recommended for 2 to 8 players from 8 years of age and with a duration of about 15 minutes.

Players will have to visit the stalls of our market and get the necessary products to elaborate recipes of main dishes and desserts of Spanish gastronomy. Play your cards right and get ahead of your opponents by stealing products, changing the shopping cart or becoming a VIP customer.

Be the fastest to visit all the stalls and don't run out of ingredients for your menu!

The game, in addition to offering a good time of fun, seeks to promote the tradition and culture of food markets among young people. Discovering the different market stalls, the origin of their products and the ingredients that make up the recipes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Food Tycoon
description:
A family bidding game.
There are some ingredients on the table every round.
All players will bid how much the ingredients are. Higher win.
After the bidding phase, each player can develop a new dish by the ingredients.
The new dish will increase your income and score.
Whoever gets 18 points first will win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Рыцарское сражение (Knight 's Battle)
description:
Рыцарское сражение ("Knight 's Battle") is a tactical and strategic military board game for two players aged seven years and older (7+). Children will be transported to the Middle Ages, a real battle will unfold on the playing field.

From the beginning, cards with warriors are laid out under the protection of castle walls: blue – in a castle with a blue flag, yellow – with a yellow flag. Figures of the same type are placed on top of each other on one square. The first participant of the battle rolls a die and moves any warrior outside of his castle by as many cells as there are dots on the die. Movement is possible in any direction except diagonal. You can only move through unoccupied cells. Any figure starts its movement from the castle with a red square. As soon as one of the participants in the game has moved all his pieces outside of his castle, he can go on the offensive. A knight and a crossbowman can defeat any enemy warrior; a man–at-arms - anyone except a knight; an archer is able to defeat only an archer, a man-at-arms, a militia, a standard-bearer; a militia and an infantryman can defeat a man-at-arms, a militia, a standard-bearer; a standard-bearer cannot defeat anyone.

The victory is awarded to the one of the participants of the duel who will be the first to remove the enemy's standard-bearer from the battlefield, or his standard-bearer will enter the enemy's fortress.

—user summary

name: De Hàmster Kùmmt Wieder
description:
De Hàmster Kùmmt Wieder (Hamster goes home) is an assymetric, fast-paced multiplayer board game for 2–5 players age 8 and up. The game demonstrates the struggle of hamsters with and against their natural enemies in their habitat in Alsace. Like most good stories, there is a fictional hero, the Super Hamster. A box includes a detailed playing field, special ability cards - all this is hand-printed, 22 miniatures of hamsters and predators, and a dice to solve ingame contests. Rules are simple and intuitive, each team has its advantages and disadvantages.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Environmental, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Movement Points, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: No More Vikings
description:
In the Middle Ages it was not easy to develop your small coastal village and satisfy the King and his whims even when you had to face incessant Viking raids! A strategy game in which you will have to manage your resources wisely, develop your village, protect it by anticipating enemy raids from looters and satisfy royal whims! Become the Grand Mayor and the King's favorite village!

Goal of the game :
Make your village grow in order to score the most points at the end of 12 months (12 rounds) to become the Grand Mayor!

How to play ?
Each of the 12 rounds will take place in 5 stages:

Choose your secret strategy
Beware the Vikings are attacking!
Apply your strategy
Resolve Viking Raids!
Move the White Drakkar counter to the next month and start again!


—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Fluzzle
description:
Every good gardener knows that the secret of a beautifully landscaped area lies in making the best use of the resources that you have available!

Head-to-head against your opponent, fill the flower beds on your grid according to the shapes rolled on the pattern die, strategically using the flowers in your hand.

Score for every flower bed that you fill, score more if that flower bed is filled with the same type of flowers and score the most if it is filled with the same type of flowers all of the same colour.

Out-garden your opponent by scoring more and finishing with the most impressive floral display in this exceptional puzzle game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Tile Placement

name: Fish 'n' Flips: Sea Lion Promo Cards
description: Nine sea lion cards for Fish 'n' Flips, given out at SPIEL '19.

name: Futory Cards II
description:
Futory Cards II takes players on an exciting ride through the universe. Exotic landmarks and creatures will serve those able to control them. It offers an expanded battle system with intuitive card combinations that make every game unique.

Futory Cards is a deck building game in which up to four players buy cards from the Bazaar to create the strongest deck and defeat their opponents. With Landmarks, Creatures and Artifacts, the players go through four phases in which they try to remove the 24 Time Points from the other players.

Once 12 Time Points are lost, the Light Die gets removed from the player and they can no longer get up to 24 Time Points. A player has lost the game after their Dark Die gets removed.

If a player can no longer draw cards from their Future Pile, their History Pile gets shuffled and creates a new Future Pile. This dynamic feature enables long term strategic thinking.

Futory Cards II can also be linked with other titles from the Trilogy, allowing even more strategic variety and a higher player count.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Drawing, Market, Player Elimination

name: Guns N'Bosses
description:
Guns N'Bosses is a rogue-lite, cooperative, medium-weight, dice/card/bag building, board game designed by Nicolas de Tauriac and features around 80 weapons and 40 enemies illustrated by Julien Boulet.

You are mercenaries sent onto a distant planet to chase hostiles and prepare future colonisation. With the small budget allocated to this mission, you will have to find yourself some heavier weapons on the remainings of previous teams.
In a first part, you will encounter waves of enemies to loot. Then when you feel ready, you can confront the boss and try to defeat it !

Choose wisely your equipement to match your gameplay but also that of your crewmates
Balance your arsenal by adding or removing dices in your bag to sustain fire
Prepare your guns, charge them and fire them at the right moment
Never let down your crewmates and assist them with healing abilities or by taking shots for them

If you enjoy rogue-lites video games, intense arena boss fight and shooter-looter, I think Guns N'Bosses is a mission for you to take on !

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Farming, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Chaining, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Pattern Recognition, Re-rolling and Locking, Team-Based Game

name: Mercado Central: Recetas aragonesas
description:
Expand the Mercado Central game with eight Aragonese traditional recipes.

This pack of additional cards is sold separately from the main game.

The recipes included are:

-Borrajas con almejas
-Cardo con almendras
-Pollo al chilindrón
-Rancho
-Trucha a la aragonesa
-Trenza de Almudévar
-Pastel ruso
-Frutas de Aragón
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Mit SMACKS im Königreich Excalibur
description:
Both players get two game figures of the same color, blue or red. All figures start at the castle. Both dice are rolled. However, you only move the number of spots on one die on the board. You can always choose which of your pieces you want to advance with, but move figures at the start first! If you get on a space of your color, roll the dice again! Two figures of one player may not be on the same space at the same time! If you come to a space on which an opponent's figure is standing, you send it back to the castle. The track makes a circle in the middle of the board. Here you follow the arrows! If you land on the crossing point (black space), you block the way for your opponent. While waiting until you leave the point or get hit there, you are allowed to pass with your own character. You must reach the target spaces with the sword behind the cave entrance with a direct throw. Whoever is the first to get both of their pawns onto the target space of their color wins and returns the magic sword to the castle.

The game was published on the back of a box of "Smacks".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Ars Bellum II: Scénarios "Bélisaire, l'épée de l'empereur"
description: In this expansion, find the Roman armies of the East, Persian Sassanid, Vandal and Moorish of the High Middle Ages and carry out the conquest plans of the Emperor Justinian.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Felix-Ferien-Reisespiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The game begins at "Start und Ziel" by rolling the means of transport. The number thrown only entitles you to occupy a starting space. Whoever throws 1, 2 or 3 travels by train and pays two tokens into the till. Whoever rolls a 4 or 5 takes the omnibus and pays three tokens. Whoever rolls the 6 travels by plane and pays four tokens. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The winner is whoever finishes first; he gets everything that's in the till.

The game was published inside the comic magazine "Felix".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Majesty Moose
description:
The goal of Majesty Moose is quite simple: The first player to discard all of their cards wins the round and is given the lowest score. The round continues until players, one by one, have discarded all their cards and one player is left with cards still in hand. The player who got rid of their cards first is the Emperor/Empress and will start the next round followed by the other players in the order developed from the last round -- the last being the individual who still had cards in their hand at the end of the round. The player with the combined lowest score after a certain number of rounds is the winner.

—description from the back of the box

name: Baseboardgame
description:
The new and most complete Board Game for Hardcore MLB Fans.
Experience the Fun and Thrill of Baseball With This Board Game
Enjoy one of the most popular American sports with your friends and family through BaseBoardGame! It is a one-of-a-kind board game that equates to a real baseball game. Rain or shine, day or night, you will never miss out on the fun with our unique board game.

The Players
BaseBoardGame combines the excitement, suspense, and other ingredients of a true baseball game. It has the same number of players and batters are ranked in three groups with different batting averages. The board also contains the same elements of a real field, so you can experience the most common situations of a baseball game.

—description from the publisher

name: Hack-s-ticker
description:
A card game in which mischievous twins compete by hacking terminals around town.

Players take the role of one of the twins and place square cards on the field to expand the area under their control. To place a card, it must overlap with a card on the field, either partially or completely, and the overlapping area must be of a different color.

Cards can be rearranged when certain conditions are met.

After the specified number of cards have been used, the player wins when the number of consecutive areas in his or her area exceeds the number of areas in the opponent's area.

—description from the publisher

name: The Rings Of Saturn
description:
The Rings Of Saturn is a 2-6 player board game where captains race their space ships from the outer rings of Saturn inward to the planet of Saturn while navigating the difficulties of space travel. The first one to Saturn wins.

Actual gameplay involves a multiple step process where captains
(1) gain resources from rolling and their generator cards previously purchased,(2-3)trade and buy improvements for space travel or buy travel to the next ring, (4)hire crew members, and finally (5) draw an anomaly card where unfortunate events happen to your crew.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Drawing, Investment, Race

name: Dice of the Round Table
description: "Dice of the Round Table" is an exciting new dice game for 2 to 4 players. Players will roll their dice and use strategy to defeat their opponents and become the ultimate ruler of the kingdom. Players can choose to attack a knight or king, infiltrate the enemy's castle, poison the enemy king, boost their own morale, or even resurrect a fallen knight. With a combination of luck and strategy, the game is easy to learn but challenging to master, making it perfect for casual and experienced gamers alike. Gather your friends, sharpen your skills, and get ready for an epic battle in "Dice of the Round Table".

name: Vector Victor
description:
Vector Victor is designed as a demonstration game to make use of Vector Dice and the Vortex Dice Tower. It is a quick and easy to learn abstract where the directional Vector Dice are slotted in to players ships. The direction and magnitude shown on the die in a ship determines which direction and how fast it will travel each turn. Players fly across the board hunting for treasures and other player's ships to be the first one to reach 5 points or the last player with ships remaining.

—description from the designer

name: Talassos
description:
Talassos is an ocean-adventure game. It takes inspiration from the game The Quest for El Dorado.

In Talassos players will try to reach a mysterious monolith on a very remote island. The player who reaches the Island first wins the game.

On the main ocean game board, players can travel horizontally or vertically. Each player has 1 submarine (unless playing 1 vs 1).

Movements are done by using movement points (mp). Each player throws dice to determine their movements points for that turn.

Horizontal movement costs 5mp
Vertical movement costs 1mp.

Player gets a depth mp bonus depending on which level vertical depth level they are traveling on.

name: Obliquity: Buildings and Bombs Expansion
description:
The Buildings and Bombs expansion adds a whole new deck to Obliquity: The Trenches, the blueprint deck. This new deck consists of building and defence cards, to expand your trench and improve your operations.

Players can now utilize No Man's Land as they set up defences against their enemies. Racking up Attack Points, instead of Power Points, your defences directly repel your opponent's trench.

Buildings can be constructed in the trench, to house and protect cards as well as provide unique bonuses. Your trench will become a lot more colourful and powerful as you set up bunkers along the front row, and POW Camps in the back.

Four new special cards also enter the fray, providing devastating and unique effects if played. This expansion adds new dimension to the regular game, after one game, you'll never look back.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Space Bureau
description:
Welcome aboard, Captain, Sir!
The 10-XN class starship is ready for discovery. New worlds are waiting for us!

Space Bureau is a family board game about space exploration in a very small universe. You become the captain of a space research ship. Under the orders of the Space Bureau, you will embark on a journey through wormholes to
Discover new planets,
Collect samples,
Deliver planetary explorers,
Build research stations,
All to earn reputation points in our cool organization of salty space dogs and become the best captain of the millennium. Well, or at least the Captain of the Month – the competition for the right to have your photo uploaded to the main page of the Space Bureau is too fierce.

More enthusiasm, Captain, sir! This is not rocket science. Oh, sorry, it really is rocket science. But the entire crew believes in you, Captain, sir. Ignition on!
mechanics: Contracts, Grid Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Easy Answers
description:
Easy Answers is a party game for 6+ people. This game will make you laugh, cry, sweat, and probably throw your marker across the room. In Easy Answers, players are asked super simple questions with super simple answers, so anyone can play. The problem is, players may not want to write down the first thing that comes to mind, because more points are awarded for unique answers. Oh, and players also need to write their answers super fast to beat the competition. So just avoid the obvious answer and do it really fast. That’s Easy Answers…

Example:
A card is flipped and reads “Something you watch.” Well “TV” of course. But wait… everyone’s going to write that. I’ll go with “movies”, but even that seems obvious. “People”? I watch people? A little creepy but I honestly do sometimes…

Ok, I need to decide. I literally can’t think of anything but watching people. And now I’m just taking forever! Screw it, “TV” it is. Wait, everyone’s turned in their answer already???

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Cold Face Dagger Promo Card
description:
The Cold Face Dagger is a gear card that was included with the Hellebore - A Frozen Survivor miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

Cold Face Dagger (weapon, melee, dagger, ice, stone, melting 4) - If you are Insulated, your warm hands can better clutch the blade. This gains +1 speed.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Das Bamberger Brückenspiel
description: The players try to reach the cathedral with their 2 players. In doing so, they must cross bridges that are constantly collapsing and being rebuilt. On the event card fields you can get help, but sometimes obstacles are put in your way.

name: Vak!
description:
A fast paced 2-4 player game that is based on tic-tac-toe.

Every player has a pile of 24 cards. The one who gets rid of all cards first wins. The method of playing cards is simple: You take a look at the top card and then put it somewhere on the playing field. Be careful however you don't create three in a row of another player's symbol! When you do, all cards currently on the table become part of your drawing pile.

There are no turns. It's all about how fast you can put cards on the table without accidentally creating three of a row of another player, while trying to get three in a row of your symbol.

Although this can be played by 5-year-olds and 95-year-olds alike, it is best enjoyed by players of equal speed, although this can be remedied by giving the fastest player some piles from the slowest player.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Drinking Heroes
description:
-THE NEW FANTASTIC DRINKING GAME !-

Confront your friends during parties to become the great champion !

AIM OF THE GAME : To win at Drinking Heroes, you must be the player with the most of points when the game ends. You win points according to the Level of the monster you kill. Every turn, roll a dice to fight a monster. Depending on the result, you either kill the monster or have to drink sips.

FOR AN EVENING WITH OR WITHOUT ALCOHOL : It’s possible to play without drinking A player who doesn’t drink won’t have more than 2 trials max against all MONSTERS to kill them. He/She won’t be targeted by SPELL cards that distributes sips. If all the players don’t drink, take off all the SPELL cards that distributes sips.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Door to Door
description:
A dynamic delivery game where you first build your city, filling it with buildings, roads, parks and depots.
Deliver secret items to secret locations.

BOARD SETUP:
Players first take turns building a town. Each time they play, a completely new town is created.
They use two-sided tiles to create a network of roads that connect to buildings, parks and depots.
Randomly scatter packages at parks.

GAME SETUP:
Players randomly select three delivery location cards, three item pickup cards and a truck. Place the truck on their numbered depot.

GAME PLAY OVERVIEW:
Players may:

flip and/rotate one road tile
add or remove a road block
move their truck
pick up an adjacent package
drop off their package at adjacent delivery location


Upon delivering three items, the first player to return to their depot is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Gruul Stompy
description:
Challenger Decks 2022 are a set of preconstructed decks designed for tabletop players that wish to start competitive tournament play right out of the box for the Standard format. Released on April 1, 2022, there are four decks in total, containing a 60-card main deck, a 15-card sideboard, as well their associated tokens.

Gruul Stompy contains 1 mythic, 26 rare, 7 uncommon, and 26 common cards.

name: Black Pearl in a Crystalline Shell
description:
Black Pearl in a Crystalline Shell is a print and play, roll and write game you can play with 1-4 players set in the old days of pirates and treasure islands. Explore the island of Saturnia and find the Black Pearl!

Choose a pirate character (each with different abilities), one of the three game maps and create your own custom treasure map. Roll your dice and take actions such as collecting gems and coins, digging up treasure and moving around the map to discover the spot of the Black Pearl. Be the first to escape the treasure island Saturnia with it.

—description from the designer

name: Cryptic
description:
Cryptic is a card-based table-top RPG that takes up to 6 heroes across a new world plagued with the undead.

It is up to six worthy heroes to slice and dice their way through Inferis, vanquishing monsters, ridding the world of evil whilst levelling up, collecting unique loot, and crafting useful items.

Be warned through, The Legion is the least of your concern.

Grab a shield, sharpen your blade, and drink those potions! You've got a whole world full of adventure ahead of you.

The Isle of Inferis awaits.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Tell Me A Story: GTG
description: A cooperative storytelling game that plays like Uno, where players build a story by adding elements from the cards in their hand. They can pick story elements such as characters, settings, action and motivations from themes such as Science Fiction, Romance, Horror, and Detective/Noir. The cards allow players as young as 8 to participate and build their confidence in telling stories, while everyone gets to laugh in the absurdity of their creation.

name: Night at the Ossuary
description:
Night at the Ossuary is an 18 card, 2 player trick-taking game that implements some unique mechanisms and takes roughly 15 minutes to play.
You are archaeologists exploring the depths of a newly discovered ossuary, attempting to find the most valuable artifacts inside.

Players play out four hands in an attempt to score the most points to win the game.
In each game players will want to consider leveraging some of the unique mechanisms in this game:

Playing multiple cards to a trick
Emptying your hand first to score all the remaining cards in your opponent's hand
Take zero tricks to score all the points your opponent would have scored this hand
Pressing your luck based on the two unknown cards that weren't dealt this hand


—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Guardians of Malta
description:
The Maltese forces were fighting a losing battle in the Siege of Malta, beset by monsters on all sides. Only the timely intervention of a true miracle saved them from total annihilation. Now the Vatican have rescued the beleaguered defenders and brought them to the relative safety of Venice. Here they put their hard fought experience to good use, fighting for the glory of God.

This box provides some divine reinforcements for your Vatican gang. The Angel of the Blooded Rose is a frontline fighter and an inspiring presence to those that fight alongside her. A Burning Saint provides area denial with full plate and a fiery aura and is quite a capable combatant in their own right. A Baptist provides support for his gang, commanding blessed water to provide safe passage for allies and danger to his enemies. Two Chevalresses protect their allies and with sword and shield put down any that would see them harmed.

Contains 5 resin miniatures and 5 plastic bases.

name: Rumbling Seed
description:
Players are disciples at a monastery on Mt. Kunlun. The holy tree is blooming, and you need to collect its seeds and present them to the old masters of the monastery and the divine beasts.

Players have a hand of five movement cards, and spend one each round to move a shared pawn between the six magic sites and collect seed cards. Each player and each site also has a master card, and players can spend the matching seed cards at a master to score points. Movement cards are not recycled, so the game ends after five rounds.

name: Stranger Tales
description:
Stranger Tales is a role-playing game (RPG) and Board Game in which we will play the role of kids who will have to face the “Evil”. We are in the 1980s, an era that you probably experienced directly or indirectly through films, music, board games, videogames and everything that that unique and unrepeatable decade has left thanks to the echo of a time near and far. Did you know that the 80s were full of monsters and creatures of all kinds? If your answer is no, you probably did not directly experience that era or you have been told that it was just rumors; but if you lived it, if you were a child or a kid during those years, you know what I'm talking about. Monsters existed and walked around on their own legs. Of course, adults would never have believed you, but I can guarantee you that at that time Evil had eyes and legs, mouths and teeth.

The peculiarity of Stranger Tales is that you will have everything ready in one box: Just take it with you to experience fantastic adventures and you won't need anything else! Everything is in the box. Stranger Tales is also a mammoth work on ’80s and ’90s Pop Culture. In fact, in the definitive manual, you will find not only the rules to play but also contents that will help you identify yourself again—or for the first time—in a world so near and far.

The Fusion System that was born in Tales of Evil and continued in Boogeyman here evolves to the highest levels. It will only be your imagination and what you find in the stories that set the limits; but in reality, there is no limit whatsoever. You will be able to integrate into the game any action or behavior you wish in order to help your Investigators during your adventure. You may even be able to foresee that some Tests could take place outside of the usual game session, such as challenging players with special tasks to complete “side quests” in their real life. For example, nothing prevents you from requesting a certain type of flower or object be brought the next time you get together to play, or performing real actions such as going to a place and hiding something there and then asking the other players to find the object that you have hidden before your next game session. As you can see, the limits to what you can create with the Fusion System are practically infinite. Don't like the Fusion System? Don't love taking actions in your real life to directly influence the game? No problem. In agreement with the other players, you can safely decide not to use the Fusion System for your games. The beauty of Stranger Tales is precisely this—that is to say, being able to adapt the game to your liking and in your image and likeness. Again, there is no limit.

—description from the publisher

name: 1453 İstanbul'un Fethi Eğitici Kart Oyunu
description:
That game aims to arouse children's curiosity about the history of İstanbul, where they live or visit, and encourage them to research and learn. There are 60 questions in total in the game consisting of 30 cards.

How to play?

All cards are shuffled
The youngest player answers first. The player to her/his left draws the top card and asks one of the questions on the card.
If the player answers true he/she takes the card. If the answer is false, the card is put below the deck. The game continues clockwise.
If a player takes 4 cards of the same type, that player is the winner.


Short Game:

If a player takes 4 cards of any type, that player is the winner.


Long Game:

If a player takes all cards of the same type, that player is the winner.


—user summary

name: Bi'Film Önersene Sinema Quiz Vol.1
description:
Answer the questions with pleasure, and do not stay away from the movies in the environment!

How to play:


All cards are shuffled.
Players answer the questions in 90 seconds.
Easy cards are 3 points, medium-difficulty cards are 6 points and hard cards are 9 points. Players need to answer both questions on the cards correctly to get points
After 90 seconds who the most points collects wins

name: Blend!
description:
The best of each world: board games and teas come together to create a fun, meeting and strategy game. We have to use the flavors of our favorite tea. You have to form collections and score points!

El Equipo Azul and Heredia Infusiones y Especias present Blend!, the ideal game to sit around a table, share something delicious and play with the senses.

It is based on the draft or drafting, which is a mechanic in which players choose from a group of cards and then pass them on to the other players so they can choose from the rest.

The object of the game is to score the most points after three rounds. ¿How? forming tea collections. Whoever gets the highest score wins the game.

name: Delve: Necromancy
description:
In this expansion to DELVE: A Solo Map Drawing Game, you are given control of powerful Necromancers who can create undead units out of the new Bone resource earned from special rooms and new Undead themed Events.

New units for your hold including Vampires, Liches, Bone Golems, Undead Gunner, Paladins, Ghouls, and Vampire Hunters.
New rooms including the Monastery, Crypt, Stitcher, and Vampire's Nest.
13 New Discoveries including Ancient Burial Sites, Blood Pools, and Bone Wyverns.
6 New Monstrosity Traits
and 6 New Relic Powers

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Delve: On Honor
description:
Every dwarven culture contains the sharing of stories. Some are terrible warnings, some are bawdy tales, and some are romantic ballads – but all center around great dwarves of times past. It is every dwarf’s desire to become the subject of one of these stories that define their culture, to have their name become the stuff of legends remembered for centuries to come. For that reason, dwarves care deeply about great and daring exploits, grand battles – about names, and accomplishing things worthy of those names being honored.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: QUEST: An RPG-styled hack for Delve
description:
QUEST is a map-drawing RPG, based on the incredible DELVE by Anna Blackwell, about exploring and re-discovering a ruined keep above and vast underground dungeon beneath it. You take control a party of adventurers exploring this abandoned keep, for fame, fortune, and a chance to discover the legendary Void Crystal.

QUEST is intended to focus on telling the story of a group of adventurers and the ruined keep they are exploring. Whenever the Party kicks open the next door, you’ll use a standard deck of cards to randomly determine what is found. Maybe ruined structures, and the treasures they hold, or lakes of lava, or nightmarish horrors more ancient than the keep. Once you find out what you’ve discovered, you'll draw it on your map as a record of your exploration, and write about it in an ongoing journal.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: RISE: Demons
description:
In this expansion to RISE: A Solo Game of Spreading Evil you are given access to new Demonic Powers which come in the form of:


New Units like the Haunted Dolls, Imps, Clown, and Lawyers



New Rooms like the Circus, Dollhouse, and Infernal Court where you can sue Adventurers!



Monarchs - Powerful royal demons that you must work hard to summon. Their special provide game changing abilities.
categories: Book, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Umbra: Stations
description:
The first expansion for UMBRA, this 26 page digital zine features:


New Station Building Mechanics - take a derelict station and revamp it with new station specific rooms. Conduct your research in the relative safety of space or appease Guests and earn some ♦



Boarding Mechanics - control a tight knit group of units as you board alien spaceships in a party-based tactical exploration. Utilise disguises, hiding spaces, hack enemy security systems, loot rooms, and steal spaceships to expand your station.



New Rooms - From bars and casinos to biohackers, escape pods, and museums, expand your colony and your station in new and interesting ways.



Stores - Entice alien merchants to set up shop and benefit from their strange and wonderful goods. From scanners to skeletons, libraries to less legitimate businesses.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Umbra: Cyberspace Expansion
description:
Venture into the cyberscape to protect yourself against a new kind of threat in this digital themed expansion to the solo map drawing game UMBRA.

With new Rooms, Units, and Events, this expansion provides loads of new challenges and rewards such as Shipboard A.Is and new Research as well as Artefacts and Terrors.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: DELVE: Legion of the Lost
description: This expansion adds new mechanics in the form of a new unit type, classes, and ranks. All Legion UNITS will begin at the lowest rank in the Legion and have a random class assigned to them. By completing fights with the Legion units you will collect experience points to increase their abilities and rank.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bible-it: A Biblical boardgame
description:
The Bible has 66 books, and each book a theme that God wishes to share with his people.

Bible it is a fun family game for 2-5 players where you will explore and learn about the various books in the Bible as scholars who are competing with each other to score points through various tokens.

Exploring these books and finding the right ones to bind together in its biblical order of course is your number one priority. Earn points when you do this and sometimes bonuses too. Race to collect the most points. And that's how you win at Bible-it.

—description from the publisher

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 31
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some war machines never die. This PDF-only series includes brand-new BattleMechs and OmniMechs, alongside Classic ’Mechs and combat vehicles from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans rebuilt with the latest technology to keep them competitive on modern battlefields. This series also includes in-universe development notes, battle histories, notable pilots, and record sheets for each unit.

—description from the publisher

Same as https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/379944/battlete...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: On Whimsical Waters
description:
Zoltán Győri's new card game, Szeszélyes Vizeken ("On Whimsical Waters"), is a fast-paced bluffing card game that lasts for five rounds.
At the beginning of each round, shuffle the cards belonging to the current round thoroughly, then spread them close to each other in any arrangement face down in the center of the playing field.
During the game, players can choose between scouting (here they can bluff), sailing (here there can be failure or glory in the deck) and passing.

At the end of the round, any untaken cards are returned to the game box, and then the next deck is used in the next round. The game ends after the fifth round.
The players count the value of their glories (each is worth the number on it) and subtract the value of their failures from this (it is also true here that each card represents a failure equal to its value).
The player with the highest score wins the game. In the event of a tie, the player with fewer failures wins the game. If there is still a tie, the players share the victory.

name: Memorace: A káprázatos természet
description:
One minute isn't the world, is it? Do you feel the same way even if you only have so much time to memorize every detail of a picture? Exciting challenges await!

The Memorace board game develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy in a fun way: this time you can marvel at natural phenomena. Get involved as soon as possible, learn playfully!

Along with the challenges, the game develops logical thinking, memory and attention - all in an interactive and fun way.

Gameplay:


Draw a card and place it in front of you.
Turn the clock over and try to remember as many details as possible while the sand is spreading - this is about 10 seconds.
Roll the dice!
If you rolled a 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front page. Look at the picture and count or guess correctly!
If you did not roll a 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will test your memory, but if you pay attention, you will definitely know the answer!

name: Die Spinne im Netz
description:
2, 3 or 4 people can take part in the game, each paying 5 or 10 tokens into the till. With 2 players, one leads the spider, the other the 12 flies. If there are 3 players, one leads the spider, the other two each 6 flies. With 4 players, one leads the spider, the other three each 4 flies. If the flies are distributed among several players, they must be numbered.

One of the flies begins the game by throwing a die and moving from a predetermined corner to the opposite corner on the weblines. When it reaches it, it gets 3 tokens from the spider. However, if the fly doesn't reach the opposite corner, the spider rolls the die and in turn moves. If the spider reaches the fly, it has caught the fly and receives 3 tokens from the player concerned. If the spider throws high, it can catch 2 to 3 flies in one turn. After each turn the spider is placed back in the middle of the web.
The flies that have stayed on the board always have the first move. Then a fly, which is not yet on the board, moves, which the spider always following.

The flies caught by the spider are taken off the board and remain in the spider's custody until released. This happens when a fly from the same player reaches the sanctuary. This is also taken off the board and can continue to move anew.
For each fly that escapes from the web, the player concerned writes down one point; For each fly caught, the spider gets one point. Whoever gets 50 points first wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Flower Petals
description:
Any participant starts the game, and then it continues in the clockwise direction. When it's your turn, you roll all three dice three times in a row. After each throw, you fix your result:

For each die that has a value with a central point ("center of the flower"), you get points: one for one, two for three, four for five.
For every two, four and six you get no points.
If there are three even numbers, then the number of points scored by him in this round doubles. However, if he repeatedly throws three even numbers in this circle, then the points are not doubled. In addition, even threes are not included in the limit of throws.


Write down all the results in a notebook and add up the results of each player. The player who received the highest amount of points based on the results of four rounds is the winner.

—user summary

name: Jeu de Cavagnole
description:
Jeu de Cavagnole is a game of Genoese origin, notably played in the eighteenth century in France, where it was introduced in the 1730's. Its name comes from the Italian words cavagnolo or cavagnola "small basket". The game was mostly played by women of the aristocracy.

Jeu de Cavagnole is made up of a variable number of square cards, each card with five numbers, four in the corners and a fifth in the center. Each part of the game has an illustration (painted or engraved), usually of small popular subjects.

The game is similar to a lottery where you bet on the numbers that will come out, a bit like roulette (a game of chance). In turn, one of the players "holds the bank", that is to say, extracts from a bag a numbered ticket that decides the gain or loss of the players. You bet by putting token coins on the numbers. You can play a whole card, two numbers in a row or a full number.

name: BattleTech: Succession Wars
description:
This is a Print and Play partial reinvention of the 1987 game published by FASA. In collaboration with three individuals, Battletech Succession Wars is an attempt to address the shortcomings of the original game and (hopefully) attract a new fan following of enthusiastic grand strategy gamers to the Battletech genre.

Five players command the military, political and economic resources of the five Great Houses: Davion, Steiner, Liao, Kurita, and Marik of the Inner Sphere.

The goal of the game is to neutralize fellow House players through military conquest becoming the next Star Lord of the Inner Sphere.
categories: Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Glory: Knight Errant
description:
An expansion for Glory: A Game of Knights that introduces:


A 5th player with all components needed.
Errantry - new way to duel players or NPC knights.
Scenarios. A set of conditions that change the base game and force change of the winning strategies.
New Titles, Supporters, Travel cards - and more!


In addition to the artists known from the base game, the expansion has a set of great paintings made by Graham Turner who is also a jouster.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: La Course
description:
This card game simulates a 200 kilometer long cycling race. During each player's turn, they play a card from their hand. This could be an attack card, letting them escape from the peloton. Other cards cause accidents for your opponents, change the circumstances of the race, or advance the distance counter.

When the distance counter reaches predetermined values, there is an intermediate sprint by the leading cyclists. The winner of such a sprint wins a bonus card that can be played at the end of the race, to win the game.

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 31
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 31 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Callisto A Battle Armor (Bearhunter/ER Laser/HMG/MRR/SRM)
• Savannah Master Hover Craft (Reflective)
• Skimmer
• MASH Truck (AMS)
• Harrier Hover Tank (Standard/PPC/Re-Laser)
• Manticore HEavy Tank (XL)
• Behemoth Heavy Tank (Davion/Kurita/Kurita Upgrade/Liao/Refit)
• Javelin JVN-12N
• Clint CLNT-3-4T
• Shogun C 3
• Pillager PLG-6Z

Same as https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/379854/battlete...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Open Road
description:
The Story - The Gypsy peoples originate from Sind region now in Pakistan. When entering west Europe they initially had letters of protection from the King of Hungary. This privileged situation did not last long as amazement at their way of life led to hostilities. The Gypsy way of life still leads to hostilities from people of their host nations. Europeans regard "private property" as sacrosanct, whereas gypsies do not have a word for possess which gives to two incompatible ways of life and a continual problem of gypsies being regarded as "thieves" from the European's view.

The Object - Earn as much gold as we can and bring it to the Big Gypsy Gathering. We need to help finance the various Festivities of Weddings, Baptisms, Meetings, Feasts and Entertainment. This must be done before border checkpoints are closed, preventing us from travelling and earning our living. We have only two rounds of events to accomplish our goal of raising money for the Big Gypsy Gathering.

name: Avalanche
description:
A quick, family friendly dice game.
Players take turns adding dice from their personal dice pool to the snowball in the middle of the table, making it grow bigger. Roll all the dice in the snowball to see what happens. Sometimes you will get dice back, and sometimes you won’t. If you run out of dice, you are out of the game. Last player with dice wins!

Currently this is an inexpensive Print and Play game, containing only the instructions. Players are required to provide their own standard D6 dice.

-description from designer

name: Pineapple Royale
description:
Pineapple Royale is a card game in which players control different fruits in a battle to be the last one standing. Each fruit comes with its own unique stats and some have special abilities that can help them in battle. These may provide defenses, movement buffs, or ways to mess with your opponents. The fruits fight in an arena styled after a kitchen where there are objects such as countertops, kitchen sinks, and even an oven to move and position yourself around for battle. Some of these items take up territory, while others provide strategic benefits and threats to the players.

Players will need to collect kitchen utensil-themed cards to use against their opponents. You will start out with only a spork but can collect additional cards such as chef knives, graters, and chopsticks to increase your attack, or items such as fruit stickers to recover your health. Once a fruit runs out of their “servings” they are eliminated from the game.

The play area consists of a ring of randomly dealt cards that get shuffled around after each round. This creates constant variety as no two games or rounds will have the same layout to maneuver around. Movement is 2-dimensional around this circle, meaning your options can be limited depending on the randomly dealt battlefield.

During a game, you will find heavy amounts of social interactions as other players try to get you to gang up on other players, or keep the peace and draw a card instead of attacking them. All of the utensil cards (aside from the spork) can only be used once, creating a tricky balance between when to strike and when to wait for the chaos of the game to do the work for you. Once the first fruit is eliminated things will quickly spiral into chaos and bring about a quick conclusion to a game.

description from designer
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Map Reduction, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Seat at the Table Games LLC

name: Energy Management: Tactical
description:
Energy Management: Tactical is a paper-based simulation of tactical air-to-air combat using the innovative TRACE-R combat system. The system uses energy-maneuverability theory to faithfully simulate close-range dog-fighting tactics and fighter performance with relatively high accuracy.

The system eliminates the limitations of hex and counter systems by replacing them with geometric construction methods using paper and common drafting tools to allow for quick, accurate, and fluid game-play.

Each game turn represents approximately 10 seconds of flight per aircraft. During its turn, an aircraft may make any number of individual maneuvers (called “segments”). Each segment is tracked on the aircraft’s flight log to calculate changes in the energy state of the aircraft. The key to victory will be in managing an aircraft’s total energy while maneuvering into attack position.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Mighty Meerkats: Finding Kiki
description:
A terrible sandstorm is raging in the desert. By dawn, when everything finally quiets down, the suricata family's burrow is covered in dust, their items scattered everywhere. Worst of all, Kiki, the youngest member of the family, is missing! The suricata family band together and do something they've never done before: they leave the burrow and its surroundings to travel the desert together to find Kiki. You control a member of the family, build your own deck and if you complete the adventure deck fast enough, you might just save Kiki.

The game's special feature is that you build not only your own deck, but also a shared deck. In your own turn, you first play some of your cards in order to:

get a new card for yourself
add a new card to the common deck
perform a special action
reveal the next adventure card
"defeat" the current adventure card.


You can do any number of these as long as you have enough cards. At the end of your turn, you draw new cards.

This simple card game puts a twist on the familiar deck-building mechanic.
