Can you hide from the eagles? Will you be able to defeat the rattlesnake? Or perhaps make new friends along the way? But most importantly, will you be able to save Kiki and bring the family back together? It depends on your decisions!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Messy Monsters!
description:
Those messy little monsters are at it again! They’ve snuck into your room and messed up all your things! Now you have to clean it all up before bedtime, but the monsters are still hiding in the mess and trying to keep your room dirty!

Can you outsmart them and get your room clean before the sun goes down?

In Messy Monsters!, players work together to clean up their messy room by matching two item tiles of the same color. Hidden within the pile of clothes, toys, and books, however, are monster tiles, which undo your hard work, and sun tiles, which signal that bedtime is getting closer. If you can match all the items before the sun sets, you win!

-description from designer

name: Container Dice
description:
Any participant starts the game, then they take turns.
In his turn, the participant throws the dice two times consecutively. The first throw determines how long a block of cells it should place on the game plan. The second roll determines the number of such blocks that it should place.
The participant places blocks horizontally or vertically by crossing out the cells included in this block on the game plan. The thickness of the block is always one cell, the block can start from any cell, the blocks can touch the ends or sides, but cannot intersect or be placed on top of each other, the block cannot be curved, the block cannot go beyond the game plan.
The participant continues to roll the dice and place blocks as long as he can place blocks on the game plan. As soon as this opportunity disappears, he finishes the game and counts the number of penalty points, which is equal to the number of unclosed cells.
The winner is the participant who scored the least penalties.

—user summary

name: Strung
description:
The participants roll the dice at the same time. Each adds up the dropped values. Further actions depend on the resulting amounts:

If both participants received numbers in the range 4-10, then the participant who received the smaller number puts in the pot the number of chips equal to the difference between the numbers of participants.
If one participant received the number 3 or 11, and the second – a number in the range 4-10, then the first participant takes 5 chips from the pot (or the whole pot, if there is a smaller number of chips in it)
If one participant receives the number 2 or 12 (Strung combination), and the second participant receives any other number, then the first participant receives all the chips in the pot.
In other cases, the dice are thrown. The participant who has collected all the chips wins.

name: Умножение (Multiple Game 2-12)
description:
Any participant starts the game, then throws are made in turn. In his turn, the participant throws both dice, sums up the values that have fallen out, after which he can put a chip of his color on any free field corresponding to a number that can be obtained by multiplying an integer by the amount received.
The winner is the participant who first laid out four chips in a row.
Variants

name: Fact-O
description:
Any player starts the game, then dice throws are made in turn. On their first turn, the player throws all three dice, then using at least two mathematical operations, they combine the die results to get a number. When combining numbers, you can use addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. If the resulting number is present on the game board and is not marked, the player places one of their chips on the number, then passes the dice to the next player.

On their second and subsequent moves, the player uses any two mathematical operations — or one operation twice — to combine numbers, trying to get a number adjacent to the number previously marked by him. If successful, they place a chip on this number and score a point; if not, they place a chip without scoring.

If a player cannot combine numbers to create a number on the game board or the number is already marked, they receive a warning.

name: Contig
description:
Any participant starts the game, then throws are made in turn. On his first turn, the player throws all three dice and puts a chip on the field, which is the sum of the values of all three dice. On the second and subsequent moves, the participant performs any mathematical actions (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) on the values of all three dice, resulting in a number that then closes on the game plan.
For each closed number, the player gets 1 point. The game goes eight rounds, the winner is the player with the highest number of points.

name: Gambit: The Pyre Wars
description:
Gambit: The Pyre Wars is a two player, semi-abstract game where each player uses their hand of cards to lead their units to victory through either gaining control of the Pyre, an ancient and ominous artifact, are by eliminating their opponent's leader.

Gambit: The Pyre Wars is played an a 7x7 grid of squares, which each player controlling an army consisting of five units - one leader and four troops. Players take turns activating one of their units by playing of the order cards in their hand, allowing the chosen unit to move to another space or to attack an opposing unit in a particular space.

Players begin each round with a hand of five orders, and no new cards are drawn after playing one. The round ends when both players' hands are empty. At this time the positions of each players' units determine who controls the Pyre based on who has the most "presence" by having their units on various control points on the board. After then replenishing their hands and possibly replacing any lost troops, a new round begins. The game ends when a player has controlled the Pyre at the end of any three rounds or eliminates their opponent's leader.

Gambit: The Pyre Wars allows for dramatic plays thanks to a collection of unique units, each with its own special abilities and powerful Tactics cards that can alter the course of the game. Careful timing and positioning are required to take full advantage of these, however, and the player who manages their hand of cards and controls the battlefield the most effectively will be victorious!
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Esperaization
description:
Welcome to Esperaization! This is a co-operative language-creation game in which you create unknown languages ​​and develop civilizations. What kind of language and what kind of civilization it will be is up to you. To summarize gameplay:

1. The questioner explains the question in an unknown language, and the respondent guesses it.
2. Acquire new words as you solve more problems, and use them to create more futuristic and complex words.
3. What will be the end of your civilization?

name: Esperaization: Entropy
description:
A strange light shines on civilization...

In the Esperaization: Entropy expansion, you meet even more new things — specifically, fifty theme cards — that will surely make your civilization stranger and more evolved. It will be something.

name: Gibberers: Invention of Language and Civilization
description:
People with different knowledge and languages met and united as a new tribe, creating a new language and developing civilization.

Gibberers: Invention of Language and Civilization is an expert word game akin to field linguistics. In the game, players become primitive humans who meet aliens and create a new language that allows them to communicate. As the vocabulary grows and generations pass, the new language evolves like a tech tree.

Gibberers includes short rules that allow for a 60-minute game and full "expert" rules that generate a 180-minute experience not like any other word games.

name: Rabbit Hole
description:
Relaxing during his annual vacation on Earth 1, Mr. Stickerbomb – the infamous mad scientist from Parallel Earth 85, has inadvertently opened a portal to the Multiburp (the craziest corner of the Multiverse), letting in the criminal mastermind Mr. Rabbit and his Odditorium. It’s your job to round them up and send them packing.

AIM OF THE GAME

Make chains of numbered cards to free as many Oddity cards from Mr. Stickerbomb’s Rabbit Holes before you run out of cards in your draw deck.

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Oi navarcoi!
description:
The 5th century BC is the golden age of ancient naval warfare. It is the age of the Persian and Peloponnesian wars, of Salamis and the Arginusae, of Temistocles and Phormio, when triremes ruled the Mediterranean. Oi navarcoi! is a wargame ruleset to play fleet battles during that time.

The trireme was a long and thin unstable platform, with ram as the main armament. It was built for speed and for ramming, a man-propelled guided torpedo. Well trained crews could exploit the trireme's qualities with complex tactics such as the periplous or diekplous.

Oi Navarcoi aims to replicate this specific character of classical era naval warfare, which is different from the later Hellenistic and Roman periods – when ships got bigger and bigger and emphasis was definitely on boarding and missile fire (even with war engines!).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Das Leipziger Zoospiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach the exit wins the game.

The map doubles as a game and a guide through the zoo.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Mari-Rama
description:
Mari-Rama is a game intended to test an individuals ability to survive by finding and maintaining a foothold in the underground society of "Mari-Rama".

Before the game begins, each player receives $3000.00 in any denominations from the City Fund. Next dealers decide by mutual agreement who shall start the game and take turns in a clock-wise direction. The starting dealer rolls the dice, moves their colored pawn the appropriate spaces on the board and follows the instructions on the space on which they land.

Players land on either routes or "special spaces". If a dealer lands on a route space which is not yet invested in by another dealer, they may purchase it from the "city fund" at the investment price indicated on that space. If they do this they receive the route receipt proving their investment. When a dealer lands on a route that is already invested in by another dealer, they must pay the owner the "street price" indicated on the space.

If a dealer can acquire all routes of a particular type of marijuana, they may increase their investment in these routes by offering a greater quantity for sale.

The game ends when a dealer lands in jail for the fifth time or at the end of a predetermined time limit. The winner (of a time limit game) is the dealer with the largest holding of money plus assets.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Dat Hep Gestaan Op Feesboek: De eerste uitbreiding
description:
De Eerste Uitbreiding is an official expansion for Dat Hep Gestaan Op Feesboek. In this expansion you will find 75 new status cards and 125 new addition cards to add to the base game.
This will bring the total possible combinations to 75.000!! That is 30.000 more than with the base game alone. WAJO!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Majesty Adventure
description:
Card game for the whole family; each player takes on the role of a powerful (but greedy) Leader in a Kingdom of Adventurers, who through cunning, courage and luck, sends his minions in search of fame and riches.

Suitable for all ages 6 and up, 2 to 6 players. A game can last from 20 to 30 minutes.

Game based on luck, but that requires a good level of tactics, skill and synergy to be mastered and dominate your minions!

The first player to get 10 Treasure Tokens wins the game!

There are two decks with two different Backs, called Adventure Deck and Adventurer Deck; divide them, shuffle the cards of each deck so that each game is different from the previous ones, keep them face down and place the two separate decks in the center of the table.
Each player draws 3 cards from the Adventurers deck. Also distribute 3 Supply Tokens(ST) to each player, represented by the Food image.

Procedure: The game is divided into rounds, at the beginning of each round the Adventure is determined by the top card of the corresponding deck. Don't reveal it yet, the only information you will have will be the Difficulty level, given by the number on the back of the card ranging from 1 to 3.
Warning, Lv 3 Adventures give more rewards but also hide traps!
After evaluating at the beginning of each turn whether to participate in that specific adventure, players can put one or more Adventurer Cards from their hand onto the field, initially face down.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: The Forgotten History: Mammothodus
description:
The players in the Mammothodus are put in a situation where they must work together as a team to survive and to build a portal to another world in order to avoid the humans that are coming to eliminate your clans. The gameplay is simple but challenging, as each player must strategize on how they can build the portal while defending themselves against the humans. However, the challenge is compounded by the fact that the players are limited in time and resources. Players have to work together to build the portal before the humans reach them and kill them all. The game also offers an expansion pack that provides more clans and resources to the players in order to increase the chances of survival and completing the mission.
The game mechanics itself is simple yet challenging. Players take turns moving figures around a gameboard with the goal of placing their pieces in strategic positions to build a portal and win. Depending on the complexity of the game, it can take anywhere from 60 minutes to 2 hours to complete a full game.

name: Dat Hep Gestaan Op Feesboek: Internetgekkies Themaset
description:
Internetgekkies Themaset is an official expansion for de game Dat Hep Gestaan Op Feesboek. In this expensions you will find 8 new status cards and 24 new addition cards. You will also get the profile of mister Mandje, a unique action to get rid of your addition cards in an original way. MAND!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum – Suicide Squad: Assault on Arkham Asylum
description:
Join the Suicide Squad in this new game mode where you will have to accomplish a very special mission: to extract the Super-Villains. With this "Batman: Escape from Arkham Asylum" expasion you will be able to play the new Extraction game mode. Choose a Super-Villain and enter with the Suicide Squad into the Arkham facility to extract them as you face all the dangers hidden in the asylum.

Includes: 31 miniatures (7 super-villains, 24 adversaries), rulebook, 40+ cards. 5 game tiles, 1 extraction plan, 7 infamy trackers, 30+ tokens, 24 colored base rings
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum – Riot in Blackgate
description:
Now we are the owners of Blackgate and no one, not even Nightwing, will be able to stop us. There's a riot at Blackgate! The Super-Villains have managed to control the asylum.

Nightwing will enter Blackgate to stop the riot, but they won't make it easy for him. They are fully organized and armed. Black Mask knows Arkham Asylum very well, Deadshot is unstoppable, Lady Shiva is also in Blackgate after sneaking in to talk to Black Mask, Deathstroke is in Blackgate to finish a job, and Catwoman has sneaked into Blackgate to search for clues about her past. She won't let Nightwing get her for that reason. In addition, Ratcatcher will fill Blackgate with rats to give them a nice new home, adding an extra touch of danger to the place.

Use these characters to your advantage to stop Nightwing from restoring order to the prison!

They have obtained merchandise from the other side and have set up a small black market to purchase what they need, introducing a deck building mechanic to the game.

Includes: 37 miniatures (Nightwing, 6 super-villains, 3 followers, 27 adversaries), rulebook, 40+ cards. 25+ game tiles, 1 riot plan, 6 infamy trackers, 30+ tokens, 27 colored base rings

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum – Ra's Al Ghul & the League of Assassins
description:
This expansion gives you 2 options - You can face Ra ’s Al Ghul as a boss or play him and his daughter Talia Al Ghul as Super-Villains to take advantage of his incredible abilities to escape from Arkham Asylum. You decide which one to choose!

This expansion gives a new challenge to the escape that will require all your skills to achieve your goal. With this expansion you can play with Ra's Al Ghul too, the Head of the Demon, the most infamous leader of any organization of the world, as a new Super-Villain, and also with its daughter, Talia Al Ghul, who will try to prove why she is a true and worthy heir for her father.

This expansion gives you 2 options - You can face Ra ’s Al Ghul as a boss or play him and his daughter Talia Al Ghul as Super-Villains to take advantage of his incredible abilities to escape from Arkham Asylum. You decide which one.

Includes: 20 miniatures (Ra's Al Ghul, Talia Al Ghul, 9 Scimitar Assassins, 9 Ranged Assassins), 1 Lazarus Pit Tilem 1 Escape Plan,, 20+ cards. 2 infamy trackers & tokens,
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum – Quest at Arkham Asylum
description:
Batman enters Arkham Asylum to stop the Super-Villains. Their escape plan must be foiled to restore order to Arkham Asylum. For this reason, he will use his best detective skills in search of clues, but he will not be alone. Batman will receive the help of Alfred who will be represented by a miniature that will indicate where he has access to the information from the Batcave.

However, Batman is cunning, and will take all dangers into account while he obtains the necessary information to defeat the Super-Villains that will be waiting for him.

“Batman: Quest at Arkham Asylum” is for one player and will change the style of the gameplay. As with the core game, depending on which Super-Villain is the boss, the gameplay objectives and strategy will change.

Includes: 1 miniature (Alfred Pennyworth), 1 rulebook, 161+ cards, 1 Batman character card, 3 ability cards, 12 equipment cards, 7 boss cards, 25 adversary cards, 35+ event cards, 8 clue cards, 30+ villain plan card, 30+ boss combat cards, 10+ NPCs event cards, 1 Heroism tracker and tokens
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum – Heirs of the Cowl
description:
With this expansion you can replace Batman as the stalking nightmare in the core box, as it gives you 6 exciting new characters.

You can also play these characters in the "Batman: Quest at Arkham Asylum" expansion. This means you have 6 additional heroes to play in solo mode, or you can increase the number of players for a fully cooperative experience.

Includes 6 miniatures (Red Robin, Robin (Damian Wayne), Batgirl, Huntress, Red Hood & Orphan), 80+ cards (6 character cards, 18 skill cards, 18 upgrade cards, 20+ equipment cards, 6 boss cards, 30 boss combat cards) and 6 heroism trackers
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum – Stretch Goals
description:
The stretch goal box contains all the unlocked stretchgoals unlocked during the campaign.

28 playable characters
2 skins
2 new bosses
2 vending machines
5 times 9 new henchmen
New item cards
New event cards
Batman upgrade cards
12 dice
Batman combat cards
Special Skill cards
2 face metal coin
Killer Croc's Player's Cards & Infamy Tracker
Victor Zsasz's Player's Cards & Infamy Tracker
Scarecrow's Nightmares (New Adversaries + Escape Plan)
Catwoman's Hero Player's Cards & Heroism Tracker
Azrael's Hero Player's Cards & Heroism Tracker

name: The New Game of Stock Exchange
description:
An auction game where each player selects one of five trades (fishmonger, farmer, poulterer, dealer in wild animals, and gardener). Each trade has five cards having values of 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 counters. The object of the game is to try to collect all five cards of their chosen trade, which is considered completing one’s “Stock”.

All 25 trade cards (5x5) are shuffled with five dealt to each player. Each player also starts with counters totalling a value of 20. The first player selects a card from their hand to auction and places it face down on the table. The highest bidder wins the card and adds it to their hand, with the counters going to the seller. Should a player complete their “Stock”, it is announced (thus ending the game) and that player also receives a bonus of 10 counters.

The game also features 10 speculation cards - five of which earn additional counters (“pay”) and five deduct counters (“draft on bank”). These cards are placed face down and are usually drawn when a player is in financial distress. Players can also pawn any of their own trade cards for their face value in counters.

At the end of the game, any player who did not speculate during the game is required to draw one speculation card before determining final scores. The player with the highest score, calculated by adding the values of trade cards in hand plus the value of their counters, is the winner.

name: Restaurante
description:
Dive into the world of delicious food, skilled cooks, and famous restaurants. With the game components in this box, you can play three distinctive games with your family and friends:

Manage the fast food market in Restaurante: Cook and Sell
Spend an easy, fast, and fun time in a pen and paper game Restaurante: Think and Write
Show your dexterity skills in the game Restaurante: Food Fight


Brief description of Gameplay:

Food Fight


Gets sets of three cards by cycling cards between players
The first set will get you in possession of a precious burger
The second set will grant you the right to shoot at another player
Every set of cards is worth 1 point, and for every miss of yours or hit by another player you get 1 penalty point


Cook & Sell


Choose what food you want to sell. The offer from all players determines the initial price of the food.
Play various Action cards to change the state of the market.
Fill your deck with new cards and upgrade your kitchen.
Be the first to get a certain amount of money.


Think & Write


Mark up to two food types to sell. Mark none or just one and save them for later sales.
The offer from all players determines the initial price of the food.
Circle Booster cells and change the price of products.
Be the player with the most money after the 10th round.


—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Economic, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Market, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: Constantine Magnus
description:
Welcome to the exciting ancient world of Constantine the Great!
During this game, you will use your tactical and strategic potential to fulfill the demands of the Roman Emperor Constantine.

Constantin Magnus is an:

Action selection game in which every action affects all players and grants bonuses for a player who chooses the action
Tile laying game because every chosen action gives, you and your opponents, tiles to be placed on your city maps
Resource management game where you get resources and with them complete different tasks, made by Emperor Constantine, that will grant you points


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Contracts, Grid Coverage, Income, Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Cosmic Empires: Fog Mini-Extension
description:
Originally available as a promo at SPIEL '13 in Essen.

Field "Nebel" ("Fog")
No combat takes place here.
If ships of different players meets on this field, there will be no combat. They all remain on the field.
In addition the fog field cannot be taken by any player. No stone is placed to mark the field.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
Backers of the Fuzzy Mage Fight Kickstarter campaign received two promo cards: Eachthighearn mage character and the FMF Super Mineon for the base game deck.

Eachthighearn basic abilities: needs 10 magic to win; for one turn can adopt another mage's special ability. Essence ability: can adopt the essence ability of another mage for one turn.

FMF Super Mineon: draw 2 cards at the start of your turn, discarding one of your choice.

name: Close Action 3rd Edition: Master Log Pack
description: This pack includes 30 ship logs, including all the most commonly encountered ship types in Close Action, for the British and French navies from the period of 1775-1802. In addition, it includes 2 copies each of the new Close Action version 3.0 chart sheets--namely the light blue gunnery sheet, the dark blue gunnery sheet, the yellow critical hits tables, and the red movement sheet. Note that these sheets are very thick high-quality cardstock with a lacquered finish, so that they are mostly impervious to spills and kinks.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Box Dice
description:
The game is started by any participant, later they take turns.
In his turn, the participant consistently throws the bone twice. The first throw determines how large a cell block it should fit in the game plan. The second throw determines the number of blocks that must be placed on it.
The participant places the blocks horizontally or vertically, crossing out the cells entering the given block in the game plan. The thickness of the block is always one cell, the block can start from any cell, the blocks can touch the ends or sides, but cannot cross or place on top of each other, the block cannot be curved, the block cannot go beyond the game plan.
The participant continues to throw the dice and place the blocks as long as he can place the blocks in the game plan. When this opportunity disappears from him, he finishes the game and counts the number of penalty points equal to the number of unclosed cells.
The winner is the participant who scored the least number of penalty points.

name: King of Spicey
description:
Test your culinary knowledge by guessing the right ingredient in a funny spicy card game

Relaxing game for all ages

Fast, Funny and even a little strategic

Colorful, whimsical and you can bring it everywhere

Separate the contingency deck from the main deck, consisting of recipes and ingredients, which will be called the "pantry".
Shuffle the pantry deck and deal 4 cards face down to each player
You choose who starts, no matter how.
The starting player places a card face down from their hand in the middle of the table and loudly specifies which recipe it is.
The other players take turns, following the established order, play one of their cards from their hand, placing it face up in the middle of the table. Players must field an ingredient card that they believe is contained in the recipe in play.
Those who do not have the right ingredient or do not want to risk, can decide to fold, not playing any cards.
When each player has made their choice, the one who started turns their card face up, revealing it. Then he lists aloud the ingredients present in that specific recipe and at that point he takes all the cards in play, placing them next to him, in a dedicated pile.
The player (s) who have the wrong ingredient, playing a card that is not present in the specific recipe, draw 1 card from the pantry deck and 1 from the unexpected deck.
Finally, always following the order of the turns, the next player places his recipe card in the center of the table, and so on.

The objective of the game is to run out of cards in hand and when only one is missing, shout "Spiked", under penalty of having to draw 2 cards from the dispensation deck.

The player whose turn it is to put his recipe card into play can decide to bluff, especially if he doesn't have one. The other players can accuse him of bluffing but before verifying it everyone must have completed their turn. Whoever has been caught bluffing will have to draw 2 cards from the dispensation deck and one from the unexpected deck; Who has guessed the bluff can discard a card from his hand; finally, in the event of a mistake on the part of the accused, he will be the one to draw a card from the dispensation deck.

The Recipe cards have 3 precise and fundamental classifications: Origin, Flavor and Type of Cooking. Pay attention to these categories whenever you encounter Unexpected cards that can facilitate or compromise your final victory.

Provenance means the origin of the dish and you just need to know the state of origin, represented on the card by a flag.
The Flavors are divided into Salty - Spicy - Sweet - Sour and Vegetarian
Finally, the types of Preparation or Kitchen are divided into Pot - Pan - Oven or Fridge

name: Dicemon
description:
Dicemon is an exciting board game for 2 to 4 players that combines monster catching and combat. Inspired by the popular monster catching video game, this game implements its mechanics in an accessible format without the need to purchase additional cards. The goal is to capture monsters and participate in trials and events during the adventure phase to earn victory points and be the first trainer to reach 20 points. Improve your decks and evolve your dicemons to increase your chances of victory in combat and become the best trainer.

—description from the designer

name: Llamas Unleashed: Cosplay Goaticorn Promo Card
description:
2021 Convention Promo card

Card Text
Magical Coat card
This card counts as both a Goat card and a Ram card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Llamas Unleased: Llama Summoner Promo Card
description:
2023 Convention Promo card

Card Text
Magical Llama card
When this card enters your Field, you may search the deck for a Llama card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the deck.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Conquest: Two Player Starter Set – Nords Vs City States
description:
Conquest The Last argument of the Kings 2.0 (TLAOK2.0) is a tabletop gaming world produced by Para Bellum Wargames. Our flagship, “Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings” is a Mass Battle game and under its umbrella you will find our entire range of miniatures. Its sister system, “Conquest: First Blood 2”, is a skirmish game, played with the same minis and offering fast-paced combats. Both systems come with easy to learn rulesets, which also afford veteran players multiple levels of strategy to master. With both rulebooks available online for free and a “Living World” platform which allows the community to influence the lore, the world of Conquest invites you to an immersive gaming experience!

This Starter Box brings 2 armies

The Nordsmen (huge vikings with gigants)
vs
City States

also with a new set of rules of game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Wet Monkeys
description:
Objective:

Collect six(6) of your opponent's monkeys to win the game. Get six water counters on an opponent's monkey to soak it. Soaked monkeys are collected as trophies. The first player to collect six trophies wins!

Start:

Each player sets aside one #1 monkey card from their deck. Each player shuffles and offers their opponent a cut of their deck. Each player puts the set aside #1 monkey card on the center square in the first row on their side of the board with one water counter on it. Each player rolls the D6 die to see who goes first. Highest roll wins. If a rematch the loser goes first.

name: Tanks on Fire
description:
Objective: Collect six(6) of your opponent's tanks to win the game. Get six damage counters on an opponent's tank to destroy it. Destroyed tanks are collected as trophies. The first player to collect six trophies wins! Contents: 1 game board 1 blue tank deck (18 cards) 1 red tank deck (18 cards) 1 D6 die and 50 damage counters Start: Each player sets aside one #1 tank card from their deck. Each player shuffles and offers their opponent a cut of their deck. Each player puts the set aside #1 tank card on the center square in the first row on their side of the board with one damage counter on it. Each player rolls the D6 die to see who goes first. Highest roll wins. If a rematch the loser goes first.

—description from the designer

name: RedTide
description:
700 years ago, a worldwide geological cataclysm changed the face of our planet and humanity. Countries joined to survive and maintain what remained of society. These two factions have discovered that the continent of Antarctica had shifted north and the icecap has completely melted. A new war is beginning over control over Antarctica's resources.

RedTide is a real-time strategy (RTS) game that brings the experience of RTS video-games, i.e. Command and Conquer, to the tabletop.
Players will build their base, train their army, collect ore, and be the first to complete their mission objectives to win.
mechanics: Action Timer, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: Flash: The Electronic Arcade Game
description:
Electronic fun in a flash for the whole family. Electronic computer. Sound. Light. Instant cumulative scoring. Individual game selector. Designed for play on table or wall. Ready, Aim, Play.

Pinball: 6 chances to hit all 8 color panels and light all the lights for a top score. Bonus points if you hit more than one panel at a time.

All or Nothing: Half the lights are on and half are off. Use strategy and you can turn them all on or off and win.

Memory: The panels are given a different point value for each game. Aim for the top points without hitting the zero panel that will wipe out your score.

Moving Targets: Round and round the lights go and you've got 40 seconds to score by hitting the panel that is lit while the lights keep going.

Time Trials: Speed and accuracy count as 8 panels light at random 2 to 6 second sequences. The shorter time the panel is lit the higher the score for a hit.

name: The Narrows: Naval Operations in the Dardanelles
description:
The Narrows is a solitaire game that recreates the Allied naval operations in the Dardanelles in February-March 1915, with the objective of forcing the straits.

During three or four turns, the player must choose a firing line for their squadrons and manage their assets and firing opportunities at each fire position in order to disable the Ottoman batteries. The fire from these batteries and the mines will hamper the player's attempts.

—description from the publisher

name: Bear Hunt 捕熊陷阱 [Bǔ xióng xiànjǐng]
description:
Postcard wargame of the battle of Hunhung Ni (Sinhung-Ni / Xinxing Li) in late November 1950 during the Korean War. Two players represent the Chinese 'volunteers' and the US forces respectively.
A standard hex-and-counter wargame (move-fight-recover for each side in turn) lasting six 1-day turns and containing only 21 counters. Map scale is 1km per hex.
In an unusual mechanic, the Chinese use a d10 in combat, and the US a d6, but both seek to roll less that their own attack strength minus the enemy's defence strength.
The Chinese player must reduce US morale to 0 in order to win immediately, otherwise they win if Chinese units occupy the town of Hunhung Ni, while the US wins if it exists a given number of strength points off the map.

name: Dylan Dog Poker
description: A deck of poker cards inspired by the Italian comic book Dylan Dog. It includes a manual containing 25 solitaire card games to be played with the deck, and named after iconic elements from the comic.

name: Жёванный крот (Fricking heck)
description:
This game is a great conversation topic generator and a way to get to know your friends better.
Everything is very simple - decide which questions you will play with: with ordinary or piquant. Take a card and read it. Everyone who did what's described there, should drink.
The game ends when all cards have been played. You will learn a lot about your friends and you can hear unusual stories.

name: Шот: Всё выключено (Shot: All Uninclusice)
description:
Shot it's a drinking game with tasks. All tasks are about holidays, the sea and the beach, so you can feel yourself on vacation even in January in your apartment.

On your turn, you either complete a task or drink. For tasks you get bonuses, but you decide whether to spend them or not. Sometimes special animals shows from the deck and make you move.

The game will end when the “Time to go home” card appears from the deck. The winner is the one who has accumulated the most completed tasks.

name: Шот #безфильтра (Shot: unfiltered)
description:
The Shot #unfiltered is a drinking game. You either complete the task or you drink. Tasks are about intimacy (up to kisses), about frank conversations and actions. And also about social networks - subscribers will be surprised. With each task and with each sip, the game is more fun and frank.

The game ends when the "Drinked" card shows from the deck. The winner is the one who completes the most tasks and still stands on his feet.

name: Dungeon Blitz: Catacomb of Chaos
description:
Dungeon Blitz is a series of fast-playing solo adventure games.

The Temple of Kur-Tar stood atop a hill in the lonely moors for a thousand years, until it was destroyed during a great battle. Now the land is haunted, the dead rise from their graves and demons crawl from their fiery pits. Someone must venture into the ruins and put an end to the evil that lurks there. Are you clever and lucky enough to survive the CATACOMB OF CHAOS?

In each adventure you create a character and undertake an exciting and dangerous dungeon crawl with little more than your trusty weapon and wits. All you need is some paper, a pencil and three six-sided dice. The dungeon is randomly generated and you will map it as you play. As you discover new locations you might be attacked by monsters, set off a trap or find wondrous treasure. Eventually, you will find the terrible monster at the heart of the dungeon and either defeat it or die trying!
categories: Adventure, Book, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Strung
description:
Participants roll the dice at the same time. Each adds up the deleted values. Further action depends on the resulting amount:
If both participants receive numbers in the range of 4-10, then the participant who receives the smaller number will put the number of chips equal to the difference between the number of participants into the pot.
If one participant receives the number 3 or 11, and the second-a number in the range of 4-10, then the first participant takes out 5 chips from the pot (or the entire pot, if there are a smaller number of chips in it)
If one participant receives the number 2 or 12 (string combination), and the second participant receives any other number, then the first participant receives all the chips in the pot.
•In other cases, roll the dice. The participant who has collected all the chips wins.

name: Architect and the Multiverse of Greatness
description:
Embark on a journey through multiple dimensions, where you take on the role of an architect tasked with designing and constructing the greatest structures across the multiverse.

Architect and the multiverse of greatness is a party game for 3-99 players, each player is an architect who travels through the universe, and finds the perfect one to build their masterpiece.

In each turn gamers have to open several multiverse cards and architecture, and each player has to decide what place and what building is the best combo. But be careful, you must choose the unique one, so you have to guess what other players are thinking, the player who chooses the universe that the least player goes to gets the point.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Timescape: Loup-Garou de Londres
description:
Timescape, a new collection of escape games, to take you on a supernatural experience outside of space and time... and transport you here to 1888, one night, in the heart of London. Students of quantum physics professor Heinrich Zeist, you have been transported through space and time following a failed teleportation experiment, and, as if that wasn't enough, you learn that you must repair the disasters that your jumps in time cause, in order to be able to return.

Here you are in 1888, in the heart of London, the full moon has just risen, in front of you a half-wolf, half-man creature is staring at you, you hear the voice of the professor: "Run away, but you will have to undo the curse of the werewolf to be able to return! "Investigate, find ways to fight, don't delay! In the box, you'll find 60 cards to develop the scenario and its surprises, with puzzles to solve collaboratively.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Timescape, une nouvelle collection d'escape game, pour vous faire vivre une expérience surnaturelle hors de l'espace et du temps... et vous transporter ici en 1888, une nuit, au coeur de Londres. Elèves du professeur de physique quantique Heinrich Zeist, vous avez été transportés dans l'espace et le temps à la suite d'une expérience de téléportation ratée, et, comme si cela ne suffisait pas, vous apprenez, effet papillon oblige, que vous devez réparer les catastrophes que vos sauts dans le temps entraînent, pour pouvoir revenir.

Vous voilà en 1888, au coeur de Londres, la pleine lune vient à peine de se lever, face à vous une créature mi-loup, mi-homme darde son regard, vous entendez la voix du professeur : "Fuyez, mais vous devrez défaire la malédiction du loup-garou pour pouvoir revenir ! " Enquêtez, trouvez les moyens de lutter, ne tardez pas ! Dans la boîte, vous trouverez 60 cartes pour développer le scénario et ses suprises, avec des énigmes à résoudre de manière collaborative.

—description from the publisher

name: East Rune
description:
“East Rune” is a competitive card game played with a card set that reinterprets the rune cards used for divination so that they can be used in the game.

Let's compete for chair card by playing cards with matching runes.

When the game is over, you will score points for your chair cards collected and lose points for cards remaining in your hand.

The person with the highest score is the winner.

name: Villain
description:
Villain is an immersive group/party game that gives each player roles and tasks to perform while trying to out the player who has the role of the “villain.”

The best part is that you can play it for 5 minutes or 5 hours and it will be just as fun! Ages 8+ recommended, but younger have fun too, and can be teamed up with older players.

In this fast and exciting party game, you will pretend that your house or other building you are in is a town. Each player will have a Character card that will tell you Who you are. You also get a Job card to Do. There are many Job cards in these decks, so you can continue having fun playing over and over!

However, if you are a citizen doing your job, you will want to watch your back because someone is a VILLAIN. The Villain is KNOCKING OUT (tapping), as many people as they can. If the Villain avoids getting caught and Knocks Out key citizens they win! But, if the Villain is caught and accused or enough tasks are completed CITIZENS win!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Area Movement, Race, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Pitchfork Rebellion
description:
A one map game.
60 to 80 0.75” counter game of the Monmouth Invasion in 1685 England.
Monmouth needs to either take Bristol or breakout towards London.
No CRT, no supply, no stacking.
Small game with a lot of choices.
Desertion, Recruitment, Variable Government Reinforcements will keep both sides guessing.

—description from the designer

name: Rough Draft
description:
Rough Draft is a screenplay drafting game where you generate your own screenplay, one scene at a time!

Players create a 3-act masterpiece across 6 rounds, with every round consisting of a Drafting and Voting Phase.

At the start of the game each player is given an Inspiration card they score from, and try to keep their inspiration hidden from the other players throughout the game.

Then all players are assigned a Role card that gives them unique benefits or perks.

Players draw 5 Scene cards in the Drafting Phase and create a unique part of the screenplay. Players try to include their scoring Inspirations in the scenes, but try to not give their hand away!

In the Voting Phase players use tucked cards as voting power and choose the screenplay that ends in the final Rough Draft.

The player with the highest number of scoring genre cards in the final screenplay wins! The winner names the masterpiece and everyone helps reenact their new favorite script.

Tell a one-of-a-kind story together and then pitch it to Hollywood!

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Closed Drafting, Connections, Deduction, Finale Ending, Hidden Roles, Hidden Victory Points, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Storytelling, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Pick The Pug: Kittens Expansion Pack
description:
The Pick The Pug Kitten Expansion Pack includes:
1 Kitten Pug
1 Mythical Creature
1 Donkey
2 + 2 Blue Monkeys
1 + 1 Green Monkeys
1 Orange Monkey
1 White Monkey
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Pick The Pug: Eternals Expansion Pack
description:
The Pick The Pug Eternals Expansion Pack includes:
1 Eternal Pug
1 Mythical Creature
1 Donkey
2 + 2 Blue Monkeys
1 + 1 Green Monkeys
1 Orange Monkey
1 White Monkey
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Nobody's Fool
description:
This solitaire game is a fan-fiction re-imagining of the story that unfolds in the comic Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, volume 1, #2, “Nobody’s Fool”, published by Mirage Studios in July 1987.

It consists of a 54-card deck, and it is free to print and play.

Take on the roles of the four ninja turtles and their unexpected ally, “Nobody”. Break up an unlawful weapons sale, leave evidence of the exchange for the police, and vanish into the night!

The game lasts 4 rounds. In each round, you draft 13 cards from the deck into your hand. Then, you play these cards from your hand to the tableau and/or use the actions on them in any order that you choose. The order of card play and the timing of their use is the heart of the puzzle.

Each round has specific objectives that must be met, or you lose. By the time the last plot card is played, your ninjas and their vigilante friend will have had a busy night.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play

name: Starship: Stage Zero
description:
Stage Zero is more than a board game. Each element shares the story of Starship as players race to not only win the game but also solve side-quests and learn some aerospace engineering along the way. The game objective is to attain 42 Progress Points before the Boss returns by building the launch tower (Mechazilla), installing Raptor Engines on your ship & booster, all while surviving events occurring around the Launch Site, named Starbase.

Players are dealt a hand of 2 Tower Cards, and on their turn choose 2 of 4 available actions. 1) They can try to build Mechazilla, Starship, or its booster by trying to match one of their cards to another players. 2) Activate an Event Card and play out its effect. 3) Deliver engines for installation on the rocket. 4) Attempt to launch the rocket in its current status.

Turns continue clockwise, with the group gaining more Progress Points from how successful launches are. The game ends when the Boss token returns to Starbase after 42 turns. If enough points have been scored, everyone wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Connections, Cooperative Game, Race, Simulation

name: Thinko.Tierra de sueños
description:
Create spontaneous and fun stories by quickly connecting different elements. You will not have to pause until you reach the time set in the countdown.
3 different ways to play: Thinko Team (Cooperative game), Thinko Story (Creation of stories with a sequence of images), Thinko Race (Compete to be the winner by reaching the finish line first).
Have you counted sheep to sleep? THINKO, a very creative sheep is the one who creates dreams, mixing very strange things, animals and characters from LAND OF DREAMS, a place where anything can happen. From a fire-breathing apple that flies in the air, a fish with woman's legs, to a flying octopus, THINKO will create the funniest stories.
Have you thought what would happen if you never dreamed again? LAND OF DREAMS is in danger, ENZO together with other villains have come not only to create nightmares but also to steal all dreams, but THINKO together with the 5 GUARDIANS will prevent it, help them by creating with all your imagination and fantasy the most originals.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Party Game

name: Mikes Skirmish Game
description:
Mikes Skirmish Game is a table top skirmish and RPG game. It comes with 3 ways to play right off the bat! Skirmish battles using our character cards or using your own created with the rules. A narrative or more linear campaign for the Campaign you are playing. And finally a Open World Campaign where party building, Base Building, and Character growth are paramount to the game.
This is a miniature agnostic system so all you really need to play is our Rules. 1D20, some index cards, and miniatures!

name: Hücrebaz
description:
("Hücrebaz" is defined as equivalent of "Cell Master")

How do mobile phones work? How do they communicate among themselves?How is communication provided by the switchboards?

Not through satellite communications as many people imagine. Satellites are only engaged in intercontinental and similar situations, but under normal conditions, communications are being established on the earth by means of radio and transmission antennas at the tower or building-like heights that are located on base stations in close proximity to each other.

The stations that are planned to be established on certain areas on the map provide service in those areas so that the subscribers in the area can communicate with mobile phones.

The stations required for communication with mobile phones are not able to provide service very far since the outpu powers are not very high and a new station must be installed after a certain distance.

Our game starts at this point... As your mobile phoine infrastructure service provider, your aim and your job; to decide which base station should be installed in which area, to rent the area, to set up the required base station and to cover all the cells where the subscribers is located on the map...

In this direction your goal to win the game is not to cover the areas more than your competitors, but the total number of subscribers you have covered have to be higher. As you upgrade your established towers, your coverage will expand to the extent.

In places where the towes are to be installed, it is necessary to obtain the right of installation by renting. Every cell that is rented or covered is painted in the player's own color and yet controlled by the player. Sometimes luck turns; extra prizes are won, but sometimes they do not get lucky; with public reactions, natural disasters or theft, the player may lose control of his place or resurces.

Rent Sites
Install Towers
Cover Cells

Components:
Game board pieces (8 units)
Active Player Token (1 unit)
Special Chance Dice (2 units)
Chance Cards (52 cards)
Summary Cards (2 cards)
Game Guide (1 unit)
Tower Piece Part 1 (30 units)
Tower Piece Part 2 (24 units)
Tower Piece Part 3 (18 units)
Tower Piece Part 4 (12 units)
Tower Piece Part 5 (6 units)
Blue Coverage Token (100 units)
Red Coverage Token (100 units)
Green Coverage Token (100 units)
Yellow Coverage Token (100 units)
1 Gold (40 units)
5 Gold (10 units)
1 Metal (40 units)
10 Gold (10 units)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Dastardly Drivers
description:
Drivers! Start your engines! Get ready and…be dastardly!

Dastardly Drivers is a simple, fast-paced racing game where players compete against each other to cross the finish line first! But, to do that, they’ll need to employ some strategy, some guile, and a bit of luck to avoid any obstacles on the track and finish ahead of the other racers.

Each player secretly chooses their actions for the round and each action is revealed in player turn-order (which changes based on the player position on the track). Players can also receive items that will aid them along the track or help them hinder their opponents.

The game supports up to 6 players and features a modular track creation system so no two races need to be the same! Want to do 1 lap of a long 20-tile track? Perfect! Want to do 3 laps of a short 8-tile track? Sounds great! Dastardly Drivers provides the components you need to make the track to your desired specifications!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Catch the Leader, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #05 – Favorite Enemies
description:
While friends and family make this time of year all the more special, having your favorite enemies makes this time of year all the more motivating. What better source of being your best self is available than showing out your competition? Favorite enemies: the cure all for a lazy Sunday afternoon.

—description from the publisher

Expansion 5 - Favorite Enemies expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards and a new optional rule - Companions:

- 5 Companions
- 1 New Environment
- 7 New Quests
- 5 New Items
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #06 – Bountiful Boon
description:
It's the time of year when you find yourself overwhelmed with wrapped boxes of different colors and possibilities. What is inside each one? Is it a present? Is it a dangerous threat? Maybe there's little to no difference for you! Celebrate this holiday season with all the things that matter most: whatever television and movies have told you about the holidays. This year someone told me it's a stuffed animal character that likes to be tickled, for which I refuse to participate.

—description from the publisher

Expansion 6 - Bountiful Boon expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards:

- 2 New Environments
- 1 New Shop Card
- 4 New Companions
- 6 New Quests
- 5 New Items

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #07 – Resolutions
description:
Who needs resolutions when you're perfectly fine? I mean, honestly, you've made it this far in life and are still walking around, doing quests, existing. That's got to be worth something, right? So instead of trying to new-year-new-you, relish in the fact that you're pretty great and lean in on that.

—description from the publisher

Expansion 7 - Resolutions expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards:

- 1 New Environment
- 1 New Companion
- 4 New Quests
- 3 New Items
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: ANTARA
description:
ANTARA is a solo tower defense game based on dice placement.

THEMATIC
Play as a group of heroes that must protect their city against the Darklord and his army.

GOALS
First, you must find and destroy 3 relic cards hidden in the threat deck. The relic cards give the Darklord immortality. After destroying the 3 relics, you can now damage the Darklord.

The game is won if you defeat the Darklord. You lose it if your city's defense level drops to 0.

GAMEPLAY QUICK OVERVIEW
Throughout the game, you will enter a succession of rounds until you reach the win or loss condition. A turn consists of 4 phases :

Phase I – "Preparation phase"
Launch all the action dice available.

Phase II – "Actions phase"
During this phase you may take the following actions anytime you want and in any order :
Play a hero - Place an action dice on the hero's card then resolve one of the 2 actions on the card.

● Manipulate dice value - Spend mana points to reroll a dice or change his value by -1/+1.
● Resolve a plot card - Roll dice in the required combination.
● Destroy a relic card - Resolve the specific action mentioned on the relic card.
● Gain additional dice - Spend mana points to add a bonus dice to your dice pool. (3 max)
● Increase defense level - Spend mana points to increase your defense level by 1.

Phase III – "Enemies phase"
In this phase, the enemy plays. You will need to resolve the different steps in the following order:

1. Reveal a new threat card and place it on the battlefield
2. Launch the threat dice. The result of the threat dice will determine the enemies who will be activated during this turn.
3. All activated enemies should be played from left to right and from bottom to top.
4. Reveal a scheme card and resolve it.

Phase IV – "Clean up phase"
During this turn, decrease the defense level by one for every hero that is K.O. (a hero becomes K.O. if his lifepoint falls to 0 during this turn).

The dice activated on K.O.'s hero should be placed in the Sanatorium and the others should be placed in the Barracks.

The dice in the Sanataorium can’t be played until you play a specific action.
The dice in the Barracks can be played for the next round.
Restore all the K.O.'s hero lifepoint.
Start a new a turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Döttrar & Söner
description:
The game is a trick-taking card game.
Goal of the game: In Döttrar & Söner ("Daughters and Sons") every player plays as one of Gustav Vasa’s children: Erik, Johan, Katarina, Cecilia, Magnus, or Anna. In the game you have markers representing influence and are called influence markers. You must win as many influence markers as possible to convince the riksdag of estates that you should be Sweden’s next regent.

Who wins? The first person to get ten influence markers wins the game and is crowned regent.

name: Subliminal
description:
This is a game that opens the door leading to the secrets of our subconscious, using subliminal messages and colors – the mother tongue of the subconscious mind. How well can you read minds and hidden messages? How well do you know one another? Are you skilled in coded communications? If your coding and decoding skills are top-notch, you will be faster in arranging all your colors on the common board...

During the game each player tries to acquire tiles in colors corresponding to the archetype characters on their cards (eg. six red, four yellow and two greens) and to put them on the central puzzle. To do so, he/she needs to construct clue using letters and numbers and guess others clues, too. As soon as one of the players see their color combination at the central color puzzle, he ought to say SUBLIMINAL and he is the winner of the first phase. Now he needs to construct final subliminal message. Actual winner is the one who guesses final message, or the author of the message (if nobody manages to guess it).

-description from designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Voting

name: None Like Me
description:
You will take on someone's figure, facial expressions, gesticulation and voice in turbulent life situations.

Some of the characters will be easier to relate to, some more difficult, but exploring another way of being is always an exciting adventure that will motivate you to discover hidden qualities within that you may not have pondered before, and it will make you laugh long after the game is over.

There are 54 characters and hundreds of funny situations in which they will get to express themselves.

But, there is the tricky part - they will have to hide a special word in their scripts and guess other players hidden words if they want to win.

In the first phase of the game, when players are guessing each others characters, they score points when someone guesses who they were and when they guess others characters. In the second phase, when secret word is involved, everybody tries to find "hard" word for others and to hide word given from others in self constructed one sentence script.
Each time players guess the secret word they advance on the scoring board and each time nobody guesses secret word, the author advances even more. First player to reach 24 points on the scoring board - wins.

-description from designer

name: Face By Case
description:
Astonish everyone (including yourself) with your illustrating skills. In this creative game participants draw 6 cards from the deck. Cards contain shapes of head, eyes, nose, mouth, ears and hair. Each participant draws unique face using acquired cards. The result is number of different, funny faces and expressions.

Game consists of 4 decks of card. Each deck aims at different drawing: face, robot, dog or fish. Other side of cards hold parts of large puzzles.

There is non competitive mode and competitive mode of the game.
In non competitive mode player ore players randomly takes six cards numbered from one to six from one of decks and draws new characters by following suggestions on cards. In more advanced version, players mix all the decks and take randomly 12 cards and try to implement as much elements as they can in new drawings.

In competitive version, players play simple game of matching numbers by order. The first who puts all cards in order first ends the game. Players count who acquired the most sets of cards from 1 to 6. The players with the most "Face by Case" sets is the winner.

The game develops drawing skills, releases tension in children who are intimidated to draw, creates supportive environment for drawing and talking about emotions.

-description from designer

name: Disintegration
description:
Players start out as an atom of Uranium-235. The goal is to use various decay processes to shed bits of your nucleus until all that remains is a single elementary particle (i.e. a proton or neutron).

Be careful to avoid decaying into a stable isotope or becoming an isotope that cannot exist in this reality (at least, according to 1970s atomic theory and knowledge.)

name: Géronimo Stilton le jeu: Frissons au château hanté
description:
The players are trying to find diamonds placed randomly around the castle. Play your cards to move wisely to the gems but some nasty bats wants to steal your loot, avoid them and try to escape the castle. The winner is the one out with the most diamonds.

Basically it's a mix between Macgregor and memory themed with Geronimo Stilton, a popular kid franchise in the mid 2000's.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory

name: Madread: The Boardgame
description:
This original boardgame from Mindwork Games takes place in the dystopian city of Madrid, where ancient rivalries crash into the modern era.

The plague of the undead Antorchas unleashed by the infamous lord of the Undead Don Garcia, brought the city to its knees, but it’s not over yet… the spirit of the people has demanded the return of the famous Commander El Cid Campeador and his Revenant Champions to carry on the RECONQUISTA of Madrid!

Madread: The Boardgame has a cooperative soul but this statement can quickly change when players start to accumulate FAME and equipment… even from stealing each other's loot and kills.
In the end only one Revenant is going to be the El Cid Campeador Champion’s.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Kill Steal, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Shark-opoly
description: A shark-themed knock-off of Monopoly from Late for the Sky Publishing
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Morimentu
description:
A board-game about dig to find your family memories and be able to discover the family tree.

Each player must be able to complete the combinations of objects of the various ancestors found in the ground to reconstruct the family tree, within the time set by a 20-minute background music.

The game takes place in turns clockwise starting from the first player, everyone will show a certain number of land cards based on the tool unlocked up to that moment (using the coins) and will look for the correct combinations corresponding to the ancestors, so that they can keep the terrain cards of the combination and being able to flip the corresponding ancestor card, placing it in the correct position with respect to your objective card.

The game ends when the game time runs out or when all ancestors are completed. Each player gets a final score based on how many ancestors they have revealed, where they were placed, and how many items they have found.

Developed during the Global Game Jam 2023 in Cagliari (Italy) by Stefano Fadda, Franco Sardo, Leonardo Tomasi, illustrations by Laura Sotgiu, Giulia Scalas, music by Giuliano Cau.

—description from the designer

name: Mafia: The Card Game
description:
Think you've got what it takes to rule the roost? Tactically outrank your opponents by using your cards to work your way up the mafia tree.

As you progress from poker chips and getaway cars, to underbosses and The Don, don't forget; as high as you make it up the Mafia tree, The Don's Momma always has the final say!

Get rid of your cards first to be named The Don, and avoid being labelled the traitor.

—description from the publisher

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 32
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 32 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: DKT: Das klimaneutrale Talent
description:
Who will improve the CO2 balance and plant the most trees? Add to this the conversion of fossil power plants into renewable energy sources and the common goal of climate neutrality comes ever closer!

In the family game Das klimaneutrale Talent (DKT), the topics of environment, climate and sustainability take center stage, but without a raised forefinger, but with a lot of fun and a willingness to take risks, as well as a portion of luck. Based on the classic game Das kaufmännische Talent, which has been known for generations, especially in Austria, free areas may be leased here and then planted with trees (later with forests), which positively influences the climate marker. Environmentally conscious people use the train in the game and everyone tries to do their part in shutting down fossil fuel power plants, as this commitment is rewarded at the end of the game.

Depending on your willingness to take risks and your financial strength, you can also make lively investments in "The Climate-Neutral Talent", sometimes facing insolvency or even bankruptcy. Weather extremes, the CO2 tax and penalties for climate sinners provide additional excitement. However, one thing is always clear: the climate can only be saved by working together, which is why it's win or lose. Whoever has planted the most trees and forests is crowned climate hero.

Game target
The goal is to work together to achieve climate lity. To achieve this, you must either convert three fossil fuel power plants into renewable energy sources or reduce CO² emissions to a minimum.
In addition, the person who has planted the most trees will be crowned climate hero.

In a special way, The Climate Neutral Talent combines cheerful fun with informative facts about sustainable development and goals for climate neutrality according to the UN "Agenda 2030". More is vividly explained in the accompanying booklet.

Of course, Piatnik has not only placed value on sustainability editorially, but also in the game production. Das klimaneutrale Talent is produced entirely with materials from the EU, and the (pre-)materials are FSC-certified. Administration and production at Piatnik in Austria use 100% green electricity. However, this does not only apply to this game, but for years already to the majority of Piatnik products.

All components used in the game were produced from biodegradable materials!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Mein grüner Fußabdruck
description:
The quiz for smart kids on the topic of the environment and sustainability.

What helps the environment? What is the "ozone hole"? And who is Greta Thunberg? Together you try to answer questions about the environment and climate and move your game piece forward. If someone doesn't know the answer, the team can help. Can you make it to the finish line?

Also includes rules for the game for 1 player: in and different difficulty levels!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Mein grüner Fußabdruck: Das Spiel
description:
What can you do for the climate? How do you protect the environment?

In this game you will try to slow down climate change. Work together to stop the approaching problems and keep global warming as low as possible. Because even if it takes the cohesion of everyone to improve the Earth: You can take action with small steps and be part of the solution.

With 92 quiz questions that teach children about sustainability.

The children's and family game "My green footprint" is suitable for 1-4 players:inside from 8 years and lasts about 30 minutes.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Environmental, Trivia

name: Lumen: A Game of Photographic Terminology
description:
Lumen is a game of photographic terminology and image analysis that challenges players to visually interpret concepts and critique images.

Designed as a fun and engaging educational experience, Lumen introduces players to terminology useful in photographic critique and discussion, while also encouraging critical thinking, debate, and analysis.

Lumen is a judging game that consists of four parts: reading a terminology card, submitting photo cards, judging, and scoring. Each round a judge reads a terminology card and players submit photo cards in response. The judge selects the photo card they feel best interprets the term and explain why they made their choice, then players engage in discussion. The first player to score five points by winning five rounds wins the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Jiggered
description:
Easy to learn, simple to play, yet always a challenge. Complete your puzzle and find your mastercard to win...but move the wrong way and you could be jiggered.

In Jiggered, players traverse a board with their markers collecting numbered personal puzzle pieces in order, then finally their mastercard. Dice is used for movement, but rolling a six means the board will be shifted from below, leaving unpredictable holes that players' markers can fall through and be lost. Each player has 5 markers, but if all are lost, they are out of the game. Solitaire variants exist, and the game also comes with poker chips to add a betting element to play.

—description from the back of the box

name: Aces R High
description:
A fast and fun WW2 fighter plane combat game. Simple rules that fit on a single page. All you need is an ordinary deck of playing cards which are used to determine possible manouvres, a few model planes (flat counters included if you don't have those yet), some friends that don't mind being shot down and a ruthless, killer instinct!

Optional rules allow for altitude advantage
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simulation, Turn Order: Auction

name: Brigare: Secret of Eden
description:
You've discovered heretics' terrible plot to envelop the world in darkness. To protect your enjoyable everyday life, you'll have to band together with your fellow students to stop the heretics' assault and interrupt their dark ritual.

The players cannot fight the heretics directly. You must sniff out their target location and strengthen its defenses, laying traps to neutralize them. At times, you may receive assistance from your schoolteachers or from nature.

"Brigare" is a cooperative game where players do their best to improvise a solution within a limited period of time. Can your plans achieve victory over an overwhelming opponent?

name: The Gate of R'lyeh: Empath
description:
A promo card distributed at Origins and Gen Con in 2018.

Empath: Shuffle with the Investigator cards, discard 1 and then shuffle in the Cultist cards.

"If a Cultist is Discovered, you become a Cultist."

name: Victory of the RAF: The biggest match of modern times
description:
Vintage strategy board game about air battle with chess mechanic, square to square movement. Different airplanes (heavy bombers, diving bombers, fighters - each side owns 15 airplanes) and anti aircraft guns (each side owns 5 such a guns) have different actions.
Player, who first capture opponents town, wins the game.

Published in Brussel, Belgium.

—user summary

name: NAVKAKRI: Ancient game meets Tech
description:
NAVKAKRI is the Modern avatar of Nine Men’s Morris Board game! The nine men’s Morris is one of the most played strategy board games dating back centuries. The earliest traces can be found in the Roman empire and possibly Ancient Egypt. This game is known by many names, such as Mill or Windmill. FROLIX has designed NAVKAKRI board game which improves skills in strategy and planning. NAVKAKRI follows all rules of Nine men's Morris Game which is a strategy board game for two players. The board consists of a grid with twenty-four intersections or points. Each player has nine pieces, or 'men'. Players try to form 'mills'—three of their own pieces lined horizontally or vertically—allowing a player to remove an opponent's piece from the game. The grid is equipped with series of smart sensors which makes it interactive and joyful.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Crimson Skies: The Broadway Bombers Squadron Pack
description:
A set of four aircraft miniatures for the Crimson Skies base game's aerial dogfight rules. The pack includes two E-1C Avenger miniatures (aircraft #1 and #2) and two F6II Brigand miniatures (aircraft #3 and #4).

All four miniatures are painted in a style common to the squadron with different details on each plane.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Crimson Skies: The Fortune Hunters Squadron Pack
description:
A set of four aircraft miniatures for the Crimson Skies base game's aerial dogfight rules. The pack includes two P12-J MK III Devestator miniatures (aircraft #11 and #12) and two FB14 Vampire miniatures (aircraft #13 and #14).

All four miniatures are painted in a style common to the squadron with different details on each type of plane.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Ridley's Games Room: Sing It Back
description: Step into the limelight with Sing It Back, the game that entertains regardless of whether you're out-of-tune or operatic. Simply sing or say the first line of the song, and see if your team can sing or say the next line back. It's time to warm up those vocal chords! (Earplugs not included)

name: Monopoly: Beast Wars Transformers
description:
Will you win the Beast Wars?

Play as a heroic Maximal or a villainous Predacon in an epic battle to secure vast quantities of Energon on a primitive planet!

Players move around the board trying to take over locations around the Ancient planet using Energon, then installing Statis pods to charge more rent.

Wield the power of the Golden Disk and obtain precious Stasis Pods! In this Monopoly board game for Transformers fans, claim the Golden Disk for gameplay perks but watch out … another player can steal it at any moment

14 playable tokens! Switch between tokens throughout the game to play in robot mode or alt mode! The player with the most Energon wins the game!

Includes gameboard, 14 character tokens, 7 character cards, 6 reference cards, 1 Golden Disk, 1 Golden Disk card, 20 Title Deed cards, 16 Maximal cards, 16 Predacon cards, 16 Stasis Pods, 1 die, 100 plastic Energon pieces (55 Energon Crystals, 45 Energon Cubes) and game guide

name: Quadro
description:
America's New Block Game, Quadro!

This set of 20 blocks comes with four different games to play as well as three puzzles. Nineteen blocks use the numbers 0 to 6, as in a double-6 domino set, plus one "Q-Quadro", which acts as a joker or wild.

Quadro is in the vein of dominoes, where players are trying to place blocks that have ends which add to a multiple of 5.

Pung requires the two players to form two 2x2 squares, where all the inner numbers match domino-style.

Put and Take has the players attempting to fill their hand with a single suit of blocks. As in dominoes, a suit is a set of blocks that all have the same number on them.

Match is a simple game for children, where the players score points for matching numbers on the blocks. Each player gets 4 turns, then the totals are scored.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: SWIPE
description:
The game where you find dates for your mates!

How well do you know your friends? What are their hot buttons? Their red flags? Do they prefer soul-searchers to stock market surfers, and what toxic traits will they overlook in someone who can make their inhibitions disappear quicker than you can type “u up?”
