Grab a handful of cards and wish the perfect partners into existence. In this hilarious game for 2 to 20 players you’re guaranteed all of the laughs and at least some of the exhilaration of dating – without any of the downsides.

—description from the designer

name: Lords of Vegas: Con Jobs
description:
Con Jobs is a 55-card deck of convention events that can enhance any version of Lords of Vegas or any of its expansion boards. Depending on which kind of casino you focus on during your turn, you can host any event from a Route 66 Rally to a Petroleum Industry Summit‚ even the office favorite Clown College Reunion!

-description from publisher's Kickstarter page
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Random Production, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Popstix
description: Press the magic button in Popstix, and up pops a colorful stick. Place the stick on the table so that the colored ends match other sticks already in place; if you complete a triangle, place your token in the middle. Sticks can also give you wilds, skips, and steals — and ideally you'll be able to place all of your tokens first to win.

name: Crimson Skies: Ace Pack #1 – East Meets West
description:
A set of two aircraft miniatures for the Crimson Skies base game's aerial dogfight rules plus two pilot miniatures for the base game's personal combat rules. The pack includes one Bloodhawk aircraft miniature (aircraft #9), one E-1C Avenger aircraft miniature (aircraft #10), pilot miniature Charlotte "Charlie" Steele (pilot #1), and pilot miniature Loyle "Show-stopper" Crawford (pilot #2).

Also includes a pack of Navigation Cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Crimson Skies: Ace Pack #2 – Deadly Duo
description:
A set of two aircraft miniatures for the Crimson Skies base game's aerial dogfight rules plus two pilot miniatures for the base game's personal combat rules. The pack includes one P21-J III Devastator aircraft miniature (aircraft #15), one FB-14 Vampire aircraft miniature (aircraft #16), pilot miniature Maria Sanchez (pilot #3), and pilot miniature Nathan Zachary (pilot #4).

Also includes a pack of Navigation Cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Kaizen
description:
A Malaysian produced Crazy Eights or UNO-style card game which differs from UNO in a few ways.

First the cards come in 5 colours, rather than 4. Second, the wild cards give you the choice of skip or reverse, and there aren’t any draw more cards. Third, the cards each have ‘living skills to be successful’ written on them, which don’t impact gameplay but might inspire you to do better. Finally, increased difficulty levels let you only play mis-suited cards in a certain order, following the Kaizen business management approach.

The game was created by a local consultant who wanted to spread the word about this approach to work and life.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: King Thief Minister (Second edition)
description:
3 to 8 players act in the role of eight characters that represent 8 groups of people in the whole of human history: King, Thief, Minister, Executioner, Sheriff, and Peasant.
Every player has 5 coins in the game, 3 in her hand and 2 in the treasury which is the area in the center of players. The game is to divide the treasury between the players and when the treasury is empty, the winner is the player who has more coins in her hands.

The starting player shuffles the cards and places all 8 cards from the back on the table. Depends on the number of players from 6 to eight cards in the game. First, take these four cards out: "King, Thief, Minister, and Peasant"

Every player can do 4 things on their turn:

Rotate the cards: by saying "one/two to right" every card goes to the spot in its right. By saying "one/two to left" we do the same to the left.
Pay a coin to the treasure and see her card.
Claim a character and act!
Change the card with the card in the center (not for 8 players)
mechanics: Memory, Role Playing, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Миллионер deLuxe (Millionaire deLuxe)
description: The game using Monopoly mechanics under different design and brand. Sell and buy property to create a monopoly and become the richest millionaire. Additional JackPot mechanics are added to spice it up.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: A Lesson In Life & Death
description:
It may sound morbid but you won't believe how some of these famous people in history died! Match the historical figure's life to their death in this darkly comic and factual card game. The player with the most matches at the end is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Plantes Enchantées
description:
Embark on a heroic journey to find the adequate medicinal plant to heal your villager. Your ultime goal is to become the new Druide.

In Plantes Enchantées, you will learn how to relieve everyday diseases (colds, sore throats, insect bites...) using medicinal plants. You don't need any previous knowledge to win the game. It's a fun, strategic and educational game accessible from 7 years old.

In the Middle Age, the frontier village of Larock was renowned beyond its borders. Nestled in the heart of the valley and surrounded by mountains, it is the home of the Druidess Eureka. Many villagers rush here in the hope of healing thanks to the advice of the Druidess. Unfortunately, she can't help all the visitors, she is overwhelmed. Your role as an apprentice harvester is to help her relieve the villagers.

The game can be played collaboratively or competitively. If you play competitively, the winner is the first one to have the right plant card for his villager and to have it validated by the Druidess. Once a player has won, you can stop here or play until each player has healed its villager. In collaboration, the game ends when each player has relieved his own villager.
May the journey begin!
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Medical, Medieval
mechanics: Acting, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: ¡Llegué Bien!
description:
Argentina is a vast and diverse country. ¡Llegué Bien! is a game that invites you to go through it mixing traditional amusements: cards, tic-tac-toe, memory, puzzles, clothes and folkloric mischief. It is also a book of couplets written by Mariano Medina on Argentine roads and illustrated by Istvansch, whose pages are loose: they are the cards with which you advance during the game.

General objective: Entertain by enriching knowledge about Argentina, motivating reading and promoting interpersonal communication through play and expression.

HOW IS IT COMPOSED?
It is an easily transportable box (fits in one hand), which contains a sheet-board (map approved by the National Geographic Institute), an instruction sheet, 48 cards to play and 60 cards with proposals for activities and clothing based on the natural and cultural diversity of the country.
The instructions present a basic game rule and then propose instances of complexity and entertainment that include virtual interpersonal communication. Some proposals include oral expression displaying imagination based on real data.

In the game there can be both competitive and collaborative moments, depending freely on the composition of the group of players.

It is suggested for individuals 7 years of age and older, a minimum of 3 players and a maximum of 5.

WHO ARE YOUR RECIPIENTS?
Although it is intended for a family audience, it is also recommended within educational and recreational settings, due to its entertaining information and the skills it favors: Orality, reading, psychomotricity, image recognition, memory development, deductive reasoning, creativity, communication. interpersonal, associative intelligence.

Who wins the game
It is a tour of the country, the player who obtains the most kilometers in three hands or the first to complete a distance set by the group before starting wins. There are six ways to collect kilometers: Arrive safely, assist the traveler, Ru-ta-ti, Recount the trip, send couplets by cell phone, complete puzzles, propose rings. It is established beforehand which of these options is going to be played with.

name: Vomitland
description:
Vomitland is a board game that has players pushing their luck (and stomachs) as they whirl through roller coaster maneuvers trying to accumulate emotions and experiences without throwing up!

Use every opportunity available at the amusement park to have the most extreme day of your life, and of course, make your friends squirt vomit out of their nostrils!

Vomitland is a push your luck game for 3 to 6 player. Player will choose which place of the theme part to go. When going into the roller coaster, the main attraction of the game, they will open manouver cards that award emotion symbols used either to complete objectives or make the player vomit. Once all objectives seleceted at the start of the game are completed, the game ends and the player with more victory points is the winner.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Shoot People in Space
description:
Shoot People in Space is a set of rules for science fiction skirmish battles. It is aimed at being dramatic, exciting and occasionally over the top game of battle and space adventure. It is not meant to be a hardcore military game and the results are not meant to be particularly realistic.

-description from rulebook

Battles are fought in phases with alternating activations: In the action phase your figures take turns carrying out one action (moving, firing, doing something else) while in the firefight phase most figures can fire (potentially shooting a second time).

Combat uses a simple 2D6 table with several unexpected factors built in: Firers can fumble or inflict critical hits and the use of a separate Threat die can cause surprise reactions such as the targets diving for cover or firing back. Gun battles plays out quickly and chaotically.

Intended for head-to-head play with 10 scenario objectives to pick from, but offers tools for non player forces and a random unit generator. These are great for solo play or to have a third party force show up mid battle if you like.

With about 8-15 figures per side, SPiS occupies a middle ground between the man-to-man combat of Five Parsecs From Home and the larger battles of Renegade Scout / Clash on the Fringe by the same publisher.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Jabber Jaw
description: Jabber Jaw is a hilarious alliterative description game. It’s your job to describe or mime out phrases like “the judges juggled,” or “the duck is downstairs” and to get your team to guess as many as they can in 60 seconds. Careful! When describing, you’re not allowed to say the two words that start with the same letter.

name: GNAM
description:
GNAM is an educational game for children in primary and secondary school, with the goal to help them develop correct food habits. The game is based on a deck of food/water cards, each of them showing nutrients (carbohydrates, fats, proteins, liquid) and a symbol to specify when the food is usually consumed during the day.
Players draft 6 food cards, trying to collect 2 of them for each of the daily meals (breakfast-lunch-dinner).
A player who collects too few liquids cannot win; the other players check whether they have eaten too many (or too few) nutrients. The most balanced diet wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: SNIPPETS
description:
Can you recall that song line, that ad, that funny or famous quote? Reach into the Corners of your mind to complete the tantalising snippet you’ve been given. From movies to TV, adverts to comedy, music to famous figures from past and present, there are snippets for all tastes and interests!

While readers risk chips on your likelihood of winning, you can go bold and take a 'blind' guess for a double bonus, or take one of the three options available, only one of which is the real answer.

SNIPPETS is the perfect pick-up-and-play game that’s tip of the tongue fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Alle meine Fahrzeuge
description:
Game for young Children where vehicles are hidden behind houses, are assigned to different places and compared to each other. There are three recommended modes to play for children in different ages.

discover and describe
assigning
hide and seek


Goal of the latter ones is to find all hidden vehicles behind the houses and assign them to the right location.

name: Kaël
description:
Kaël is a game of speed and strategy. The main goal will be to get rid of as many cards as possible to get the lowest score in your hands. However, pay attention to the cards of other players when you pronounce Kaël. Certain combinations of cards can be equal to 0 even though a player has 4 cards (example: -1/1/0/0 = 0).

This game is based on a point system. The goal is to be the last player to reach a score higher than 100. To do this, you must obtain the lowest possible score at the end of each round, the score is calculated by adding up the value of the cards in your hands at the end of each round.

At the end of the different rounds, the respective scores of each player will be added up. The first player to exceed 100 points will be eliminated and the game will continue until there is only one player below the 100 point threshold.

Kaël est un jeu de rapidité et de stratégie. Le but principal sera de vous délester d’un maximum de cartes afin d’obtenir le plus petit score entre vos mains. Faites néanmoins attention aux cartes des autres joueurs lorsque vous prononcez Kaël. Certaines combinaisons de cartes peuvent être égales à 0 alors même qu’un joueur dispose de 4 cartes (exemple: -1/1/0/0 = 0).

Le jeu est basé sur un système de points. Le but est d’être le dernier joueur à atteindre un score supérieur à 100. Pour ce faire, il conviendra d’obtenir le score le plus bas possible à chaque fin de manche, le score se calculant en additionnant la valeur des cartes entre vos mains, à chaque fin de manche.

A l’issue des différentes manches, les scores respectifs de chaque joueur vont se cumuler. Le premier joueur à dépasser 100 points sera éliminé et la partie se poursuivra jusqu’à ce qu’il n’y ait plus qu’un joueur en dessous du seuil des 100 points.

name: Two Thousand Years
description:
You are a planet. You became self-aware about twenty minutes ago. Five minutes ago, you discovered that you have the power to manipulate the environments of your surface. Three minutes ago, you managed to create life out of the very elements. Needless to say, these developments shocked and impressed the sentient life forms that had been forming tribes all over you for hundreds of generations.

Then, one minute ago, you felt the distinct sensation that you’ve awakened before. What were you doing? It seemed very important at the time.

Two Thousand Years is a Make-As-You-Play campaign of solitaire card games. Each game represents 100 years of warfare between your tribes. Each tribe is represented by a card. You make the cards yourself, and they are modified during and after every game with advancements, corruption, extra staying power, and many other characteristics.

At the end your campaign, whether you win or lose, you will have generated a history of your peoples (of any type that you imagine) and important landmarks (also pretty much up to you).

It is a game of patience and foresight and planning. The board will want to clear itself, and you need to stop it by using clever sequences and mystic powers! Rash decisions may carry brutal, permanent consequences. You might want to have a space in your home where you can leave a game undisturbed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blocus
description:
The goal of Blocus is for each player (or team) to delimite as large a territory as possible on the board. The boundaries of this territory are determined by the movement of each player's (or team's) pieces. In fact, each player, while placing each of their pieces on a square, must simultaneously place a counter of their color (white, black, or red) on that square. It is these markers that determine the outlines of the borders of the territory conquered by the player (or team). There is no specific rule for a starting lineup of figures. Each player places his figures where he wants on his first moves and immediately marks the square with a marker in his color.

The figures have different shapes and colors so that each player (or team) can identify their own. However, all have the same value and move in the same way: like the chess queen, they can move horizontally, vertically or diagonally, in any direction, one, two or more squares.

However, under no circumstances may a figure cross a square already covered by a counter, regardless of the color of that counter. Also, a figure cannot land on a square that is already covered by a counter. It also cannot go over a square occupied by another piece and of course it cannot stop there either. A figure that can't move anymore is eliminated from the game.

A game ends when all of a player's (or team's) pieces are eliminated. Whether there are two, three or four players, a game also ends when a total of five figures have been removed from the game. The final score is determined by counting the empty squares within the borders. There is one point for each empty square.

—user summary

name: City Pets
description:
A serious game for the In-Habit project. Player must match dogs with families able to satisfy their attentions of Needs, Space, Activity. Advantages for the families and the Public Services in the District where they live make things easier. The first player to find 6 families for 6 dogs wins.

—description from the designer

name: Bard Cards
description: A trivia game that tests your knowledge of Shakespeare. 400 cards contain quotes from his plays, with one word missing. For one point each, fill in the blank, name the play, and name the character that said it. First person to score 30 points wins.

name: Kumulus
description:
The rules are the same as regular chess, except for these changes. Every piece has a nominal value attached to them. E.g. The Queen is worth six, a Pawn is worth one. Pieces move like in traditional chess. You can capture opposing pieces, which will then transform them according to their former value minus the value of the opposing piece, into the piece which value it now represents. This applys vice-versa. For example: Queen(6) captures Pawn(1) and will transform into a Rook(5), or Pawn(1) captures Rook(5) which transforms said Rook into a Knight(4). The pieces that go below value one will be put outside the board. You can also capture your own pieces, which adds their values together and promotes the capturing piece accordingly.

To make transformation handier, the status of the set pieces (whether it‘s a Knight or a Bishop) is displayed on each side of a die. The board is a seven by seven squared chess board. To account for the six sides of a die, a new piece has been added, which we of today call Geminus, which acts like a doubled Pawn and can capture one square diagonally in any direction and can move one or two squares forward or one back.

The goal is like in traditional chess, to check mate the King of the opposing side.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Resource to Move, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Twilight Dance: Bluff & Counter Bluff in Cold War Europe
description:
“TWILIGHT DANCE is a Cold War themed ‘worker placement’ chaining game, in which two adversaries take turns to place and move hidden identity playing pieces on a four by four grid featuring sixteen European capitals. The city of Cold War Berlin is represented by an additional special space in the centre of the board.”

What the two adversaries need to play:

The Print & Play game board (available in the files section)
16 wooden playing pieces (tokens, pawns or blocks etc) [8 each of two different colours]
The 16 Print & Play images that need to be affixed to the underside of the playing pieces [4 Agents, 2 Moles and 2 Decoys each]


Objective of the game and how to play:
The winner of the game is the Spymaster with the most points at the end of the game. The game ends after all 16 pieces (representing KGB and SIS Agents (or Operations if you prefer) have been played out – i.e., both players’ hands of playing pieces are empty; or, after the conclusion of an agreed number of turns (usually set at 12).

Pieces are played to the board, which is a 4-by-4 grid forming a schematic representation of key European Cold War capitals, with the city of Berlin represented by an additional ‘special’ space in the middle of the board. The cities represented - in addition to Berlin - are Oslo, Copenhagen, Stockholm, Helsinki, London, Amsterdam, Warsaw, Moscow, Paris Bonn, Prague, Vienna, Lisbon, Madrid, Rome and Sofia.
Points are awarded at the end of a game for each chain of two or three adjacent cities the two players have Agents or Moles in. Chains can be orthogonal or diagonal. Chains of two earn 2 points and chains of three 3 points. Berlin cannot be used to accumulate points but has a special role in the game in that it is the only location on the board in which ‘stacking’ is allowed. At player discretion however ‘supremacy’ in Berlin may be used to adjudicate ties.

Players can do one of the following five things on their turn:
1 Place one of their pieces in any one of the sixteen cities, provided the space representing that city is empty.
2 Relocate one of their own pieces already on the board to any other city, provided the space representing the new location is empty.
3 Place a piece as 1 above and then “shunt” it and all other pieces one location in any single orthogonal plane. *
4 Place a piece in Berlin or “stack” a piece on an opponent’s piece already there. (Maximum stack: one piece each.)
5 Use the topmost piece in Berlin, if it is theirs, to shunt a piece or pieces along any one of the four diagonal planes extending from the city. *

[*Note: If a piece is shunted off the board, it enters the other player’s hand, irrespective of allegiance.]

Scoring examples are illustrated in the rules located in the files section.

Notes on restrictions and other essential rules:
In the basic game, players cannot “relocate” their adversary’s pieces. They can only be moved by ‘shunting’.

Players cannot forego their turn if they possess unplaced pieces.

‘Shunting’ is orthogonal from the 16 cities comprising the 4-by-4 board. It is diagonal from Berlin.

A piece passed to a player as a result of shunting should not be examined by the shunting player. The player receiving the piece will be able to look at its hidden side once it is in their hand.

Pawns and stacking
Players preferring to use pawns for playing pieces can simulate stacking by the way the pawns are positioned in the Berlin space on the board – a Top and Bottom within the space is clearly apparent.

Variant rules
A number of variant rules can be adopted at set-up by mutual agreement of the players. These are included with the base game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Slide/Push, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Spirit Master
description:
Be the last player remaining in this fast-paced fantasy card game that thrives on re-playability, creativity and expanding gameplay. Enjoy this "strategy meets chance" game with large and small groups of people. The main deck is inspired by standard playing cards allowing you to enjoy traditional card games in style!

How to play:

Depending on player count, a specific number of cards are dealt out from the main deck to each player. These cards remain face down and are not looked at. The player to the left of the dealer chooses an opponent to battle. They then choose a "spirit" among their force to flip over. This attacking player then chooses a spirit among their opponent's force to be flipped over. The player with the higher number wins. Both flipped spirits are discarded and
the winner of the battle replaces their spirit with another from the main deck. The loser does not replenish and now has 1 less spirit in their force. This continues until there is only one player left.

Additional play:

Gifts are items(Supplies)and additional spirits(Supports)that are gained in battle. They have varying abilities that can help change the outcome of the game.

A Versatile Card Game:
This is the main way to play, but it is not the only way. Be creative and start up your own version of Spirit Master. Change some rules or add new mechanics altogether. Inside are a few game variations to get players started. The game is also modular and can have additional decks added or removed to extend or change your game. Players could even bring their own full Spirit Master collection and battle it out in a massive clash of spirits. As mentioned before the main spirit deck is inspired by standard playing cards, so go ahead and play some spirit poker. Future expansions will be themed decks and will be interchangeable, adding even further versatility.

Check out https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/spirit-master

Inspirations:
The card game War and Magic the Gathering.

All card art was created By A.J.F.Nicholson in Microsoft Paint.
Stone-Age Font Created by Dave Bastian

—description from the designer
mechanics: Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Less Chess
description:
Your goal in Less Chess is to place the opponent's king into check in three different ways at the same time.

To set up, lay out the 3x6 game board, then place each player's king on the designated space on the game board. Shuffle each player's deck of cards, then choose a start player.

On a turn, reveal the top card of your deck, then either take the depicted piece from your reserve and place it orthogonally adjacent to one of your pieces currently in play or move a piece on the game board of the depicted type following the normal movement rules of chess. You can capture any opponent's piece other than the king. If you move a pawn to the opponent's back line (or place a pawn there), you promote it to a piece not currently in play.

If you ever have the opponent's king in check by three pieces at the same time, you win.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Watch Baseball, Get Drunk
description:
How drunk will your team get you?

The baseball drinking game designed to keep everyone's attention on the actual live baseball game while still handing out plenty of drinks.

Gather your friends around a live baseball game on TV or in person and bust out this game to deal out drinks with trivia, challenges, group votes, and even secret actions that only you know to watch out for during the live game.

Can you guess which Secret Plays your friends have?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: OutlanDish
description:
OutlanDish is a party game where players cook up a storm and compete for culinary glory!

The Head Chef chooses a scenario like "Grandma's weird favorite" and a star ingredient like "Pizza". Everybody assembles a dish with their own ingredients that they think will tantalize the palate or tickle a funny bone! The Head Chef mixes up the dishes, reads them out loud, and then everyone simultaneously places their order on the menu of the dish they want to order.

It's a bite-sized competition that will make you laugh out loud, and possibly never think of Ice Cream the same way ever again.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Dice the Boss
description:
Dice the Boss utilizes custom dice to bring together a co-operative group of 2-5 adventurers to take on the roles of heros, gain skills, then throw dice at a series of bosses until the party wins or loses. With exponential combinations of parties and a solid epic 2 player mode this game is highly replayable and utilizes the fun and family friendly dice, art, and themes that Arcanist's Armory has developed.

Every hero has health, speed, defense, and attack stats as well as a few skills that will grow and develop as you defeat the zany bosses such as Quasi-Moto the hunchback biker or the sinister Dead of Knight. This game is meant to fill the gap between serious campaign crawlers and simple dice games so that everyone of any skill level or strategy apetite can come together to play and enjoy.

—description from the publisher

name: Plutonauts
description:
Congratulations! You have been chosen for an inter-planetary mission to colonize Pluto. You are one of eight astronauts from around the solar system who will take flight. Unfortunately, a spy has infiltrated your ranks… You must act as a detective and ask all other players questions to identify the spy before the flight lands. If not? The colony may collapse before it even has its first inhabitant…

Plutonauts is a turn based card game for 3-8 players. There is a standalone 2 player version. Players are dealt a unique and secret Role and Home Planet card. They deal one Truth and one Lies card to the players to their left and right, choosing who to give each card. Players then ask one question per round, for a total of as many rounds as players. If asked a question by the player to their left or right, they must answer according to what the card they gave that person says. They can use a one time special power that is unique to their Home Planet to help. At the end of the game, players take turns voting on their guess for the Role and Home Planet of each player. The winner is the player with the most correct guesses.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Voting

name: Boomy Beaver
description:
Theme
Key serene nature music as fuzzy eager Beaver prepares to build its Dam. Then...BOOM! SNIP! SLAP! BOOM! Your beaver worldview now destroyed, you cannot help but be driven to utter madness as you try to quickly build your beaver Dam first, while opponents destroy your loving construction of sticks to make their own. SLAP! your opponents and steal their sticks, or make them dive deep and miss their turn. SNIP! your opponent's attempts to BOOM! your Dam to smithereens, then give them a big ol’ slap! Suffer the same fate as the other eager beavers slap you back and snip your Boom sticks. Boomy Beaver is simple game of wooden chicanery of extraordinary proportions.

The Goal
Build your Dam using Stick cards to be the first player to get a total of 7 or more Stick Points (3-4 players) or 10 or more Stick Points (2 players) to win or have the most points (the biggest Dam) at end.

Gameplay
On your turn, lay a card to do the following.
STICK Cards are laid to build your Dam.
BOOM! Cards destroy part of a Player's Dam to thwart their progress.
SNIP! Cards counter a BOOM!
SLAP! Cards counter a SNIP! or a BOOM!, take card from another player, or make a player miss a turn.

—description from the designer

name: Elves: Employee of the Month
description:
Christmas is just a few hours away and Santa is late.
He decides to hold a competition. The elf that obtains more Christmas Points becomes employee of the month!

Elves: Employee of the Month is a roll and write, print and play, Christmas-themed game about helping Santa to build toys and to fill stockings. Each player rolls dice. Two dice will determine which room on a central board you may enter. Then four dice will determine what items and materials you may pick up there. Your materials: wood, glue and paint can then be combined with the proper dice roll to build toys and earn Christmas points.

—description from the designer

name: Siege of Cranes
description:
Siege of Cranes is a turn-based game where players must decide between adding cards to their collection to gain points or discarding cards to perform various actions, most of which affect other players. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins, with large collections of a single type of animal gaining the most points.

Each type of card is based on an animal and its noun of assemblage (e.g. a skulk of foxes).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Interrupts, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Take That

name: Circus: Pizza Tosser Performer Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Pizza Tosser
-Woman
-Acts as a magician or juggler
-When added to the arena, change up to 2 cubes in another color

name: Pizza: Mangy Cat Customer Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Mangy Cat
-2 fish and 1 mushroom
-9 points first serving
-6 points otherwise

name: Escape the Fountain of Youth
description:
A wealthy woman has hired you to do the impossible… to find the fountain of youth! She has stumbled upon the journal of the famed conquistador Ponce De Leon and she claims that it holds the route to this treasure. A Spanish fort was constructed deep within the swamps of the Everglades and it is said that the stream trickles through the center of the structure. Unfortunately, getting to the fort will be quite difficult, as the swamp is filled with alligators and venomous snakes. If you do manage to make the discovery, however, a wonder like no other awaits you… One sip of this water can heal any injury and it can make the old young again. A treasure like this is worth killing over! Let’s just hope that it won’t come to that…

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Championship Drag Racing: Pro Stock Motorcycle
description:
Re-live the excitement of a Pro Stock Motorcycle Season.

Anything that can happen in a real life drag racing event; can and will happen with the same frequency in Championship Drag Racing. Drivers will red-light, have tremendous reaction times, blow up their engines, and even crash with the same frequency as the year represented. And as with any replay game that is worth its salt there are allowances made within the confines of realistic frequency for ANYTHING to truly happen.

In general, your results will be very close to the on-the-track action of the season represented. However, keep in mind, that this game simulates hundreds of variables that can occur in any race. As with any sport, sometimes pure luck can be the deciding factor. That’s no exception with Championship Drag Racing. On the whole, you’ll experience very realistic results. But, within the confines of a single qualifying run or elimination race, anything can truly happen!

Championship Drag Racing: Pro Stock Motorcycle Edition gives you every Bike and Rider that made an elimination run in a season. You also get all 17 circuits rated by lane making the lane choice strategy just as important as real life. A full schedule and complete points standings are included.

Can you set a new Elapsed Time Record, or a new Top Speed Record? Order today and find out!

name: Musical Casino: The Major-Minor Game
description:
Game intended to teach some aspects of musical composition.
The object is to collect cards together using four different actions.
Matching: Just matching cards in your hand to those on the table.
Pairing: Taking one card with another card in your hand that forms the interval of a Major or Minor third.
Chording: Taking one card with another card in your hand to build a major or Minor chord.
Sweep: Clearing out all the table cards.
First to 21 wins (which may take several games to do that according to the rules).

—user summary

name: The Sword and the Flame: Action Deck
description:
For the Gamer who wants all the advantages of a dedicated Card Deck, but wishes to use just one for all his TSATF battles.

An "Action Deck" is a set of Cards that serves the role previously played by the Standard Card Decks of 800FE and TSATF, determining the order of Movement and Fire, and for TSATF, casualties.

The 2.5" x 3" TSATF Action Decks cue movement and fire order, but also specify casualties, identifying which Leader, "Key," and Other Ranks have been hit. Wound severities ("Serious" and "Light") have been added, but are entirely optional.

Unless stated otherwise, most TSATF Action Decks consist of 63 Cards: 52 for Movement/Fire/Casualties with the full degree of detail required by the rules. There are also 10 Optional Cards, 8 of which provide specific Events equally affecting both sides, and 2 "Halt!" Cards which can end the Movement and/or Fire Phases early. For the more sadistic among you, there are 2 "blanks" for creating your own Events. Finally, there is a Card providing some instruction on use of the Deck.

Using contemporary full color illustrations and terminology specific to the foe facing the British/Imperialist players, each Action Deck not only speeds the steps of play, but heightens the "atmosphere" to make every exciting game even more so!

—description from the publisher

name: Elleven
description:
Elleven is a free dice game with upgrades, an eleven-of-a-kind, and no pencils!

THE FAMILIAR:

Roll dice to create sets.
You get 2 re-rolls of any number of dice.


THE NEW:

Use upgrades to modify rolled dice.
Complete sets to score points and reclaim used upgrade dice.
Shoot the moon and go for an eleven-of-a-kind to score big.
No pencils required to play!


Requires 6 shared dice, plus 5 dice per player.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Ett litet Tidhfördriff
description:
A local mining clerk in the swedish town Falun, Gisle Jacobson, published the text, entitled 'Ett litet Tidhfördriff' (A small pastime) in 1613. The booklet describes a ritualized dice game used by the miners at Stora Kopparberg in order to help the miners to make decisions in connection with the organization of this hazardous work.

The reader shall throw three dice, and then look for the same score in the booklet. Three six-sided dice, numbered from one to six, give a total of 56 different combinations if you throw all three simultaneously. Consequently, the text itself consists of 56 rhymed stanzas, combined with schematic pictures of three dice that are linked to all possible combinations. Every poem gives the miner different rules for living and moral advice as an answer to a wish made before he threw the dice.

Those who manage to score highest may be first in the pair line* and have an advantage over the others, who must wait further down the pair line. But the one coming last will be stuck there because of his low and unlucky throw. This may be due to a three, four and six on the dice. Those who come first are likely to get copper, and those who are last get just rocks.


Pair line = The term was used to denote the order in which the mining teams took turns to break ore in the mine.


—user summary

name: Rocky ‘Roid
description:
Rocky ‘Roid is an asteroid-mining roll and write in which you individually try to find the best asteroids to mine and then race back to sell the ore you’ve mined in the shared market.

In the first half of the game players choose two of three shared dice to decide where to move and what asteroid they find at that location, optionally using additional fuel to modify the dice for themselves.

Once players have headed home they sell the minerals they have collected one at a time in the order they arrived home, with each sale reducing the price for all other players.

The game comes with multiple maps, each with slightly different rules and more maps will be added over time.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Sand Castles
description:
It’s the annual sand castle building competition again, and this time it's your turn to compete!

In the game, players will be building sand castles by using decoration tiles that they collect by flipping up face-down decoration tiles in the rock pool. You can push your luck while collecting tiles, but if you draw 2 matching tiles you drop all past the first of the matching pair and all players draft the dropped tiles. You also have to watch out for occasional waves washing away players' stashed tiles. If you're lucky, the crab and seagull critters might help you to find what you need. Collect tiles wisely, and build sand castle walls (which have point values based on the difficulty required to build them) as soon as you are able. Or push your luck for better decorations to earn more points! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Code of Silence
description:
It is early in the 20th century. You are a member of mafia. There is a series of horse races coming up and Don has an errand for you. He will be glad if a certain horse ends the season at a certain rank and he will appreciate your help in the matter. Other players are Don's other fixers with similar, non-contradictory errands. You will play as a team trying to accomplish as many orders as possible, because if someone screws up, Don will not care who and will be disappointed in all you. Yet he does not allow you to tell your order to others because the old man is not a believer of sharing information.

Code of Silence is a euro style cooperative game with limited communication. It is played with 3-6 players and also includes a solo variant. Regardless of how many players there are around the table, there are always 6 horses and 6 secret orders in the game. In the beginning everyone knows one secret order but some orders may not be known by anyone.

On your turn you will choose a race card from your hand to play. Every card moves multiple horses and makes progress towards one useful action or another. You will need to make hard decisions where all your moves are ambiguous and what benefits a task often harms another task. The game also includes events that introduces further randomness, a betting system and secondary tasks that give some immediate benefits and victory points.

Code of Silence is a funny yet challenging game with medium complexity where strategy, communication, deduction, intuition play equal parts.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Moving Multiple Units

name: The Ultimate Entertainment Game
description:
TV and movie fans will love playing The Ultimate Entertainment Game. Suitable for three or more players, it's the laugh out loud TV and movie themed game which will test your drawing, miming, describing, trivia, and humming skills.

Take it in turns to draw, mime, describe, question, or hum the TV or movie title on your card. If someone guesses correctly within the one minute limit, the player that did the challenge gets to keep the card. The first player to collect five cards wins the game!

The Ultimate Entertainment Game is fun for all the family. Included in the box are 50 answer cards, a dice, a pencil, a pad of paper, a sand timer, and full instructions. Recommended for ages eight and over.

—description from the publisher

name: So, What's Wrong With You?
description:
A party game inspired by bad dates!

A collection of 200 terrible things to say on a first date turned into a fun party game! Great for lively game nights, hen nights, pre-drinks, or if you just need something to spark conversation and debate.

Perfect for those, who do not like reading complicated rules, or plotting strategy.

Best played with groups of 3 to 8 people aged 17 and over. Flexible play time. Game box includes instructions for two simple game modes, and more game-play options on their website.

—description from the publisher

name: Bark Manor House
description:
It's night and you've got lost, but luckily you've seen an old mansion with a hotel sign on your way. Later, in your hotel room, you hear strange noises, a scratching and pawing, a tripping and breathing and then you realize you are not alone.
Suddenly you notice that something is crawling into your bed, from all sides and then they are there, the bed pugs. Where do they all come from?
They need a lot of space in your bed and like your body warmth. It doesn't look like they're leaving voluntarily.
You are looking for a solution to get rid of the small dogs. Maybe they would feel comfortable with another guest?

An entertaining game for 2 to 4 people. You have the task to throw as many of the "Bed Pugs" out of your bed as possible and place them in the beds of the other players. Not all dogs are so easy to convince to leave your bed. Action cards can help you with this. But the clock is ticking and of course you want to start the next day as well rested as possible. But the Pugs also have some tricks up their sleeves to spend as long as possible in your warm bed. The goal of the game is to spend as quiet a night as possible and to wake up rested. For every more or less quiet hour of sleep you get corresponding points. The different ways to get a peaceful sleep are manifold in the game and also depend on the different hotel rooms. Unfortunately, the reception of the hotel is not really reliable...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Clash of Decks: Champion – Broblivion
description:
Broblivion is a promo champion for backers, who support the "GOLDblivion"-Kickstarter and the "Clash of Decks Season 3"-Kickstarter.

The card needs a starter kit/ advanced deck to be playable.

Broblivion
Mana Cost: 5
Attack: 3, Defense: 2

The special abilities are:
Berserc
Rage
Splash
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Clash of Decks: Champion – Micha the Henchman
description:
Micha the Henchman is a promo champion for backers, who support the "Henchmania"-Kickstarter and the "Clash of Decks Season 3"-Kickstarter.

The card needs a starter kit/ advanced deck to be playable.

Micha the Henchman
Mana Cost: 4
Attack: 1, Defense: 4

The special abilities are:
Blackmail
Defender
Reinforcement
Retreat
Vanish
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Grimbergens bar-quiz
description:
A trivia game about beer-related stuff for two or more players or teams.
Each question card has three questions from different categories. On your turn, another player will tell you the three categories. You choose one, answer the question, and if correct, you keep the card. At the end of the game (after 15 minutes), each card is a point. Most points win.

There are nine categories: Film & TV, Food & Drink, Politics & History, Geography, Music, Sports, Culture, Nature & Science, and Beer.

The game suggests that the loser buys a round - and that you drink responsibly.

The game has been made in a collaboration between the brewery Grimbergen and the game studio Bezzerwizzer.

name: STORY WARS
description:
A battle to build the wildest, craziest story.

A storytelling card game of mashed up storylines where story cards are broken into three categories: Scenario, Character, Action.

Players hold a hand of cards and one player draws a top card from any of the three categories, ie "Character: A ballet dancer with chronic diarrhea", and the other players then build a story from that card with the cards they have in their hand.

The player who drew the top card, selects which story they liked the best, and rewards the winning player with that top card.

Players can either build a story individually or as a group, with the player who's won the most story battles after 10 rounds (received the most reward cards) winning the game!

It's fun, simple to play, and ridiculous stories each round.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
publishers: Ad Magic, Inc. (AdMagic Games), Writers Room

name: Unicorns to the Moon
description:
Unicorns To The Moon is an action-packed tabletop game for 1-4 players that turns your dreams of being a hotshot venture capitalist (VC) into a reality! Your job as a VC? Invest in ‘Unicorns’ (companies worth a billion or more dollars), and
send them to the moon.
In this game you’ll start by defining your strategy. Then, you’ll manage your fund by investing in companies and resources to help those companies become unicorns (worth over $1B). Finally, take your shot at sending unicorns to the moon (worth over $10B), to see who is the best VC! The player with the most money at the end of the game wins!

name: Path of Conquest
description:
Path of Conquest is a two-player strategy game with elements of fantasy.
Each player starts the game with 22 pieces that are placed on a board with 10x10 tiles. Then each player chooses 1 of the 4 different available so called Commanders and places it on their side of the board. Every Commander has unique special abilities that allows each player to exhibit a different play-style.
The game is simple, maneuver through the battlefield and capture the opposing Commander.

—description from the publisher

name: Ebb & Flow
description:
Ebb and Flow is a hilarious two-person strategy game that's perfect for family game nights, date nights, or anytime you want to have a good time! In this fast-paced game, you and your opponent race to reach each other's bases while outsmarting each other with a variety of silly and surprising moves. With easy-to-learn rules and quick gameplay, Ebb and Flow is the perfect game for kids and adults alike. But don't be fooled by its simplicity – Ebb and Flow is packed with strategy and surprises that will keep you coming back for more.

—description from the designer

name: Kick It
description:
Kick It can be played in two ways - in a league or knockout tournament style. Each match consists of six rounds of multiple Attack vs Defense moves from each player, and the player who scores the most goals when the Full Time whistle blows wins the game. In the event of a tie, a Penalty Shootout round will be played to determine the ultimate champion. The game includes 36 player cards, 8 time cards, 4 coach cards, 4 subs cards, 2 penalty round cards, 18 goal tokens, and instructions. Kick It is a perfect game for families, football/soccer fans, and non-sport fans alike and has an average gameplay of 20 minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: FarWater
description:
FarWater is a marine board game set in the time of the great discoveries in which 2 to 5 players gather riches through trade and piracy, exploring and settling an archipelago of islands they created.

FarWater modular board creation system is designed to create unique basins for movement of ships, as well as islands of any size and shape. This is done by players that add more hexes to the board as the game progresses creating a unique archipelago with each game.

The game starts with each player taking control of a single ship on a single starting hex. They proceed to take turns until all of the hexes are added to the archipelago or one of the players gathers the necessary amount of gold to win.

Each turn consists of adding another hex to the board with possibility to settle a new land and then rolling a custom dice. The possible results of the roll are:

Set Sail! Each of the players can move, trade or explore using controlled ships. They can also choose to expand their fleets.
Jolly Roger. Player that rolled the dice can choose to rob ships of his competitors.
Storm. A tropical disaster sends all ships not protected by ports to the bottom of the sea.


FarWater gameplay and the shape of the archipelago depends on the players imagination and their strategy. Their collective choices will shape both the trade and travel during their games.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction: Multiple Lot, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Take That, Trading, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: WW84: Wonder Woman – Jeu de Cartes
description: Memory game

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lunar Twilight Knight
description:
The Twilight Knight celebrates the first new moon of the year with a festive presentation. A painters scale model perfect for hobbyists and a gamers scale model for gamers looking for a fun survivor stand-in for their gaming sessions by new moon light. Includes a new hunt basic hunt event and the chance to gain a festive fish dish.

The Lunar Twilight Knight is packaged in an illustrated box that includes:
1 x Hard Plastic Painters Scale Lunar Twilight Knight
1 x Hard Plastic Gamers Scale Lunar Twilight
1 x Exquisite Aroma hunt event card
1 x Fish of Abundance gear card
1 x Large Matte art print
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 50mm round base and scenic insert
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round base and scenic insert
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Poker for Couples
description:
In Poker for Couples two players (of any gender) attempt to score points both by creating the best poker hand and by winning tricks. For each point scored, they move their pawn one step on the game board track and collect different sexy reward cards on the way.

The game also comes in two different versions depending on if you want to play a quick and simple game, or something a bit more complex and strategic. Both versions are of course included in the same box, and regardless of which version you decide to play, it’ll probably be the most fun you’ll ever have with a deck of cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Zoontalis: Battle Royale
description:
Bring the whole family together for fun and adventure with our family-friendly Zoontalis Battle Royale. Perfect for game nights and family gatherings, Zoontalis provides endless entertainment for players of all ages.

Created by a father, son and daughter team Zoontalis Battle Royale usurps the evil ‘screen time’, replacing it with family time full of adventure, creativity and enjoyment. Enjoyed in over 20 countries, find out why it’s taking over the TTG world.

Battle with gangs of animal warriors through a variety of Zoontalis scenarios that’ll provide family entertainment for game nights. Easy to follow rules ensure everyone can enjoy the fun whilst providing a highly engaging creative adventure.

Set in a land that pits different factions against each other, the first thing you’ll notice is the awesome figures. They are without a doubt some of the fiercest creatures you’ll have seen in the tabletop gaming world. They are amazing and have awesome powers that compliment each other and make them into a real team.

Based on animal warriors and magicians the quest can be set up easily and there’s multiple scenarios for different types of gameplay.

So much so that the rule book, which is downloadable, comes with a few setups for you to try, but we’re always hearing about how players adapt to what’s happening and we love that.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit: Kellogs Kartensatz
description:
A promo expansion from Kellogs from 1998
It exists of 54 cards (in yellow and blue). Each pack contained 6 cards and a collapsible cube in a bag.
The cards are numbered.

name: Unser täglich Brot
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 90 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Four Suit Rummy
description:
This is a rummy variation for 2 players.

The object of the game is to make four runs of three consecutive cards, one in each suit, with bonuses for matching sets made of the same numbers.

A player may take either the upturned card or the top card of the stock as in standard Rummy. If a player wishes to lay down a set, he must do so before discarding.

Aces are wild within their own suit - i.e. Ace of Spades can be any Spade, Ace of Hearts can be any Heart, etc.

Once one player has laid down all their cards, both players work out their scores as follows:

For each set laid down score 20 points.
For each matching set laid down score an additional 50 points - e.g. 3,4,5 of Hearts matches 3,4,5 of Spades.

The first player who lays down all their cards also scores points for all the cards left in their opponent’s hand. Both players score points for all sets laid down, regardless of who lays down first. In fact it is possible for the player going out first to score less than their opponent if the other player has matching sets.

First to 1000 points wins.

name: Wizard Kittens: Gizmo promo card
description:
Promo card with stats adding the new player character Gizmo to the game.
Gizmo is the kitty of Magpie Games' director of community relations, Kate, and was the Gencon kitten for 2020!

Gizmo's advanced side has:

SLING: Send one of your cards to another ritual circle
SWAT: Discard two of your cards
SWITCH: Swap the location of any two cards
SWAG: Choose another kitty; they must either give you a card from their circle (and you place it anywhere in yours), or let you draw two cards from the deck
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Wizard Kittens: Bonus Pack
description:
This Wizard Kittens Card Game bonus content includes:

1 Exclusive Grey Spell Token

7 Exclusive Character Cat Playmats, featuring: Cinder, Bandit, Orion, Whiskitos, Daisy, Marquise de Cat, and Ser Isaac McFluffykins

2 Exclusive New Rules Cards

4 Exclusive Monsters

2 Exclusive Curses

This pack is full of exclusive Kickstarter content, including new kitties chosen by backers and an exclusive Cinder character mat and additional spell token.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Crazy Canteen: Cafeteria Edition
description:
A low complex version of roll and write game "Crazy Canteen".
Mechanics are quite similar, but level of decision is reduced.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Reasonable Links
description:
Card game in which players link the cards in their hand to form an item, title, person, and so on.
Examples: A letter and a piece of chain = Chainmail
A Crossbow and an Apple = William Tell
A Ring, a light Bulb and a Bath = Ring of Bright Water
Having laid down a 'Link', the other players vote if they think the link is acceptable. Once accepted scores are awarded:
2 Card Link = 2 Points
3 Card Link = 10 Points
4 Card Link = 25 Points
5 Card Link = 50 Points
6 card Link = 100 Points
The player with the most points at the end of the game, wins.

name: El Cajón de la Abuela
description:
WHO DOESN'T HAVE A DRAWER LIKE THIS IN THEIR HOUSE?
There are drawers to store cutlery.
There are drawers to store underwear.
And there are drawers to store all the rest….

Always, in each house, there is a space where they will keep the most crazy, disparate and random things.
True boxes of surprises and wonders. What was this or that for? We almost no longer recognize the things that are there, but they remain there as if they were telling a story.

THIS GAME IS THE ZEUS LEVEL MEMORY CHALLENGE!

The game consists of observing the drawer for a while and writing as many objects and the main colors as they can remember.

Do you think it's easy?

TO CHALLENGE SOLO OR IN GROUPS!

Ideal for a quick tabletop challenge.
But also to challenge yourself and exercise your memory.

name: Halloween Hustle
description: Trick-or-Treat across the neighborhood with dice and unique Hustle Cards to collect a massive candy stash and complete Challenges Cards. Keep creativity alive by equipping costume upgrades that make your costume even more awesome (a robot with a magical staff? Sign me up!). But beware, even veteran Trick-or-Treaters’ skills are tested since the competition will surely use devious tricks to secure their spot on top. Yet, there is no time to delay. The night is short, and only the Trick-or-Treater with the most points will stand on top as the king or queen of Halloween.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Negotiation
mechanics: Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Map Addition, Multiple Maps, Negotiation, Tile Placement

name: Lovely City
description: An Immersive murder mystery game solved in 10-15 hours. In each case, you will work directly with local Detectives as they take you on a serial killer's journey with multiple crimes, deaths, and injuries. All seasons are between 1 to 5 episodes long. Each episode is packed with evidence, clues, puzzles, and more. Choose this experience if you are looking for a fully immersive murder mystery that can be played over time. It can be played in a group or alone.

name: Inappropriate Minds
description: A party game where the judge reveals a question card, and the other players submit answers from their own hand of answer cards. The judge awards the question card to his preferred answer. The judge rotates around the table. The game ends when a player collects three question cards, or after a predetermined number of rounds.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pick Your Chickens
description: A children's counting and matching game. Draw a card from the middle and count the number of chick's, if it matches a number from your coop you can fill that spot. Be careful to avoid the broken eggs because they will cover one of you coop spaces, and then you will need to draw a hen card to lay a new egg and clear your space. The first person to fill their coop is the winner.

name: Who's Your Monkey?
description: A simple matching game with a monkey theme. Draw from a pool of facedown cards and attempt to be the first person to get your monkey fully dressed. Avoid the banana peels though because they will take up room on your board and you will have to find a broom to clean them up before you can finish dressing your monkey.

name: Battletech: Recognition Guide vol 1 – Classics
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some war machines never die. As the ilClan era dawns, the most recognizable BattleMechs stand ready to carry your banner into the future, bristling with cutting-edge weapons and armor.

Recognition Guide, vol. 1: Classics collects some of the best-known Inner Sphere, Clan and ComStar BattleMechs, rebuilt with the latest technology to keep them competitive on modern battlefields. This volume is the companion to Recognition Guide, vol. 2: ilClan, and contains material originally published in the bestselling PDF-only BattleTech Recognition Guide: ilClan series.

Each machine is fully detailed with an illustration, in-universe development notes, battle histories, and notable pilots for each unit.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Battletech: Alpha Strike Battlemat – Aerobase #2
description:
Map is 34″ x 22″, the perfect “two-map” size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

-description from publisher's website

name: Battletech: Alpha Strike Battlemat – Aerobase #1
description:
Map is 34″ x 22″, the perfect “two-map” size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

-description from publisher's website

name: Scenario Designers Guide
description:
The Scenario Designers Guide is a 72-page manual provides everything needed to start designing your own ASL scenarios! From conception to research to design to playtesting to publishing, it gives expert advice and guidance.

If you have never tried designing scenarios, the Scenario Designers Guide makes it easy. It also includes valuable appendices such as Victory Condition and Scenario Special Rule compendiums.

The Scenario Designers Guide includes two FREE scenarios. These challenging tournament-sized scenarios take place on the island of Java at the end of World War II. One scenario features the last independent offensive by the Imperial Japanese Army! The other features British and Japanese troops fighting together on the same side!

It continues the Desperation Morale tradition of offering tools and resources for the ASLer.


TABLE OF CONTENTS

Author’s Preface
Introduction. Three Thousand Keys to Success
Chapter One. Scenario Ideas: Theory and Practice
Chapter Two. Scenario Sources and Research
Chapter Three. Creating the Landscape
Chapter Four. Creating ASL Orders of Battle
Chapter Five. Miscellaneous Scenario Concerns
Chapter Six. Playtesting
Chapter Seven. Okay, So It’s Done, Now What
Appendix A. Victory Conditions
Appendix B. SSR Compendium
Appendix C. Scenario Design Example: The Java Scenarios
Scenario Java 1. The IJA’s Last Battle
Scenario Java 2. Unlikely Allies

—description from the publisher (adapted)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Pieces
description:
Pieces are creatures who love to do imitations. One by one, they all imitate something different. Not a single one has a fixed form. None of them have a fixed form.

Pieces (ピーシーズ) is a sandbox game containing 35 3D-printed pieces in a drawstring bag. Each piece is a different simple shape that the players can use to communicate with each other. The intention is that players will use the included rules or create their own games that use the Pieces. Instructions are included for sharing the games you create through social media.

The game includes rules for at least eight different games that use the Pieces, including a twist on Shiritori (a word chain game where each new word begins with the last letter of the word before), charades (using combinations of Pieces in a guessing game), group storytelling using drawn Pieces to suggest where the story goes, and Shape Poker (where you try to create poker-style groupings). The game includes a small three-by-three board for games like Triple Word Chain, where you try to get three words chained in a row.
categories: Game System, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Neon Reef
description:
Set on a floating aquatic city in the Mid-Pacific, Neon Reef focuses on the first Hydro-Habitat west of the USA. As the city grows out of its infancy, factions compete to shape the future of the Reef. Will Neon Reef become a scientific utopia nurtured by a peaceful group of Botanists, or a hub of offshore cyber-crime overseen by the Glitch Hunters?

Neon Reef is a game that breaks away from traditional genres by combining tile placement with draftable factions. Over the course of the game, up to 6 players choose a faction, place buildings, and build their economy to find a unique path to victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Income, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Magicative
description:
You learned magic called Magical at the Academy of Magic.
Collect and combine magicka cards, which are pieces of magic,
Let's make it a magic formula and create a big magic!
Can you pick up discarded cards? Better if you wake up! ?
Read the flow, seize your destiny, and aim for the greatest wizard!

name: Spy Royale
description:
A certain European country where tensions continue.
Here, spies from all over the world are fighting day and night for confidential information.
As a spy dispatched to this country, you must also interfere with spies (other players) from other countries, outwit them, and obtain more confidential information than any other country.

name: Generationskampen
description:
A trivia game for multiple generations to play... at the same time!

Divide the teams and let the youths, parents, grandparents play against each other or mix the teams evenly. Which generation is the most knowledgeable?

Unique to the Generations Battle are the digital challenges. Listen to music and watch video clips and answer correctly directly on your phone, no need to download an app, it works directly in the web browser.

To win, the team must complete a full lap around the game board and answer questions from all four different generations. A game for all occasions and all ages!

name: Robots and Rockets: Launchpad
description:
Welcome to the Launchpad Spacedock! As a skilled builder, help build and launch rockets capable of reaching beyond the speed of light. Compete against other players, earn the respect of robots, and become the best builder in the galaxy!

Robots & Rockets: Launchpad is a competitive rocket-building card game for 2 to 4 players. The goal is to build and launch rockets to collect the greatest number of rocket parts by the end of the game.

Build and launch rockets to collect the best combination of robots and rocket segments by the end of the game. Players take turns clockwise, starting with the first player. On their turn, they choose SWAP or PLAY cards from their hands.

At the end of a turn, if the deck is empty or all Robot tokens are claimed, all players get one more final turn each (including the player whose turn just ended).

This is a special edition made for the Launch Tabletop Launch Kit.

name: Chouette Tambouille !
description:
An educational game to learn how to consume in a healthy and ethical way!

A fun and innovative educational learning game to :

Raise students' awareness of the impact of nutrition on their health and the environment.
Raise their interest in the origin of the products on their plate.
To exchange and debate about sustainable food, which seeks to respect and preserve the environment and animals without over-consuming.
To make the pupils actors of their reflection, to help them to verbalize their thoughts and to argue their choices, while stimulating them by the game.

Each player in turn draws food cards and places them side by side on the table, face up.
table, face up. He can stop drawing at any time and keep the cards he has drawn.
cards. He puts them back into his hand or places them face down in front of him.
The player draws as many cards as he wishes, provided that he does not draw :

a Food card from a family already drawn during this round;
a Red Zone card.


In these two cases, the player's turn ends immediately.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un jeu pédagogique pour apprendre à consommer sainement et de manière éthique !

Un jeu éducatif d’apprentissage ludique et innovant pour :

Sensibiliser les élèves en douceur à l’ impact de la nutrition sur leur santé et l’environnement .
Susciter leur intérêt pour l’ origine des produits qu’ils ont dans leur assiette.
Échanger et débattre autour d’une alimentation durable , qui cherche à respecter et à préserver l’environnement et les animaux sans surconsommer.
Rendre les élèves acteurs de leur réflexion , les aider à verbaliser leur pensée et à argumenter leurs choix, tout en les stimulant par le jeu.

Chaque joueur à son tour pioche des cartes Aliment et les pose côte à côte sur la
table, face visible. Il peut s’arrêter de piocher à tout moment et conserver les cartes
piochées. Il les range dans sa main ou les pose devant lui, face cachée.
Le joueur pioche donc autant de cartes qu’il souhaite, à condition de ne pas piocher :

une carte Aliment d’une famille déjà piochée lors de ce tour ;
une carte Zone rouge.


Dans ces deux cas, le tour du joueur s’arrête immédiatement.

—description from the publisher

name: Action planète!
description:
An educational game to raise awareness of sustainable development!

A fun and innovative educational learning game to :

Raise students' awareness of the impact of their daily actions on the planet and enable them to acquire the basics of sustainable development .
Exchange and debate about actions that protect the planet and environmental issues.
To make the pupils actors of their reflection, to help them to verbalize their thoughts and to argue their choices, while stimulating them by the game.

Players take turns playing and, when it is their turn to play, they can perform the following actions in any order:

draw 2 cards ;
play up to 3 cards;
discard cards from their hand.


—description from the publisher (translated)

Un jeu pédagogique pour sensibiliser au développement durable !

Un jeu éducatif d’apprentissage ludique et innovant pour :

Sensibiliser les élèves en douceur à l’impact de leurs gestes quotidiens sur la planète et leur permettre d’acquérir les bases du développement durable .
Échanger et débattre autour des gestes qui protègent la planète et des enjeux environnementaux .
Rendre les élèves acteurs de leur réflexion , les aider à verbaliser leur pensée et à argumenter leurs choix, tout en les stimulant par le jeu.

Les joueurs jouent chacun à leur tour et, lorsque c’est à eux de jouer, ils peuvent
réaliser les actions suivantes dans l’ordre qu’ils veulent :

piocher 2 cartes ;
jouer jusqu’à 3 cartes ;
défausser des cartes de leur main.


—description from the publisher

name: Split the Party
description:
Split the Party is a dice-placement board game themed around fantasy roleplaying, where you are taking on the role of an adventuring party made up of classic themes such as Mage, Warrior, Rogue, etc. The hook for this game, however, is that each of these character archetypes are represented by a custom d10 die, with different skill faces on each one. You place these dice around the board in areas that represent places an adventurer might visit in a fantasy town and its surrounding areas, such as the Tavern, Shop, Wizard's Tower and Dungeons. Then after each player has placed all of their dice, players encounter cards at those locations, trying to succeed at checks to defeat or acquire those cards by rolling the dice workers themselves, earning victory points or gold to buy useful items, etc. The player with the highest total victory points at the end of five rounds is the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: 7つの未解決事件 (7 Unsolved Cases)
description:
Becomes a mystery? Case solved? A detective and the true criminal face off over seven incidents.
The existence of the true culprit involved in all the incidents...
The showdown between the great detective and the true criminal begins over seven unsolved cases!
If the detective solves one case, new facts will be obtained.
The investigation is really full-blown. Which faction will be able to read the opponent and control the confrontation?
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: ONE-NINTH
description:
An exciting psychological warfare game for two players! Predict the last remaining tile while outsmarting your opponent!
A battle-type psychological game in which 9 tiles arranged in 3x3 are alternately thrown away and the last tile is predicted. In a maximum of 7 matches, the first to win 3 or the one with the most wins wins.

name: Octopus Puzzle Game
description:
The game contains:
1 wooden board
80 double-sided (red and black) numbered tiles from 1 to 8
Book with 100 puzzles
Single-player and multiplayer instructions

Basic information:
There are 8 lines, 6 circles, and 1 head.
The HEAD is contained of 8 main squares and extra 4 squares showing the directions as a reminder. All 8 main squares should contain the numbers from 1 to 8.
Direction of each line always starts from inside out. Each LINE has 8 squares in total (2 squares inside the head and 6 squares outside the head). Each line should contain the numbers from 1 to 8.
Each CIRCLE should contain the numbers from 1 to 8. All 6 circles are located outside of the head. Each circle is formed of 8 squares connected
with thin lines.

Rules:

Each number from 1 to 8 can appear only once inside the head.
Each number from 1 to 8 can appear only once in a single line.
Each number from 1 to 8 can appear only once in a circle outside the head.
HIGH TIDE, LOW TIDE, CARIBBEAN, AEGEAN, PACIFIC, ATLANTIC, INDIAN and ARCTIC line can appear only once in a single game.


MULTIPLAYER
Set up the board according to the puzzles from the book.
Set a stopwatch for each player and measure the time.
FOR EXAMPLE
If there are three players:
Each player takes a separate wooden board, and the fastest player wins the game.

SINGLE PLAYER
Set up the board according to the puzzles from the book.
Set a stopwatch and measure the time.
You become a pro once you solve the puzzles within the following minutes:
BEGINNER < 3
EASY < 4
MEDIUM < 6
HARD < 8
EXPERT < 10
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Bane Goliaths
description:
Bane goliaths are the result of the goliath specialization process. These autonomous combat systems based of type 3 frames are equipped with two nucleus guns each. These weapons give them vicious anti-tank fire at long range, while they remain extremely efficient against infantry.

This Unit Box contains a unit of bane goliaths with a leader. Equipped with very heavy weaponry, these soldiers offer outrageous firepower, they are capable of wiping any kind of infantry or armored vehicle unit coming their way. The unbelievable accuracy and the devastating penetration of their two nucleus guns will deny the enemy any chance of retaliation.

Includes miniatures and stat cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight

name: Exit Vector
description:
Exit Vector is an aerial combat board game set in a dystopian near future where nations, criminal syndicates, and powerful corporations compete for power in a high-tech world. Players assume the role of an expert pilot for hire, flying their high-performance aircraft on jobs ranging from search and destroy to troop transport.
