Exit Vector is built from the ground up to be a flexible tool for any gaming group, whether it’s as a stand-alone tabletop game or integrated into a role-playing game as a vehicle combat simulation. The mechanics are rules agnostic and compatible with multiple different systems (Shadowrun, Cyberpunk, Starfinder, etc.) Quick to set up, easy to play, and scalable to the level of complexity preferred by your group, it’s the aerial combat simulation you’ve been waiting for!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Erudia: Battle of Birthrights
description:
Build Your Army. Defeat Your Rival. Claim Your Birthright.

Erudia: Battle of Birthrights is a two player expandable card game featuring asymmetric tactics and strategies. Before the game begins, each player will select one of 96 unique deck combinations by drafting a primary and secondary class representing classical RPG archetypes and job systems. Players will then further customize their decks to create an additional layer of intrigue for their coming battle.

Players take turns advancing on battlefields which can be captured by multiple objectives. Players select up to three tactics to use each turn, with each tactic offering multiple options to ensure that no turn is wasted. These options include playing cards to advance their position on battlefields, activating abilities, strengthening their units, damaging rival units, and drawing cards to enhance their position. Battlefields are captured through area majority or through unique terrain based objectives which offer alternate means to victory. The game ends when one player has amassed 16 or more Victory Points from capturing battlefields and has claimed the throne of Erudia.

Erudia is unique in its design in that it contains a predetermined number of planned expansions that have been designed in advance, allowing for a single, consistent rulebook as well as narrative hints and spoilers of how the war unfolds. New classes and content will be added through expansions regularly, but Erudia also proudly features a Community Content Initiative where players get to collaboratively design actual content that will be included in the game. This Core Set contains two such classes, with more opportunities for involvement in the future. Overall, the Core Set contains 8 primary decks and 13 secondary decks for a total of 96 unique armies that are further customizable for endless replayability!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Ekosi
description:
Ekosi is the card game played by the characters in the upcoming indie video game Freeborn (formerly Luckless Seven). As a reward for the more generous supporters of the game's Kickstarter campaign, physical Ekosi cards were produced.

Ekosi plays very similarly to Blackjack. Each player is dealt cards by the dealer with the goal of getting as close to a combined value of 20 as possible without going over. Players will either "Hit" or "Stand" on their turn until both players "Stand" or one player ends their turn with a combined value greater than 20, also known as a "Bust". If both players "Stand" at the same total, it is considered a tie and no points are awarded that round.

The key difference in Ekosi is that players also have cards in their hands that can be used to alter their point total during their turn. There are four different color cards; green, blue, red and yellow. Green cards are dealt by the dealer and always add to your point total each round. Blue cards can be played from your hand to increase your point total. Red cards can be played from your hand to decrease your point total. Yellow cards can be played from your hand and have special properties such as doubling the last card dealt or allowing you to break a tie.

A standard Ekosi deck is made up of 72 cards. There are 40 green cards which are separated and shuffled to become the Dealer's draw pile. The remaining cards are shuffled and become the players' hand draw pile. If you are just learning the basics, it is recommended to remove all the yellow cards prior to shuffling the players' hand draw pile. Once you are comfortable with the core features of Ekosi, you can add the yellow cards in a future game. This helps to keep learning Ekosi from becoming too intimidating or confusing.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: 막타 (MAKTA)
description:
MAKTA a.k.a Last hit is a board game in a fantasy world where the player with the highest honor score wins when peace comes to the village by defeating monsters, collecting items, and completing quests.

MAKTA is a turn-based board game for 2 to 5 players.
When it's their turn, players must collect honor points by moving around the map, performing events, or using skill cards to disrupt and subdue enemies.

A total of 5 characters, warrior, archer, wizard, king, and farmer, have different stats and unique skill cards. Players can choose and play according to their own preferences.
There are various types of skills such as skills that increase strength during battle or attack enemies located at a distance, and each character has 5 unique skills.

The map is made by randomly arranging 36 map tiles, and consists of 7 types of buildings, 3 types of resource facilities, 4 types of events, 12 types of monsters, and 10 types of quests.
Items are equipment that help you fight. You can only put one item in the inventory slot of the information board, and you cannot have more than one item from the same part.

name: ¡Lo encontré!: en casa
description:
Learn about phonics, numbers, shapes and much more as you have fun with the exciting game of “Search and Find”! CAN YOU FIND… Something that smells good? Anything smaller than the palm of your hand? Shout “I FOUND IT!” when you have found the object Play with your friends and try to be the first to win 7 cards!

How to play:

Step 1: Place the Game Cards in the card holder so that they are visible through the window and take one.

Step 2: Read the clue on the card aloud and look for the object. When you find it, yell I FOUND IT!

Step 3: Read the questions at the bottom of the Game Card. Repeat this “Seek and Find” activity until you have 7 cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Aprende sobre fonética, números, formas y mucho más a medida que te diviertes con el emocionante juego de “Buscar y Encontrar”! ¿PUEDES ENCONTRAR… Algo que huele bien? ¿Algo más pequeño que la palma de tu mano? Grita “¡LO ENCONTRÉ!” cuando hayas encontrado el objeto ¡Juega con tus amigos e intenta ser el primero en ganar 7 tarjetas!

Como se juega:

Paso 1: Coloca las Tarjetas de Juego en el tarjetero de forma que se vean por la ventana y coge una.

Paso 2: Lee la pista de la tarjeta en voz alta y busca el objeto. Cuando lo encuentres, grita ¡LO ENCONTRÉ!

Paso 3: Lee las preguntas que hay en la parte inferior de la Tarjeta de Juego. Repite esta actividad de “Buscar y Encontrar” hasta conseguir 7 tarjetas.

—description from the publisher

name: Party Poison: Most Likely To
description:
Ever wonder what your friends really think of you? In Most Likely To, you'll vote anonymously on a variety of outrageous topics using your player card - choosing the player you think is most likely to be the statement that has been read out. The player who has received the most votes will win the card.

Watch out, the player who is chosen as 'most likely to' will have a chance to guess who has voted for them! Did they already know what you thought of them? They will now!

—description from the publisher

name: Color Fox
description:
In Color Fox you must collect as many sets of matches as possible. An ingenious game of strategy, observation and luck. Arrange the cards to match colors. Each matchstick you form earns a stick. Be the one with the most sets of sticks to win!

Step 1: 3 cards are dealt to each player (they are not shown to the rest), the rest of the cards are left in a discard pile face down and the colored sticks are placed within reach of all players. A card from the discard pile is played face up

Step 2: On their turn, each player must place one of the cards from their hand next to the cards in play so that the color of at least one matchstick matches. In doing so, he picks up a stick of that color. It is important that the cards always have the same orientation.

Step 3: Sort the sticks you have collected by sets of different colors (you cannot have the same color twice in the same set). A set can include up to 6 sticks. Count your score according to the rules of the game. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

En Color Fox debes coleccionar el máximo número de sets de cerillas como te sea posible. Un ingenioso juego de estrategia, observación y suerte. Coloca las cartas para juntar colores. Cada cerilla que formas ganas un palito. ¡Sé el que más sets de palitos tenga para ganar!

Paso 1: Se reparten 3 cartas a cada jugador (no se muestran al resto), el resto de cartas se dejan en un mazo de descarte boca abajo y se colocan los palitos de colores al alcance de todos los jugadores. Se juega una carta del mazo de descarte boca arriba

Paso 2: En su turno, cada jugador debe poner una de las cartas de su mano al lado de las cartas que estén en juego de forma que el color de, al menos, una cerilla coincidan. Al hacerlo coge un palito de ese color. Es importante que las cartas siempre tengan la misma orientación.

Paso 3:Ordena los palitos que has conseguido por sets de diferentes colores (no puedes tener el mismo color dos veces en el mismo set). Un set puede incluir hasta 6 palitos. Cuenta tu puntuación según te indican las reglas del juego. El jugador con la mayor puntuación gana.

—description from the publisher

name: Sixstix
description:
Move the sticks to form as many shapes as possible, using only three moves per round. Sixstix is a game of logic, pattern imitation and card collection.

How to play:

Step 1: Prepare 5 sticks in a row and reserve one. 4 cards are dealt to each player and placed face up in front of each one.

Step 2: On your turn, move the sticks to get as many figures of your cards as you can. You have 3 moves each turn.

Step 3: When all the cards have been used up, the game is over and the points are counted. The player with the highest score wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Mueve los palitos para formar el mayor número de figuras posible, usando solo tres movimientos por ronda. Sixstix es un juego de lógica, imitación de patrones y colección de cartas.

Como se juega:

Paso 1: Se preparan 5 palitos en fila y se reserva uno. Se reparten 4 cartas a cada jugador y se colocan bocarriba delante de cada uno.

Paso 2: En tu turno, mueve los palitos para conseguir tantas figuras de tus cartas como puedas. Tienes 3 movimientos en cada turno.

Paso 3: Cuando se han acabado todas las cartas se acaba el juego y se cuentan los puntos. El jugador con la puntuación más alta gana la partida.

—description from the publisher

name: Savage Cyanide: Debate It!
description:
Ready to defend your position in this game of absurd debates?

In Debate It, each player is dealt a hand of outrageous and hilarious items, players must use these to present a case as to why their item is best suited to a particular debate card.

Other players may issue a challenge if they believe that one of their items is better, they must make a strong counter-argument if they want other players to vote for their item as the winner!

Prepare for some conflict, as the first to get rid of all of their item cards by successfully playing them or succeeding in a challenge wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: みんなのさいたマップ (Minna no Saitamap)
description:
みんなのさいたマップ (Minna no Saitamap) is a co-operative game from Japan, based upon local knowledge of the Japanese city Saitama and the surrounding area.

Saitama lies just a little Northwest of Tokyo. The game was produced by a local game circle Wuerfel (ヴェルフェル) to celebrate Saitama's 150th birthday in 2021. It's intended to delight and inform players of the sites and life of Saitama. Whilst it helps to be a resident and know a bit about Saitama, the game is deliberately designed to be played by anybody. The design includes elements to win by developing unity, and to gain clues by spending points. However, the game is text heavy, so being able to read Japanese is needed.

Players take turns to play through the game, travelling around Saitama while getting to know Saitama's charms. As they do, the mascot characters, municipalities, tourist attractions and companies will appear one after another. To win the game, the players must reveal all the map cards making up Saitama, and to turn up five Unity cards that bring the residents together.

There are several types of cards in the box, map cards (the game title is a portmanteau of 'Saitama map'), Yura-chara cards (the local mascots), discovery cards (quizes on local stuff such as businesses), and Unity cards (which given special abilities). The game has 185 cards including high quality photographs from the region.

The map cards are used to lay out a plan of Saitama with four districts, North, East, West and Chichibu, three cards to each quarter (more for the advanced and demon levels). Players are dealt five Yura-Chura cards to their hand, which are used in gameplay but also have vital local information. By reading the cards, players can discover new things about Saitama which later will help them win the game.

Players start with their tokens in the centre of Saitama and move North/South by discarding one hand card, or East/West by discarding two. This reflects local transport in Saitama being easier North/South than East/West.

After moving, a player can turn over a map card by discarding Yura-chara cards with the matching symbols. But before turning a card over, the player must answer a quiz question on the card. Only the turn player can answer, but players can swap Yura-chara cards around, so passing the correct answer on.

Even if a player cannot answer the question, they turn the card over and read out the answer and other information about Saitama. The cards also have photographs taken especially for the game.

Players move a marker on a quiz qauge up or down if they got the answer right or wrong (they start at 5 out of 10). If the gauge hits zero, the player is eliminated from the game, for knowing nothing about the wonders of Saitama! (A player can also spend 3 points to count as a symbol needed to flip the card.)

After turning the map card and adjusting their gauge, the player turns up a Discovery card. This is another quiz, on local businesses, goods and retailers. Likewise, getting questions correct helps you proceed.

Finally, a player refills their hand to five and the next player goes.

During the game, a player might turn up a card saying "Everyone United!". These Unity cards give special abilities to help players. But all five Unity cards must be revealed to win the game. Players spend hand cards to achieve this, working together.

The game is won by revealing all the map cards and Unity cards. If the deck of Yura-chara cards is exhausted, the game ends.

The game designer playtested the game with Tokyo residents and they had no trouble playing. But the designer also lost the game twice playing on the Intermediary level, despite being a resident and the designer of the game. The illustrator of the game is uncredited, but the designer credits the photographer on their blog.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Questions and Answers

name: Operaopoly
description:
In Operaopoly, players are wealthy patrons from the golden age of opera (c. 1800 - 1932), sponsoring the era’s most talented composers (Verdi, Wagner, Bizet) and producing their operas in iconic opera houses of Europe. Each performance earns sponsoring player's profits measured in victory points. Rise to the level of Impresario and direct composers to follow your tactics. Selecting the best opera houses, casting talented artists, and deciding when an opera will have its final run of performances are just a few things successful Impresarios must master to win the game.

Operaopoly uses set collection, resource management, and hand management mechanics that gradually reveal new player abilities and action options. Impresario and Producer bonuses offer engaging win-win scenarios that spark player collaboration. You decide where and when to invest or reserve resources - advancing your influence throughout Europe and preventing others from monopolizing composers and their operas.

-description from designer

name: Football Simulator
description:
Fancy playing a game of American football, but without getting hit? Try this game and enjoy the thrill of the sport in a simplified and easy to understand way.

Free PNP game, original idea by Chris Hill
Translated and adapted by @Ludoman

To play you just need a die, a score recording sheet, a pencil and 8 cards (5 attack and 3 defense). Strongly recommended also to print a football stadium so to control the plays.

12 plays in each quarter, 4 quarters per game. On each play, the offense and defense play a card and the offense rolls a die. To see the advance (or retreat), both cards and the die are compared on the board and the next down is played.
If a 1 is rolled, the roll is repeated. If another 1, fumble! If a 6 is rolled, the roll is repeated, and if a 6 is rolled again, the yards gained are doubled... and the roll is repeated! Continue until no more 6's are rolled or a touchdown is scored.
You can kick to put the ball away or to kick a field goal. You advance the number of yards resulting from the value of a die roll multiplied by 10. If you don't reach the distance from where you kick, the field goal is considered missed.



¿Te apetece jugar un partido de fútbol americano, pero sin llevarte golpes? Prueba este juego y disfruta de la emoción de este deporte de forma simplificada y fácil de entender.Juego gratuito PNP, con idea original de Chris Hill
Traducido y adaptado por @Ludoman

Para jugar sólo necesitas un dado, una hoja de registro de puntuaciones, un lápiz y 8 cartas (5 de ataque y 3 de defensa). Se recomienda encarecidamente imprimir un estadio de fútbol para controlar las jugadas.

12 jugadas en cada cuarto, 4 cuartos por partido. En cada jugada, el ataque y la defensa juegan una carta y el ataque tira un dado. Para ver el avance (o el retroceso) se comparan ambas cartas y el dado en la tabla y se juega el siguiente down.
Si sale un 1, se repite la tirada, En caso de nuevo 1, fumble! Si se saca un 6, se repite la tirada y en caso de nuevo 6, se duplican las yardas obtenidas... y se vuelve a tirar! Se continúa hasta que deja de salir 6 o se consigue un touchdown.
Se puede patear para alejar la pelota o para conseguir un field goal. Se avanza el número de yardas resultante del valor de una tirada de dado multiplicado por 10. Si no se alcanza la distancia desde donde se lanza, se da por fallado el field goal.

name: リギラウの粛清 (Purge Of Rigilau)
description:
リギラウの粛清 (Purge Of Rigilau) is a werewolf game from Japan. In the People's Republic Of Rigilau, the General Secretary of the Communist Party is the dictator. The General Secretary guides the party faithful, guiding them to solve tasks, and purging the treacherous dissidents.

One player has the role of General Secretary and the rest are Ministers in the Government. As the game progresses, the dissidents are secretly trying to disrupt the progress of government by preventing issues from being solved. Their goal is to overthrow the Secretary and seize power. The Secretary and the loyal Ministers are trying to maintain control, and purge the rebels from the Party.

Players are dealt one of the 7 Position cards, identifying their role in the Party. The General Secretary is obviously loyal, and the Ministers each get a Faction card ($ loyal and 2 dissident). These set up the players approach to the party agenda.

The game is played over a series of rounds in which the General Secretary lays out the issues to be resolved by using Agenda cards (18 in the game). The Party members try to solve these issues with 49 Resource cards, representing Elements of the State such as the Armed Forces, Policies, Finance, Production, and party networks. There are 9 of each type plus 4 non-co-operation cards in the deck.

First, the Minister in charge of the Agenda reports on the Agenda. Then, the Ministers hold a meeting to discuss how to resolve the reported content. At that time, it would be a good idea to interrogate suspicious persons as dissidents. The General Secretary concludes by identifying the suspects on the basis of his superior talent. The suspects are purged from the party.

Each Minister also has special privileges from their position to help them resolve the issues on the Agenda. By working together and using the resource cards, the Ministers can resolve the issues facing the Party.

If the General Secretary is successful in completing the Agenda by resolving the issues, the Party faithful win. But if the Party cannot resolve the issues, the dissidents win.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Enigma Crate: Steampunk
description:
An escape-room like game meant to be played by 1-6 cooperative players. A series of key and combination locked containers must be opened by studying clues and solving puzzles. The difficulty level is designed for teens and adults or ambitious youngsters with a little help.

In Steampunk, "Mandelbrot Bennett-Squall has just lost his wife and daughter in a tragic dirigible accident and vows to seek revenge for his loss. Your mission is to stop the mad Doctor before he uses his deadly device to destroy the Washington Territories. You will solve Victorian-era word puzzles and codes, open locks, discover hidden secrets
and save the Northwest."

This is solvable without damaging or breaking any of the boxes, bags or items within. You do not need to cut anything, tear anything or otherwise damage any of the contents.

name: Enigma Crate: Vampire
description:
An escape-room like game meant to be played by 1-6 cooperative players. A series of key and combination locked containers must be opened by studying clues and solving puzzles. The difficulty level is designed for teens and adults or ambitious youngsters with a little help.

In Enigma Crate Vampire, "The Ancient One has just moved his coffin to Seattle and plans to enslave the human race. Your mission is to stop the Ancient One by stealing his center of power before he uses his deadly gaze to enslave the Northwest. You will solve puzzles, open locks, discover hidden secrets and save Seattle."

This is solvable without damaging or breaking any of the boxes, bags or items within. You do not need to cut anything, tear anything or otherwise damage any of the contents.

name: 救え！燃え尽きる前に (Sukue! Moetsukiru mae ni)
description:
救え！燃え尽きる前に (Sukue! Moetsukiru mae ni) is a push-your-luck card game from Japan. Players are trying to cook around a campfire. They add cards to fuel the fire, and then try to place their food at the right time to cook properly.

There are a variety of firewoods, which burn differently and give off more or less heat, such as oak, cedar, pine and so on. Players have potatoes, marshmallows, and meat in garlic to cook. By playing wood cards and food cards at the best times, they can cook their food best.

The game title translates roughly as "Save Me! Before It Burns Out", meaning players have to time the fire so it doesn't go out before their food is done.

name: Enigma Crate: Alien
description:
An escape-room like game meant to be played by 1-6 cooperative players. A series of key and combination locked containers must be opened by studying clues and solving puzzles. The difficulty level is designed for teens and adults or ambitious youngsters with a little help.

In Enigma Crate Alien, "Earth has been contacted by Aliens. Your mission is to decode the messages being sent by the Otherworldly creatures to determine if they come in peace or are asking for our surrender. You will solve math and science themed puzzles, open locks, discover hidden secrets and decode the messages from beings from space to perhaps save our pale blue dot."

This is solvable without damaging or breaking any of the boxes, bags or items within. You do not need to cut anything, tear anything or otherwise damage any of the contents.

name: Enigma Crate: Museum
description:
An escape-room like game meant to be played by 1-6 cooperative players. A series of key and combination locked containers must be opened by studying clues and solving puzzles. The difficulty level is designed for teens and adults or ambitious youngsters with a little help.

In Enigma Crate Museum, "The Consortium has been stockpiling art and artifacts to keep them away from the public. Your mission is to recover these priceless masterpieces from around the world for the Art for the People movement to ensure they are available for future generations. You will solve art and world travel puzzles, open locks, discover hidden secrets and bring Art back to the People."

This is solvable without damaging or breaking any of the boxes, bags or items within. You do not need to cut anything, tear anything or otherwise damage any of the contents.

name: World Cup! Laws of the Game Expansion
description:
Bring the referee to your World Cup! tournament with this expansion. Warnings, yellow cards and red cards, injuries...and even VAR! Watch out, as the referee can work for or against you!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: はんかくさいツアー計画 (Hankakusai tours keikaku)
description:
はんかくさいツアー計画 (Hankakusai tours keikaku) is a sliding puzzle game from Japan. Players are tour operators trying to complete ridiculous requests from customers visiting Hokkaido. The tour operators complete demands by sliding different parts of the island closer together.

Hokkaido is a very large island to the North of Honshu, which is the largest island in the Japanese archipelago. But Hokkaido is nearly as large as Honshu, and has no Shinkansen (Bullet Train) either. The main cities and tourist sites in Hokkaido are far apart and hard to get around. Tourists can only use the local express trains.

But tourists are wanting to visit Sapporo, Hakodate, Kushiro in 3 days and 2 nights! So, obviously, Kushiro must be moved next to Sapporo! As a result, Hokkaido looks like a mess, but it's a small sacrifice if you can fulfill the customer's wishes.

In the game, the island's geography is divided up across a grid of square tiles. Players take turns, rolling three dice and moving the tiles around liking a sliding puzzle game. The tiles can be rotated (they have a marker in one corner to show the correct orientation). The player who can move their tourist around the required locations fastest scores points.

The game designer is from Hokkaido and in the game title 'Hankakusai' is a dialect of Hokkaido and means 'stupid' or 'ridiculous'.
user summary
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Retail Rejects
description:
The official card game of the Flip the Table gaming podcast, Retail Rejects is a set collection and drafting game where 2-4 players compete to build the best collection of cheesy, weird, and obscure board games. Cards featuring parodies of actual old games from the show can be collected from three locations: your Friendly Local Game Store, the Thrift Shop and even Soviet Russia. Raid the shelves for games of different genres like VCR games, kids games and, of course, roll-and-move games. Collect special "BANCE" cards for special bonuses and time your moves to make the highest-scoring sets.

—description from the publisher

name: Destination Europe
description:
Experience key challenges in decision-making about migration issues in the European Union. In 3 rounds, you will move from the EU level to national and finally city level. You will take up different roles on each level with sometimes conflicting interests.

Each round, you will face several events with two possible outcomes each. You will debate their possible impact, try to convince others of your point of view, vote on the event outcome, and finally see the impact of the winning outcome on different groups of migrants and the european public.

Destination Europe is a role-playing game produced for learning purposes. No single player wins, instead, you measure your success as a group. It uses contrasting hypothetical scenarios in order to stimulate debate.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Voting

name: Governance game
description:
A collaborative card game where the goal is to structure the governance of a codebase to overcome calamities.

You take the role of the stakeholders of a codebase for public organizations and are given a random starting state and scenario. Depending on those drawn cards, different actor and object cards are added to the table. These should collaboratively be placed on the table so that everyone knows what their position signifies.

Then, in two subsequent turns, random calamity cards are drawn, after which their effect will need to be explained. In between rounds, it is possible to negotiate and restructure the relationships between the different stakeholders on the table. If the group overcomes both calamities, they have won the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Negotiation

name: カードツイクスト (Card Twixt)
description:
カードツイクスト (Card Twixt) is an expansion to the original game Twixt produced by Japanese Twixt Association (日本ツイクスト協会). The intent is to help players learn Twixt and explore the different strategies in the game.

NOTE: you need a copy of Twixt to be able to use this deck.

Players new to Twixt are faced with a blank board and don't know where to start. Card Twixt helps by offering new ways to play. There is a deck of basic rules and introductory rules that explore variants in the game.

For example, cards in the basic set might be played to instruct a player where to place their next peg. Or the introductory rules add variants such as starting positions, or removing a bridge piece.

The designers set out to help players learn Twixt but discovered lots more opportunities in the game themselves as they developed Card Twixt.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: Japanese Twixt Association (日本ツイクスト協会)

name: What the $%&! is that Song
description:
What the $%&! Is That Song is a party game to play with your streaming music service and a device such as Siri or Alexa. Simply grab a card, choose a category, and PLAY THAT SONG! The next person has to then pick a card and play something before that song is over.

There are 6 topics:
Female Artist
Male Artist
Groups
Lyrics
Categories
Starts with the letter...

Flip a card, reveal your category, and make your AI play a song that satisfies the question. If you do, you keep the card. If not, your opponents may "steal the mic" and answer the question.

Play continues until a person or team have 10 cards.

name: Holy Trinity
description:
Every player has a hand of the same 10 beautiful characters that they will play out during 3 rounds in a simultaneous fashion. Each time the characters face each other and the strongest will win the available loot but only after the weakest character effect will be triggered! Which may result in a cascade of events that will change the outcome of the loot division. Outplay your opponents with the same 10 cards by anticipating their choices and scoring the most loot!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: amai!
description:
Be the first to try to build a smart AI solution such as a smart refrigerator, a nutrition coach or a waste sorting aid. You do that by collecting the right cards. And make sure your system doesn't crash!

Each AI system requires a fixed set of 3 symbols (ethics, ...) as well as a task specific set of symbols (robotics, visuals, ...) to be collected in order to be built. First one to collect all symbols wins the game. You collect symbols by picking cards from the market.

The game is simple with simple rules and is suitable for young and old , at home or in the classroom . The cards have fun graphics and players don't need to understand all the AI ​​terms to play the game. Those who would like to learn more about AI can read the descriptions with the images. The AI ​​solutions you can build are also based on ideas from citizens that were collected on the amai! website.

The card game was developed in collaboration with game developer Pilipili Games and graphic agency Buro Knal and can be played with two to five players from the age of eight .
mechanics: Drawing, Hand Management, Market, Set Collection

name: Die Dukatenjagd
description:
Adults always play on the blue track, children on the winding brown track. Each player receives a figure that he places on the starting position at the beginning of the game. Each player receives 3 ducats as entry fee, the remaining ducats go into the bank. The winner of a game is whoever brings home 10 ducats first.
The blue track (adults)
At the beginning of the game, each player on this lane receives 6 jokers (2 of each value). The jokers are placed before rolling: they can be used when you are behind and want to move forward quickly or when you want to jump over an obstacle. The placed jokers must be given to the bank. The bank also gets 12 jokers in reserve. The bank jokers must be placed in such a way that the 4 jokers are on the bottom, then the 3 jokers and on top the 2 jokers.
You get a new joker as soon as you come to a crossing space (purple). You get a ducat when you reach or jump over the ducat bank.
If a player on the blue lane comes to an intersection with the brown lane, he receives a joker if this space is unoccupied. However, if the crossing is occupied by a player on the brown track, or if he reaches it, he must be paid a ducat as a way fee, and the player who paid must also go back 1 space.
If a player on the blue lane reaches another player on his lane, he receives a ducat from him. If 2 players are already sitting on a space reached by another, each player must pay 1 ducat to the newcomer.
Every player on the blue track can place ducats on a space. If an opponent comes onto the corresponding space, the player who placed the bet receives a ducat from his opponent. A space can only be betted on by one player at a time. You can bet if you come directly to the space of the ducat bank (if you want to bet more than one ducat, then 1 ducat must be paid to the bank as a betting fee for each additional ducat placed. ) or if you have jumped over the bank space, then however, a 1 ducat placement fee must be paid for the first ducat wagered.
The ducats you bet can only be brought back home if you are directly in the bank or have just jumped over it.
The brown train (kids)
Each player receives 2 ducats when he enters the space of the dukate bank. If he jumps over it, he only gets 1 ducat.
The player can also get ducats from the blue lane players if he comes to an intersection and meets a blue lane player there (1 ducat toll).
If a player on the brown lane is reached by another player on the same lane, he must pay this player 1 ducat and return to spaceno. 1.
If a player rolls a 6 on the brown lane, he may roll again. If he comes to a crossing space, he may roll 2 more times. If another player is reached with a number rolled, he must pay and return to space 1.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: アディショナル人狼 (Additional Werewolf)
description:
アディショナル人狼 (Additional Jinro) is a werewolf game from Japan. In this game, nobody is eliminated until the end of the game. The villagers start as children and develop through the game until the finale.

Players start with two cards, one showing their position, and another giving them additional abilities. This allows the children to change as they grow up and change their roles. Players can switch from being werewolves to villagers and back if they want.
user summary
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: 天界じゃんけん (Heaven's Rock-Paper-Scissors)
description:
天界じゃんけん (Heaven's Rock-Paper-Scissors) is a 2 player card game from Japan. The Archangels Lucifer and Michael are battling over the Earth. With each clash of their swords, a quarter of the Earth is destroyed. They draw on hunters and weapons to help them in their battle.

In this game, players use a variety of action cards to strengthen their position, and then settle the round with a rock-paper-scissors (RSP) contest (known in Japan as Janken). The first player to win three rounds is the ruler of Earth.

The game has a deck of cards, color-coded on the back so you know which is which; a support card (blue), a rock-paper-scissors card (yellow), or a weapon card (black). Players start a round with a hand of five cards. On their turn, a player draws a card from the deck, and may play one or two action cards, and then pass their turn. After both players have had a turn, if they both have a yellow card in hand, then a RSP test takes place. The players shuffle their hand cards and draw one at random. If this resolves a RSP, one player collects a scoring marker, and the cards are all reshuffled for a new round. If there is no RSP resolved, the start player marker switches to the other player and the game resumes.

The action cards give various benefits, such as drawing extra cards, or reclaiming a card from the discard and so on. Ultimately, a player is trying to determine which yellow cards their opponent holds, so that they might win the RSP contest. The game is more tactical than luck, and players are allowed to check the colours of the cards in the draw deck.

The game also includes some extra cards that allow variants to be played, including an undersea city and demons and devils.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Mystic Elements
description:
Milleniums ago, the seven emperors has agreed to divide the world according to the spheres of they control and magic they use to run their empires.

They were extracting the mystical energy from the universe and used it to keep their worlds separated that there was almost impossible to travel among them. It was artificial state of balance and natural magic flow usage was restricted. Their folks lived in peace and the magic was inherited through the dynasties of each of these 7 founders.

But they have missed one thing. Balance was kept for thousands of years, but it was not perfect. There were one aspect of magic, which could not be used for keeping the balance, the most dark, unpredictable and chaotic energy.

This magic energy aspect accumulated over the years, becoming stronger, requesting more effort from the seven powers. The heirs of kings noticed to problem but suspecting each other from breaching the balance to increase their own potential profit. Finally the inhabitants started to feel the problems themselves. The magic used originally for comfort of the citizens were needed more to keep the borders. Reality breaches started to appear frequently.

The heirs of original seven emperors did not manage to keep people content. Heretic voices raised about connecting the worlds back together. However nobody knew what's exactly going on.

One day the massive amount of chaotic energy accumulated for millenias bursted out like gigantic flood from a dam and caused reality breaches that crushed all artificial boundaries. The energy started to flow uncontrollably and magic abilities started to appear randomly through the population.

There is nobody in control and world is balancing on the edge of chaos. Who can combine the aspects of mystic energy to estabilish a peace and gather the mightiest army to conquer the new world?

The game contains 120 cards, 15 cards from each of eight colors representing the elements. At the beggining of the game the player choose combination of three colors which determines their 45 card deck to play with.

At the beginning of player's turn, they draw up to 7 cards and then get an increasing amount of energy of certain color to play the cards, summon spells, warriors and creatures.

Units in battle can fight each other or damage the player which causes removing the cards from the top of their deck.

The first player which runs out of the cards in the deck loses the game.

name: Kakurenino
description:
Kakurenino is a three-dimensional deduction game. Each player has a set of wooden blocks made up of wooden squares; the pieces are different colors and both players have the same set of pieces. In addition to the basic cubes, there are "decoy" cubes.

Simultaneously, each player builds a 2 or 3 dimensional structure using their pieces. Optionally, they can include some decoy blocks.

When both players are ready, they stare at their opponent's structure trying to deduce which pieces their opponent did not use. If you have correctly guessed within the time allowed, you win!

name: Goat Restaurant
description:
In Goat Restaurant, the players are chefs at a restaurant visited by goats, trying to make quirky paper meals which will satisfy the goat customers.

The game includes several categories of cards representing the goats' preferences which guide how the players will arrange the game's unique paper cards. The shapes have slits, holes, are are non-traditional in shape.

Each player is given the same set of cards and one card from each category is revealed. The first player to create a structure which satisfies the criteria is awarded 2 points and other players who can complete the task within the time limit are given 1 point. The player with the most points after three rounds wins.

name: バレントール (Barentor)
description:
Barentor consists of 12 cards. Each round, a subset of these cards are given to one player who selects some to keep, and passes others to the next player. Typically, a card is removed randomly before the next player looks at them; the next player also chooses two cards and passes them on. A variation of this happens for each player (and player count.)

Once everyone has two cards, their effects are resolved in order, beginning with the 1 and ending with the 12. Then, each player sums the cards in front of them, taking into account any effects. Each player compares their sum with the sum of the first player only. For each pair making the comparison, the person with the higher sum earns 1 point.

The game lasts a number of rounds and the person with the most points wins.

name: Favor of the Gods
description:
Story
In the land of ancient Greece, the noblest of all men have set their sights on a journey to the top of Mount Olympus, where the Gods themselves reside. Enter the world of Favor of the Gods. Set in ancient Greece, you’ll take on the role of a nobleman seeking to prove your worth to the Gods of Mount Olympus. You must fight, pray, and offer the skulls of your enemies to gain the admiration of the Gods and earn your place amongst them. As you journey through the land of Greece, you’ll encounter rivals, temples, wild boar and much more. You will use your private deck of cards to unleash powerful abilities, gain the Favor of the Gods, and rest to regain your strength. You must choose your actions wisely as the Gods’ Favor is a limited resource, and you’ll need to be cunning to outwit your opponents. Only the first player to prove their worth through strength, merit, and devotion will be welcomed to Mount Olympus where eternal paradise awaits. So, gather your hoplites and pray that the Gods show you their Favor as your try to earn your place amongst them, in Favor of the Gods.

Gameplay Overview
This game puts you into the role of a Greek noble trying to do anything in his power to please the Gods, whether that be through strength, merit, or devotion. You with a small private deck of cards. On your turn, you can use a cards special ability which is limited in scope but powerful when used correctly, discard a card to gain Favor of a God, make an offering of your enemies’ skulls to the Gods, or rest to regain your cards. The game will end when one player proves their worth among the Gods by completing at least 1 of each category of victory conditions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Race, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: World War II: The Struggle for Europe and Asia
description:
Designed to be a perfect mix of the aesthetically appealing but short strategy war-games with the more realistic, longer, and difficult conflict simulations. World War II: The Struggle for Europe and Asia contains a truly unique and challenging game system. Play tested for more than 10 years, the game is a labor of love for its designers and artists that has a good balance between playability and historical accuracy.

The core mechanic is an alternating movement system based on leadership initiatives. Players are always involved managing such actions as mechanized breakthrough's, unit operational ranges, reinforcements going into battles, and naval fleet pursuits on a die-12 combination with CRT's. Game features setup for 1939 and 1941 starting dates, historical build limits, and optional political cards for players to fight on a beautiful global map. Players may discover that many of the decisions made then may be the right ones for them now or explore other options as they present themselves.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Delayed Purchase, Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement

name: Argatoria
description:
In the vast territories of Argatoria every day, wild tribes of Barbarians, Reptilians and other races fight, led to battle by great generals and mighty champions. Overwhelmed by the vision of the power or the whispers of the gods, they unleash great wars, which are harnessed by huge beasts, machines and magic. The voice of the drums mixes with cries of warriors, big cities and strongholds are burning, and great armies are coming from each side. It's the time of blood, time of war, time of Argatoria!

In Argatoria Wargame you command one of four armies - Arox, Sorgax, Vaendral, or Dirandis. Your army may include from a few to over a dozen units, as well as champions, great beasts, prayers and unusual spells that will allow you to fight even more exciting fights.

Each turn you can move, charge, melee, shoot etc with your army units. Too win you have to destroy your opponent army och do the mission in the scenario your plaing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Waldduell
description: An exciting quartet jump-off game for children 4 years and older. Choose from foxes, rabbits, bumblebees, trees and flowers and grab your opponent's cards. Gradually, varied extensions and special rules can be added to the game. This is not a normal quartet game, but due to its different special rules it is an own exciting game.

name: Muumilaakson vuodenajat
description: The goal of the game is to get rid of your cards by playing them in common decks. First on to do so wins the game.

name: Humans.
description:
Humans are such weird little creatures. It must be fun to be one. Why not dress up in your finest human costume and find out what they're really like by joining their party? Just be on your best human behavior or they'll figure out you're not supposed to be there!

In this game you play as non humans attending a costume party hosted by a human. It is your job to blend in without your non human traits ruining the party. Since all guests are in costume, it shouldn't be too hard to blend in! All you have to do is act human, which we all know how to do right?

—description from the publisher


You are not a human, but you like human things like small talk and parties. You and some of your other non-human friends decide to dress up as humans and attend a human party. However, your non-human quirks show up at the most inconvenient times. Try to make your way through the party without it getting too out of hand.

3-8 players gamify small talk in this larp, improvisation, awkward game of trying to not show your true self. Create basics of a non-human, flip over a card to see what the small talk conversation topic is, and then talk away!

—description from the designer

name: うんこふんだ！ (Unko Funda!)
description:
うんこふんだ！ (Unko Funda!) is a bluffing game from Japan. The game title translates literally as 'to step in poo!'. Players are walking around town trying to avoid stepping on dog poo on the pavement.

The game has 41 cards. Some are poo cards, some are score cards and some score cards have special actions. The deck is shuffled and the cards are all laid out face-down. They can be set out how you like, in a grid, in a loose mess, anyway you like as long as they are laid out separately.

On a player's turn, they take a card and look at it secretly. Then they choose to put it back face-down, or to keep it. If they keep it, and it is a poo card, it goes face-down in front of them and has no benefit. If it is a score card, it goes face-up and if it is a special action, that takes effect.

If the player puts the card back, it goes back face-down. The other players now have a chance to challenge the turn player, calling out Unko Funda! if they do. The card is turned up. If the card is poo, the turn player is eliminated from the game and scores zero at the end. The player who called out Unko Funda! keeps the poo card face up in front of themself, and it scores 2 points at the end.

But if the card is not a poo card, the turn player collects it face up, and the challenger is eliminated. So as players draw and play cards face down, they trying to bluff each other whether or not the card was poo.

Players use a mix of bluff, deduction and knowing what cards they have seen to work out if the card played is poo or not.

At the end of the game, the players still in the game calculate their scores, and the most points wins.
user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: ブラックジャンケン！ (Black Janken!)
description:
ブラックジャンケン！ (Black Janken!) is a shedding card game from Japan. The game uses a sock-Scissors-paper mechanism (called Janken in Japan), but the winner is the first person to clear their hand.

The game has 9 yellow and 9 white cards, and 3 black cards, showing rock/scissors/paper evenly. However, the white cards show the RSP on both sides, giving information to the opponents. And if a player wins a round with a black card, that card is picked up by the loser.

The game is for 3 to 7 players, and card distribution varies according to the number of players. But players end up with a random selection of cards in hand. Cards are held so that opponents can see clearly who has what colour cards in hand.

On their turn, a player nominates another to battle. The players call out Rock Scissors Paper PON! as a 1-2-3-Go! call, and play their card immediately on the final shout.

If the battle is won, the winner sheds their winning card, unless it was a black card in which case the loser collects it to their hand. The loser collects their losing card back into their hand, and the turn moves to the next player after the turn player.

When one player has cleared their hand, they win.
user summary

name: ウィッチズウィスク (Witches Whisk)
description:
ウィッチズウィスク (Witches Whisk) is a game from Japan, with apprentice witches at a magic school flying on broomsticks over the sports field. The game can be played as a competitive game for a single winner by scoring victory points, or as a co-operative game trying to stop the escaping magical creatures. The main rules apply for both games and the co-op game can be played solo.

The game has a subtitle ～ジェレミア魔法学校の訓練法～(~Jeremiah Magic School Training Method~).

Players use dice to place against three actions: Activating Magic, Movement, and Student Skills.

By placing dice against the six different magic circuit cards, a player can gain magic spells from them. Magic is used when attacking other players, or the creatures. Dice used on the magic broom of a student allows the player to move that witch across the playing field. Each student has special skills which are used once per round with the dice.

The game ends after six rounds. Players need to balance the development of their students, combining attack and defence, and movement and growth of skills. The more a student develops, the more they can achieve by the final round.

In a 2 player game, each player controls two witches. In a co-operative game, players can pass on good dice rolls. In the competitive game, getting to be start player gives you advantages.

The second edition released in 2022 had improved components and box art, but the gameplay was the same.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Quests Over Coffee: Dice Game
description:
Quests Over Coffee: Dice Game is a dice rolling game where you are trying to get the highest score against your opponent. It is a childhood game that has been experienced by many of the different patrons in the Quests Over Coffee world, but each with their different spin on scoring and winning the game.

—description from publisher

name: Maailman OMG
description: Try and recognize natural phenomena, world traditions, places and animals from amazing photographs on cards. One player selects one of the open cards and everyone writes what they see and where in the world they think it might occur. Both the right place and phenomenon score you points, and the most points wins.

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Wolf's Dragoons
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Wolf’s Dragoons Assault Star.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Eridani Light Horse
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Hansen's Roughriders
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Hansen’s Roughriders Battle Lance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Kell Hounds
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Kell Hounds Striker Lance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Northwind Highlanders
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Northwind Highlanders Command Lance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Word Buzz!
description:
Word Buzz! is a word game similar in style to Password: A player draws a topic card, keeping it hidden from their teammates, then must describe the topic for their teammates to guess within a set period of time. However, before beginning their description, the player must also roll a 1d6 "forfeit die", the result of which affects what they may say to their teammates. For example: a '1' means the player may only speak in the past tense; a '2' means the player may only use words of six or fewer letters; a '6' means the player may only speak in rhyme; and so forth.

Teams score a point if their player can adhere to the forfeit conditions and the teammates guess the topic. If the player does not adhere to their forfeit, the opposing team may hit the buzzer and score a point, and also end that player's turn. If the player's teammates are unable to guess the topic, the opposing team has one guess. If correct, they win a point, if not, no points are scored.

A bonus point may be scored if the player adheres to their forfeit and manages to avoid saying "um" or "er", even if their team does not correctly guess the topic.

Play then passes to the opposing team. The first team to reach ten points is the winner.

name: MYSTERY BOOKS Dysturbia: The Case of the Dead Crow
description:
An abandoned house in the middle of the woods, an ominous presence, & a dead crow with a cryptic note attached to its neck... Do you have the guts to explore Creek Village and uncover the truth behind this dreadful case?

"The Case of the Dead Crow" is an elaborately crafted puzzle book with bonus content both within and beyond its covers.

name: ESCAPE Dysturbia Advent calendar: A Taste for Revenge
description:
For years, fine-dining restaurants "Arcobaleno" and "Der kleine Löffel" have been in fierce competition over who can serve the most popular and exclusive Christmas dinner. And each year, envy, malevolence, and conspiracy dominate preparations for the feast. But when confronted with kidnapping and death, it becomes clear that this year's long-running feud is about to reach a new level. Find out who's willing to play dirty and serve up a side of murder with their Christmas dinner.

24 letters, each with challenging puzzles to unravel a thrilling story, all in one box for each day of Advent!

name: Peter Pan
description:
It's a simple running game. The aim of the game is to be the first to reach the last field. When a pawn lands on certain squares, the events from the game rules must be observed.

—user summary

name: ColourQuest
description:
ColourQuest is a strategic board game that involves navigating a map using color cards. The aim of the game is to travel across the map and collect the most points by capturing colored territories.

Players all start with their coloured token on a predetermined stating locations, then they draw five coloured cards from the colour deck. The first player then draws a territory card, and this territory becomes the target for that turn.

Using the colour cards, player must move across the map, capturing territory's to score points. At the end of each turn players discard a number of cards, depending on locations captured. The game continues until all territories have been captured.

Players must strategize which territories to capture to maximize their points. They must also carefully manage their color cards to ensure they always have a match to move. Players can also try to block their opponents' movements by occupying key territories.

The game ends when all territories have been captured. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Map Reduction, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: ノラネコ ボスネコ (Noraneko Bossneko)
description:
ノラネコ ボスネコ (Noraneko Bossneko) is a game from Japan. Stray kittens are in the park run by a boss cat. The grumpy boss cat will only let one kitten stay, the one that gets close but doesn't disturb. So they must sneak up quietly to the boss cat but not get caught out.

The game has a grid which the five kittens must advance across, and a chart measuring how angry the boss cat gets when disturbed. There are 25 stray cat cards (walk, run, make eye contact, look away, blink, 5 of each), and 8 boss cat cards for relaxing, normal, alert, vigilant and bad mood.

Players choose cards from their hand to move their kitten. The kitten furthest to the left moves first, and kittens in columns go from top to bottom. After the kittens move, a card is turned up for the boss cat's mood, and a marker might move on the scale. If the marker reaches the top of the scale, the boss cat lashes out and then becomes calm again, resetting the marker back to zero.

The kitten that successfully gets to the boss cat first is accepted and wins the game.
user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Het Beursspel
description:
Players move with their token on a 40 space round track by 2 dice very similar to Monopoly. According to the space landed on, they may do a specific action. 21 spaces allow to buy a specific share. Any following player landing there must pay a dividend to the owner (similar to the rent in Monopoly). In both cases, a spinner decides the exact amount. If you have all 3 shares of the same category, you may invest up to 3 times 3000 guilders to cash in 5 times the amount for each investment.
In the beginning of the game, players receive an equal amount of event cards. One of it must be played when landing on one of the 8 spaces "beursdag". Players may swap, buy and sell shares among each other.
After an agreed time or when all players but one are broke or when the bank runs out of money the richest player wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Income, Loans, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: 勇者対策会議 (Yusha Taisaku Kaigi)
description:
勇者対策会議 (Yusha Taisaku Kaigi) is a tactical card game from Japan. Players take on the roles of Generals serving the Demon King. As a hero approaches to attack the Demon King's castle, the Generals must work together to defeat them. But if the hero is vanquished, a single winner is decided, based upon the strength of attack each General secretly held back in their hand.

Players send monsters to attack the hero, with the monsters card showing a value in stars. The players also use dice which amend the attack, and also determine how the hero moves. The hero can use weapons and items to defeat the monsters.

If the hero is killed, the stars left in each player's hand are totalled up for each player, with the most stars winning. If the hero reaches the castle, all the players lose. But a player can win the game by sudden death by managing to assassinate the hero in a single stroke.
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Phase Order

name: The Judgment Table
description:
The Judgment Table is an exciting board game that features two different game modes - competitive and cooperative. In this game, each player is assigned a capital sin and two secondary sins, and must work to identify the original sin(s) by asking and answering questions. The game is both fun and challenging, as players must use their wits and strategy to uncover the correct answers.

With its unique and engaging gameplay, The Judgment Table is perfect for players of all ages who enjoy strategy and deduction games. The game is easy to learn but difficult to master, ensuring that every playthrough is different and exciting. The customizable rules also allow players to adjust the game to their liking, making it a versatile addition to any game collection.

Whether you're playing competitively or cooperatively, The Judgment Table is sure to provide hours of entertainment for you and your friends.

—description from the publisher (English)

The Judgment Table es un emocionante juego de mesa que presenta dos modos de juego diferentes: competitivo y deductivo. En este juego, a cada jugador se le asigna un pecado capital y dos pecados secundarios, y debe trabajar para identificar el pecado original o pecados (en caso de que hubiera más de uno) haciendo preguntas y respondiendo a ellas. El juego es divertido y desafiante, ya que los jugadores deben usar su ingenio y estrategia para hacer las preguntas y responderlas de manera correctas.

Con su jugabilidad única y atractiva, The Judgment Table es perfecto para jugadores de todas las edades que disfrutan de los juegos de estrategia y deducción. El juego es fácil de aprender pero difícil de dominar, asegurando que cada partida sea diferente y emocionante. Las reglas personalizables también permiten a los jugadores ajustar el juego a su gusto, convirtiéndolo en una adición versátil a cualquier colección de juegos.

Ya sea que juegues de manera competitiva o cooperativa, The Judgment Table seguramente proporcionará horas de entretenimiento para ti y tus amigos.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Voting

name: NUKEDOKU
description:
"Recently graduated has a bomb defuser and the most dangerous device is your first job... a nuclear bomb contained inside a card!"

Try to disarm the NUKEDOKU card before time runs out or everything will blow away!

Set a timer and start to roll the dice allocating the results on the empty squares of the NUKEDOKU card, but remember that the numbers can't be repeated on the same file, column or boxes!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Math, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 勇者対策会議Ⅱ (Yusha Taisaku Kaigi II)
description:
勇者対策会議 II (Yusha Taisaku Kaigi II) is a tactical card game from Japan, re-working 勇者対策会議 (Yusha Taisaku Kaigi) with new rules and additional characters.

Whilst the main gameplay is the same, the players' characters now have special abilities they can use to improve their position. And the hero is now accompanied by hunters and priests to add the approach to the castle.

Players take on the roles of Generals serving the Demon King. As a hero approaches to attack the Demon King's castle, the Generals must work together to defeat them. But if the hero is vanquished, a single winner is decided, based upon the strength of attack each General secretly held back in their hand.

Players send monsters to attack the hero, with the monsters card showing a value in stars. The players also use dice which amend the attack, and also determine how the hero moves. The hero can use weapons and items to defeat the monsters.

If the hero is killed, the stars left in each player's hand are totalled up for each player, with the most stars winning. If the hero reaches the castle, all the players lose. But a player can win the game by sudden death by managing to assassinate the hero in a single stroke.
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Do Not Hump
description:
Do Not Hump is a novel take on roll-and-write games, using a common pool of dice per round as the incoming train to be humped. Players form rail car sets which can then be "humped" together into like groups on their rail yard sheet that you can then "switch" to score. After a set number of rounds, best humper wins!

The term Do Not Hump was stenciled onto particularly delicate rail cars so that it would not be forced down a hill by gravity into the right group of cars, potentially damaging its contents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Omaha Spur
description:
Omaha Spur is a “sharpie-rails” variant of traditional 18xx games for 2-6 players set in the greater Omaha/Council Bluffs area. It is a city-scale game that simulates the development of railway Systems, passenger and freight routes, and industries roughly during the period 1870 to 1930.

It generally follows traditional 18xx rules borrowed from 1830. There are stock rounds where shares are bought and sold, and operating rounds where tracks are laid, stations placed, and trains run for revenue. Some parts from 1830 are necessary to play the game.

Rather than laying tiles, players draw track sections and place station tokens with their companies' colored sharpies to both indicate completion and ownership. Companies can lease track from other players to complete their routes

The revenue values of hexes increase as game phases change and industries "pop-up" in those hexes at the end of each operating round from a pre-programmed chain of industry tokens.

As with traditional 18xx, players' portfolio and cash holdings determine the winner.
mechanics: Connections, Crayon Rail System, Drawing, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Haribo Phantasia Würfelabenteuer
description: The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach space 30 wins the game. On some spaces events caused by Haribo products hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Top100 des personnages fictifs
description:
A simple trivia game with a pop culture theme. On your turn, pick a card from the deck and give the the first clue. Then in playing order, the other players try to guess the character you're describing to get a max of point. No one gets it right! No worry, give a second clue and start asking the other players again for a lessr amount of points. Still no good answer, the third and final clue is read.and players may make a final try for minimal score. The game ends when a player reaches 100 points.

—user summary
Faites un saut dans le monde imaginaire grâce à ce jeu-questionnaire amusant ! Le Top 100 des personnages fictifs vous fera redécouvrir vos histoires favorites sous un autre angle ! Pour remporter la partie, soyez le premier à atteindre 100 points en trouvant les bonnes réponses avec le moins d’indices possibles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Never Split the Party
description:
Co-op comes to D&D Onslaught! In the Never Split the Party scenario, four players cooperatively play as the monsters - and the adventurers are the enemy! Adventurer behavior is dictated by behavior cards, unlocking a new way to play the 12 characters from the core set. Each kit will receive 6 scenario sheets and 6 decks of double-sided behavior cards – run the scenario in-store and/or pass them out to excited players!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game

name: 恋愛禁止学園 (Renai Kinshi Gakuen)
description:
恋愛禁止学園 (Renai Kinshi Gakuen) is a hidden identity game from Japan. 'Gakuen' is high school, and 'Ren-aikinshi' is the rule talent agencies apply to their stars forbidding personal relationships (because they think it deters the fans). So the game tile means a love-ban at high school. In this game, a player must find the one they are destined to fall in love with. The player count is 5 to 9, because of the minimum five roles in the game.

Set in a school where romance is prohibited, the goal is to fulfill the love between the main character and the destined person. However, if the disciplinary committee among the students finds out about the relationship, there is a danger of expulsion.

Players have five roles:
1. Protagonist looking for a destined person
2. A person destined to do his best to be confessed to by the main character
3. A friend who supports the main character and the destined person
4. If confessed to by the main character, the only rival
5. A disciplinary committee member who finds the person of destiny and expels him from school

Only the main character's role is revealed, and the identity of the other players is unknown.

Using the prepared character cards and combination attribute cards, you will play a role and perform events that are common in school things. Even if you know the other player's identity, the only way to tell it to the main character is through role-playing.

Depending on their role, each player has a different win condition.

An expansion pack was published later.
user summary
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 恋愛禁止学園 拡張セット (Renai Kinshi Gakuen Expansion Pack)
description:
恋愛禁止学園 拡張セット (Renai Kinshi Gakuen Expansion Pack) is an expansion pack for 恋愛禁止学園 (Renai Kinshi Gakuen). It adds new cards, new characters, new abilities, and new rules to allow 2-5 players or for playing in two groups.

The new characters in the game are Chiaki Takakura (an Ore-sama type - reformed trouble-maker)and Hinano Aizawa (a Yurufuwa type - soft and gentle). With the addition of characters, Boy Love play and Yuri play are possible even with 9 people (forms of popular manga romance genres). The additional characters allow the new rules to be played.

There are 8 new Character Attributes, expanding the game for all rules sets. The added character attributes include: 'blood relatives', 'unknown gender', 'Otaku', 'Yandere' and other styles from popular genres.

The two new rules sets are Coupling Jijiki, and Group Dating. Coupling Jijiki is for 2 to 5 people, and lets players create couples by combining characters and attributes. The player must improvise an explanation as to why these two belong togetehr and the players vote to agree or disagree. If the couple is accepted, it is played in the game combined. The couple gains a Like Token which is a new feature in the game.

Group Dating lets players form two groups of 4, 6, or 8 people. Attribute cards are mixed together and exchanged across the groups. By role-playing your attribute, you can find your destined partner, and also reveal confessions from the other group. But because your attributes are now known to others, you have to be careful keeping your identity concealed from your group.
user summary
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fussball Fieber
description:
Fussball Fieber is a card game for 2 players. The soccer ball is moved across the playing field using playing cards. The game is played in two halves. Players try to score goals and win with tactical moves such as corner kicks, shots on goal, penalties, free kicks, throw-ins and goalkeeper saves.

—user summary

name: Murder Mystery Party: A Cuban Killing
description:
The Cuban Nova in Havana. In 1952. is where the rich and famous come to play. This is the height of the season but not everything has gone according to plan. Yesterday evening, the hotel manager , Rico Ricardo, was found dead. And as the police believe - he's been murdered. That means that the guests are now suspects:-

C.D Gonzalez- Rico's business partner an one of the wealthiest men on the island
Lolo Cabana - A showgirl whose friendship with Rico took hr off the stage and into management
Sir Ian lemming - A British writer of spy stories and rumour has it maybe a spy himself.
Lady Lemming - Sir Ians wife and a successful film actress in her own right,
Lady Common - Lady Lemmington's sister , whose husband died tragically young leaving her an immense fortune.
Che Guava - A Cuban playboy and would be politician
Nico Marx - The most celebrated of the American comedy troupe the Marx sisters
Butch highway - An American writer whose love of dangerous sport is topped only by his love of himself.

name: SILK HAT
description:
SILK HAT is a game where players use tangram type pieces to get other players to guess words from clue cards. Each card has four options for the artist, worth a different number of points based upon the difficulty.

Players guess at the same time while the artist is forming the shapes into their clue; once someone guesses correctly, both the artist and the correct guesser earn points equal to the difficulty of the clue.

The first person to 6 correct guesses or at least 13 points, wins.

name: Recycle Rally
description: Described on the box as "An exciting way for kids to learn about the importance of recycling while developing problem-solving, critical thinking, and strategizing skills!" Recycle Rally challenges players to clean up the town by rolling dice to move along the board and collect tokens. Play continues through three in-game weeks and the player with the most points wins...unless there are too many tokens in the landfill, in which case all players lose.

name: Seeker's Quest
description:
Seeker's Quest is an LDS scripture based card game. Each card in your hand is a verse of scripture. Take those verses from your hand and play them onto the tabletop into chapters. Verses build into chapters, and chapters merge into Books. As you complete books, draw blessings until you're a winner!

In addition, most verses have special rules, or effects, that are based on the meaning of the scripture. These effects make those verses even more powerful in the game. Each one can change the course of the game a little. Combine this verse in your hand with that verse on the table, and you could just draw the winning blessing! Look for the “Pearl of Truth” verses for extra power!

After the game, trade verses from your collection. The more you can collect, the more you can combine into the strongest deck to play with your friends. Learn Strength, Faith, Wisdom, Histories, Life, and Trials to complete the Seeker's Quest!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wyrmheist
description:
Wealthy nobles treasure the eggs of dragons. Some think they taste great with salsa. Others want to raise baby dragons. Either way, they’re willing to pay you in bags of gold for risking your skin to steal the eggs. How much are you willing to risk? Each toss of the dice shows how many eggs you can steal. But each time you try to steal, there's a chance the mama dragon will wake up and flame you! Just how far will you go for the fortunes of the eggs?

—description from the publisher

Wyrmheist is a push your luck dice game about stealing eggs from a dragon!

name: We're Sinking!: Swords & Souls
description:
Swords & Souls adds two new enemies to the base game that bring new abilities, challenges and play styles: The Navy and The Ghosts.

The Navy is well-armed with state-of-the-art cannons that add 6 different attack cards in the form of cannons. When playing against The Navy, players will shuffle the 6 Cannon cards and then randomly pick 2 to be used as The Navy's special attacks. This creates even more replayability. Plus, the cannon cards have individual damage counters. When you deal damage to The Navy, you get to choose which cannon to focus damage on. Once both cannons are destroyed, The Navy is defeated!

The Ghosts will be dealing out haunt cards to individual players. During the enemy dice rolls, the Ghost's attacks will cause mayhem to anyone who is haunted. Six Ritual Candles can be found in the Water Deck as Treasure cards. They can be used to protect against attacks. If you can get enough out, you can remove haunt cards.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Hot Potato, Order Counters, Prisoner's Dilemma

name: Archangelis: Commander Add-on
description:
The Commander Add-on provides fourteen new cards that can be added to your Archangelis Core Set.

Eight of the cards are the commanders: Powerful archangels of legend: Michael, Gabriel, Raphael, to name a few.
