At the beginning of the game, players can either select a commander of their choice, or they can be handed out at random. The card is placed face-up in the player's play area, and grants a global bonus throughout the game.

The remaining six cards are the new Title cards. These cards are shuffled into the Holy deck of the Store: If purchased, they can be placed in the player's play area face-up, granting bonuses to specific angels and demons.

name: Archangelis: World Locations Add-on
description:
The world is full of mysterious and mystical places! The Archangelis Core Set provided players with various powerful locations across the United States. With the World Locations Add-on, you can now combat for control of locations around the world.

The add-on contains twelve new location cards, that can either be shuffled into the location cards from the Core Set, or substituted for the Core Set locations.

name: Archangelis: Four Player Add-on
description:
Bring more friends to the battle!

The Four Player Add-on includes all the cards needed to expand the Archangelis game to allow 2 to 4 players.

The card included are the base deck cards required for an additional two players: 14 Erelim cards, 6 Nephalim cards, and 10 Ophanim cards.

name: Archangelis: Unlikely Allies Add-on
description:
Here comes trouble! With the Unlikely Allies Add-on, you'll be able to add more demons, profane humans, foul curses, and unholy relics to your Archangelis game!

This add-on includes: 2 new demon cards, 8 new humans, 6 new miracles, and 6 new relics. The sacred cards (white back) can simply be shuffled into the Holy deck...and the profane cards (red back) can be shuffled into the Infernal deck. And that's it...you're ready to go!

-description from designer

name: Archangelis: Complete Set
description:
Get the full Archangelis game experience with the Core Set, plus four add-ons all in one box! In this deckbuilding game, you will purchase angels, demons, humans, miracles, and relics from the store...building your deck until your army of angels is ready to conquer locations around the world! Conquer enough locations...and it will be time for the final battle against your opponents!

The Core Set contains 100 cards, all that is required for two players to play Archangelis.

The Four Player Add-on adds the ability to invite up to two more players to your game.

The Unlikely Allies Add-on introduces new, sinister strategies. It includes 22 new demons, humans, miracles, and relics...of a more evil variety.

The Commander Add-on contains 14 new cards: Power commanders you select at the beginning of the game, providing global bonuses. Additionally, it adds Titles which can be purchased from the store...making your angelic and demonic forces stronger.

The World Locations Add-on contains 12 new locations from around the world, to supplement the United States locations from the Core Set.

Comes with a deluxe rulebook, as well as a deluxe box big enough to contain the Core Set and all Add-ons.

-description from designer

name: Critical: Foundation – Episode 0
description:
Episode 0 (available on #FreeRPGDay) sets the stage for nine 30-minute episodes, formatted like a TV show ending in a huge season finale! This unique RPG is perfect for first-time Game Masters, with its episodic pacing, immersive world, and approachable rules!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mint Works: Spieleschmiede Promo Cards
description:
The mini-expansion contains one new double-sided card to integrate with the base game:

Architect (Architekt) on one side
Investment broker (Investitionsmakler) on the other side
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Point Blank: Winter Victory
description:
In December 1944, in some of the most bitterly cold weather experienced on the West Front. German forces thunder into the snow-covered Ardennes forest, opposed only by a few exhausted Allied troops as German armor and infantry forces raced across the allied lines and into the countryside. The Allied player is in a desperate struggle to hold the front line and repel the all-out German offensive.

"Point Blank Winter Victory" is an expansion module for Lock 'n Load Publishing tactical World War 2 squad card "Point Blank V is for Victory." "Point Blank Winter Victory” is for 1-2 players and adds exciting new combat units, such as the German Tiger II, more famously known as the King Tiger tank, and the American M4A3 tank. New terrain and objective cards and been included expanding already on the large terrain types in the game. "Point Blank Winter Victory” takes you out of the dog days of summer and leaves players to contend with freezing weather with our added new snow and fog rules. Each of the 12 new scenarios included presents the players with a unique situation involving squads of men, support weapons, leaders, and individual armored fighting vehicles.

This game pits the forces of the Allied and German forces against each other in the frozen Ardennes forest during the Battle of the Bulge. Each player has victory conditions determined by the scenario in which to defend or take objectives, seek and destroy their opponent’s units, or one of many other different scenario objectives.

The game is played on an abstract map board made up of terrain cards in the game and managed through a distance system that accounts for the range to targets, line of sight, and defensive attributes. The player has units that start out on the map and gradually work their way towards their objectives by advancing through the battlefield, all the while conducting combat actions against their opponent or defending their troops from return fire or whatever hell awaits them. Players draw cards from a common action deck where they will play actions on their units on the map board. The game is an IGOUGO impulse system, and turns are managed when the action deck is exhausted. (Some scenarios may require multiple deck exhaustion to finish the game). Actions in the game consist of Fire, Move, Assault, Rally, etc. The action cards contain dice icons on them to determine random results.

One of the unique features of the game is that it contains a deck of terrain cards that are not part of the action deck. As players change terrain, they will draw a terrain card in which their moving units will occupy. Some action cards, such as Recon, help players manage what terrain they occupy, but your opponent may have other plans for your moving troops during their turn.

The game can be played in about an hour (depending on the scenario size), and if you cannot find an opponent, then try the game solo system. In general, the gameplay is fast and exciting and compares to such legendary game systems as Up Front.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Line of Sight, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 12
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine puts your loyalty to the test amid unrelenting BattleMech combat that spans the war-torn battlefields of the 31st century and beyond!
The head of a security team must seek unusual allies to keep the First Prince of the Federated Suns safe from assassination. An aging Elemental warrior imparts lasting lessons to a young cadet when pirates threaten everything he holds dear. A young IndustrialMech pilot must use the only weapon he knows in the face of rampaging occupiers.

In this issue, you’ll visit the Unwearied Second’s 1,000th birthday celebration, a gala attended by the upper crust of Lyran society. Then roll up your sleeves and dive into testing a dangerous but poweful experimental weapon system. Stand firm with the Nova Cats, who try to hold back the inevitable tide of destiny, and travel to the Mercenary’s Star to navigate through scams and con artists in order to find the right outfit to call home.

Sign your contract and seek victory, with the help of mercenary-advice articles, technical readouts, unit digests, an in-depth look at the true nature of the “Death to Mercenaries” edict, and more—all by BattleTech veterans and new recruits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Boom Checkers
description:
Two player competitive on a 9x9 checkeredboard. Roll for how many spaces to move. Gameplay is fast paced with each match lasting one minute. The win condition is to land a roll directly on the enemy player then the game is over. It's best to play at least best out of 3 matches.

-description from designer

name: The Amazing Life Hacks Card Game
description:
Life Hacks is a card game where players must attempt to pick the real Life Hack from three seemingly-bizarre answers on a red Question Card. Get it right and you keep the card and the points. Watch out for green Challenge Cards, where you must DO the Life Hack and prove it's real in order to keep the cards and the points!

—description from the publisher

name: Dice Squared
description:
A solo game that requires nothing more than a few dice. The rules are simple enough to memorize, and short enough to fit on a business card.

Roll 3 action dice to manipulate the dice in your 3x3 square, using the actions on the card. Get 1 point for each row, column, or diagonal that has:


the same colour
the same number
an ordered sequence


After 4 rounds, count up your score. A score of 6 or more is considered to be a win.

—description from the designer

name: Schovka
description:
„…three, two, one… ready or not, here I come!“ Cute animals in the forest are playing hide-and-seek, looking for the best hiding place. Can you find them all? Hide-and-seek is designed for players up from the age of three. There are several difficulty levels to choose from.

Goal of the game is collect as many animal cards as you can.

One player is a seeker. Seeker chooses six yellow animal cards and puts them picture up on the starting squares called HOME BASE. Then he shuffles all the blue animal cards and put the pack on the CARD PACK square.

He turns the cards on the starting squares face down. He moves individual yellow cards randomly from the starting squares to the hiding squares (HOLLOW, NEST, ANTHILL, BEEHIVE, THICKET, STONES, TREE STUMP) on the board. One of the squares will remain empty.

Now all the players take turns, clockwise. At the beginning of their turn, each player turns the blue animal card on the top of the pack. Then he takes an attempt to find the same animal on a yellow card hidden on the board.

If he succeeds, he keeps the pair.
If not, he returns the blue card to the bottom of the pack and places the yellow card on an empty hiding square of his own choice back face down.
If a player thinks that the animal is not currently hidden on the board, he announces this, puts the blue card face down in front of himself and takes a new one. Then he try to find the matching yellow card for the new animal. (BUT! the players get two penalty points on the end of the round, for every animal which is eliminated this way and yet its matching yellow card is found to be hiding on the board.)

Once all the hiding animals are successfully matched, the players count the cards they won and note the corresponding number of their points. This closes one round of the game.

The number of rounds corresponds to the number of players.
Players with the most of points on the end of all rounds of the game is winner.

name: Po prostu P Prostokąty
description:
Po prostu P Prostokąty (Simply S: Shapes) is a game in which every idea counts! Suggest the secret S-password to the other players, using only rectangles!

See selected slip showing secret subject.
Start showing shapes suggesting secret subject.
Show, suggest, symbolize, stage, steer...! Someone says solution!
Success? Score!


Simple? Somewhat...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Po prostu P Prostokąty to gra, w której liczy się każdy pomysł! Pokaż pozostałym zawodnikom sekretne hasło na literę P, używając do tego wyłącznie prostokątów!

Pobierz papierowy prostokąt.
Przedstaw powiedzenie przy pomocy prostokątów
Poukładaj, poruszaj, podpowiadaj prostokątami! Pozostali próbują podać prawidłowe powiedzenie.
Podałeś prawidłowo? Pobierz prostokąt – punkt.


Proste? Przekonaj się!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time, Trivia

name: Army Men Dice War
description:
Your dice are going to war! Using the Army Men d6 Dice Set (or any twelve standard six-sided dice), two players go head-to-head in this simple dice game. Perfect for children of all ages, especially those younger ones looking for something to do on a rainy day.

Ante one of your dice, roll the rest, freeze 1 or 2, and continue until you are out of dice. Then your opponent does the same. Whoever scores lowest (with 1s counting as zero points) takes back their ante while the other is discarded.

Lowest total score when one player is out of dice wins.

Inspired by the Tripps classic dice game

name: Clash: The Card Game
description:
Clash is a card game for 2-4 players and the age target is 7 and above. Clash is a simple and easy game to play with some level of strategy involved.

The game starts with each player setting up a defense, after which they have to destroy each other’s defenses and then beat each other out in a duel. The last player standing wins the game.

The game consists of attack cards with different numbers, as well as 5 different action cards. The attack cards are primarily used to attack the opponents, whereas the action cards have different functions.

Gameplay (How to play):


Shuffle the deck
Deal 8 random cards to each player.
All players set up 3 Defense cards, which leaves 5 cards in hand.
In turn, use the Attack cards to destroy enemy defenses and use the Action cards to turn the tide of the battle to your advantage.
The game is played in a clockwise direction and the person to the left of the dealer starts the game.
All players will in turn try to destroy each other’s defenses.
Players are allowed to perform up to 2 moves (plays) when it’s their turn as long as the moves are not of the same card type. E.g. it’s not allowed to play 2 Attack cards or 2 Action cards, but instead, playing an Action card followed by an Attack card is allowed.
Use the Action cards to turn the tide of the game to your advantage
Attack enemy defenses and destroy them all
When the opportunity comes, reinforce your defense

When a player loses all 3 Defense cards, then the player may be challenged by other players to a duel. The duel is carried out by both the duel initiator (the attacker) and the player with no defenses left (the defender) playing an attack card faced down, after which both cards are revealed at the same time.
If the defender's card is weaker than the attacker's card, then the duel is lost and the defender is out of the game.
If the defender's card is stronger than the attacker's card, then the duel is won and the defender is rewarded with +1 new Defense card (placed from the cards in hand). The defender gets to continue the game.

The last player remaining wins the game.


—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game
